Thráin, Thorin's father, named the gates of these halls after his eldest son, Thorin Oakenshield, long before the city itself was known as Thorin's Hall.
The Silver Deep is a hall that was abandoned long ago before it was completed. The discovery of ancient Elf-ruins and a troll prompted Thorin and Gandalf the Grey to seal it off.
The way-station of Noglond serves as a provisioners' outpost and resting place for merchants and weary travellers.

The fortress of Gondamon was once an Elven fortress, abandoned when the Elves of Edhelion abandoned their former refuge for Duillond, after Skorgrím Dourhand's treacherous assault. The dwarves rebuilt the stronghold to their liking.

deed.name: Elf-ruins Exploration
deed.description: Explore the old places left behind by the Elves as they abandoned Edhelion and moved further south to Duillond.

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The ruins of Nen Hilith speak of more peaceful times when the Elves dwelt by the lake and contemplated the world that was. Now, evil wolves stalk the ruins, casting a dark shadow over the beautiful memory of the place.
In the days when Tham Gelair stood whole, it was a place of celebration and ceremony for the Elves of Ered Luin. Now it is a wretched ruin, a shattered memory of better days.

Limael's Vineyard was once the chief source of wine-grapes for the Elves of Ered Luin, but goblins have since taken over the once-peaceful vale. Nevertheless, the Elves still harvest the grapes when they ripen, as well as the trespassing goblins.
Dol Ringwest was once a place of great beauty, home to many Elves. Now it is a decayed and broken ruin.
This tower overlooking the Lhûn once guarded docks where ships would carry wood and wine from Edhelion to Mithlond. Now it has been abandoned to the wild.

deed.name: Rath Teraig Exploration
deed.description: Explore the dark valley of Rath Teraig.

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Northern Barricade of Rath Teraig is held by stalwart dwarf-warriors posted out of Gondamon. Since the resurgence of the goblins in Ered Luin some years ago, the dwarves have fought to keep them bottled up in Rath Teraig to prevent them from spilling out into the vales and forests beyond.

The Southern Barricade guards the way to the Grey Havens to the south-west. It was sealed off by the dwarves some years ago as the goblins swarmed out to overrun Rath Teraig and now lies abandoned and impassable, making the trek of the Elves travelling to the Havens a long and arduous journey as they must use passes far to the south.
The goblins have fortified the canyon of Tum Agor, preparing for an assault against the barricades, trapping them within Rath Teraig.
The goblins trapped within Rath Teraig have established a camp upon Amon Thanc, from where they can view the dwarf-barricades.
The goblins of Rath Teraig have established their largest camp here in the Crookdell. This is where they plan their raids against the dwarf-barricades.

deed.name: The Villages of the Earth-kin
deed.description: An odd people calling themselves the Earth-kin have been discovered in the eastern North Downs. Seek out their villages and learn more of them, and whether they be friend or foe.

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: It seems that the Earth-kin hunters of Rusfold are friendly enough, if rather odd. They speak of others of their kind to the east however, who have fallen under the sway of Angmar.
It seems that this village and others have fallen under the sway of Angmar. The Earth-kin are fighting amongst themselves -- to the amusment of the lords of Angmar, no doubt.
Kar Lak is a camp of Earth-kin that has fallen under the yoke of Angmar. If they would listen to reason perhaps they could be freed, but they do not seem to be in a mood to talk.

Hidden deep within the Ram Dúath you have discoverd this camp of the Earth-kin. Trapped from their home in the south of Angmar by the forces of the Angmarim, their lot does not seem to be a happy one, as they have been turned against one another by the lies of Angmar.

deed.name: The Eastern Ruins
deed.description: Many ruins lie forgotten in lands east of the Baranduin. Explore them and determine if they have fallen into the hands of the Enemy.

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Ost Lagoros was a watch-tower which once held vigil over the eastern passage to the great city of Fornost Erain.
Ost Galumar once stood as a forward outpost of the kingdom of Arthedain, a steadfast guardian against the shadow from the North.
Dol Nendír was a small Arthedain fortress on the north-eastern edges of Meluinen, before it was razed by the armies of Angmar, long ago.
Merenost was once a small, walled town of the North-realm of Arnor long before the marshes of Meluinen swallowed the land.
Ost Crithlanc had been one of the forwardmost outposts of the kingdom of Arthedain. Now it lies in ruins, home to evil Men out of Angmar.

deed.name: Strongholds Exploration
deed.description: Spy out the Orc and goblin-strongholds in the North Downs

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Once this pass served as the Grand Gate of Nan Wathren, a strong fortress that stood guard over the city of Fornost. It has long lay in ruin.
Once the eastern pass served as the postern gate to the fortress of Nan Wathren. These days it has become a supply road for the goblins that now inhabit the ruins of this once-proud citadel.

Long ago, this place served as the keep of proud Nan Wathren. It fell into ruins after the city of Fornost was destroyed by the Witch-king of Angmar, and has lain abandoned for many long years. Now the goblins have come here through dark, secret tunnels and made this crumbling fortress their own.
The war-camp of Hîsuk provides a commanding view over the blasted wastes of Dol Dínen. Here the Orkish army gathers its might and prepares for further conquest of the North Downs.

Tûmat lies hidden deep within the mountains of Dol Dínen. It is here that the Orkish commanders confer with their dark lords and receive the orders that will set them to march against the Free Peoples of Eriador.

deed.name: The Western Ruins
deed.description: Explore the ruins scattered in and around the Fields of Fornost

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: A tower once sat atop Amon Raith, guarding the pass through the hills south of Fornost. Now it is home to Rangers and refugees.
The city of Minas Vrûn once lay to the south of Fornost, on the eastern side of the pass at Amon Raith. The lord of the city fell beneath the blade of Amarthiel, champion of Angmar.
Ost Nuaran was an outlying bulwark of the great city of Fornost. The betrayal of the fortress commander caused its downfall and allowed Angmar to pass into the city.

The Falconer's Tower was a watch-tower from which guardsmen could see for miles across the North Downs. It was named so because the guardsmen used falcons to espy the land and deliver messages to the king at Fornost Erain.
This was once the main entrance into the king's city of Fornost Erain. The gates were laid to ruin and rebuilt by the Witch-king of Angmar when he seized the city for himself.
Glírost was a watch-tower which once held vigil over the Evendim Gate, the passage leading to Annúminas, the ancient capital of Arnor, now an abode of fell spirits out of Angmar.
Tham Lorn was the second of two fortresses set to guard the Evendim Gate, the passage to Annúminas, the ancient capitol of Arnor. Fell spirits now haunt its ruined halls.

deed.name: Garth Agarwen Exploration
deed.description: Garth Agarwen lies in the north-east hills of the Lone-lands. Once a great fortress of the ancient kingdoms, rumours say that it has become a stronghold of corruption and evil.

objective.text: Explore Garth Agarwen.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Circle of Blood is a vile marsh in Haragmar, formed by the corruption overflowing from Agamaur in the north.
Nan Dhelu was once a beautiful valley before the corruption of Agamaur flooded the land. Now it is home to vile creatures of Morgoth who live only to breed terror.
This gate opens into the courtyard of Garth Agarwen, once a fortress of the evil Rhudaur, now the ruined palace of the Red-maid of Agamaur.
This gate leads into the inner sanctuaries of the Red-maid and the vile and corrupted creatures who serve her.
This crypt is the resting place and throne of the Gaunt-lord Ivar the Bloodhand, Lord of War, necromancer in service to Angmar.
This is the sanctum of the Red-maid of Agamaur, a River-maiden corrupted by the blood spilled in her waters during the wars between Angmar and the North Kingdom.

deed.name: The Grimfens
deed.description: The Grimfens are in the south-east extent of the Lone-lands. Travellers have avoided this place for as long as any can remember -- and for good reason.

objective.text: Explore the Grimfens.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Ost Haer was a fortress of Arthedain set against the might of Rhudaur's Garth Agarwen in ancient days, now fallen into ruin and decay, home to the shades of Oath-breakers sworn to defeat the Red-maid of Agamaur.
Nindor was another fortification of Arthedain, overrun by the Hillmen of Rhudaur in the wars with Angmar. Wights summoned by the Gaunt-lords of Morgoth now haunt the ruins.

deed.name: Defences of the Lone-lands
deed.description: The Lone-lands were once host to a string of forts and towers that guarded the roads against the incursions of Angmar and Rhudaur. Long ago, they fell into ruin with the defeat of the North Kingdom.

objective.text: Explore the ancient fortifications of the Lone-lands.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo:
The tower of Barad Lachiant is the symbolic centre of the stronghold of Minas Eriol, once it rose high above the valleys below and caught the first rays of sunlight as it slanted in over the surrounding mountains.
In ruins now, it is only a symbol of glories long lost.

Once the primary keep of Minas Eriol, proud knights of the Kingdom of Arnor once issued forth from the gates of Ost Laden into the hills and plains below.
Now only goblins jeer from the shattered parapets, keeping a dark watch upon those few brave enough to travel into the Lone-lands.
The Lornspan once bridged a river which flowed near Mithrenost, long parched into a dusty gully.
Mithrenost was once one of the strongest fortresses of the North Kingdom in days past. Now it is naught but a hiding hole for dwarf-brigands in the service of Skorgrím Dourhand.
The tower of Thandobel once guarded the passage between Ost Cyrn and Mithrenost. Now it lies in ruin, home to the outcast Dourhands.
Ost Cyrn once stood vigil against the Hillmen of Rhudaur and the Angmarim of the North. Now Orcs use the ruined fortress to lay siege to the barren Lone-lands.
Naerost was one of the first of the fortresses of the North Kingdom to fall when the Witch-king marched upon Amon Sûl. Now half-orc brigands out of the South dwell within its ruined halls.
Not much now remains of the watch-tower upon Amon Ros, for it was the weakest of the bulwarks of the North Kingdom. Now spiders infest the surrounding gullies and ditches.
Ost Guruth served as a stronghold of the North Kingdom in the days of the Witch-realm of Angmar. Now it serves as the temporary home of the Forsaken, the Ruin-hold of the Eglain.

deed.name: Weathertop Exploration
deed.description: Weathertop is in the western half of the Lone-lands. Its proper name of old is Amon Sûl, and within it once lay one of the palantíri of the ancient kingdoms.

objective.text: Explore Weathertop and its surroundings.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The tower at Echad Sûl once guarded the northern approach to Amon Sûl, but it was destroyed in battle with Angmar and Rhudaur.
Weatherfoot is at the south-west edges of Amon Sûl , an ancient watch-post now beset on all sides by goblins.
In the northern reaches of the Weather Hills lies Glumhallow, an ancient way-station. Orcs have made the place their residence, where they plot the invasion of Eriador.

Weathertop, the great hill of Amon Sûl, was once the site of a great watch-tower which was razed by the Witch-king of Angmar after he discovered that the palantír which was once contained within had been taken west by the king of Arthedain. It is a place hallowed by Rangers.

deed.name: The Farms of the Shire
deed.description: Farming represents the heart of the Shire, and farmsteads can be found throughout -- the largest of which surround the town of Michel Delving.

objective.text: Explore the Farms of the Shire.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Dora Brownlock owns one of the largest farms near the sleepy village of Waymeet. She has been having troubles with wolves recently.
Bamfurlong is the land owned by Farmer Maggot, one of the most respected farmers in the Marish.
Old Odo Burrow once held the largest leaf farm in the Southfarthing, though it has now fallen to ruin.
The Delving Fields are the largest farmhold in the Westfarthing, providing foodstuffs for much of the Shire.
Farmer Appledore grows some of the sweetest fruit in all the Shire.
Cam Puddifoot grows a variety of vegetables, but he is best known for his honey. Unfortunately, his bees are often threatened by bears.

deed.name: The Sights of the Shire
deed.description: The pastoral peace of the Shire presents travellers with an excellent opportunity to explore its historical and cultural places.

objective.text: Explore the Sights of the Shire.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This enormous tree has long been known as a place where festive occasions can be celebrated by the Hobbits of the Shire. Standing on the outskirts of Hobbiton proper it can be seen for quite some ways, and during festivities it is often hung with dozens of bright streamers and lanterns providing a cheery atmosphere for most any event.

It is said that when old Bilbo Baggins returned from his wanderings abroad, he came back with a good deal more wealth than he had before he left.
While rumours abound as to the source and improper nature of his riches, among the works he built within the Shire was the Methel-stage upon which hobbits of an artistic leaning are invited to perform and entertain their fellows during festive occasions.
Of course, Bilbo has disappeared again recently - bringing up all the old rumours of his improper adventures and such - but many of the folk of the Shire nevertheless continue to appreciate the causes to which he put his money.

The Stocktower is a curious old Arnorian ruin standing guard near the Brandywine Bridge.
Few such ruins still stand in the Shire - having long ago been dismantled by industrious hobbits to construct more modern residences, but the Stocktower has become something of an icon and mischevious hobbit children have been known to frequent the ruin despite their parents' admonishments to the contrary.

For a long time, dwarves were not seen with much frequency in the Shire and bringing stone from far abroad was expensive, so the hobbits constructed their own quarry to supply the needs of builders and masons.
Recently, however, better quality stone has been available from the West, so the quarry has fallen into disuse and has become infested with dangerous vermin.

Bridgefields Wall is one of the few remaining signs of the ancient Kingdom of Arnor within the bounds of the Shire.
Farmer Puddifoot has been threatening to pull it down for years now to build walls for his own fields, but some of the richer hobbit families of Michel Delving have prevented him from doing so in the Shire councils, demanding that the wall be preserved for historical purposes. So it stands there still.

While not as well known as the Party Tree, the Great Willow is considered a good deal more mysterious and romantic by the younger Hobbits of the Shire.
Folk tales abound of Elves travelling into the West who spend their evenings in mysterious revels beneath its boughs, and young hobbit couples often come there to declare their romantic intentions, perhaps hoping a bit of fairy magic might give them luck and bravery enough to say the words.

deed.name: The Barrow-downs
deed.description: The Barrow-downs are south-west of Bree-town. For many generations the Dúnedain of Cardolan buried their dead within the Downs, until the Great Plague destroyed the last vestiges of Cardolan, and spirits from Angmar claimed the barrows. Now only the most brave -- or most foolhardy -- dare venture therein.

objective.text: Explore the Barrow Downs.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The path from the Great East Road into the Barrow-downs passes through the wight-haunted Northern Barrows.
This stone pillar stands amidst the barrows, pointing skyward like a warning finger. Even in the heat of the day, the stone of the Dead Spire is cold and casts no shadow.
This bluff overlooks the town of Bree. Some Bree-folk claim to have seen the Dead walking upon the ridge.
Othrongroth, the Great Barrow, is the oldest and deepest of the ancient barrows of the Edain, the first builders of the barrows.
Now fallen into decay, Ost Gorthad once stood proudly as the last bastion of the Dúnedain of Cardolan against the ravages of Angmar.

deed.name: The Old Forest
deed.description: The Old Forest lies on the border between the Shire and Bree-land. For years beyond memory it has been a forbidding place, which Men and hobbits alike have shunned. Hobbit-tales tell that the trees are aware and can move of their own accord.

objective.text: Explore the hidden places of the Old Forest.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Bald Hill is a treeless slope which rises above the treetops of the Old Forest; nevertheless, little of the surrounding landscape can be seen from here.
Tucked away in a dark corner of the Old Forest, this is the lair of an evil brood of monstrous spiders.
This is the lodging of the strange and powerful Tom Bombadil and his wife, the River-daughter Goldberry.
This pond is favoured for its beauty by the River-daughter Goldberry, wife of the enigmatic Tom Bombadil.
The Bonfire Glade marks the place where the Brandybucks cut down and burned hundreds of trees after the Old Forest attacked the High Hay, the great hedge dividing Buckland from the Forest.

deed.name: The Ruins of Bree-land
deed.description: The ruins of old Arnor are scattered all across Bree-land. They remain a constant reminder of the ancient glories of the North Kingdom... and of the evil that destroyed it.

objective.text: Explore the Ruins of Breeland.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Little lore remains from the days of the North Kingdom, but it is said that these ruins are all that remain of a Cardolan lord's failed attempt to hold back the wrath of Angmar.
This scattered ruin is all that remained of the ancient town of Hillshire, once a sister to nearby Bree.
In the days of the kingdom of Arnor, the Old Greenway Fort stood guard over the once-busy road leading to Fornost Erain. Now it is little more than a ruined monument to a ruined kingdom.
Once an abode of the Men of Arnor, these ruins now house an unruly mob of outlaws calling themselves the Blackwolds.
Long ago, this ruined fortress guarded Cardolan against the armies of Angmar and Rhudaur, but now it serves as the seat of power of the Blackwold brigands.
These ancient ruins stand at the edge of the Midgewater Marshes and the Chetwood, a meagre remnant of a long forgotten age.
These ruins mark the place where yet another tower of the North Kingdom once stood, now faded into memory.
This spider-infested ruin lies at the centre of the Midgewater Marshes. It is rumoured that the wandering Rangers frequent this ancient fortress.
Little is known of this ancient pile of rubble, except that goblins have chosen to roost here... a cause for concern to the Men of Bree.
These ruins, an abode of vile brigands from the south, mark the passage from the Vale of Andrath southwards into long-abandoned Minhiriath.

deed.name: Lore of the Cardolan Prince
deed.description: Find pages of the Journal of Cardolan lost within the Barrow-downs.

objective.text: Collect the pages of the Journal of Cardolan and learn the history of the Barrow-downs.
Collect the pages of the Journal of Cardolan and learn the history of the Barrow-downs.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This page tells of the time not long after the fall of Cardolan, when the remaining Dúnedain in Cardolan banded together to bring some measure of order and leadership to the lands of the north.
This page tells of the advent of a great plague that issued forth from Mordor in the year 1636, claiming the lives of many Men in the southern kingdom of Gondor.
This page tells of the coming of the Dark Plague from the south some years after the fall of Cardolan. Many of the Dúnedain who remained in Cardolan were slain or weakened by its evil.

This page describes the funeral rites of the Dúnedain of Cardolan, who founded the Barrow-downs as a place where their fallen might be interred. Many Men were buried there during the time of the plague.

This page tells of an attack upon a funeral procession within the Barrow-downs by spirits that crept there out of Angmar. The remaining Dúnedain of Cardolan were greatly angered that the resting place of their ancestors should be defiled in this manner.

This page tells of the gathering of the remaining Dúnedain of Cardolan to drive the wights out of the Barrow-downs and restore the sanctity of their ancestors' burial grounds. The final entry at the bottom of the torn page is stained with blood and illegible.

deed.name: The History of the Dúnedain
deed.description: Explore the history of the Dúnedain Rangers of the North.

objective.text: Discover clues about the history of the Dúnedain scattered throughout the Arnorian ruins in Bree-land.

itemUsed.loreInfo:
The worn but noble visage engraved on the statue you discovered belongs to Aranarth, the first Chieftain of the Dúnedain after the fall of Arthedain.
The statue was probably created some time after the wars that destroyed the old Kingdom, most likely by the Rangers who hold Aranarth in great reverence.
It was in good repair suggesting that they tend to it to this day. The memories of the Dúnedain are long, and their respect for the dead borders on obsession at times.

The runes you found seemed to be very old indeed, and in style of ancient Arnorian script that few would readily recognize in these times. While you made out only a little of it, the inscription is likely an oath of fealty taken by Dúnedain to their lords.
The Men of those days put great store in ceremony and oaths, and believed that to break one would bring a terrible curse upon the oathbreaker.
Few Men put much store in ritual and ceremony these days -- save for the Rangers of the North, who are rumoured to have descended from those very Dúnedain who once ruled Arnor. Perhaps they are the ones who have protected the inscription from the wear of time?

The cairn is rather unlike many that the Men of old built, but you recalled a tale of an old battle...
In the time after the fall of Arnor and the defeat of Angmar by the host of Gondor, few men remained in the north. Those who remained loyal to the old kings banded together under the first Chieftain of the Dúnedain and became the forebears of the Rangers who walk these lands today, or so it is rumoured.
In those days there were still evil Men and worse who walked these lands and there was a battle few Men alive today remember. Though the Dúnedain were victorious, their numbers dwindled. The cairn you have found is most likely the resting place of the men who died in that battle, built hurriedly and in secret.

You found a carving with an old Arnorian symbol upon it. It appeared to be the crest of the ancient kingdom of Arthedain.
The ruins of that kingdom stretch for miles to the south-west and north. Bree-town itself was built upon a crossroads between Arthedain and its sister kingdom Cardolan to the east. Once they were all one great kingdom, stretching all across the north, but the folly of Men first sundered them, then set them against each other until one after another they fell over the long years of the Third Age.
There are some folk who still remember the tales of Arthedain, but you suspect that the crest may be of particular importance to the Rangers, for it is said that they are descended from that bloodline.

The strange altar you found appeared to be Arnorian in origin, with signs that some gathering or ritual had taken place there recently.
You've heard rumours that Rangers here in the north occasionally gather for a ceremony to declare the coming of age of one of their number, where they induct the young man or woman into their ranks by way of an oath to the old kingdoms.

You found an old obelisk out among the Arnorian ruins, seemingly newer than the ruins themselves, with the names of many Men carved upon it. Your only guess is that it must be some sort of memorial.
The design and the style of the names you saw there suggest that it was built by the Dúnedain, and given their reverence for their ancestors there is every reason to believe that it may be a memorial for their fallen.
Some of the names seemed to have been added recently, suggesting that the Rangers are somehow involved....

deed.name: Flowers of the Old Forest
deed.description: Old tales tell of eight Entwives who passed from the south into the Old Forest, never to be seen again. Could they be true?

objective.text: Find the flowers marking the passing of the eight Entwives within the Old Forest.

itemUsed.loreInfo:
You have found the flower of Rhosthon. It is believed that she was once an Entwife who stood with vigilance over her gardens. None could approach without her knowledge, and those with evil intent would feel her gaze upon them and flee.
She passed into the Old Forest many long years ago and became part of the forest, granting her keen senses to the trees and creatures herein that evil might not approach unseen, for those were dark days and few places remained that were untouched by the power of Sauron.
The flowers are said to mark the place where she disappeared into the forest and seem to have been tended by someone.

You have discovered the flower of Neldorlas, an Entwife of old. It was she who was foremost in the arts of nurturing the young, that they might achieve their potential in the fullness of time.
Not one seed did she plant, nor youthful mind touch that did not come to fruition, unless it was struck down by unfortunate fate. Such was her understanding of the arts of cultivation and teaching.
As with her sisters, she chose to become a part of the Old Forest, that it might endure the encroachment of darkness and evil throughout the years. So the folk tales say, anyway.

The flower you found marks the place where the Entwife Dorollin passed into the Old Forest, perhaps forever.
She was among the largest of her kind, taller than any other, for the essence of all that grows was at the core of her nature. Her gardens were sprawling places wrapped in great vines, and enormous trees cast their shade upon acres of fertile ground.
She gave herself to the Old Forest to ensure that it would grow great enough to protect itself from the incursion of evil such as Orcs and thoughtless Men.
Some folk say that one day they will awaken and emerge from the forest - but no one knows when that might be.

You discovered Cordofoneth's flower -- said to be one of eight Entwife sisters. Among her kin, she held most dear her affection for all living things.
It was this affection that she lent the Old Forest when she passed into its depths long ago, that all manner of living things might find shelter within its bounds. The flower you have found marks the place where she entered the forest, and she has not been seen since.
Alas, the Old Forest has oft been harmed by Men or intruded upon by darker powers, and so it is said that her heart lies muted, and she sleeps more deeply than her sisters. Perhaps she is awaiting the day when this world might become a place of lighter moods and the love of life is not so easily betrayed by axe or fire.

You have discoverd the flower of Lenhwest. She was believed to be an Entwife known for her unquenchable passions. She could love as no other, but fury and despair were also her constant companions.
Amongst her sisters, she was the first to give herself to the forest, swept by her own emotions to ensure its survival during the trials of those dark years. Her presence is strongly felt in these woods still.
It is for fear of Lenhwest's tempestuous anger that folk walk with care in the Old Forest, for many believe that if her heart turns against you, it is unlikely you will ever emerge from it again!

You have found Silloth's flower. She was said to have been a wonderous spirit - her heart was unbowed even during the ancient war that drove the Entwife sisters here, for mirth and frivolity ever followed in her wake, and her gardens were believed to be places where even the weariest of mortals could bring themselves to smile and laugh.
Among the Elves she was particularly beloved, and of those who remember her they fear they may never again hear the sound of her laughter beneath the boughs of ancient trees.

The flower of Braiglad is seen as a warning by superstitious folk who would dare the depths of the Old Forest. She was an Entwife unusual amongst her sisters, for she was a wild and capricious being. Her gardens were populated by untamed beasts, and even the most delicate flowers within them were adorned with sharp thorns.
Braiglad rarely spoke with mortals, preferring the wild places of the forest, and in time she gave herself to the forest to protect it from the dark powers.
There are those who say her spirit is strongest when aroused by wild and dangerous times such as these.

The tale of Merillif's flower often brings tears to those who hear it. Of the eight Entwives who came to the Old Forest, she was the most beautiful and the most beloved of all.
Her gardens shone with a brilliance of colour that even the finest artisans of the Firstborn would regard with envy. Her jewels were said to be the petals of flowers, and while they would last but a short season -- unlike the gems of the Noldor which are forever -- their beauty far surpassed that of any object carved of stone or crystal. This passing beauty was such that it endured no greed, and so the vanity of evil hearts could neither possess nor endure it.
Those who are fond of the story say that she will awaken some day when beauty can again be shared amongst all the creatures of Arda without fear of despoilment or jealous vanity.

deed.name: Bree-land Adventurer
deed.description: Danger presses upon Bree-land from all sides, foreshadowing the ascension of a great darkness. You are called to stand against the Shadow. Your efforts on behalf of Bree-land will be rewarded.

objective.text: Undertake quests in Bree-land.

deed.name: Bree-land Adventurer (Advanced)
deed.description: Danger presses upon Bree-land from all sides, foreshadowing the ascension of a great darkness. You are called to stand against the Shadow. Your continued efforts on behalf of Bree-land will be rewarded.

objective.text: Complete additional quests in Bree-land.

deed.name: Bree-land Adventurer (Final)
deed.description: Danger presses upon Bree-land from all sides, foreshadowing the ascension of a great darkness. You are called to stand against the Shadow. Your extraordinary efforts on behalf of Bree-land will be rewarded.

objective.text: Complete a large number of quests in Bree-land.

deed.name: Tales of the Lonely Road
deed.description: Undertake quests within the Lone-lands.

questComplete.loreInfo: As barren as the Lone-lands are, there are still those who dwell there who need your aid, such as the Eglain of Ost Guruth.

deed.name: Tales of the Lonely Road (Advanced)
deed.description: Continue to assist the inhabitants of the Lone-lands.

questComplete.loreInfo: As barren as the Lone-lands are, there are still inhabitants who could use your aid, such as the Eglain of Ost Guruth.

deed.name: Tales of the Lonely Road (Final)
deed.description: Continue earning the trust of the inhabitants of the Lone-lands.

questComplete.loreInfo: As barren as the Lone-lands are, there are still inhabitants who could use your aid, such as the Eglain of Ost Guruth.

deed.name: Of Glories Long Past
deed.description: The North Downs were once the home to the capitol of the North Kingdom. Now it lies in ruin, inviting the return of Angmar.

deed.name: Of Glories Long Past (Advanced)
deed.description: Orcs and evil Men out of Angmar have overrun the virtually empty North Downs, threatening the safety of the few farmers who remain there.

deed.name: Of Glories Long Past (Final)
deed.description: The Rangers of the North muster their forces within their hidden refuge of Esteldín, preparing to turn back the tide of the Iron Crown.

objective.text: Complete 75 North Downs quests.

deed.name: Restoring the Quick Post
deed.description: Restore the good name of the Quick Post service.

objective.text: The Quick Post service is responsible for more than a dozen mail routes throughout the Shire. If its good name is to be restored, you will need to help deliver mail at each of its routes.

questComplete.loreInfo: Michel Delving is the mayoral seat of the Shire, home to the chief office of the Shirriffs and Bounders.
questComplete.progressOverride: Service Little Delving to Michel Delving Route

questComplete.loreInfo: Waymeet lies at the crossroads between the Great East Road and the north-south road leading from Needlehole to the Southfarthing.
questComplete.progressOverride: Service Michel Delving to Waymeet Route

questComplete.loreInfo: Needlehole lies at the edge of the Shire, bordering both the Westfarthing and the Northfarthing. The road leading through Needlehole from the south also continues on beyond the Tower Hills into Ered Luin.
Michel Delving is the mayoral seat of the Shire, home to the chief office of the Shirriffs and Bounders.
questComplete.progressOverride: Service Needlehole to Michel Delving Route

questComplete.loreInfo: Tuckborough is the chief village of Tookland, home to the Great Smials, ancestral dwelling of the Thain of the Shire.
questComplete.progressOverride: Service Michel Delving to Tuckborough Route

questComplete.loreInfo: Hobbiton is a quaint town best known for Bag End and the antics of its former owner, Bilbo Baggins.
Overhill lies to the north of Hobbiton, nestled against the eaves of Bindbole Wood, where there is rumour of walking trees.
Bywater -- best known for its inn, The Green Dragon -- lies across the Water from Hobbiton.
Woodhall lies nestled in the arms of the Woody End, where it is said Elves sometimes can be seen travelling to the Grey Havens west of the Shire.
The beer at The Golden Perch in Stock is purported to be the best in the Shire.
Budgeford is the home of the Bolger family and pork-capital of the Shire. rarely does it see too many visitors....
Best known for its quarry, the town of Scary lies at the border of the Northfarthing, in the arms of the Hills of Scary.
Brockenborings was named for a series of old tunnels in the hills near Scary.

objective.text:
Postmaster Proudfoot is in Michel Delving, near the Town Hole.
Thanks to your efforts, the Quick Post has regained its reputation for speedy delivery of the mail. Postmaster Proudfoot will be delighted to hear of all you have done.

deed.name: Ally of Ered Luin
deed.description: Complete 10 quests in Ered Luin.

objective.text: Complete 10 Ered Luin quests.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Shadow of Angmar is long and reaches even into distant Ered Luin -- one of the few places in Middle-earth where dwarves and Elves can be found living in a tenuous peace.

deed.name: Defender of Ered Luin
deed.description: Complete 20 Ered Luin quests.

objective.text: Complete Ally of Ered Luin.
Complete 20 Ered Luin quests.

questComplete.loreInfo: Earning the trust of the peoples of Ered Luin is no simple matter, for the Elves and dwarves here have long distrusted each other, and it leaves them with little love for strangers. Nevertheless, your deeds in these lands have made great inroads, and your name has become known among both peoples.

deed.name: Hero of Ered Luin
deed.description: Complete 30 Ered Luin quests.

objective.text: Complete Defender of Ered Luin.
Complete 30 Ered Luin quests.

questComplete.loreInfo: Your deeds among the hills and valleys of Ered Luin have been spoken of widely among its people. Your name has risen above the traditional distrust of the communities of Ered Luin, and your heroic example is admired by many.

deed.name: Marching into Shadow
deed.description: Undertake quests within Angmar.

deed.name: Marching into Shadow (Advanced)
deed.description: Complete additional quests within Angmar.

deed.name: Marching into Shadow (Final)
deed.description: Complete most quests within Angmar.

objective.text: Complete 30 Angmar quests.

deed.name: Deeds in the Wilderness
deed.description: Undertake quests within the Trollshaws.

questComplete.loreInfo: Your efforts to help keep the valley of Rivendell hidden shall not go unrewarded.

deed.name: Deeds in the Wilderness (Advanced)
deed.description: Complete additional quests within the Trollshaws.

questComplete.loreInfo: Your efforts to help keep the valley of Rivendell hidden shall not go unrewarded.

deed.name: Deeds in the Wilderness (Final)
deed.description: Complete most quests within the Trollshaws.

objective.text: Complete 30 Trollshaws Quests.

questComplete.loreInfo: Your efforts to help keep the valley of Rivendell hidden shall not go unrewarded.

deed.name: Peril of the Mountains
deed.description: Perform valiant deeds among the snows of the Misty Mountains.

questComplete.loreInfo: Rising up as a great wall on the eastern border of Eriador, the Misty Mountains have long proven a formidable obstacle to travellers. Goblins are known to infest warrens dug beneath the mountains, while giants stride among the peaks capriciously threatening those who attempt to pass through its snow-swept ways.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete quests within the Misty Mountains.

deed.name: Peril of the Mountains (Advanced)
deed.description: Perform more valiant deeds among the snows of the Misty Mountains.

questComplete.loreInfo: You've spent enough time in the Misty Mountains to learn that it is bitterly cold, very dangerous, and as wild as any place you've ever seen. It's clear why few attempt this route, and no-one chooses to live here. Luckily the bulwark of Rivendell keeps the Goblins from wandering down into the lands to the West.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete quests within the Misty Mountains.

deed.name: Peril of the Mountains (Final)
deed.description: Perform many valiant deeds within the snows of the Misty Mountains.

objective.text: Complete 30 Misty Mountains Quests.

questComplete.loreInfo: After so much time here, the Misty Mountains seem almost like an old friend now - assuming that your old friend was a cranky, tempermental Dwarf with a callous outlook on life and a remarkably cold chip on his shoulder -- not the kind of friend you'd invite over for dinner all that often, and certainly not in polite company.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete quests within the Misty Mountains.

deed.name: Barghest-slayer
deed.description: The vile Barghests, bred down from wild hounds and twisted to evil by the Dark Lord Sauron, often range where the Dead roam. You are called to drive the Barghests from the Barrow-downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have pursued and slain many of the Barghests who haunt the Barrow-downs.

deed.name: Barghest-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The vile Barghests, bred down from wild hounds and twisted to evil by the Dark Lord Sauron, often range where the Dead roam. You are called to drive the Barghests from the Barrow-downs.

objective.text: Defeat many Barghests in Bree-land.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer
deed.description: Many bands of brigands roam the wilds of Bree-land, waylaying travellers and bullying the inhabitants of Bree and the towns surrounding it. It is up to you to counter the threat the brigands pose to the inhabitants of Bree-land.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The folk of Bree-land hail your efforts to protect the roads from roving bandits.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Many bands of brigands roam the wilds of Bree-land, waylaying travellers and bullying the inhabitants of Bree and the towns surrounding it. It is up to you to counter the threat the brigands pose to the inhabitants of Bree-land.

deed.name: Bree-land Woodsman
deed.description: Legends of the Old Forest abound. It is a place of fear and malevolent spirit. Some dark will fills the trees with a hatred of all that goes on two legs. It is up to you to quell the Forest's malevolent spirit.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You've proven a match for the rotten hatred the trees of the Old Forest hold for the two-footed folk of Middle-earth.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat awakened trees in the Old Forest

deed.name: Bree-land Woodsman (Advanced)
deed.description: Legends of the Old Forest abound. It is a place of fear and malevolent spirit. Some dark will fills the trees with a hatred of all that goes on two legs. It is up to you to quell the Forest's malevolent spirit.

monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat awakened trees in the Old Forest

deed.name: Neekerbreeker-slayer
deed.description: The Midgewater Marshes are home to the Neekerbreekers, a variety of annoying insect that has recently become hostile, following the passage of Black Riders from the East. You are called to halt the plague of Neekerbreekers.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Who would ever have thought that Neekerbreekers could grow that big?

deed.name: Neekerbreeker-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The Midgewater Marshes are home to the Neekerbreekers, a variety of annoying insect that has recently become hostile, following the passage of Black Riders from the East. You are called to halt the plague of Neekerbreekers.

deed.name: Orc-slayer
deed.description: A company of Orcs has passed into Bree-land from the North Downs, ravaging the countryside and razing farms. The advance of the Orcs out of the North must be brought to a halt.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have proven your mettle against the Orcs who have invaded northern Bree-land.

deed.name: Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: A company of Orcs has passed into Bree-land from the North Downs, ravaging the countryside and razing farms. The advance of the Orcs out of the North must be brought to a halt.

deed.name: Sickle-fly Slayer
deed.description: With the passing of Black Riders from the East, the disease-bearing sickle-flies of the Midgewater Marshes have begun to breed more rapidly, threatening to spread contagion among the inhabitants of Bree-land. You are tasked with ending the threat of the sickle-flies' plague.

monsterDied.loreInfo: People may snicker, but how many of them have had to fight one of these giant bloodsuckers?

deed.name: Sickle-fly Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: With the passing of Black Riders from the East, the disease-bearing sickle-flies of the Midgewater Marshes have begun to breed more rapidly, threatening to spread contagion among the inhabitants of Bree-land. You are tasked with ending the threat of the sickle-flies' plague.

deed.name: Spider-slayer
deed.description: Strange, monstrous spiders have crept into Bree-land from the dark corners of Mirkwood, beyond the Misty Mountains in the east. Your courage will be tested against the spider infestation spreading through the forests and marshes of Bree-land.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Spiders have become quite a threat of late in Bree-land, but your prowess against them is well known.

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Strange, monstrous spiders have crept into Bree-land from the dark corners of Mirkwood, beyond the Misty Mountains in the east. Your courage will be tested against the spider infestation spreading through the forests and marshes of Bree-land.

deed.name: Wight-slayer
deed.description: Long ago, the Barrow-downs fell under a shadow of evil, and the Witch-king sent fell spirits out of Angmar and Rhudaur to stir the bones of the dead which lay beneath the green mounds. Something has disturbed the Dead that Walk, and you must lay their bones to rest.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The wights of the Barrow-downs no longer hold any terror for you. Now you just find them deeply unsettling.

deed.name: Wight-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Long ago, the Barrow-downs fell under a shadow of evil, and the Witch-king sent fell spirits out of Angmar and Rhudaur to stir the bones of the dead which lay beneath the green mounds. Something has disturbed the Dead that Walk, and you must lay their bones to rest.

deed.name: Bog-lurker Slayer
deed.description: Defeat bog-lurkers in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Whence came these slimy horrors that now plague the Lone-lands, few recall, but it is believed they were not always creatures of evil.

deed.name: Bog-lurker Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many bog-lurkers in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Whence came these slimy horrors that now plague the Lone-lands, few recall, but it is believed they were not always creatures of evil.

deed.name: Wight-slayer
deed.description: Defeat wights in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Wights are the remains of Men who have been inhabited by fell spirits out of Angmar and Rhudaur, sent forth in ages past by the Witch-king of Angmar.

deed.name: Wight-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wights in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have laid to rest the bodies of many restless Dead, banishing the fell spirits who inhabited them.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer
deed.description: Defeat goblins in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: No matter how many goblins you kill, the Lone-lands just seem to become overrun with yet more of them.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many goblins in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: No matter how many goblins you kill, the Lone-lands just seem to become overrun with yet more of them.

deed.name: Orc-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Without your strength, it seems likely the Lone-lands would be overrun with Orcs by now.

deed.name: Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Orcs in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Without your strength, it seems likely the Lone-lands would be overrun with Orcs by now.

deed.name: Spider-slayer
deed.description: Defeat spiders in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Lone-lands, too, are infested by these eight-legged horrors, each stronger than the last -- yet still they fall before you!

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many spiders in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Lone-lands, too, are infested by these eight-legged horrors, each stronger than the last -- yet still they fall before you!

deed.name: Warg-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Wargs in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Along with the goblins, Wargs have come to the Lone-lands. They'll not have free run as long as you stand against them!

deed.name: Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Wargs in the Lone-lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Along with the goblins, Wargs have come to the Lone-lands. They'll not have free run as long as you stand against them!

deed.name: Goblin-slayer
deed.description: Defeat goblins in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The goblins have retaken deep delvings carved in the hills of the North Downs, inhabiting them in great droves. While they have learned to fear your name, you don't seem to have made much of a dent in their numbers.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat goblins in the North Downs

deed.name: Goblin-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many goblins in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The goblins of the mountains of Angmar are a cowardly lot, and they have learned to fear you.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat goblins in the North Downs

deed.name: Orc-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Most of the residents of the North Downs have been driven away by the Orkish incursion, but those few who remain now herald your name as their saviour against these brutish invaders.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the North Downs

title.name: Hero / Heroine of the North Downs

deed.name: Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Orcs in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orcs of Angmar still threaten to march through the North Downs, but there will be far fewer of them to do so, thanks to you.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the North Downs

deed.name: Redeemer
deed.description: Defeat shades in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Long ago many princes and warriors of the Dúnedain fell upon the Fields of Fornost - you cannot say if these horrors are them, but either way you've returned many of them to the peace of the grave.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat shades in the North Downs

deed.name: Redeemer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many shades in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Oathbreakers of Fornost are a wicked lot, most refusing to fulfill their oaths and redeem themselves.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat shades in the North Downs

deed.name: Troll-slayer
deed.description: Defeat trolls in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Trolls -- they are among the strongest and perhaps the least intelligent of the servants of the Enemy. Now it seems that these monstrous giants wander the North Downs at will, or would, if you did not stand against them!
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat trolls in the North Downs

deed.name: Troll-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many trolls in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The trolls of the North Downs are a powerful and terrible lot... yet you have proven their better.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat trolls in the North Downs

deed.name: Warg-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Wargs in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Anywhere goblins can be found, you'll likely encounter Wargs. Thanks to your valiant efforts there are fewer of them in the North Downs however.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Wargs in the North Downs

deed.name: Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Wargs in the North Downs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Wargs of Angmar stalk ever more carefully through the fields and hills of the North Downs, for they know you hunt them even as they hunted you.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Wargs in the North Downs

deed.name: Worm-slayer
deed.description: Defeat worms in the North Downs and Ram Dúath.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The worms of the Ram Dúath have long been a threat to those who live in the North Downs. They often creep down into the fertile valleys below to devour livestock and unwary men alike.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat worms in the North Downs and Ram Dúath

deed.name: Worm-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Worms in the North Downs and Ram Dúath.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Legend has it that the Enemy spent long ages devising the great breed of Dragons that have bedeviled Middle-earth. Worms are among the lesser forms that were discarded along the way -- but they are still deadly foes, and more common than their greater kin by far.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many Worms in the North Downs and Ram Dúath

deed.name: Brigand-slayer
deed.description: Defeat brigands in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Bounders of the Shire look on you kindly for your help in dealing with the recent brigand troubles in the Southfarthing.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many brigands in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have proven yourself a bane to the Big Folk who have been troubling the borders of the Shire.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer
deed.description: Defeat goblins in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: It has been long since the scions of Golfimbul endangered the folk of the Shire, but they will have to make it past you first.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many goblins in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The goblins of the Greenfields have learned to fear the name of

deed.name: Harvest-fly Slayer
deed.description: Defeat harvest-flies in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The harvest-flies are more of a threat to the crops than to the folk of the Shire, but the farmers are thankful for your efforts to destroy them.

deed.name: Harvest-fly Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many harvest-flies in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The farmers of the Shire depend on you to deal with the harvest-flies which plague their fields.

deed.name: Slug-slayer
deed.description: Defeat slugs in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You are not sure that this was the title you were looking for when you set out on the path of an adventurer....

deed.name: Slug-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many slugs in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Slugs quiver at the approach of

deed.name: Spider-slayer
deed.description: Defeat spiders in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Like so many places in Middle-earth, the Shire has seen a recent infestation of dangerous spiders, but they have learned to fear your sting.

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many spiders in the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The name of

deed.name: Wolf-slayer
deed.description: Defeat wolves within the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Just as in olden days, wolves again threaten the Shire, but you have taught them a lesson they will not soon forget.

deed.name: Wolf-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Slay many wolves within the Shire.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The fell hounds which have crossed the Brandywine River are no match for you.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer
deed.description: Defeat brigands in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Dourhands have proven a sore thorn in the side of Durin's Folk, having lost the respect and trust of their kin. You have fought them enough now to realize that they are a greater threat than most imagine.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many brigands in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have fought long and hard against the Dourhands and defeated many of the traitorous curs. What could have incited so many of the Dwarves of the Blue Mountains to rebel in such a cowardly fashion? Jealousy of the accomplishments of Thorin's kin? Some ploy of the Enemy? Simple greed? It matters not, for they seem full set upon the path of chaos and brigandry.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer
deed.description: Defeat goblins in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Ancestral foes of dwarf and Elf alike, goblins again challenge the lands of Ered Luin, but you stand ready to defy them.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many goblins in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
As with so many warriors and heroes before you, the eternal question hangs over all your struggles and pain...
'Just how many of these thrice-cursed goblins are there!?'
The vile creatures put rabbits to shame with their endless numbers, and you fear your arms will rebel and take their leave of you ere you finish the battle against them.

deed.name: Hendroval-slayer
deed.description: Defeat hendrevail in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Unlike the noble Eagles, the filthy hendrevail are used as spies for dark masters across many lands, Ered Luin included.

deed.name: Hendroval-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many hendrevail in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Too gamey to eat and too vicious to leave be, at least these nasty little birds make for good target-practice.

deed.name: Spider-slayer
deed.description: Defeat spiders in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Spiders have long lurked in all the dark corners of Middle-earth, but those of Ered Luin, at least, have reason to fear you.

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Spiders in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Long ago, it was said that a giant and immensely evil spider strove to devour all light in the world. You are not sure what to make of such tales, but there is no doubt that the spiders you have seen and fought of late are not like the simple ones you watched in garden webs in your youth. These are possessed of an evil menace, a dangerous hunger, and of course a far greater size....

deed.name: Wolf-slayer
deed.description: Defeat wolves in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Driven down from the frozen north, wolves are a constant challenge to all those who dwell in Ered Luin, but your prowess has proven their master.

deed.name: Wolf-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wolves in Ered Luin.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Wolves and the people of Middle-earth have never been good neighbours, and the hard winters of late have not improved matters in the slightest. You wonder, though, at the number and size of these beasts as their packs wander down from the Northern hills. Perhaps the Enemy has taken to breeding these curs to unleash upon the lands of Eriador? It does not seem unlikely.

deed.name: Angmarim-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Angmarim in Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: These evil Men wield terrible powers granted them by their Dark Lord -- but such magic will avail them not as you pursue them into the deepest corners of their great strongholds in the north.

deed.name: Angmarim-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Angmarim in Angmar.

deed.name: Orc-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Numbering in the tens of thousands, Orcs have long formed the mainstay of the Enemy's armies. You long ago lost count of how many of these foul creatures have fallen before you -- and yet their numbers seem undiminished.

deed.name: Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Orcs in Angmar.

deed.name: Troll-slayer
deed.description: Defeat trolls in Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The trolls of Angmar are the deadliest of all you have faced. Wielding arms and armour from the forges of the Enemy and possesed of a cruel cunning, even great heroes have fallen before their might.

deed.name: Troll-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many trolls in Angmar.

deed.name: Uruk-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Uruks in Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The mighty Uruks form the elite forces of the armies of Angmar. Having defeated so many of their kind in battle, your name now commands a certain respect -- and even deeper enmity -- among their ranks.

deed.name: Uruk-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Uruks in Angmar.

deed.name: Warg-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Wargs in Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The dreadful Wargs raised within the kennels of Angmar have known no other masters -- until now.

deed.name: Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Wargs in Angmar.

deed.name: Wight-slayer
deed.description: Defeat wights in Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Angmar hosts a dread realm of fell spirits enthralled to the power of Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar. There are few places in all of Middle-earth that inspire such dread as those halls -- even the Angmarim do not dare its borders -- yet you have fought these evil abominations and emerged alive.

deed.name: Wight-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wights in Angmar.

deed.name: Worm-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Worms in the swamps and caves of Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Misshapen half-children of the great Dragons of old, the worms of Angmar possess a fair portion of their elder brood's power and cunning, yet you have overcome their power and proven their match.

deed.name: Worm-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Worms in the swamps and caves of Angmar.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Worms have long infested the swamps of Angmar and the surrounding environs - yet they are rarely used as beasts of war by the Angmarim, for they are very difficult to tame and aggressive to a fault. Most are as likely to turn on their handlers as any enemy.

deed.name: Bear-slayer
deed.description: Defeat bears in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have heard that the giants sometimes breed the largest bears as pets -- and that would not surprise you. They grow them big here in the Misty Mountains -- really big.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat bears in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Bear-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many bears in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have never seen bears this large or aggressive before. Those rumours you had heard about the giants raising them as pets must have been true, for no other explanation makes sense. Nevertheless, you have taught the beasts to respect your prowess -- though it has not improved their attitude towards you one bit.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Bears in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Giant-slayer
deed.description: Defeat giants in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You had thought these great creatures must be legend and myth when you were told stories of them by your parents. Not anymore. Their strength is as great as their size, and their bravery that of a creature that knows it is unmatched. Nevertheless, your valour has brought down a fair number of these foes, despite their immensity.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat giants in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Giant-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many giants in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Since you first laid eyes upon these huge creatures as they stepped towards you through the driving snow, you have become something of an old hand at fighting them. Their size can be used against them, and their brains have definitely given way to brawn. Nevertheless, you know that the day you become careless or complacent is the day you will find yourself being pounded feet-first into a frozen grave.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat giants in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Snow-beast Slayer
deed.description: Defeat snow-beasts in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The snow-beasts that inhabit the Misty Mountains are odd creatures. You had only heard vague tales of them before you came here, and most people would consider them myths, but you have fought enough of them to be quite sure they are real. Where they may have come from, though, you cannot say, unless they are some distant relative of the trolls.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat snow-beasts in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Snow-beast Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many snow-beasts in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have learned no more about the origins of these strange creatures than the day you first encountered one. They are savage brutes however, and they share no love of the Free Peoples of Middle-earth -- or anyone else from all you have seen. Fortunately, they can be defeated much like any other dangerous beast, and you have fought your share and lived to tell the tale.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat snow-beasts in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Troll-slayer
deed.description: Defeat trolls in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: As if the biting cold in the Misty Mountains was not bad enough, it seems to have given rise to a particularly unpleasant breed of troll. These creatures thrive in the ice and frost, and they lurk here waiting to crush and devour any traveller unlucky enough to cross their paths. Your own prowess has served to protect you from them thus far, and you have made a fair tally against the monsters. If only that were the end of it....
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat trolls in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Troll-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many trolls in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: With a cruelty as cold and sharp as the ice that coats the peaks and ridges of the Misty Mountains, the trolls here have striven to destroy you and your companions -- but in this aim, they have failed, and you have proven yourself their match and more. Yet they do not cower from you, for their hearts are frozen, and death holds no fear for these brutes no matter how swiftly you deal it out.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat trolls in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Warg-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Wargs in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Where there are goblins, there are Wargs, and the Misty Mountains are no exception. Tempered by the deadly cold and harsh conditions, these Wargs have become particularly vicious and deadly, but you have found them to be passable opponents at best. Still it is best to be wary, for a pack of the beasts could tear even a stalwart hero apart.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Wargs in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Wargs in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
Since you have come to the Misty Mountains, it has been nothing but Warg-steak, Warg-soup, baked Warg, broiled Warg, Warg-on-toast...
In truth, Wargs are renowned for their horrible taste and gristle, and you would have to be on your last legs before you would touch the stuff. Nevertheless, it does seem like a terrible waste having to do battle with so many of the beasts, and yet come away hungrier than when you began.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Wargs in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Worm-slayer
deed.description: Defeat worms in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: It is said that worms have long lived in the far north, among the desolate and frozen wastes. Alas, it seems only natural then that as the gates of Angmar have been laid open, that they should have unleashed many of the creatures into the frozen peaks of the Misty Mountains. You have succeeded in winnowing their numbers some, but it seems that the pens of Angmar are inexhaustible -- or the creatures have begun to breed here in the mountains. That is an unsettling thought.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat worms in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Worm-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many worms in the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have joined in battle against these great creatures more times than you would care to tell now and proven your worth against them. You can only be thankful that their savage power and steel-sharp claws are backed only by a ferocious cunning and not the great intellect of their elder cousins, the Dragons of legend.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat worms in the Misty Mountains

deed.name: Crawler-slayer
deed.description: Defeat crawlers in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The many-legged horrors which inhabit the crags of the Trollshaws do not daunt you.

deed.name: Crawler-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Crawlers in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The many-legged horrors which inhabit the crags of the Trollshaws do not daunt you.

deed.name: Giant-slayer
deed.description: Defeat giants in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Few dare to confront the great giants of the Mountains, yet you have stood boldly before them and laid them low.

deed.name: Giant-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many giants in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Few dare to confront the great giants of the Mountains, yet you have stood boldly before them and laid them low.

deed.name: Troll-slayer
deed.description: Defeat trolls in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: These lands were not named the Trollshaws without good reason. You have certainly found no shortage of the brutes to test your mettle against.

deed.name: Troll-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many trolls in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: These lands were not named the Trollshaws without good reason. You have certainly found no shortage of the brutes to test your mettle against.

deed.name: Wight-slayer
deed.description: Defeat wights in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The vile creatures of Angmar which cause the dead of ancient Rhudaur to walk once more hold no fear for you.

deed.name: Wight-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wights in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The vile creatures of Angmar which cause the dead of ancient Rhudaur to walk once more hold no fear for you.

deed.name: Wolf-slayer
deed.description: Defeat wolves in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The wolves that inhabit the Trollshaws are among the most wild and powerful of that breed. Serving neither Man nor goblin, these wolves prey upon any foolish enough to venture into their territory -- save for you.

deed.name: Wolf-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wolves in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The wolves that inhabit the Trollshaws are among the most wild and powerful of that breed. Serving neither Man nor goblin, these wolves prey upon any foolish enough to venture into their territory -- save for you.

deed.name: Worm-slayer
deed.description: Defeat worms in the Trollshaws

monsterDied.loreInfo: Where could so many of these terrible beasts have been hidden away? The wastes of the far North, or buried beneath the Gates of Angmar? It does not matter where they came from, so long as you strive to drive them from the lands of Middle-earth.

deed.name: Worm-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many worms in the Trollshaws.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Where could so many of these terrible beasts have been hidden away? The wastes of the far North, or buried beneath the Gates of Angmar? It does not matter where they came from, so long as you strive to drive them from the lands of Middle-earth.

deed.name: Monster-slayer -- Tier 1
deed.description: Stem the tides of Darkness in the War.

condition.loreInfo: You have taken your first steps upon the battlefields of the Ettenmoors and Osgiliath.

deed.name: Monster-slayer -- Tier 2
deed.description: Stem the tides of Darkness in the War.

objective.text: Complete the previous deed tier.

condition.loreInfo: Many of the Enemy have fallen before you -- but it is only a tiny fraction of the hordes issuing forth from Angmar and Mordor.

deed.name: Monster-slayer -- Tier 3
deed.description: Stem the tides of Darkness in the War.

objective.text: Complete the previous deed tier.

condition.loreInfo: You have tested your mettle and hardened yourself against the terrible stress of battle. Your experience in the War will serve you well.

deed.name: Monster-slayer -- Tier 4
deed.description: Stem the tides of Darkness in the War.

objective.text: Complete the previous deed tier.

condition.loreInfo: As you have striven to turn the tide issuing forth from Angmar and Mordor, you have mastered the arts of battle, many of those foolish enough to stand before you fall to your strength.

deed.name: Monster-slayer -- Tier 5
deed.description: Stem the tides of Darkness in the War.

objective.text: Complete the previous deed tier.

condition.loreInfo: You stand tall among those who war for control of the Ettenmoors and Osgiliath. As a lord of battle, you command the respect of all those who would fight -- be they of the Light or the Darkness.
condition.progressOverride: Defeat monster players in the War

deed.name: Monster-slayer -- Tier 6
deed.description: Stem the tides of Darkness in the War.

objective.text: Complete the previous deed tier.

condition.loreInfo:
Your name is now known widely across the North as a hero who has fought tirelessly in the battles that rage across the Ettenmoors and Osgiliath.
As long as you stand in defence of the Free Peoples, the Enemy's victory shall never be complete.

deed.name: Monster-slayer -- Tier 7
deed.description: Stem the tides of Darkness in the War.

objective.text: Complete the previous deed tier.

condition.loreInfo: Even amongst those Eldar who have seen Ages of the world pass before them, your name is now one of renown. Valour and strength such as yours are the stuff from which legends are born, and the evil which gnaws at the edges of the lands quakes at your approach.
