deed.name: Boar-slayer
deed.description: For too long, Boar-kind has plagued the land. In your efforts, you have shown a desire to drive them from Middle-earth.

deed.name: Calling them Home to Roost
deed.description: Defeat twenty players across the Ettenmoors.

condition.loreInfo: Cowards fear your very name. Why not call them all /chicken and bring them home to roost.
condition.progressOverride: Defeat any combination of twenty players within the Ettenmoors.

deed.name: Something in the Air
deed.description: Defeat thirty foes in the Ettenmoors.

condition.loreInfo: There is something in the air tonight. Perhaps you should /sniff the air to find out what it is.
condition.progressOverride: Defeat any combination of thirty players within the Ettenmoors.

deed.name: Taunting the Foe
deed.description: Defeat ten players across the Ettenmoors.

condition.loreInfo: The very sight of you drives fear into the heart of your enemies. You may now /taunt them mercilessly!
condition.progressOverride: Defeat any combination of ten players within the Ettenmoors.

deed.name: Battle Acumen
deed.description: Master your understanding of battle and the space in which it takes place so that you can end battles more swiftly in the future.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A Champion is acutely aware of his surrounding throughout battle. This sesitivity and understanding can allow them to more readily access their skills when their understanding and control has reached a greater level.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Battle Acuity or Enhanced Battle Acuity

deed.name: Mighty Blast
deed.description: You must master your horn-blowing technique to use the horns of the South Kingdom.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Many of the nations of Middle-earth employ distinctive styles of horns. While some are imbued with a greater power than another, the power and will of the wielder can make up for much.

deed.name: Improved Rend
deed.description: Practice your attacks which cause bleeding in your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'If you have gone to the trouble of getting past enough hide, metal, or mail to make them bleed, you might find it worth your while to cut a strap or two on your way out. I usually do.' -- Brethilthor, Stone-troll Slayer

deed.name: Tight Grip
deed.description: Practice your weapon-recovering strike; it could save your life...or a friend's.

skillUsed.loreInfo: In a sword-fight, it is usually a safe bet that the man without a blade is in a bad way. You, however, have learned how to hedge that bet better than most.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Hedge or Improved Hedge

deed.name: Athletic
deed.description: Build your sprinting stamina with focused training.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Many a champion improves his running strength barrelling into battles or to the aid of an ally. On occassion, a champion finds all the training useful at the other end of a fight -- but more often its to find the next foe before the last has come to rest on the ground.

deed.name: Bountiful Mercy
deed.description: Learn to identify the turning point in a foe's strength and strike.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The veteran eye can sometimes see when a foe's strength starts to flag even before the enemy himself knows it.

deed.name: Controlled Fury
deed.description: Master self-control, and many techniques will be possible that were not before.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Why is it that the last thing anyone expects from me is a little self-control? Do you think anyone lasts particularly long swinging a pair of blades about your body without a little control?' -- Grímr, Champion of the Blue Mountains

deed.name: Vigour of Champions
deed.description: Use the defeat of your foe to fuel your attack against the next.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is true that sometimes success in battle may take a toll on the conscience of the victor. Not all enemies begin as such and even the champion, confident in his cause, may grieve for the fallen.

deed.name: Strength from Within
deed.description: Master drawing greater strength from the courage you share with your fellows.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is greater strength for the courageous than even that which they give to others. It can lead to greater independence, but may also make imparting direct commands impractical.

deed.name: Tactical Prowess
deed.description: Master the call to arms and the empowerment of your shield-brother.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The army on the field is one arm as much as it is a thousand. The arm that matters most in the moment is the one holding the blade best positioned to strike. Inspire your brother to deliver the blow, and you all will have swung the tide to victory.

deed.name: Battle-master
deed.description: Press the advantage against your foe and strike when the time is right.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The tide of battle is at your command, and it may ebb only if you give it leave to. The commander must yield the advantage, but strike with it and you will strike with ever greater strength and vigour.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Devastating Blow or Pressing Attack

deed.name: Composure
deed.description: You must learn to make the most of personal sacrifice to be of the greatest aid to your fellows and your cause.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Even when the need is great or desperate, if the commander upon the field is composed, a personal sacrifice may yet yield a greater gift of inspiration and hope.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use the Time of Need skill

deed.name: Adherent of Elendil
deed.description: Invoke the name of Elendil, the Elf-friend and king of old, and let his example guide your blade.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The blood of Westernesse carries strength to this day, no matter how distant the days of the kings of old may seem.

deed.name: Deeds before Words
deed.description: Be an example to your shield-brother, and you will find your inspiration greater still.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Action is the best spark to kindle fire in your shield-brother's heart.

deed.name: Relentless Optimism
deed.description: Study how encouraging words may sometimes yield very great changes in the hearts of your fellows.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is not possible for each kind word or bold proclamation to have the same effect. The hearts of your companions will receive them each time anew. You have learned how to make the markedly inspiring even more so.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Words of Courage or Rallying Cry

deed.name: Precise Ally
deed.description: You must field your archer to practice his art in order to cultivate greater skill and precision.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You understand well the role of the archer on the battlefield and the need for precision. Under your training and guidance, your ally has achieved new levels of excellence.

deed.name: Enduring Morale
deed.description: Increase your vigour and find greater well-springs of spirit within yourself.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The stalwart are those who stand strong long after lesser men have abandoned hope.

deed.name: Flow of Harmony
deed.description: Train to perform your heroic tales with less effort but equal effect.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Let us join the tale that never ends. It goes on and on, my friends. And so shall we.' -- Burt Ninetails, Minstrel Tale-weaver

deed.name: Improved Herald's Strike
deed.description: Be a herald of your opponent's defeat.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have refined your ability to attack with Herald's Strike.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is piece of victory in every skillful swing of a sword. Draw heart from the strike, let it herald your ultimate triumph.

deed.name: Lyrics of Bravery
deed.description: Become a master of your own will, and you will not so easily fall under the sway of others.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Those who are composed with the resolve to face their greatest fears shall conquer them.

deed.name: Improved Echoes of Battle
deed.description: Let the calls of battle echo from the hills and mountains in a great clamour.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The clash of clamour and battle shall be intensified by your songs, sending your foes down to swift defeat.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Melody of Battle, Echoes of Battle or Timeless Echoes of Battle

deed.name: Improved Raise the Spirit
deed.description: Master the words that may raise the spirits of those who stand upon the edge of despair.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Do not give in to despair, friend. Trust in me as I trust in you, and we shall overcome even this.' -- Éadoin, Dawn-singer
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use any version of Raise the Spirit

deed.name: Improved Song of Soothing
deed.description: Train yourself to diminish your appearance in the eyes of your foe.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Sometimes, a soothing melody cannot come swiftly enough.

deed.name: Power of Song
deed.description: Cultivate the endurance to last through any conflict.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Breath is the life we draw in and draw upon. So long as you draw breath, you have the power to act...and to save.' -- James Grant, Healer of Ills

deed.name: The Study of Frost-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of frost in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may lower the temperature of the air about your enemies still lower.

deed.name: Improved Sign of Power: Command
deed.description: You have heard that there may be a more complete form of the sign you uncovered previously.

skillUsed.loreInfo: One must take care when employing the sign of command. The imposition of one's will upon another can leave a lasting mark upon both.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Sign of Power: Command

deed.name: The Secret of Tar
deed.description: Refine the quality of your sticky mixtures to make them easier to prepare.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Handling this substance can be, well, a sticky problem. Fortunately, I have perfected a mixture that surmounts the problem. The solution? Now, that would be telling....' -- Vistan, Master of Robes

deed.name: The Study of Fire-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of fire in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may raise the temperature of the air about your enemies still higher.

deed.name: The Study of Wind-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of wind in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which brings stronger gusts to hamper your foe's movements even more.

deed.name: Improved Sign of Battle
deed.description: Continue your study of ancient signs and the power they represent.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'I believe that the path to knowledge is a road with no end. I suppose, therefore, that I will probably never get there. That is why I take frequent stops to read, have a bite to eat, lend a hand here or there, that sort of thing. Just because I take my time about it does not mean I have not gotten anywhere. There are secret things that I could show you, but...well, you would probably not enjoy the lesson.' -- Gregori, Wanderer from the Forest
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Sign of Battle: Wizard's Fire

deed.name: Improved Storm-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the sudden fury of storms in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which makes the sudden echoes of the storm even more dangerous to your enemies than before.

deed.name: Improved Inner Flame
deed.description: Channeling your Inner Flame takes great effort and concentration, but the reward can be quite enlightening.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You've mastered your Inner Flame, able to spread the benefits to nearby allies.

deed.name: Blocking Force
deed.description: Practice opening your opponent's guard and learn how to gain further advantage from it.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Even while on an aggressive footing, it is possible to achieve an effect similar to some shield-techniques.

deed.name: Hit Where It Hurts
deed.description: A well-placed strike can throw your opponent off-balance.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Without balance, movement is hampered; without movement, speed is hindered; without speed, the fight is against you. Remember this and apply it to your foe.' -- Tirnedhruith, Guardian Trainer

deed.name: Raw Power
deed.description: Practice assuming an aggressive stance and learn how to make it stronger still.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Protecting another sometimes means removing threats from the field in the most expedient manner possible.

deed.name: Final Straw
deed.description: Practice harrying your foes, encouraging them to expose their vulnerabilities.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The guardian knows patience and possesses great reserves of endurance. You know how to whittle away at the composure and control of your foes until they undo themselves.

deed.name: Litany of Challenge
deed.description: Master the goading of your foes...train to draw and hold their ire ever longer.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The true protector's armaments must needs include the right challenge, insult, or battle-cry to engage and enrage any foe he might face.

deed.name: Quick of Foot
deed.description: Practise your stamp to interrupt your foes, for using the skill repeatedly will help you to perform it with greater ease in the future.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A quick boot, swiftly applied, can disrupt many an enemy's plans -- and it is best that the plans of the enemy do not come to fruition.

deed.name: Shield of Fire
deed.description: Taunt your foes without relent, for you know they would not spare you or your allies the blade.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned that your enemies' greatest weakness can be their pride. You have mastered the art of turning their rage and ignorance against them.

deed.name: Threatening Presence
deed.description: Cultivate a threatening demeanor and practice the imposing art of putting your shield into your enemy's face.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Nowadays, when someone asks for credit, I just give them \qThe Look'\q...you know? Sure, I learned it on the field, but it still comes in handy at the shop.' -- Patrick Pot-patcher, Guardian, retired

deed.name: Cruel Odds
deed.description: To better twist chance in your favour, you must first master the art of piling victory on top of success.

skillUsed.loreInfo: When facing off against the gambling Burglar, the odds are that their enemies find cruel chance at the point of a blade.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Achieve a critical hit with any skill unlocked by a critical hit

deed.name: Even the Odds
deed.description: Make the most of successful coordination with your allies, be it to strike fast or ready an escape.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned that the momentum of success may sometimes lead forwards and sometimes backwards. When you have the edge, taking a gamble is not such a gamble as it might have been before.

deed.name: Honed Wit
deed.description: With practice, the right comeback may no longer require a mind set only to mischief.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Mastering the art of the retort may be thought of in much the same way as perfecting a skilled sword-stroke. Just as a strike may be taught from a particular pose but executed from many, you have mastered this brand of wit so it may be levied at any time.

deed.name: Sharp Wit, Sharp Blade
deed.description: You must master the combination of a cutting remark and a marking cut.

skillUsed.loreInfo: \qWhat stings more than a harsh word? A harsh word and a sharp blade.\q -- Dexter Deep-pockets, Burglar, retired

deed.name: Spatial Sense
deed.description: No matter how well-placed the strike, there is always room for improvement.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Precision and patience yield perfection and, for your foe, new depths of pain.

deed.name: Strategic Planning
deed.description: If you can internalize the age old maxim, you may find the right location easier to arrive at and more effective than before.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Now your foes will know -- however briefly -- that location truly is everything, and that this particular location is somewhere behind their back.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use the Location is Everything skill

deed.name: Complicated Terms
deed.description: You have picked up a few new conundrums in your travels, but you will not be able to polish the weaker points until they fall flat a few times.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The best riddle is one whose answer is obvious the moment after it is revealed. The strongest puzzles are the ones tempered through trial and proven with practice.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Target must resist your Riddle or Confound skills

deed.name: Confound the Fools
deed.description: You have come to believe that confusion is only scratching the surface. With a bit of work, you could stupify them where they stand.

skillUsed.loreInfo: If they thought your riddle perplexing, just wait until they hear this....

deed.name: Heart of the Bard
deed.description: Follow in the steps of Bard himself and the servants of evil may grow to fear your name as well.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have refined your skill with Heart Seeker.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The name of Bard will live long in the memories and hearts of the Free Peoples. The same name can strike fear into the hearts of those who walk in shadows, and in their terror, they leave themselves vulnerable to the strongest attacks of the Hunter's art.

deed.name: Barbed Hindrance
deed.description: Train hard to improve the snare on your Barbed Arrow, to help keep your prey at a comfortable distance from you.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'I've even shared a trail with one or two bow-masters who carried no blades at all. They were the most frightening of all.'-- Seeker, Spider-bane, Mirkwood
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike foes with your Barbed Arrow

deed.name: Combat Traps
deed.description: Master the art of trap-setting to be able to deploy them no matter the distractions.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have made your traps more durable, ensuring they function more reliably.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It takes practiced skill to lay a trap in the midst of a fray, but the benefits are worth the hours spent in practice.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use your Set Trap or Set Snare skills

deed.name: Critical Eye
deed.description: Develop the eye to spot and target the weak points of your foes more reliably.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Precision aim comes from training and knowledge of your foe. Know your enemy, know where to send your arrow to cause the greatest result, and be able to let fly with confidence and precision.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Achieve critical hits with your bow

deed.name: Shot through the Heart
deed.description: Earn a name for yourself and improve the reliability of your most deadly attack.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'You didn't seriously think they all keep their heart in the same place did you? Those that have one at all can be cagey about those sorts of things down here....' -- Jóngir, Cavern-hunter

deed.name: Strong Intimidation
deed.description: Strike fear into the heart of your enemies and learn what it is that makes them flee.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Time spent in the wild acquaints the hunter to many forms of animal-emotions. Survival in the wild oft teaches the hunter to shape or inspire that emotion that suits their needs.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Bard's Arrow or Cry of the Predator

deed.name: The Quality of Mercy
deed.description: The quality of your shot must not strain your bow. The strain on your target is another matter altogether.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Have...some...mercy!'-- Alobri, the Zealous
skillUsed.progressOverride: Achieve critical hits with Merciful Shot

deed.name: Resolute Aim
deed.description: Cultivate the precise and dextrous movements to draw and fire at speed, no matter the distraction.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Drawing, aiming, and firing at speed is an act of skill and of will. With enough training, the petty distractions of battle will not disrupt your perfect form.

deed.name: Strong Voice
deed.description: Let loose the cry of war and see your enemy's resolve erode.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Never death, never defeat, never despair. These are not permitted by the Warden...your cause is greater than these.' -- Kais, the Ironhand-warden

deed.name: Confidence
deed.description: In the face of your confidence, let your opponent's own surety drain away.

skillUsed.loreInfo: As you show your confidence, let doubt grow within your enemy.

deed.name: Deadly Thrust
deed.description: Your spear-thrust will weaken your foe's armour.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The reach of the spear extends to the courage of your enemy. They know that that they are not beyond the touch of its point.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with The Dark Before Dawn

deed.name: Efficient Thrust
deed.description: A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your mastery of the quick thrust will be a boon to you in battles to come.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Quick Thrust, Quick Toss, or Quick Stab

deed.name: Expert Hurler
deed.description: In the way of the spear, one always desires to have the option of using the best attack at the right time.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Let the spear drop among your foes, a herald of your arrival.

deed.name: Find Weakness
deed.description: A well-placed hit may be reveal your foe's weaknesses.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Nothing made in this age is without some flaw...do you think something fashioned by these base creatures would be an exception?' -- Krom, Vault-warden
skillUsed.progressOverride: Achieve critical hits with Critical Strike

deed.name: Force of Personality
deed.description: Lead with the fist, and the rest will follow.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Master the passage of the fist, and it shall become inescapable.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Surety of Death, Resolution, or Spear of Virtue

deed.name: Master of the Fist
deed.description: Master the Way of the Fist.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you truly have a fist of legend.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Exultation of Battle or Desolation

deed.name: Master of the Spear
deed.description: Master the Way of the Spear.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you have become an expert of the spear.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Mighty Blow, Wall of Steel, or Boar's Rush

deed.name: Mighty Throw
deed.description: The point may always be made sharper.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have become more proficient with spears.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Fall from the sky and find the heart of your enemy.

deed.name: A Keen Response
deed.description: A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your mastery of the precise blow will be a boon to you in battles to come.

deed.name: Skill and Power
deed.description: Even a routine attack may become more powerful.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Skill in gambits mean that every form may be an advantage to you.

deed.name: Terrible Visage
deed.description: Let your enemy look upon your face and see the fear spread across theirs.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Sear your foe with the light of justice, let it expose their weaknesses.

deed.name: Never Say Die
deed.description: Take respite, however brief, and you can fight on.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Soldier on just a little longer and see it carry you through the battle.

deed.name: Perseverance
deed.description: Take your foe off their feet to allow yourself to recover.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The well-springs of your morale flow stronger.

deed.name: Deadly Insult
deed.description: Do not allow your foe to think of any target but yourself.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Choice words and gestures can focus the foe wonderfully upon yourself.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Warden's Taunt, Warden's Aim, or Warden's Scorn

deed.name: Efficient Shield-work
deed.description: Bring up your shield and never let it falter.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A lighter shield or a stronger arm? You wield the shield with efficiency and efficacy.

deed.name: Know Your Enemy
deed.description: Taunt your foe into error.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A battle is not as satisfying until the enemy will endanger himself to fight you.

deed.name: Master of the Shield
deed.description: Master the Way of the Shield.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden,...you have achieved excellence with the shield.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Shield Mastery, Celebration of Skill, or Dance of War

deed.name: Shield-trickery
deed.description: Present your foe with your shield...to his face.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Sometimes, your shield is like other weapons, too. Good for hitting things...and usually a little surprising.' -- Jeb Wheaton, Warden of the Trollshaws
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Shield-bash, Behind the Shield, or Shield-blast

deed.name: Skillful Blocking
deed.description: Blocking is an art cultivated with practice.

condition.loreInfo: Your shield is a weapon, too, but it is used against weapons.

deed.name: Wary Blocks
deed.description: Strike with your defence foremost in your mind.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Watchfulness in battle serves you well and those in your charge.

deed.name: Master of Connotation
deed.description: Your understanding of inference and connotation is improved by your foe's lack of understanding.

skillUsed.loreInfo: If your foe does not understand you, it may be that the connotation of your words was too confusing.

deed.name: Linnod of Peace
deed.description: Improve your collection of pacifying and calming texts.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have refined your skill at writing calming verses in battle.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Welcome words can be given to those in need with less notice taken by those who would not see them sent.

deed.name: Master of Tragedy
deed.description: Your studies in the construction of tragedy can have tremendous impact upon your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Tragedy in literature can tug at the heartstrings...tragedy in the world can tug down fortified walls.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Critical Hits with Fury of the Storm skills

deed.name: Frost-burn
deed.description: Use of offensive writs may reveal the sympathies and shared nature between the two.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The cold bites and the fire burns, but why would not tongues of flame also bear teeth? Fire and frost are not so different in their harsher aspects--though inimical to one another, they may be doubly so to those afflicted by them.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Writ of Fire or Writ of Cold

deed.name: Overflowing Confidence
deed.description: You draw strength from within and find motivation that will carry you further than before.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'I find that necessity is an excellent motivator.' -- Gronir, dwarf stone-keeper

deed.name: Confounding Principles
deed.description: Improve the effect your touch can have upon your foe.

skillUsed.loreInfo: If only your foes would learn to fear your reach, they might realize there is no place where they are safe when assailing you.

deed.name: Linnod of Subtlety
deed.description: There are ways you can put an aggressive bent to your soothing letters, allowing your invectives to burn as hot, but anger less.

skillUsed.loreInfo: When you know your purpose, you can craft your words with intent to be effective and yet cunningly subtle.

deed.name: The Prophetic Word
deed.description: Practice the art of casting your vision forwards, and you shall be able to do it with greater frequency.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Grave portents may give the uncertain pause, but with practiced eye, foresight may come more swiftly to sight.

deed.name: Tale of Rage
deed.description: Learn to let your temper loose in your writing, and it shall burn through to your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Wrath, like fire, may burn bright but cold...or hot and nigh invisible. With your rage channelled, you control the venting of your anger and stoke the fires as you wish.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Wrath of Flame skills

deed.name: Conflagration of Runes
deed.description: With practice, you can kindle flame from fragments faster and with less effort.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'If you cannot endure the heat, stay of the library' -- Ciryalen, Rune-keeper in the north

deed.name: Scathing Retort
deed.description: Kindle the fires of your passion to increase your art's impact.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Fire weakens as it burns, reducing your foe's protections against fire.

deed.name: Writ of Blazing Fire
deed.description: Your fires can burn longer still, if you only find the right words.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Insults, as burns, may fade slowly from memory and leave scars longer still.

deed.name: Icy Discourse
deed.description: The bite of cold can fade swiftly or slow. It is a matter of practice to let it linger.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned to leave your foes with a memory of biting cold that can linger long in their mind...and their feet.

deed.name: Terse Narrative
deed.description: You are able to convey epic meaning through fewer words.

skillUsed.loreInfo: An epic is sometimes best presented in a shorter form.

deed.name: Memorable Prose
deed.description: Achieve greater heights of healing while practicing the inscription of words of healing and restoration.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Kindly do words come to those who need them and linger with care.

deed.name: Rune of Endurance
deed.description: Increase the resiliency of your Rune of Restoration.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Runes may bind the stone upon which they are written, preserving meaning and integrity.

deed.name: Author of Exaltation
deed.description: Increase the protection offered by your Word of Exaltation with a dedicated inscription.

skillUsed.loreInfo: As the runes may protect against ignorance, so may they also defend against the blade.

deed.name: Master of Allusion
deed.description: Your ability to write between the lines confounds your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Meaning within meaning and allusions away from the truth can work to a rune-keeper's advantage.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use any Words of Grace skills

deed.name: Harsh Debate
deed.description: Learn how to unsettle your foe with your unrelenting assertions.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Unending discourse is your art, but it can sometimes take your foes by surprise. Of course, such is your aim.

deed.name: Closing Remarks
deed.description: Study how to make an epic conclusion to your arguments.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The crash of thunder carries finality, and the silence that follows is broken only by receding echoes unto the horizon.

deed.name: Thunderous Words
deed.description: The spark may light the way to greater things.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Few are prepared the first time they experience even the simplest of your runes.

deed.name: Winter-storm
deed.description: Your narratives combine the chill of a winter night and the turbulence of the fiercest storm.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Greatness can be seen in the details; great details can be seen in the world.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Fury of the Storm or Chill of Winter skills

deed.name: The Mines of Moria
deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.

questComplete.loreInfo: Dwarves from the Iron Hills, the Iron Garrison, have come to reclaim Moria. They soon learn that the task will not be easy....
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book I of \qThe Mines of Moria\q

questComplete.loreInfo: The Iron Garrison has begun to establish itself within Moria, reclaiming the ancient realm of Durin's Folk....
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book II of \qThe Mines of Moria\q

questComplete.loreInfo: Hope stirs in the hearts of the Longbeards as they advance against the many threats of Moria....
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book III of \qThe Mines of Moria\q

questComplete.loreInfo: The Iron Garrison prepares for war as the evil lurking within Moria turns its gaze towards them....
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book IV of \qThe Mines of Moria\q

questComplete.loreInfo: The courage of the Iron Garrison is tested as it faces the wrath of the Orcs of Moria.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book V of \qThe Mines of Moria\q

questComplete.loreInfo: There are worse things in the depths of Moria than just Orcs....
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book VI of \qThe Mines of Moria\q

deed.name: The Path of the Mischief-maker
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Mischief-maker. If you follow this path to its end, you may learn how to become a master of mischief, increasing your abilities to distract foes in combat.

deed.name: A Guide to the Quiet Knife
deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim their kingdom of old. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary \qA Guide to the Quiet Knife.\q If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.

level.loreInfo: You have achieved level 58

itemUsed.loreInfo: \qA Guide to the Quiet Knife\q was written by the same burglar who authored \qThe Book of Knives.\q This legendary book details the further exploits of a renowned knife-fighter.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Read the book, \qA Guide to the Quiet Knife\q
itemUsed.itemName: A Guide to the Quiet Knife

questComplete.loreInfo: Hope stirs in the hearts of the Longbeards as they advance against the many threats of Moria....

questComplete.loreInfo: The Iron Garrison prepares for war as the evil lurking within Moria turns its gaze toward them....

deed.name: The Path of the Healing Hands
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Healing Hands. If you follow this path to its end, you may learn how to better restore the morale and vigour of your companions in combat.

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest 'A Cry of Vengeance'

deed.name: The Master of the Charge
deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim their ancient home. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary \qThe Master of the Charge.\q If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.

level.loreInfo: You have achieved level 58.

itemUsed.loreInfo: \qThe Master of the Charge\q is a legendary book detailing the dark tale of captain who called forth Oathbreakers to fulfill their vow and aid him in a great battle.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Read the book, \qThe Master of the Charge\q

deed.name: The Mines of Moria
deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.

deed.name: The Path of the Martial Champion
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Martial Champion. Mastery of the arts found along this path will allow you to suffer the most cruel attacks and remain in the fight.

questComplete.loreInfo: With the teachings learned along the Path of the Martial Champion, you will find absorbing and redirecting your foe's blows easier, allowing you to serve your companions better in a prolonged fight.

deed.name: The Boiling Rage
deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim Moria. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary \qThe Boiling Rage.\q If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.

level.loreInfo: You have achieved level 58.

itemUsed.loreInfo: This tome is said to have been penned by a champion who fought the Wainriders as they invaded Gondor. It details how the author channelled his rage over this brutal invasion to lead his company to victory.

One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary \qThe Book of Nature.\q If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.
