questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed Beasts of the Grand Stair
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Beasts of the Grand Stair

questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed Villains of the Grand Stair (Part 1)
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Villains of the Grand Stair (Part 1)

deed.name: Letters to Igash
deed.description: Find various texts in the Grand Stair

objective.text: Find pieces of treasure within the Forgotten Treasury.
Find various texts in the Grand Stair.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: In this letter, Igash is briefed on the dire plans to wake the great beast that slumbers in a secluded corner of the Grand Stair.
The Highpeak Kennel Report details the secret plans of the Warg-keepers in the Grand Stair, for they breed Wargs in ever-greater numbers to launch an assault upon the dwarves of Moria.

Orcs loyal to Igash seem to have met a horrific end shortly after writing this brief scrawl, begging for assistance against a secret uprising of the White Hand. The plea failed to reach the eyes for which it was intended.
This document is a log of Igash's deeds since the establishment of his rule in the Grand Stair.

deed.name: Villains of the Grand Stair (Part 1)
deed.description: Defeat the villains of the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Ilzkâl, guardian of the foyer of the Grand Stair, is a powerful Orc and cruel. He invites battle on his doorstep.
The fell Warg-rider, paired with his mount, is a terrifying foe, doubled in strength with his fanged companion bearing him upon his endeavours.
The great mount, paired with his master, harbours twice the strength of a mighty foe.
Gothghaash of the flowing fire knows no fear, for his wreath of flame lends him unnatural strength and cunning defences.

deed.name: Villains of the Grand Stair (Part 2)
deed.description: Defeat the villains of the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The summoner of great beasts may inspire less awe than his fearsome minions, but left alive, he is deadlier than his mightiest underling.
The beast has slumbered quietly for many a long day, but, once wakened, it reveals its true tumultuous and violent strength.
Nardur, shield of Igash, loyal to one only, fights with great zeal for all his devotion to his master.
Igash is the lord and master of the Grand Stair, and he has as many enemies as he has devotees. He musters a great swell of arms to assault the dwarves of Moria.

deed.name: Tamers of the Vile Wargs
deed.description: Defeat Goblins in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Goblins have no love for any creature that goes on two feet, but they seem to feel some tie with the fell Wargs they raise.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Goblins in the Grand Stair

deed.name: Tamers of the Vile Wargs (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Goblins in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Master and beast behave as one, each seeming to bend to the other's will, until all their foes are brought low.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Goblins in the Grand Stair

deed.name: Followers of Igash
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Orcs in the Grand Stair ever execute the will of Igash, cleverly guarding all routes from the footsteps of unwelcome strangers.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Grand Stair

deed.name: Followers of Igash (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Orcs cleverly defend the Grand Stair and set their own plots for the power of those who dwell there.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Grand Stair

deed.name: Brutes of the Grand Stair
deed.description: Defeat Trolls in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Trolls may not possess the cunning of their fellows in the Grand Stair, but their brute strength and hardiness gives them an unrivalled place at the head of Igash's power.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Trolls in the Grand Stair

deed.name: Brutes of the Grand Stair (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Trolls in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The great trolls of the Grand Stair are as hard and powerful as any of their kind, but the will of Igash lends them unusual strength.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Trolls in the Grand Stair

deed.name: Beasts of the Grand Stair
deed.description: Defeat Wargs in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Wargs of the Grand Stair are hand-reared by the malicious goblins, and the two are bound in thought and action when entering battle together.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Wargs in the Grand Stair

deed.name: Beasts of the Grand Stair (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Wargs in the Grand Stair.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Evil Wargs, reared by their goblin masters, thirst for blood in the Grand Stair, and defend its ascending paths with their bloodlust.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Wargs in the Grand Stair

deed.name: The Watcher of Moria
deed.description: Defend Moria from the evil of the Watcher in the Water

questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed Lost to the Deeps
You've completed The Vile Maw

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete The Arms of the Watcher

deed.name: Lost to the Deeps
deed.description: Find missing dwarves within the Vile Maw.

objective.text: Find missing dwarves within the Vile Maw
Find missing dwarves within the Vile Maw

itemUsed.loreInfo: The dwarf-merchant, bringer of supplies, went missing at the very beginning of the expedition, even before you arrived to assist the dwarves.
The dwarf-miner was a stout worker for Brogur and Bósi's cause, and greatly desired to lay eyes upon the lost Mines of Moria during the course of his life.
The dwarf-adventurer feared nothing as he set his sights on Moria, but the Watcher put an end to his eagerness.
The fearless dwarf-warrior looks as though he would not go down without a fight, and from the look of it he put some fear into the enemy ere he fell.

deed.name: The Vile Maw
deed.description: Defeat the Watcher in the Water.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Watcher haunted the Black Pool, preventing the good dwarves from safely entering Khazad-dûm.
questComplete.progressOverride: Drive back the Watcher at the Black Pool

questComplete.loreInfo: The Flooded Treasury is a terrible place, filled with deadly malice from the cruel Watcher.
questComplete.progressOverride: Drive back the Watcher in the Flooded Treasury

monsterDied.loreInfo: With the Watcher defeated, Moria will be safer for all who tread there.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat the Watcher in the Water

deed.name: The Arms of the Watcher
deed.description: Cleave the arms of the Watcher in the Vile Maw.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The arms of the Watcher were many, and their master's wrath was bent upon you, but you have hewn a great many of the vile appendages.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Cleave the arms of the Watcher in the Vile Maw

deed.name: The Arms of the Watcher (Advanced)
deed.description: Cleave the arms of the Watcher in the Vile Maw.

monsterDied.loreInfo: For every arm hewn by your hand, it seemed that two more would appear in its place, but despite the malevolent force of your foe, you have done much to weaken it.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Cleave the arms of the Watcher in the Vile Maw

deed.name: The Fallen Heroes
deed.description: Find remnants of fallen heroes within Skûmfil

objective.text: Find remnants of fallen heroes within Skûmfil.
Find remnants of fallen heroes within Skûmfil.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This blade once shone bright, forged in Durin's day and wielded by a mighty dwarf-champion of old. It now shines only with the slime of the corpses in Skûmfil.
The helm you have recovered drips ever with blood-tinged fluid, though you have tried many times to wipe it clean.

itemUsed.loreInfo: Whoever bore this sword into Skûmfil hewed the bones of many enemies with its blade, now pocked with many dents.
This corroded shield is evidence of the poison of Skûmfil, for it is worn as if laid in an acid-bath for many long years.

deed.name: Triumph within the Forsaken Deeps
deed.description: Drive evil from the Dark Delvings

questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed Runes of the Dark Delvings

deed.name: Runes of the Dark Delvings
deed.description: Find hidden rune-stones in the Dark Delvings

objective.text: Find hidden rune-stones in the Dark Delvings.
Find hidden rune-stones in the Dark Delvings.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: Even in the darkest deeps, this rock glints like moonlight on a many-faceted gemstone.
This stone has been carefully shaped and crafted by the end of a pick to reflect the thought of its maker.

itemUsed.loreInfo: This rune-stone is so old that its weathered surface is as soft and smooth as silk cloth.
The dim rune-stone is unremarkable in every way, faded and dark, and almost seems as though it wishes to remain lost in Dark Delvings.

deed.name: Mastery Over Fear
deed.description: Drive evil from the horrible deeps in the Foundations of Stone

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Purifier of Skûmfil
You have completed Triumph within the Forsaken Deeps
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Triumph within the Forsaken Deeps

You've completed The Hounds of Skûmfil
You've completed The Horrors with Many Legs
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete The Horrors with Many Legs

questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed The Corpse-beasts of Skûmfil
You've completed The Blighted Ones

deed.name: Leaders of the Nameless
deed.description: Defeat the leaders of the Nameless horrors within the Dark Delvings

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Void-eater is a Nameless foe whose time in Moria is uncharted, for few have ever looked upon it and lived.
The dark beings that fly to the summons of the Doom-speaker are terrifying in their own right, but next to their master they seem as harmless as children.
The Gurvand, mutated and corrupted by countless years in the deepest delvings of Khazad-dûm, is perilously strong, weakening only in the Rune-light in his chamber.

deed.name: The Corpse-eaters
deed.description: Defeat the leaders of the Kergrim within Skûmfil

monsterDied.loreInfo: Bonetooth is a kergrim named for a terrifying mouth and an adornment of long bones around his neck.
Old Gnawer has ever delighted in chewing and picking at the bones of the dead in the corpse-piles of Skûmfil.
Rockjaw, a primitive-looking beast, clamps its mighty jaws upon dead or living without discernment.
Shalebiter sharpens its muzzle upon the cavern walls, but the deep-claw relishes flesh as much as any of its kin.
A Grimreaver came long ago to the corpse-piles of Skûmfil. He is old and deadly, and there is a keenness to his glance that his lesser kindred lack.

deed.name: Leaders of the Hive
deed.description: Defeat the leaders of gredbyg in Skûmfil

monsterDied.loreInfo: This vile grodbog has grown fat on the congealed blood of the dead, living far beyond its time.
Ulugon guards the stronghold of Brúmbereth, growing mighty on the spoils of the rotting dead and summoning minions to its call.
Nestaduan is the healing grodbog of Skûmfil, lending strength to itself when it is all but spent, ever giving it new life.
Grog is mightiest of Brúmbereth's children, dealing heavy blows with its powerful mandibles.
Grothulun is the most cowardly of Brúmbereth's kin, burrowing beneath the hard ground to keep itself safe in battle, harbouring strength only to strike again.

Brúmbereth, queen of the gredbyg of Skûmfil, walked in the vast tunnels of Moria in Durin's day, ever out of reach of the dwarves' delving. She broods now among the piles of the dead, growing mighty and cruel in her long years unchallenged.

deed.name: The Hounds of Skûmfil
deed.description: Defeat cave-claws and deep-claws within Skûmfil.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Cave-claws and deep-claws infest the mines of Moria like vermin, waylaying those who seek to cleanse Skûmfil of the evil that lies there.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat cave-claws and deep-claws in Skûmfil

deed.name: The Hounds of Skûmfil (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat cave-claws and deep-claws in Skûmfil.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The hounds of Skûmfil have been deeply corrupted by the rot of the dead and the poisons that swim among them.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat cave-claws and deep-claws in Skûmfil

deed.name: The Horrors with Many Legs
deed.description: Defeat Gredbyg in Skûmfil

monsterDied.loreInfo: Insect-kind creep throughout the fetid dark of Skûmfil, feeding upon dead and living alike whenever chance allows.

deed.name: The Horrors with Many Legs (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Gredbyg in Skûmfil

monsterDied.loreInfo: The mandibles of the gredbyg seek to consume any manner of flesh, be it rotting Orc-kind or living dwarf, halfling, Man, or Elf.

deed.name: The Corpse-beasts of Skûmfil
deed.description: Defeat Kergrim in Skûmfil.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The vile creatures that walk two-legged through Skûmfil have feasted long upon the rank refuse of that forsaken hall.

deed.name: The Corpse-beasts of Skûmfil (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Kergrim in Skûmfil.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The kergrim are deadly foes, and wherever one falls, there seem to be more to take its place.

deed.name: The Blighted Ones
deed.description: Defeat Spiders in Skûmfil.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Those spawned by the children of Ungoliant have wended their way into every dark corner of Middle-earth as the fingers of evil touch ever farther.

deed.name: The Blighted Ones (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Spiders in Skûmfil.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The spiders that haunt the rotting deeps of Skûmfil seem particularly fell and corrupted, even for their kind.

deed.name: Glow-worm Slayer
deed.description: Defeat Glow-worms in the Dark Delvings.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The glow-worms of the Dark Delvings are perilous creatures, unwittingly aiding the Nameless who haunt those halls with their luminous evil.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Glow-worms in the Dark Delvings

deed.name: Glow-worm Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Glow-worms in the Dark Delvings.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Glow-worms slither from the cracks in the Dark Delvings, their spittle poisoning the very earth upon which they crawl.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Glow-worms in the Dark Delvings

deed.name: Nameless-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Nameless in the Dark Delvings.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Nameless abominations must be kept from ever setting foot outside the Dark Delvings, for they do not belong anywhere in Middle-earth.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Nameless in the Dark Delvings

deed.name: Nameless-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Nameless in the Dark Delvings.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Nameless of the Dark Delvings relish the venomous safety of those caverns, overcoming their enemies with ancient malice unmatched in other foes.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Nameless in the Dark Delvings

deed.name: Persevering Against the Blight
deed.description: Drive evil from the Sixteenth Hall

questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed Corruption in Command
You've completed Investigating the Blight
You've completed Orcs of the Sixteenth Hall
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Orcs of the Sixteenth Hall

questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed Fallen to Blight
You've completed Carriers of the Blight

deed.name: Investigating the Blight
deed.description: Collect samples of the blight that is corrupting the Sixteenth Hall

objective.text: Collect samples of the blight that is corrupting the Sixteenth Hall.
Collect samples of the blight that is corrupting the Sixteenth Hall.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: These spores emit a faint, barely perceptible odour.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Find a sample of Virulent Spores

inventoryItem.loreInfo: A foul reek emanates so strongly from the noxious spores that you could smell them long before you saw them.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Find a sample of Noxious Spores

inventoryItem.loreInfo: The infectious spores must be handled with the utmost care.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Find a sample of Infectious Spores

inventoryItem.loreInfo: Pestilent spores are especially dangerous, filling your lungs with searing pain if you dare to inhale too deeply.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Find a sample of Pestilent Spores

deed.name: Corruption in Command
deed.description: Defeat the sources of the blight within the Sixteenth Hall.

monsterDied.loreInfo: This hideous Orc-foe is almost pitiable in his sickened state, but his illness lends him a terrible strength and malicious power of will.
Mutated nearly beyond recognition, Dhûrz of the Globsnaga seems formed to exert more cruelty than most Orcs are capable of.
The Lost One seems to be the result of an experiment gone horribly wrong; such a creature should never have come into being.

deed.name: Carriers of the Blight
deed.description: Defeat insects in the Sixteenth Hall

monsterDied.loreInfo: The insects of the Sixteenth Hall bear the cursed fungal disease with them, and risk bringing it beyond the confines of that sickened place.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat insects in the Sixteenth Hall

deed.name: Carriers of the Blight (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat insects in the Sixteenth Hall

monsterDied.loreInfo: The spread of the fungal poison must be stopped, and one precaution is to strike the vile insects that bear the disease.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat insects in the Sixteenth Hall

deed.name: Fallen to Blight
deed.description: Defeat Globsnaga in the Sixteenth Hall

monsterDied.loreInfo: The diseased Orcs walk to and fro, hideously mutated by the fungus that threatens Moria.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Globsnaga in the Sixteenth Hall

deed.name: Fallen to Blight (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Globsnaga in the Sixteenth Hall

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Globsnaga are more vile than the average Orc, yet they are more wretched also, and pity moves the sword that hews them and ends their misery.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Globsnaga in the Sixteenth Hall

deed.name: Orcs of the Sixteenth Hall
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in the Sixteenth Hall

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Sixteenth Hall is overrun with healthy and unhealthy Orcs alike, but it is only a matter of time until all creatures fall to the sickness of Moria.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Sixteenth Hall

deed.name: Orcs of the Sixteenth Hall (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in the Sixteenth Hall

monsterDied.loreInfo: Orcs are destructive beings, equally evil in their intent whether ill or healthy.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Sixteenth Hall

deed.name: Deep Delver
deed.description: The dwarves in the Deeps of Moria will need a great deal of help in overcoming the obstacles that await them in the Mines of Moria. Your assistance will be welcome, for there is much work to be done if Khazad-dûm is to be hospitable once more.

objective.text: Complete Quests in the Moria Deeps.

questComplete.loreInfo: The dwarves have some tasks for you, and you will be well-rewarded if you assist them in their undertakings.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete quests in the Moria Deeps

Complete Quests in the Deeps of Moria.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have begun to help the dwarves, but the riches of Khazad-dûm are still far from anyone's grasp, for many problems and foes still stand in the way of true progress.

deed.name: The Defence of Lórien
deed.description: The Orcs of Moria have come down from the mountains and begun their assault upon Lothlórien.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Orcs of Moria have come down from the mountains and threaten the safety of Lothlórien. Brave heroes must fight to defend the Golden Wood!
questComplete.progressOverride: Successfully defend Lothlórien from the Orcs of Moria

deed.description: The Orcs of Moria have come down from the mountains and begun their assault upon Lothlórien.

deed.name: Liberator of the Halls of Crafting
deed.description: The Orcs of Moria forge weapons of war with which to assault Lothlórien, while the Iron Garrison and the Galadhrim seek to reclaim the Halls of Crafting and hinder their production.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Chieftains of the Halls of Crafting
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Chieftains of the Halls of Crafting

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Halls of Crafting Crate Investigation
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Halls of Crafting Crate Investigation

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Halls of Crafting Melee Orc-slayer
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Halls of Crafting Melee Orc-slayer

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Halls of Crafting Ranged Orc-slayer
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Halls of Crafting Ranged Orc-slayer

deed.name: Halls of Crafting Crate Investigation
deed.description: The Halls of Crafting supply Mazog's forces with weapons. Any information regarding how they are creating weapons so quickly would be vital in bringing about the Orc-lord's downfall.

itemUsed.loreInfo: You can practically see how heavy this box would have been to lift. Weapon-parts are spilling out as you uncover it.
Odd pieces and parts of weapons were found in this crate, possibly from a production line.
Adhesives line the inner portions of this box, causing you to sputter and cough upon opening it.
Heavy hand-wrought tools are inside this box, perfect for hammering raw metal into something useful.
It appears that you have found someones lunch. Disgusting.

deed.name: Reaver of Dâr Narbugud
deed.description: The dark hole known as Dâr Narbugud was only briefly glimpsed by Durin the Deathless...and even he wanted nothing to do with the place.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Hierarchy of the Nameless
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Hierarchy of the Nameless

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Dâr Narbugud Nameless-slayer
You have completed Dâr Narbugud Orc-slayer
You have completed Dâr Narbugud Troll-slayer
You have completed Dâr Narbugud Fungus-investigation

deed.name: Dâr Narbugud Fungus Investigation
deed.description: The depths of Dâr Narbugud hold both new and long forgotten vestiges of life.

itemUsed.loreInfo: This mushroom smells of something foul.
This mushroom has a faint glow to it that may prove to be useful.
This mushroom has a beautiful colour to it.
The surrounding rune-rocks seemed to have changed this mushroom. It seems as if it has thrived and grown substantially.
There is something about about this mushroom, but you cannot seem to figure it out.

deed.name: Plants of the Water-works
deed.description: The Water-works house many creatures and types of life. The dwarves have yet to delve and catalogue even a fraction of the changes in this mysterious environment.

itemUsed.loreInfo: This strange plant has caught your eye. You have collected it to investigate later.
This strange plant has caught your eye. You have collected it to investigate later.
This strange plant has caught your eye. You have collected it to investigate later.
This strange plant has caught your eye. You have collected it to investigate later.
This strange plant has caught your eye. You have collected it to investigate later.

deed.name: Scourge of Nalâ-dûm
deed.description: The flooded Water-wheels spawn numerous creatures and plants which choke the workings of the mechanisms.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have gathered specimens of several unusual plants within the Water-works.
A few of the creatures lurking within the Water-wheels had grown powerful indeed over the years, but you have defeated them.
Lizards of many shapes and sizes have come to infest the Water-wheels, but you have driven many of them off.
Your efforts have seen most of the lizards that had come to infest the Water-wheels defeated or driven off into the deeps.

deed.name: Chieftains of the Halls of Crafting
deed.description: The Halls of Crafting, once inhabited by the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm in ages past, now boast the finest of Orc-smiths, who serve Mazog. Their work can only be hindered by the defeat of those who command them.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Âmbal is the chief of the Orc-smiths responsible for recreating the Black Fire of Saruman.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Âmbal in the Halls of Crafting

monsterDied.loreInfo: Bashkuga's knowledge of Saruman's Black Fire is too great not to be stolen.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Bashkuga in the Halls of Crafting

monsterDied.loreInfo: The vile taskmaster Thaguzg leads many Orcs in the Halls of Crafting.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Thaguzg in Halls of Crafting

deed.name: Halls of Crafting Melee Orc-slayer
deed.description: Many Orc-warriors guard the Halls of Crafting against reclamation by the dwarves of the Iron Garrison.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orc-smiths in the Halls of Crafting are beginning to wonder about their safety as their warriors fall beneath your prowess.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat melee Orcs in the Halls of Crafting

deed.name: Halls of Crafting Melee Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Many Orc-warriors guard the Halls of Crafting against reclamation by the dwarves of the Iron Garrison.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orc-warriors in the Halls of Crafting fall like saplings before your blows.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat melee Orcs in the Halls of Crafting

deed.name: Halls of Crafting Ranged Orc-slayer
deed.description: Not every Orc in the Halls of Crafting is foolish enough to engage a stronger foe in melee combat.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orcs in the Halls of Crafting are beginning to learn that there is little safety at any distance.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat ranged Orcs in the Halls of Crafting

deed.name: Halls of Crafting Ranged Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Not every Orc in the Halls of Crafting is foolish enough to engage a stronger foe in melee combat.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orcs in the Halls of Crafting cower for safety in hopes that you will not see them.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat ranged Orcs in the Halls of Crafting

deed.name: Hierarchy of the Nameless
deed.description: When the Balrog of Moria was defeated, a gap was left in the leadership of the ancient caverns. The Mistress of Pestilence and her Nameless hordes have pressed to fill that gap.

monsterDied.loreInfo: In the depths of Dâr Narbugud, the Blind One, the chief lieutenant of the Mistress of Pestilence, plots the ruins of all that is good.
The vile abomination known as the Mistress of Pestilence is responsible for the terrible fungal plague that threatens the Mines of Moria.
The Mistress of Pestilence chose Zholuga to be her lieutenant in charge of spreading the fungus throughout Moria.
Îstum is among the most deadly of the Orc-lieutenants of the Mistress of Pestilence.
Flâgît is one of the Globsnaga Orc-lieutenants of the Mistress of Pestilence.
Rung is one of two Globsnaga-trolls who lead the nearly mindless army of trolls in Dâr Narbugud.
Blagh, along with his brother Rung, is a wily Globsnaga troll who leads the trolls of Dâr Narbugud.

deed.name: Dâr Narbugud Nameless-slayer
deed.description: The Nameless are fearsome creatures, awakened from the deepest crevices of Moria, where only Durin the Deathless has ever walked.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Nameless who serve the Mistress of Pestilence have never known fear... that, however, is changing.

deed.name: Dâr Narbugud Nameless-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The Nameless are fearsome creatures, awakened from the deepest crevices of Moria, where only Durin the Deathless has ever walked.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Nameless of Dâr Narbugud would hide their faces in terror at your approach... if they had faces to hide.

deed.name: Dâr Narbugud Orc-slayer
deed.description: The Globsnaga Orcs dwell deep in the heart of Dâr Narbugud, where they serve the Mistress of Pestilence.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Globsnaga Orcs of Dâr Narbugud have learned to walk warily in your presence.

deed.name: Dâr Narbugud Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The Globsnaga Orcs dwell deep in the heart of Dâr Narbugud, where they serve the Mistress of Pestilence.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have taught the Globsnaga Orcs of Dâr Narbugud to fear you.

deed.name: Dâr Narbugud Troll-slayer
deed.description: Orcs are not the only fungus-infested creatures in service to the Mistress of Pestilence: there are trolls among the Globsnaga, as well.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Among the most dangerous of the Globsnaga are the trolls. You are learning to fear them less.

deed.name: Dâr Narbugud Troll-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Orcs are not the only fungus-infested creatures in service to the Mistress of Pestilence: there are trolls among the Globsnaga, as well.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Globsnaga trolls are nearly mindless, but for their leaders, yet even they are beginning to recognize and fear your prowess.

deed.name: Enemies in Nalâ-dûm
deed.description: Vile foes, both beast and spirit, haunt the flooded depths of the Water-wheels.

monsterDied.loreInfo: A Caerog, an earth-demon, was awakened within Moria when the Balrog fled into hiding there. With the Balrog slain, Caerlûg now stalks the flooded Water-wheels, spreading his terror.
Not every Deep-lizard in the Water-wheels is easy prey to the wandering adventurer. Spit-tail is a beast to be reckoned with.

deed.name: Nalâ-dûm Lizard-slayer
deed.description: Since the fall of Khazad-dûm, the ancient Water-wheels of Moria have become choked with lizards of varying sizes.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The scavenging lizards of the Water-wheels are more dangerous than they appear, yet you have done well to reduce their numbers.

deed.name: Nalâ-dûm Lizard-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Since the fall of Khazad-dûm, the ancient Water-wheels of Moria have become choked with lizards of varying sizes.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You are confident that one day you will be able to wipe the plague of lizards from the Water-wheels.

deed.name: Defender of Caras Galadhon
deed.description: You have been granted a discount at all Lothlórien vendors.

itemUsed.loreInfo: Your heroic deeds shall never be forgotten.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Wood Pile Uruk was extremely defensive of his wood piles.

deed.name: Lembas, Waybread of the Galadhrim
deed.description: Lembas is renowned for its sweet flavour and renewing virtue.

itemUsed.loreInfo: You have a fond appetite for the lembas of Lothlórien.

deed.name: The Pits of Moria
deed.description: The ancient dwarf-realm of Khazad-dûm is called Moria, the Black Pit, by the Elves...never have you seen so many pits.

objective.text: Explore the depths of the pits of Moria -- the hard way.

enterDetection.loreInfo: While the crevices that make up the Great Delving are not bottomless, they are more than deep enough to result in the swift demise of the careless delver.

The most prominent feature of the Silvertine Lodes is the great shaft that descends into the earth in the centre of the dig.
If you were to drop a goblin into it, the screams would likely fade before it hit bottom.
While Durin's Way does not feature the great abyssal cracks that are frequent in other parts of Moria, it still features dangerous ledges and falls for the unwary traveller.
There is a dark pit in the Redhorn Lodes that the Orcs use as a refuse dump. One can only imagine what horrors lie down there by now....

The area of Nud-melek lies riven with deadly chasms. The movements of the earth itself have badly damaged many of the works of the dwarves since they fled and left many of the paths dangerous to tread.
The bridge of Khazad-dûm has fallen, and the great chasm it once spanned now poses a seemingly impassable obstacle to those seeking to escape through the eastern gates of Moria.

deed.name: A Deep Well
deed.description: Find the bottom of the well in the guard-room.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You found the bottom of the well in the guard-room...after a long fall

deed.name: Wanderer of the Golden Wood
deed.description: The ways of Lothlórien are beautiful and restful. It is easy to lose oneself in the peaceful wood.

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Traders from Dale travelling south became trapped at the foot of the Misty Mountains as the Orcs of Moria poured forth, forcing the Elves of Lórien to grant them aid.
This spot is a favourite resting place of Galadriel, Lady of the Golden Wood.
Cerin Nauth is a peaceful hill overlooking the Golden Wood.
The Vineyards of Lórien produce sweet grapes and fine wine for the festivals of the Elves.
Imlald Lalaith, the Valley of Laughter, is where most of Lothlórien's feasts take place.
This garden recalls the past, when Lothlórien was Laurelindórenan.
Bain Gwaloth is a private garden, beautiful and secluded.
This peaceful glade is a perfect spot to view the stars of Elbereth.
This grove of Melbrethil is revered by the Galadhrim.
The Quiet Garden is a peaceful place to contemplate the troubles of the world.

deed.name: City of the Lord and Lady
deed.description: Caras Galadhon is the mighty city of the Lord and Lady of the Galadhrim, nestled amid the tall mallorn trees.

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The House of Celeborn is the home of the Lord and Lady of Lothlórien.
This pleasant garden is where Galadriel keeps her most unusual and mysterious possession: the Mirror of Galadriel.
This beautiful and ornate fountain is a testament to the artistry of the Elves.
This pavilion is where the Company of the Ring resides during its stay in Lothlórien.
This series of flets is the centre of learning in Caras Galadhon.
Telain Bangad and their sister flets, Telain Melthin, are the centre of trade in Lothlórien.
Telain Melthin and their sister flets, Telain Bangad, are the centre of trade in Lothlórien.
This series of flets is a popular gathering place among the Galadhrim.
Telain Neduil has a far view of the eastern landscapes of Lothlórien.

deed.name: Lórien Lookout
deed.description: Many flets, where the guards of the Galadhrim keep watch, dot the Golden Wood, ensuring that no enemy can approach unnoticed.

objective.text: NOT USED

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Talan Fanuidhol is where the Galadhrim stage their defence against the Orcs of Moria mustering within Fanuidhol.
This is one of many flets guarding the borders of Lothlórien
This is one of many flets guarding the borders of Lothlórien.
This is one of many flets guarding the borders of Lothlórien.
This is one of many flets guarding the borders of Lothlórien.
This is one of many flets guarding the borders of Lothlórien.
This is one of many flets guarding the borders of Lothlórien.
This flet overlooks a grove of Melbrethil.
This flet overlooks the nests of many hawks.
Haldir, Marchwarden of Lothlórien, and his brothers Rúmil and Orophin make their camp here.
This is the place where Amroth once had his home, and later, where Aragorn and Arwen first met and fell in love.

deed.name: Great Deeds for Lothlórien
deed.description: There are many opportunities to perform great deeds for the Galadhrim of Lothlórien.

objective.text: Complete all Deeds within Lothlórien

questComplete.loreInfo: You have explored many wondrous locations within Lothlórien.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Wanderer of the Golden Wood

questComplete.loreInfo: You have stood watch upon the many flets of Lothlórien.
You have explored the ways of Caras Galadhon, the city of the Lord and Lady of the Galadhrim.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete City of the Lord and Lady

questComplete.loreInfo: You have hunted many beasts in the woods of Lothlórien.
You have defeated many of Mazog's minions in the names of the Lord and Lady.

deed.name: Friend of Lothlórien
deed.description: The Galadhrim are wary of strangers. It takes much to earn their trust.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have only just begun to earn the trust of the Galadhrim.
You have earned the full trust of the Galadhrim, allowing you free run of Lothlórien.

deed.name: Beast-slayer
deed.description: Even the Elves recognize that wildlife unchecked can be as harmful to nature as wildlife slaughtered for no good reason.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have helped to cull the excessive numbers of wild animals in Lothlórien.

deed.name: Beast-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Even the Elves recognize that wildlife unchecked can be as harmful to nature as wildlife slaughtered for no good reason.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Elves of Lothlórien recognize you as a mighty hunter.

deed.name: Orc-slayer
deed.description: The Orcs of Moria have poured out of the Misty Mountains into the Dimrill Dale and Fanuidhol. It will take a brave heart to drive them back.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You joined the battle against the Orcs of Moria who have spilled forth from the Mountains.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Dimrill Dale and Fanuidhol

deed.name: Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The Orcs of Moria have poured out of the Misty Mountains into the Dimrill Dale and Fanuidhol. It will take a brave heart to drive them back.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orcs of Moria fly before your wrath as you drive them back into the Mountains.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Dimrill Dale and Fanuidhol

deed.name: Ally of Lothlórien
deed.description: The Galadhrim are preparing for war against the Orcs of Moria. They have sent a call out to all who will aid them.

objective.text: Complete quests in Lothlórien.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have answered the summons of Lord Celeborn and have joined the Galadhrim against the Orcs of Moria.

deed.name: Defender of Lothlórien
deed.description: The Galadhrim are preparing for war against the Orcs of Moria. They have sent a call out to all who will aid them.

objective.text: Complete quests in Lothlórien.

questComplete.loreInfo: Your actions on behalf of the Galadhrim have earned you great favour.

deed.name: Warrior of Lothlórien
deed.description: The Galadhrim are preparing for war against the Orcs of Moria. They have sent a call out to all who will aid them.

objective.text: Complete quests in Lothlórien.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Galadhrim sing the praises of your prowess and courage in the face of hopeless danger.

deed.name: The Mines of Moria
deed.description: Unravel the epic story of the Mines of Moria.

questComplete.loreInfo: You helped the dwarves of the Iron Garrison drive the Watcher in the Water from the Black Pool and opened the Hollin Gate.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book 1 Chapter 14: Khazad-dûm At Last!

questComplete.loreInfo: You helped the dwarves under Bósi's command to clear the Great Delving and Durin's Way of hostile forces, leading you to the Twenty-first Hall.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book 2 Chapter 8: The Twenty-first Hall

questComplete.loreInfo: You performed many tasks for the dwarves of the Iron Garrison, culminating in the revelation of the fate of Balin's Company.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book 3 Chapter 9: We Cannot Get Out

questComplete.loreInfo: You helped the Iron Garrison prepare for an assault by the Orcs of Moria and faced the Watcher in the Water once more, discovering Bróin alive in the vile creature's den.
You helped defend against the assaults of Mazog's host, but were forced to leave Bori behind to be captured.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book 5 Chapter 5: The Battle of the Twenty-first Hall

questComplete.loreInfo: The Nameless arose under the leadership of the vile Gwathnor, but you prevailed and the demon was defeated.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Book 6 Chapter 9: The Mirror of Galadriel

deed.name: The Mines of Moria -- Part II
deed.description: Unravel the epic story of the Mines of Moria.

questComplete.loreInfo: You helped the dwarves secure the aid of the Galadhrim in Lothlórien.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Volume II Book 7: Leaves of Lórien

questComplete.loreInfo: You helped destroy the artifacts left by Gorothúl in the depths of Moria
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Volume II Book 8: Scourge of Khazad-dûm

questComplete.loreInfo: You have journeyed with the Golden Host into the depths of Mirkwood, where the Elves led a great assault upon Dol Guldur. There can be no lasting victory here, but even a delay of the forces arrayed there has value. Reinforcements march from the East, and the Golden Host will need to fall back before them, but its goal has been accomplished: to draw the attention of the Nazgûl and their Master to Mirkwood, rather than elsewhere.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Volume II Book 9: Fortress of the Nazgûl

deed.name: The Crystal Mirror-shards
deed.description: The Hall of Mirrors was once a conerstone to light in Moria. Now the pieces of that once majestic system litter the floor.

itemUsed.loreInfo: You have found a small piece of a large mirror.
You have found a small piece of a large mirror.
You have found a small piece of a large mirror.
You have found a small piece of a large mirror.
You have found a small piece of a large mirror.

deed.name: Light of Lumul-nar
deed.description: If the Hall of Mirrors can be liberated from Ergoth and Frost-tail, light may return to the Mines of Moria.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed The Crystal Mirror-shards
You have completed An Evil Reflection
You have completed Lumul-Nar Morroval-slayer

deed.name: An Evil Reflection
deed.description:
Vile Wargs and fearsome merrevail darken Lumul-nar, the Hall of Mirrors. The light will not return here until the leaders of these evil creatures are dispatched.
<rgb=#FF0000>This deed can only be completed in the group version of the instance.</rgb>

monsterDied.loreInfo: Frost-tail is the chieftain of the Wargs who dwell in Lumul-nar.
The merrevail of Lumul-nar answer to Ergoth, a morroval-queen from Angmar.

deed.name: Lumul-nar Morroval-slayer
deed.description: The merrevail of Ergoth strive to keep the mirrors of Lumul-nar darkened.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The merrevail rule over Lumul-nar, but their taloned grasp is weakening.

deed.name: Lumul-nar Morroval-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The merrevail of Ergoth strive to keep the mirrors of Lumul-nar darkened.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The light of hope pervades Lumul-nar, as the merrevail slowly dwindle.

deed.name: Spring Sprung!
deed.description: Participate in the joyous festival to welcome the wonders of spring!

objective.text: Participate in the festival welcoming Spring to the lands of Middle-earth.

condition.loreInfo: Enjoy the splendor of the Spring Festival within Middle-earth

objective.text: Many challenges await all willing to find their way through the maze of wonder.

questComplete.loreInfo: Hobbits sure do have an uncanny appreciation for chickens.
Perhaps you are familiar with a phrase in an obscure piece of lore: 'Not all who wander are lost.' Most of the time, this statement is false.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete A Last Laugh at the Lost

questComplete.loreInfo: The Elves should probably consider building a refuge somewhere within the maze, and regard it as an Elven-home from this point onward.
There should really be a warning on that keg.
Mazes are easy! What's all this fuss about fools and errands and record times?

deed.name: A Day of Pranks
deed.description: A day of fun and running afoul of foolish antics.

condition.loreInfo: It is a day of fun and pranks, be careful you do not run afoul!
condition.progressOverride: Be wary of pranks on this day.

deed.name: Flet-runner Challenges
deed.description: A number of flet-runners throughout Caras Galadhon have challenged you to join their ranks by demonstrating your awareness of the city's layout and the quickness of your feet.

questComplete.loreInfo: Celechest tasked you with reaching a flet-runner on one of the high flets of Telain Galadhrim in record time.
Leginiel tasked you with reaching the flet-runner near the Stable-master in Caras Galadhon in record time.
Lagordal tasked you with reaching a flet-runner on a high flet of Telain Neduil in record time.
Bregradel tasked you with reaching a flet-runner on one of the high flets of Telain Glorelloth in record time.
Lintwen tasked you with reaching a flet-runner outside the House of Celeborn in record time.

deed.name: Slaughter them All -- Tier 1
deed.description: Drive the enemy before you and hear the lamentations as they run screaming from the field of battle. You are a troll, a killing machine in the army of Angmar bred for combat and destruction. It is time to show your strength!

condition.loreInfo: Do you hear the screams? Do you hear the voices too? You are a true scourge from the north, a troll who stands out amongst the slugs.

deed.name: Into the Black and Twisted Forest
deed.description: Complete quests in Southern Mirkwood.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Elves of Lórien have bravely begun a perilous march into Southern Mirkwood, former home of the Necromancer, who was Sauron in disguise. A great evil sits now in the dark fortress of Dol Guldur as regent in the Dark Lord's absence.

deed.name: Into the Black and Twisted Forest (Intermediate)
deed.description: Complete many quests in Southern Mirkwood.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have fought hard against the evils that lurk within the shadow of Dol Guldur, alongside the brave Elves of Lothlórien. Whether or not the war bodes good or ill is yet to be determined.

deed.name: Into the Black and Twisted Forest (Advanced)
deed.description: Complete many quests in Southern Mirkwood.

questComplete.loreInfo: The power that broods in the tower of Dol Guldur is terrible beyond reckoning. The Elves of Lórien have done much good in their bold march through the black groves of Mirkwood, but even the light of the Galadhrim cannot dispel the darkness that has settled here.

deed.name: Dead-slayer
deed.description: Defeat many wights and shades in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many Dead things walk amongst the black and twisted trees of Mirkwood, no longer part of this time, and yet they linger to spread their malice and their hate.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat shades and wights in Southern Mirkwood

deed.name: Dead-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many shades and wights in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Dead of Mirkwood haunt the trees, bound by some curse or broken oath. No matter how you hew at them, ever do they return, turning the warmth of your blood to chill dread.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat shades and wights in Southern Mirkwood

deed.name: Orc and Uruk-slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Orcs and Uruk-hai in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have done a great deal to assist the Elves of Lórien with their war against the evil servants of Sauron. Orcs and Uruk-hai prowl Southern Mirkwood in formidable numbers, waylaying any who are brave enough to penetrate the darkness of the forest.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs and Uruk-hai in Southern Mirkwood

deed.name: Orc and Uruk-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Orcs and Uruk-hai in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Your assistance to the Elves of the Mirkwood Offensive in their war against Dol Guldur shall earn you great favour amongst the Galadhrim. The cruel Orcs and Uruk-hai prowl in greater and greater numbers throughout Middle-earth these days, and there is certainly no lack of these foes in Mirkwood, but the forest has been made a little safer by your hand.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs and Uruk-hai in Southern Mirkwood

deed.name: Spider-slayer
deed.description: Defeat many spiders in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The spiders of Southern Mirkwood, descendants of Shelob, last spawn of Ungoliant, crept in with their darkness and vile poison when Sauron came here. They now plague the black forest with their webs and heartless malice.

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many spiders in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Great Spiders of Mirkwood have been a source of malevolence since first they came, but your steadfast efforts against them have made them curse your name as they once cursed Bilbo Baggins, many years ago.

deed.name: Warg-slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Wargs in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many beasts fell and cruel prowl the dark forest of Mirkwood. Thinning the Warg-population near Dol Guldur will be a great boon to the Elves of Lórien, who strive to rid this forest of Sauron's influence.

deed.name: Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Wargs in Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Mirkwood may never again return to its former peace when it was known as Greenwood the Great, but your steadfast efforts against the Wargs have helped to make this corrupted forest a little safer for those who move beneath its eaves.

deed.name: Siege of Gondamon
deed.description: The fortress of Gondamon is one of the greatest strongholds of the Longbeards in the Blue Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Thrastar is a Dourhand of the most vile disposition. Defeating him is a favour to Durin's Folk.
Hergill is one of the captains of the Dourhands sent to lay siege to the fortress of Gondamon.
Agi Gatebreaker is thus named because of his ability to lead forces to tear down the gates of defended fortresses.
Gashnákh was sent to burn down the Gondamon, but he did not succeed, thanks to you.
Sigurmar, using evil weapons of destruction, seeks to undermine the strength of Gondamon.

deed.name: Trouble in Tuckborough
deed.description: The Great Smials are the capitol of the Shire, the home of the Thain, Paladin Took. Brigands and goblins in the service of Saruman the White seek to capture the Great Smials and throw down the Tooks.

objective.text: The Great Smials are beseiged.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The goblin Ghâshfog tried to dig his way into the Great Smials...he discovered it is unwise to provoke the Tooks.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Stop Ghâshfog from digging into the Great Smials

monsterDied.loreInfo: Murbarash tried to smoke the Tooks out of their warrens.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Stop Murbarash from burning hobbit holes

monsterDied.loreInfo: Fíthrokh took a break from the siege to have a light lunch...only lunch bit back.
The bog-lurker Oldroot attacked you at the Great Willow, mistaking you for an aggressor.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Oldroot at the Great Willow

monsterDied.loreInfo: Big Fright was considered a nightmarish folk legend by the Tooks...now he really is one.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Big Fright on the hillside.

deed.name: Ford of Bruinen
deed.description: The Ford of Bruinen is the last bastion of security leading to the hidden vale of Rivendell.

objective.text: Complete all encounters at the Ford of Bruinen.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orc Zanúrz hates Rivendell and all of Elf-kind. His demise would be welcome news to the Elves of Rivendell.
Kunquin is one of the deadliest archers in the service of the Iron Crown.
The Wood-troll Durkúf is the vicious defender of the siege-engines of Angmar.

condition.loreInfo: You helped keep the friendly archers supplied with arrows.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Bruidagnir is an old and vile Rock-worm which haunts the shores of Bruinen.

deed.name: Celebrating Sunshine
deed.description: Your fervent participation in the Summer Festival does you credit!

questComplete.loreInfo: The pond has provided the Bywater fishing event with a great deal of diversity this year.
The docks at Celondim have provided the Bywater fishing event with a great deal of diversity this year.
Hopefully you now have a great store of rare and excellent fish from this year's festival event.
The canal in Thorin's Hall has provided the Bywater fishing event with a great deal of diversity this year.
Carelessness ruins festivals. Thankfully you were present to help prevent this catastrophe from occuring.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find the Missing Things in Duillond

questComplete.loreInfo: An untidy dwarf was very lucky to have you close at hand this year.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Forgotten Errands in Thorin's Hall

questComplete.loreInfo: Hobbits cannot possibly keep track of all their things when enjoying the many splendours of a festival. It's a good thing you were there to help clean up the aftermath.
questComplete.progressOverride: Recover from Too Much Festival in the Shire

questComplete.loreInfo: You have helped to light the sky most splendidly for the patrons of the festival this year.

deed.name: Stand at Amon Sûl
deed.description: The peak of Weathertop was witness to a terrible battle between Gandalf and The Nine. The aftereffects still reverberate across the Lone-lands.

objective.text: Complete all optional encounters in the Defence of Weathertop Skirmish

monsterDied.loreInfo: Golnauk was sent to gather anything remaining from Gandalf's battle with the Nine and return it to the fortress of Dol Guldur.
Few bats enjoy the taste of flesh more than Bloodwing, who has been known to devour small hobbits whole.
Gúgaw's great power always came from his arm, even after his untimely death in a whittling accident.
Since the fall of Garth Agarwen and the defeat of Ivar, Laimbenn has been wandering the Lone-lands, desperate to avenge his fallen ally.
Few things make Mokum angrier than athelas. 'Herbs are for destroying, not healing,' he often yells as he enters the fray.
Gwandir was a prized archer in life and in death, until Thadaen stole his bow.
Like a moth to a flame, if the fire is big enough, Norgol will come.
Drawn by the ferocious battle between Gandalf and the Nine, Gwathrengor has come to Weathertop seeking power.
Urkflagít enjoys spending his nights sleeping beneath the full panorama of stars on display above Weathertop.

deed.name: Priestess of Flames Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Priestesses of Flames in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Priestesses of Flame use their wiles to summon flames at the feet of their enemies.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Priestesses of Flame in Skirmishes

deed.name: Earth Gnawer Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many gnawers in skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: TBD - Placeholder

deed.name: Brood-queen Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many brood-queens in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The brood-queens of the Enemy will spawn fewer spiders, thanks to you.

deed.name: Forest-born Reaver Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description:
Defeat many Forest-born Reavers in Skirmishes.
This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have put the fear of fire into the Forest-born Reavers.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many Forest-born Reavers in Skirmishes

deed.name: Tempest of Flame Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Tempests of Flame in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Tempests of Flame are a form of Fire-grim which can sap the very strength from the limbs of their foes....
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Tempests of Flame in Skirmishes

deed.name: Dreadwing-marauder Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Dreadwing-marauders in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Dreadwing-marauders are a foe to the melee warrior. Their fearsome powers sap the strength of their foes, leaving them helpless....

deed.name: Scourge Void Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many voids in skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: TBD Placeholder

deed.name: Thunderstone-smasher Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Thunderstone-smashers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Thunderstone-smashers are masters of stunning their foes and finishing them off.

deed.name: Primordial Wrath Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Primordial Wraths in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Primordial Wrath of Morgoth lingers still, sucking the resolve from the limbs of those it comes in contact with.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many Primordial Wraths in Skirmishes

deed.name: Shepherd of Filth Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Shepherds of Filth in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many Shepherds of Filth are now gnawed upon by their own pets....
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Shepherds of Filth in Skirmishes

deed.name: Courage-breaker Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Courage-breakers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Courage-breakers are a form of fell spirit who have a particularly powerful ability to drain the morale of their foes.

deed.name: Venomous Blood-arrow Slayer
deed.description:
Defeat many Venomous Blood-arrows in Skirmishes.
This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Venomous Blood-arrows are skilled with poisons and diseases, making them a fearsome opponent.

deed.name: Bloodrook-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Blood-rooks in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have learned the secret of the Blood-rooks' strength and will know how to better defeat them in the future.

deed.name: Enraged Stonecrusher Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many enraged Stonecrushers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have brought the Stonecrusher giants to their knees.

deed.name: Hulking Pounder Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Hulking Pounders in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have saved many a Soldier's life from the assaults of the Hulking Pounders.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many Hulking Pounders in Skirmishes

deed.name: Rage of Morgoth Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Rages of Morgoth in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Rages of Morgoth are resistant to physical harm, though it drains them of power....
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many Rages of Morgoth in Skirmishes

deed.name: Echo of Death Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Echoes of Death in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: To hear the cry of one of the fell spirits is to hear the echo of death...the call of the grave.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many Echoes of Death in Skirmishes

deed.name: Daunting Spirit-sapper Slayer (Advanced)
