deed.name: Mirkwood Tower Climber
deed.description: There are two major, surviving towers in the ruins of Ost Galadh: Minas Celebolf and Minas Glórelloth. From these pinnacles, much of the expanse of Mirkwood may be seen.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Minas Celebolf, the tower of the silver tree, is one of the two watch towers at Ost Galadh.
Minas Glórelloth, the tower of the golden flower, is one of the two watch towers at Ost Galadh.

deed.name: Protector of the Vile Slayer
deed.description: Defeat a Protector of the Vile within a Skirmish.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Protectors of the Vile put forth their power to maintain the strength of their allies.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat a Protector of the Vile in a Skirmish

deed.name: Harvestmath
deed.description: Harvestmath brings yet another bountiful farming season to a close as the leaves begin to turn gold and the days grow short and cool.

objective.text: The long summer has come to an end, and a beautiful autumn settles in over Middle-earth. The air grows crisper and cooler daily, and the sun retires earlier with each passing week.

condition.loreInfo: The leaves have turned red and gold, and it would be wise to pick a warmer cloak when you leave your cozy house in the morning, for a gentle frost has settled upon the land.
condition.progressOverride: Enjoy the autumn festivities while they last

deed.name: Tutorial Offensive: Encounters
deed.description: You never know when you may run across a brigand of some repute.

objective.text: Complete optional encounters in the Bree Offensive Tutorial Skirmish.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Reginald Cutweed was attempting to blow up a stable near the South Gate of Bree.

deed.name: The Mightiest Arm
deed.description: You have demonstrated quite the talent for battering your opponents about.

objective.text: You have demonstrated quite the talent for battering your opponents about.

itemUsed.loreInfo: 'It is entirely possible that you are fighting for the wrong side. You have shown yourself to be quite the bully when beer is at stake.'
itemUsed.progressOverride: Take mighty swings at your opponents and show no mercy

deed.name: Why Your Head Hurts
deed.description: You have been roundly knocked about by your opponents.

objective.text: Is this the Spring Festival? Where is the maze?

questComplete.loreInfo: You have been a very good sport about letting the patrons of the inn bash you about as you fight over glorious beer.
questComplete.progressOverride: Successfully complete the Mightiest Blow -- Expert quest

deed.name: Thievery and Mischief
deed.description: Bree-town has a long and storied history, but until this point had mostly escaped the ravages incurred upon the Southern lands.

objective.text: Complete all encounters in the Thievery and Mischief Skirmish.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Since Lordfisher arrived in Bree, several summers have seen a sharp decline in fishing.
Many trinkets, particulary shiny ones, have been carried off into the night by this silent thief.
The past three summers have each seen a great hunt for Goretusk, each year fewer returned, but never with him.
Ned Ashleaf had a bright, promising future ahead of him as a cow-milker, until he fell in love with the daughter of a brigand.
Tom Greythistle simply never liked people: even as a child, he would kick the shins of any who happened by.
It is rumoured that Túkar's mother was from Bree...he is eager to make the town pay for not letting him be a full-blooded Orc.
Snagbúrz is a simple half-orc...a little violence and a little destruction lead to a successful day.
Gruglup hates all those taller than him, which is why he ignored the Shire and headed straight for Bree.

deed.name: Defence of The Prancing Pony
deed.description: The Prancing Pony Inn is a cornerstone of Bree-town. All who come through the village stop there for at least a pint, if not the night.

objective.text: Complete all encounters in the Defence of The Prancing Pony Skirmish.

monsterDied.loreInfo: It is rumoured that the wolf Southpaw was responsible for the death of one of the Underhills of Staddle.
When the men of Bree-town were held prisoner within the town, the Old Hunter awoke from his hibernation.
Ufglup had never left the pens of Isengard before coming to Bree. He misses the smell of burning trees.
Rat-catcher is a small but tricky lynx. Rat was the name of the brigand he last had for dinner.
Mukghashan has enjoyed staying within one of the finer houses in Bree...far better than the hard, jagged rocks he is accustomed to sleeping on.
Burning The Prancing Pony Inn was Kamhont's idea originally...he did not account for the tenacity of the innkeeper.
Banosnákh never became accustomed to sleeping in a bed. Even with all the finery of Bree, he used the cold, hardwood floors.
Willie Hawthorn came to Bree once when he was young and saw his father laughed at by the local inhabitants. His sense of revenge runs deep.
Blackfeather has watched Bree from high and afar for a long time. This is first he has ever landed in the town.

deed.name: Two with One Blow
deed.description: Among Barad Guldur's most powerful captains are the wraiths Morgaraf and Cargaraf.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have put to rest the wraiths Morgaraf and Cargaraf, foul creatures of the unseen world.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat Morgaraf and Cargaraf at Barad Guldur within 10 seconds of each other

deed.name: The Warden of the Dungeons
deed.description: The Warden of the Dungeons of Dol Guldur is a terrible Cargûl, rumoured to be one of the knights of Eärnur, last King of Gondor, lost at Minas Morgul.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have freed the Warden of the Dungeons from his terrible bonds, allowing him to leave Middle-earth in peace.

deed.name: Regent of the Tower
deed.description: To overthrow Gorothúl, it becomes necessary to overthrow the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur as well...a task not to be taken lightly.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have laid low the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur and his minions.
questComplete.progressOverride: Defeat the Captains of Barad Guldur

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Ten Guards Deed.
You have completed the Two with One Blow Deed.
You have completed the King of the East Deed.

deed.name: King of the East
deed.description: Of the Nazgûl, the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur is second in power only to the Witch-king himself. After escaping the wrath of the Bruinen and the arrows of the Elf-prince Legolas, he has returned to the fortress of Dol Guldur....

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Lieutenant of Dol Guldur has been forced to return, houseless, to the Witch-king's fortress of Minas Morgul.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur before defeating his fell-beast mount

deed.name: A Full Belly and a Nap in the Dirt
deed.description: One would think that Wargs on a full belly would be sluggish....

enterDetection.loreInfo: Kranklob and the Wargs of Dol Guldur have learned the price of gluttony.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat Kranklob after allowing Wargs to eat all the meat slabs throughout the Warg-pits of Dol Guldur

deed.name: Enter the Chambers
deed.description: Sammath Gûl is a place of terror, inhabited by the sorcerer Gorothúl and the dread spirits which serve him.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have quenched the fire of Urchír, the fell spirit of fire, in Sammath Gûl.
You have defeated Alagossir, the fell spirit of the storm, in Sammath Gûl.
The Sorcerer Gorothûl has met his demise at your hand in Sammath Gûl.

deed.name: Throwing Down Sammath Gûl
deed.description: Sammath Gûl was once the private chambers of Sauron in his guise as the Necromancer...now they are held by his regent and his minions.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Enter the Chambers
You have completed The Spirits are the Key
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete The Spirits are the Key

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Bringing Down the Enemy

deed.name: Glory in the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur
deed.description: The minions of the Enemy train in the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur, improving their skills for the inevitable invasion of Lothlórien. They must learn just how lacking they are....

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Enter the Arena Deed.
You have completed the Battle Royale Deed.

deed.name: Tempest of Dol Guldur
deed.description: Dol Guldur is among the mightiest strongholds of evil in Middle-earth. While it cannot be hoped that it will be overthrown while Sauron's Eye is turned northwards, a mote may be temporarily cast in the Eye....

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the There is a New Warden in the Dungeons Deed.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete There is a New Warden in the Dungeons

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Leader of the Pack Deed
You have completed the Throwing Down Sammath Gûl Deed.
You have completed the Regent of the Tower Deed.

deed.name: The Spirits are the Key
deed.description: Sammath Gûl is defended by many fell spirits of Morgoth in the service of Sauron.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many of the fell spirits of Sammath Gûl have been banished beyond the Void by your valiant efforts.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat fell spirits in Sammath Gûl

deed.name: The Battle of the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur
deed.description: Dol Guldur claims many champions, not the least of which are those who preside over the Sword-hall.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have challenged the Champions of the Sword-hall and defeated them soundly.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat all of the champions of the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur after challenging them all at once.

deed.name: Of Warg and Goblin
deed.description: The Warg-pits of Dol Guldur are overseen by the goblin Athgrat and the Warg Kranklob, vile servants of the Enemy.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The ability of the Enemy to train their Wargs and Warg-riders has been hampered by the death of Athgrat.
The death of Kranklob forces the Enemy to seek a new matron to foster their Warg-packs.

deed.name: There is a New Warden in the Dungeons
deed.description: The Dungeons of Dol Guldur are presided over by a Cargûl known only as the Warden. This creature makes entry into and escape from the Dungeons nearly impossible.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the The Wardens of the Dungeons Deed
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete The Warden of the Dungeons

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Liberation from the Merciless Dungeons.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Liberation from the Merciless Dungeons

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Leave No One Behind Deed

deed.name: The Ten Guards
deed.description: Dúrchest commands the Guard of Barad Guldur, defending his master from the assaults of his enemies.

enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat Dúrchest after defeating several of his personal guards

deed.name: Liberation from the Merciless Dungeons
deed.description: The Dungeons of Dol Guldur are notorious for the dire horrors inflicted upon their prisoners. There, the mind of Thráin, father of Thorin Oakenshield, was broken.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have freed the prisoner Hethulír from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Hethulír

questComplete.loreInfo: You have freed the prisoner Bregrochon from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Bregrochon

questComplete.loreInfo: You have freed the prisoner Baingaleth from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Baingaleth

questComplete.loreInfo: You have freed the prisoner Thimuil from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Thimuil

questComplete.loreInfo: You have freed the prisoner Glamrennel from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Glamrennel
Complete the quest to free Faelwen

questComplete.loreInfo: You have freed the prisoner Faenthír from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Faenthír

questComplete.loreInfo: You've freed MaedielYou have freed the prisoner Maediel from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Maediel

questComplete.loreInfo: You have freed the prisoner Borihon from the Dungeons of Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest to free Borihon

deed.name: Bringing Down the Enemy
deed.description: Gorothúl is protected by a fell spirit called Demafaer, a foul creature from beyond the Void.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated the fell spirit Demafaer.

deed.name: Leader of the Pack
deed.description: Complete the following accomplishments: - Of Warg and Goblin - A Full Belly and a Nap in the Dirt

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Of Warg and Goblin Deed
You have completed the A Full Belly and a Nap in the Dirt Deed.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete A Full Belly and a Nap in the Dirt

deed.name: Enter the Arena
deed.description: The Sword-hall of Dol Guldur is presided over by many champions, who train the soldiers of the Enemy.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated the sorcerer Urcheron at the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur.
You have defeated the morroval Carchrien, Queen of Fangs, at the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur.
You have defeated Durkâr, most terrible of Gertheryg, at the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur.

deed.name: Leave No One Behind
deed.description: The Dungeons of Dol Guldur are rumoured to be impregnable...but it is said that Gandalf the Grey twice entered that terrible place and escaped to tell of it.

enterDetection.loreInfo: More than seven prisoners rescued at once
enterDetection.progressOverride: Rescue at least seven of the prisoners at once

monsterDied.loreInfo: Following the defeat of the Warden of Dol Guldur's dungeons, you were able to recover many treasures taken from the prisoners there.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat the Warden after freeing all of the prisoners in the Dungeons of Dol Guldur

deed.name: A Game of Death
deed.description: Even the sorcerer Gorothúl must bow to the power of the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur and his wraith-minions.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Dúrchest is the Captain of the Guard for Barad Guldur.
Cargaraf, Morgaraf's brother, is possessed of the powers of fire.
Morgaraf, Cargaraf's sister, is possessed of the powers of shadow.
The Lieutenant of Dol Guldur is the Steward of Barad Guldur, and leader of Sauron's forces in Southern Mirkwood.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur

deed.name: Breaching the Necromancer's Gate
deed.description: The Necromancer's Gate guards the inner courtyards of the fortress of Dol Guldur.

objective.text: The Necromancer's Gate guards the inner courtyards of the fortress of Dol Guldur.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Lavalúg likes roasted aurochs-meat...but not as much as he enjoys those who deliver it.
Gortag enjoys making stews and draughts from the innards of his victims.
Firingúl makes sculptures from the bones of defeated heroes.
Murúk's quarters are the filthiest in all of Dol Guldur...and he takes great pride in that.
Annoniel once made a sprinting squirrel explode from two-hundred yards while blindfolded.
Thrângund does not know why he patrols the hall he does...no-one ever ordered him to, he just started walking one day and never stopped.
Morgúr helped to build Dol Guldur...until the front bridge collapsed while he was carving frescoes beneath it.
Agardúr attended a speech by the Necromancer...along with ten thousand Orcs, goblins, and Men.
Grishglok once had a rider...he has never had another since.

deed.name: Yule
deed.description: The Yule Festival is upon us! Bundle up and brave the snow, for there is much to be accomplished.

objective.text: The Yule Festival has made Middle-earth more lively during the long winter months.

condition.loreInfo: A serene winter has settled upon Middle-earth in the parts yet untouched by the growing malice in the East, but some party-planners wish to enliven the cold winter days with some warm festivities.
condition.progressOverride: Enjoy the Yule festivities while they last

deed.name: Mirkwood Landing
deed.description: Aid the Malledhrim in securing their military objectives during the landing of their forces in Mirkwood.

questComplete.loreInfo: YOU SHOULDNT SEE THIS
The fortress standing atop Amon Angened is the key to control of the Mirk-eaves, and its fall secured the landing of the Malledhrim as the first step in their assault on Dol Guldur.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the final assault on the Orc fortress that controls the Mirk-eaves

deed.name: Headcount
deed.description: The Malledhrim seek to drive back the forces of Dol Guldur from the eaves of Southern Mirkwood.

objective.text: YOU SHOULDNT SEE THIS

monsterDied.loreInfo: Legions of enemies stand in the way of the Malledhrim as they begin their assault upon Mirkwood. The fewer that escape the landing in the Mirk-eaves, the fewer that shall remain to defend the walls of Dol Guldur.

deed.name: Epilogue: Of Elves and Dwarves
deed.description: The tale of Moria and Lothlórien is nearing a close. What does the future hold for the Iron Garrison and the Golden Host?

objective.text: The Volume 2 Epilogue does not begin until you have completed Book 9: Fortress of the Nazgûl.
The Golden Host and the Iron Garrison have completed their mission to Mirkwood, but there is still a story to be told.

questComplete.loreInfo: The mithril axe Zigilburk has been returned to the place where it was found: by the side of the dwarf Óin in the watery depths of Moria.

Sigileth did not return from the assault on Dol Guldur, where she fell in battle with the defenders of the fortress. In death, she wished her knives Lanchigil and Egnassigil to be given to Celeborn, so you presented them to the Lord of Lórien.
You have ventured into the cave of Gath Ulunn, where the Orcs of Gathbúrz sought to hatch worms for use against the Malledhrim.
At the behest of Laeglang, one of the Golden Host's most daring scouts, you struck a blow against the Orcs of Dol Guldur and scouted strategic locations around the fortress.

You discovered that a company of Orcs fleeing from Dol Guldur ran afoul of the pestilent glow-worms and their matriarchs in the Hall of Lights and worked to combat the threat they posed to the Malledhrim.

You undertook an incredibly long journey for Lúth Greyhammer, slaying an Orc, goblin, or uruk in each of the many regions in which a Greyhammer was harmed by an Orc, a deed that tested your patience much more than your prowess. Lúth's father Tandri agrees and planned to speak to his son about asking strangers to perform such ridiculous feats in the name of vengeance.
Cúcheron had a single tie to Middle-earth remaining: his curiosity concerning the mystery of Audaghaim. You helped him unravel some of the riddle, though other questions remain.

Achardor did not return from the gates of Dol Guldur; his brother's widow Núrelleth must bear the grief of this loss, though not alone: the Lady Galadriel also feels the sorrow of loss...and some of its burden as well.
You have collected alchemical ingredients for Barvessain from three locations: Gath Ulunn, the Hall of Lights, and the ruins of Agistath.

Braiglinn sent you to seize one of three strategic objectives within Dol Guldur: the Warg-pens, the Sword-hall, or the Dungeons. You did so, striking a blow against the Enemy while the possibility remained and before the reinforcing army from the East arrived.
You brought Issuriel's elanor bloom to Bróin in thanks for saving her life...to the dwarf's unending embarrassment.
You and your allies have put an end to the menace of Gorothúl, and his sorcerous ways will trouble the Elves of Lothlórien and the dwarves of the Iron Garrison no longer.

deed.name: Saviour of Lothlórien
deed.description: The Galadhrim seek to reclaim the balance of nature from those that threaten them in Moria. Do all that the Galadhrim ask and you shall be named the Saviour of Lothlórien

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Liberator of the Halls of Crafting
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Liberator of the Halls of Crafting

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed Reaver of Dâr Narbugud
You have completed Light of Lumul-nar
You have completed Scourge of Nalâ-dûm

deed.name: Saviour of Eriador
deed.description: The Dúnedain have asked many things of you. Complete all of these tasks, and you will be rewarded greatly.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed all of the Carn Dûm Deeds
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete all of the Carn Dûm Deeds

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed all of the Urugarth Deeds
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete all of the Urugarth Deeds

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed all of the Barad Gúlaran Deeds
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete all of the Barad Gúlaran Deeds

questComplete.loreInfo: You've completed An Ancient Threat
You've completed Thorog Defeated

deed.name: Saviour of Khazad-dûm
deed.description: The Iron Garrison seeks to reclaim the Black Pit of Moria as their own, but many believe their expedition into the ancient halls may be doomed. Do all you can to help them, and you will be named the Saviour of Khazad-dûm.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed The Watcher of Moria
You have completed The Grand Stair
You have completed Mastery Over Fear
You have completed Persevering Against the Blight
You have completed Marshal of the Burning Depths
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Marshal of the Burning Depths

deed.name: Downfall of Carn Dûm
deed.description: You are called upon to do all that needs to be done to overthrow Carn Dûm.

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Ancient Evil of Carn Dûm
Complete The Angmarim of Carn Dûm
Complete The Orcs of Carn Dûm
Complete The Slugs of Carn Dûm
Complete The Trolls of Carn Dûm

deed.name: Destruction of Urugarth
deed.description: You are called to do all that needs to be done to overthrow the fortress of Urugarth.

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete The Foul Idols of Urugarth

deed.name: Toppling of Barad Gúlaran
deed.description: You have been called upon to do all that needs to be done to close the gates of Barad Gúlaran forever.

deed.name: Strike Against Dannenglor
deed.description: The ancient Elf-ruins of Dannenglor howl during the dark Mirkwood nights.

objective.text: Complete everything in the Strike Against Dannenglor Skirmish

monsterDied.loreInfo: Helchfaer often uses the ancient buildings of Dannenglor to conduct dark and secret offerings and sacrifices to the Dark Lord.
Ghostfang has eaten countless members of the Golden Host...the leg bones are his favourite treat.
Ruingalad only appears when flames lick the ruins of Dannenglor.
Swartclaw rules the roost of Dannenglor with an iron talon.
Rimdeloth is the mistress of Dannenglor and fiercely protective of what she has deemed to be hers.
Gorogmúl guards the bridge into Dannenglor, ever-watchful.
The majority of the spiders in Mirkwood can trace their lineage through the egg-sacs of Gothling.
The only thing Fiklúk likes less than an Elf is the sound of a horn.
Seregruin patrols through the ruins of Dannenglor, an ever-watchful guardian from a time long since past.

deed.name: Protectors of Thangúlhad
deed.description: Thangúlhad is an advance position of which the Golden Host has managed to wrest control from the forces of Dol Guldur.

objective.text: Complete everything in the Protectors of Thangúlhad Skirmish

monsterDied.loreInfo: Borndol once called the tower at Thangúlhad home. He was forced out before he could pack up his vast Black Speech poetry collection.
Ruithroval often loses competitions of speed and agility with the other drakes in Mirkwood and Dol Guldur. He stays and eats the feast while they race around the skies.
Azrí built many of the ballistae in use at Thangúlhad and has great respect for their power, though he has little respect for your aim.
Hokarul is on a mission to lay claim to the greatest pipe-weed and keep it all for himself...he has only recently heard of the Shire.
It takes a few large hits in the head before Grudom fully wakes up and is prepared to fight.
Frúzglob hates everything about siege-weaponry...give him a good sword and an enemy in front of him, and he is satisfied.
Golugthrug is one of the sneakier uruks in Mirkwood, stealth being his favourite weapon.
Lapus has spent many battles weaving through the lines to avoid the fire of catapults. He eagerly takes any chance he gets to destroy any of them.
Torúglup is a simple Warg, looking for nothing more than a good meal and a dry space to sleep at night.

deed.name: The Battle in the Tower
deed.description: The tower is the pinnacle of the fortress of Dol Guldur. Its terrible shadow casts darkness and dread over the forests of Mirkwood.

objective.text: Complete everything in the Battle in the Tower Skirmish

monsterDied.loreInfo: Thangaran is an apprentice to the master of Dol Guldur in all things.
The mistress of the tower, Iaerien, is a woman scorned by good and embraced by evil.
Hogaward is an emissary from the less organized brigand groups infesting the lands around Bree.
Múdku is fiercely protective of his weapons, even the dull, rusted ones.
Blord is not often allowed within the tower...his very footsteps cause the foundations to shudder.
Gundnákh is not the fastest of trolls, but eventually he will always catch up to his prey.
Gadhumúrz is one of the hunting Wargs of the tower's master. He feasts on the remains of all that he catches.
Urbor is curiously fascinated by flames of a blue nature.

deed.name: Bane of the Dead -- Raid
deed.description: The servants of the Witch-king have long made the Barrow-downs a place of terror...now the time has come to drive forth that terror.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have sent many of the denizens of the Barrow-downs back beyond the Void as part of a raid.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many denizens of the Barrow-downs

deed.name: Assailant of the Dark Lord -- Small Fellowship
deed.description: Mordor has sent forth many dire Lieutenants to lead the Dead of the Barrow-downs against the Free Peoples. The time has come to put an end to them.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated many Lieutenants of the Enemy in the Barrow-downs as part of a fellowship.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many Lieutenants of the Enemy

deed.name: Assailant of the Dead -- Small Fellowship
deed.description: The servants of the Witch-king have long made the Barrow-downs a place of terror...now the time has come to drive forth that terror.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have sent many of the denizens of the Barrow-downs back beyond the Void as a part of a small fellowship
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many denizens of the Barrow-downs

deed.name: Surviving the Night
deed.description: Only the most courageous -- or foolish -- adventurers would dare to endure the dread night of the Barrow-downs.

deed.name: Strength of Endurance -- Complete
deed.description: The Enemy in the Barrow-downs is relentless, throwing themselves at their foes without regard to their lives...for they have no life.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have shown you can survive within the Barrow-downs while a part of a small fellowship.

deed.name: Defeating the Dead -- Small Fellowship
deed.description: The Barrow-downs were once a stronghold of the Rangers of Cardolan, but after the destruction of the last remnant of Cardolan, the Witch-king sent fell spirits to stir the bones of the dead and make it a place of terror.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have returned a few of the risen Dead in the Barrow-downs to their proper resting places and banished the fell spirits which disturbed them.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat fifty monsters in one Skirmish session

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have returned several of the risen Dead in the Barrow-downs to their proper resting places and banished the fell spirits which disturbed them.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat one hundred monsters in one Skirmish session

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have returned many of the risen Dead in the Barrow-downs to their proper resting places and banished the fell spirits which disturbed them.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat two hundred and fifty monsters in one Skirmish session

deed.name: Mercy of the Free Peoples -- Small Fellowship
deed.description: Sometimes an insult may demoralize the foe, and the worst insult can be mercy....

deed.name: Sorcerer-slayer
deed.description: The servants of the Enemy are a formidable presence in Mirkwood as the Malledhrim press forward.

objective.text: The Golden Host is ever-threatened by the presence of Black Númenórean sorcerers in and around Dol Guldur, lending their aid and fealty to the strength of the Enemy.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The sorcerers of Southern Mirkwood lend great strength to the Enemy, and pose a terrible threat to the safety of the Malledhrim as they press forward.

deed.name: Sorcerer-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The servants of the Enemy are a formidable presence in Mirkwood as the Malledhrim press forward.

objective.text: The Golden Host is ever-threatened by the presence of Black Númenórean sorcerers in and around Dol Guldur, lending their aid and fealty to the strength of the Enemy.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have done much to hinder the foes of the Malledhrim, but the servants of the Enemy are many, and they are evil.

deed.name: Beast-slayer
deed.description: The many predators of Mirkwood are as black as the night itself, corrupted by the long years of evil.

objective.text: Many dark beasts terrorize the dense forest of Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The beasts of Mirkwood are powerful and terribly corrupted by the long presence of Dol Guldur in their midst. They hunt without mercy or necessity and harry the Malledhrim as they press ever forward.

deed.name: Beast-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The many predators of Mirkwood are as black as the night itself, corrupted by the long years of evil.

objective.text: Many dark beasts terrorize the dense forest of Southern Mirkwood.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Mirkwood may never recover from the presence of the Necromancer, and it will never be wholly cleansed of the evil that was present for so long, but the corrupted beasts of this forest will know better than to stand in your way.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many beasts in Southern Mirkwood

deed.name: Assault on the Ringwraiths' Lair
deed.description: The Ringwraiths' Lair provides the final defences for the inner fortifications.

objective.text: The baileys of the Ringwraiths' Lair are the final line of defence before the interior of the fortress.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Faelathron spends all of his time worshipping the Dark Lord, praying for a glimmer of his power.
To prepare for battle, Mazaukgrat plays drums made from the skulls of his vanquished enemies.
Kúfit never met an Elf he did not want to turn into a stew.
Durnákh, a powerful Gorthorog, wanders the Outer Bailey at night, staring up at the stars, dreaming of his next squirming meal.
Gúlheryn has never been able to make her hair look as pretty as that of the Elves, and for that she has pledged to defeat every last one.
Unlike many of his kind, Afglu enjoys walking the ramparts and staring down from the dizzying heights above the fortress of Dol Guldur.
Zánurz likes his dwarves raw....
Norchador has wandered Dol Guldur since it was originally built.
Mornákh looks down on all other uruks...they are not even worthy to bow before him.

deed.name: The Wilds of Mirkwood
deed.description: There are many wild and forsaken places to be stumbled upon as the wary wanderer passes through Mirkwood.

objective.text: There are many wild and forsaken places to be stumbled upon as the wary wanderer passes through Mirkwood.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This isolated hill in the Dourstocks is a rallying point for the wolf-packs of Mirkwood; mournful howls can often be heard upon the wind from this direction.

Gorogrod is a deep and evil den of the spiders of the Scuttledells, filled with perilous snares and sticky webs. Even the most seasoned traveller should be wary before treading here, for spiders are among the most deadly foes in Middle-earth. The spiders of Mirkwood's broods are certainly no exception.

Even trees can be corrupted by evil influences, and the Huorns of Mirkwood live out their long days growing ever blacker and ever more corrupt. Their home of Sâd Meryrn is a sad and lonely place, filled with the malice of the trees.
The fell waters of the Drownholt are polluted by many long years of corruption, and the heart of sickness in the swamp is the Pool of Creeping Death, home to many corpses and nasty creatures.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Pool of Creeping Death

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Tree of Suffering is a place where the Orcs display the bodies of their victims for all to see as a warning to all who would bring light to the dark forest.
Foul things cause the water of this pool to ripple, bringing dread and disgust to those who happen upon it.

The Wind Stones are impressive in their formation, jutting high from the forest floor, shaped and beaten by the elements. But evil has settled here, and many cruel Wargs prowl about, spoiling the land.

deed.name: Uncovering the Ruins of Mirkwood
deed.description: Mirkwood is home to many places that were once great, but have fallen into ruin after long years of corruption and disrepair.

objective.text: Mirkwood is home to many places that were once great, but have fallen into ruin after long years of corruption and disrepair.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Danneglor was once a stronghold of the Elves of Greenwood the Great, but it fell beneath the onslaught of the Necromancer of Dol Guldur long ago. Now vile merrevail out of Angmar have taken refuge there, bringing dread to the fell ruins.
Malledhrim seeking to strike into the heart of Dol Guldur have encamped in these foul ruins, hoping to avoid detection long enough to carry out their plans.
This tower once watched over the river Anduin and the passage to Lothlórien, Mirkwood's sister on the western banks.
These ruins have become home to Black Númenórean sorcerers and fell spirits in service to Dol Guldur.
The outlying ruins of Ost Galadh have become the lairs of wild beasts, corrupted by the foul power of Dol Guldur.

deed.name: Evil Strongholds of Mirkwood
deed.description: Many foes have settled throughout Mirkwood, striving ever to make it the fell and hopeless stronghold of evil that it has since become.

objective.text: Many foes have settled throughout Mirkwood, striving ever to make it the fell and hopeless stronghold of evil that it has since become.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Garmadh-maudhûl is one of many Orc-camps in the Ashenslades where the forces of Dol Guldur muster to begin their invasion of Lothlórien.
This evil place is the source of the blight upon the Ashenslades, summoned by the fell spirits and sorcerers who dwell there.
Ânghum-maudhûl is one of many Orc-camps littering the wastes of the Ashenslades, acting as a mustering hall for the forces of Dol Guldur.
Búrzkala is an Orc-fort in Gathbúrz, where the Orcs of Dol Guldur have established a foothold.
This hill was once a lookout for the Elves of Greenwood the Great before the coming of the Necromancer.
This Orc-camp was established to prevent an attack upon Dol Guldur from the forest of Lothlórien.

deed.name: Troll Wound-taker Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many troll Wound-takers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: One would not consider a troll to be willing to sacrifice himself for his allies, but the purpose of the Wound-takers do just that.

deed.name: Crazed Squad-captain Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Crazed squad-captains in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have learned the wily ways of the Enemy's crazed squad-captains and have learned to defend against them.

deed.name: Dourhand Storm-keeper Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Dourhand Storm-keepers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Storm-keepers of the Dourhands are rune-keepers proficient in summoning the power of the storm.

deed.name: Dourhand Storm-keeper Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Dourhand Storm-keepers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Dourhand Storm-keepers have misused the knowledge in their possession for too long...it is hoped the lesson you have taught them will not need to be repeated.

deed.name: Dourhand Keg-master Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many more Dourhand Keg-masters in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The inn is closed for the Keg-masters of the Dourhands. Their befuddling ways have been put to an end by your iron constitution.

deed.name: Pale Trapper Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many pale trappers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Nimwaith are a foul little folk, and their secretive trappers are no less devious....

deed.name: Crazed Squad-captain Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many crazed squad-captains in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: These maddened goblin overseers sned their boggart slaves ahead to distract their foes, while they bring their fire-pots to bear.

deed.name: Troll Wound-taker Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many more troll Wound-takers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Wound-takers of the Enemy no longer serve their purpose, as you have cut them down before they could rally their allies.

deed.name: Pale Trapper Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many more Pale Trappers in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You are familiar with the snares of the pale trappers and know how to avoid them.

deed.name: Dourhand Keg-master Slayer
deed.description: Defeat many Dourhand Keg-masters in Skirmishes. This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Do not underestimate the skills of the sodden Dourhand Keg-masters...but more importantly, never raise a glass with them.

deed.name: Smoke Before the Fire
deed.description: The One Ring has been found. The forces of Mordor are on the move. War is coming to Middle-earth....

objective.text: The forces of darkness are beginning to march, striking wherever the Free Peoples seem weakest.

level.loreInfo: The forces of the Enemy have begun to march and wage open war against the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.

deed.name: Known to the Eglain
deed.description: You have become known to the Eglain -- people who have shunned accepted society, choosing the meagre life that the Lone-lands will support.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Eglain have heard your name and speak well of you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must achieve Acquaintance standing with the Eglain

deed.name: Friend of the Eglain
deed.description: You have become a friend to the Eglain -- people who have shunned accepted society, choosing the meagre life that the Lone-lands will support.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Eglain consider you a trustworthy and valued friend.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must achieve Friend standing with the Eglain

deed.name: Ally of the Eglain
deed.description: You have become an ally to the Eglain -- people who have shunned accepted society, choosing the meagre life that the Lone-lands will support.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There are few among the Eglain who are not aware of your deeds. You have become an invaluable ally to them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must attain Ally standing with the Eglain

deed.name: Eglan
deed.description: You have become an honourary member of the Eglain -- people who have shunned accepted society, choosing the meagre life that the Lone-lands will support.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Eglain count you among their number. Your efforts to help the people of the Lone-lands have gone far to endear you to them. They will ever more call you kindred, a true member of the Eglain.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must obtain Kindred standing with the Eglain

title.name: Eglan / Eglan-soldier / Eglan-guard / Eglan-vanguard / Eglan-defender / Eglan-provider / Eglan-sage / Eglan-mender / Eglan-stonespeaker / Eglan-warden

deed.name: The Siege of Mirkwood
deed.description: Lord Celeborn and Lady Galadriel have devised a daring plan: to cross the river Anduin and attack the fortress of Dol Guldur in the depths of Mirkwood.

objective.text: It is time to execute Lord Celeborn's daring plan: an attack upon the fortress of Dol Guldur, in the depths of Southern Mirkwood.

level.loreInfo: It is time to execute Lord Celeborn's daring plan: an attack upon the fortress of Dol Guldur, in the depths of Southern Mirkwood.

deed.name: The Taming of the Shrews
deed.description: The Festival Garden of Duillond is rife with pesky pests, and some very practical help is needed to rid the garden of its problems.

objective.text:
The Festival Garden of Duillond is rife with pesky pests.
You should defeat as many shrews as you can to help the Elves cleanse their garden of chaos so that the young plants may have a chance to grow.

monsterDied.loreInfo: So impressed by your prowess are the Elves that they have bestowed yet another title upon you: Tamer of Shrews.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat shrews in the Festival Garden at Duillond

deed.name: The Shrewd Gardener
deed.description: The Festival Garden of Duillond is rife with pesky pests, and some very practical help is needed to rid the garden of its problems.

objective.text:
The Festival Garden of Duillond is rife with pesky pests.
You should defeat as many shrews as you can to help the Elves cleanse their garden of chaos so that the young plants may have a chance to grow.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Shrewdness will be needed to stem the tide of pesky pests in Duillond, and your efforts against these animals has demonstrated just such a quality.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat shrews in the Festival Garden at Duillond

deed.name: Spring is Dandy
deed.description: Spring is a dandy time of year!

objective.text: Complete many challenges of the Spring Festival, and all will be dandy.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Festival Run in the Shire.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Spring Festival Run in the Shire

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Festival Run in Bree.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Spring Festival Run in Bree

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed 'Bullroarer's Challenge -- Advanced.'
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Bullroarer's Challenge -- Advanced' at the Feast of the Greenfields

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed 'A Fool's Errand.'
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'A Fool's Errand' at the Hedge Maze

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed 'A Laugh at the Lost.'
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'A Laugh at the Lost' at the Hedge Maze

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed 'Misplaced Companions.'
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Misplaced Companions' at the Hedge Maze

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed 'Stomp-a-Shrew for the Leisurely Gardener.'
You have completed 'Stomp-a-Shrew for the Practised Gardener.'
You have completed 'The Stomp-a-Shrew Challenge.'

deed.name: The Spring Festival -- Season of the Garden
deed.description: Spring has made its presence known throughout Middle-earth.

objective.text: The good peoples of Middle-earth take some time to celebrate the beautiful new growing season.

condition.loreInfo: As the days grow longer and milder, the people of Middle-earth find themselves participating in fun games and events to welcome the bright new months.
condition.progressOverride: Enjoy the days of the Spring Festival

deed.name: Rescue in Nûrz Ghâshu
deed.description: The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu is a place where a man goes alone only if he has no wish of returning....

monsterDied.loreInfo: The fire spirit Narubras was one of the remaining servants of Morgoth still dwelling in the deeps of Middle-earth.
The Angmarim sorceress Gormalith sought to summon the servants of Thaurlach to the aid of the Iron Crown.
Gháshglob was a mighty captain of the Ghâshfra.
The Nameless things which dwell in the depths of Nûrz Ghâshu are terrible to behold.
The Ghâshfra have brought with them a new breed of troll created to traverse the molten depths of the Rift.
Lúgryn is one of the lesser spawn of Scátha the Worm.
Nurnor is the mightiest of the spawn of Scátha the Worm, dwelling now within the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu.
Fire spirits and earth spirits in the service of the Enemy dwell now in the deep places of the world, not the least of which is the Caerog Cefrog.

deed.name: Ale Association Acquaintance
deed.description: You have reached Acquaintance standing with the Ale Association.

objective.text: The Ale Association has convinced you to work hard for them, elevating your rank to that of Acquaintance standing.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Ale Association believes in one thing and one thing only: that hobbits have no business in the Ale-tasting business.
factionLevel.progressOverride: Reach Acquaintance standing with the Ale Association

deed.name: Ale Association Friend
deed.description: You have reached Friend standing with the Ale Association.

objective.text: The Ale Association has convinced you to work hard for them, elevating your rank to that of Friendly standing.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your further understanding of the motives and reasoning of the Ale Association has earned you some level of trust with its founder...but at what cost?
factionLevel.progressOverride: Reach Friend standing with the Ale Association

deed.name: Ale Association Ally
deed.description: You have reached Ally standing with the Ale Association.

objective.text: he Ale Association has convinced you to work hard for them, elevating your rank to that of Ally standing.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You and Jónar are thick as blood now, but you find yourself receiving dirty looks from those you pass. Was it worth it? Was it?
factionLevel.progressOverride: Reach Ally standing with the Ale Association

deed.name: Kindred of Malevolence
deed.description: You have reached Kindred standing with the Ale Association.

objective.text: The Ale Association has convinced you to work hard for them, elevating your rank to that of Kindred standing.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are a scoundrel and a fiend.
factionLevel.progressOverride: Reach Kindred standing with the Ale Association

deed.name: Volume III: 'Allies of the King' Foreword
deed.description: You have received a message from Pethelen, an Elf of Imladris, asking for you to see him at once about some urgent matter.

objective.text: A new story begins!

level.loreInfo: A new story begins: a dangerous chapter in the lives of those who seek to bring about the return of a long-awaited king.
level.progressOverride: Welcome to Volume III: Allies of the King!

deed.name: Allies of the King
deed.description: Unravel the Epic Story for Allies of the King.

questComplete.loreInfo: Surprising messages have come from Lothlórien, and Master Elrond of Rivendell has done what he can to respond by asking you to gather the Rangers, that they may ride to the aid of Aragorn in the wide lands to the south.
You travelled the wilderness of Eriador, bringing word to the Dúnedain: it is time to fulfill their oath of loyalty to Aragorn son of Arathorn.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Book 1 Chapter 9: The Gathering of the Grey Company'

questComplete.loreInfo: You rode south with the Rangers of the Grey Company, through Eregion and into Enedwaith, where you encountered a mysterious dwarf who has unexpected knowledge about the road ahead.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Book 2 Chapter 15: An Echo of Days Past'

questComplete.loreInfo: You have finally received truth from the dwarf Nár: the Wizard Saruman has fore-knowledge of your road, and the passage through Dunland will not be easy. Rangers of the Grey Company have fallen already on this journey, and the heart of Halbarad is heavy with grief.

You have escaped from the clutches of Saruman and rescued the surviving members of the Grey Company from the prison-caves of the Falcon Clan, but the future of your quest remains uncertain. Many foes remain between the Rangers of the Grey Company and their chieftain Aragorn.

The Fords of the Isen have been held by the Rohirrim under the command of Théodred, but the Prince of Rohan lost his life in the battle. For how long can this passage into Rohan remain secure from the ravages of Saruman?
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Book 5, Chapter 4: The Prince of Rohan'

questComplete.loreInfo: You tracked down the Nazgûl that stalked through the mists along the shores of Anduin, but Nona was wounded. You and Horn, a man of Rohan in service at Stangard, brought her to the Elves for healing. Galadriel saved her life, but the Lady of Lórien refused to speak further of what awaits you.

You tracked the Fellowship of the Ring south along Anduin to Parth Galen and the Falls of Rauros, where you encountered signs that they were set upon by foes. Two hobbits, most likely Frodo Baggins and his servant Samwise Gamgee, crossed the river and continued on their quest. The surviving members of the company crossed into Rohan, and if you are to find them and help them, you will need war-steeds of your own.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Volume III Book 7: A Fellowship Endangered'

questComplete.loreInfo: You have journeyed into the Riddermark, helping the people of East Rohan and tracking the remnants of the Fellowship of the Ring. Your travels brought you through the Wold, the Norcrofts, and finally the Entwash Vale, where Nona vanished and Horn realized his feelings for her.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Volume III Book 8: Into the Riddermark'

questComplete.loreInfo: You encountered Éomer, the nephew of the King and Third Marshal of the Riddermark, and travelled with him through the Entwash Vale and the Sutcrofts. When he brought you before the King, however, you witnessed the extent of Saruman's hold on King Théoden. The King ordered Éomer imprisoned and banished you, ordering you never to cross the Entwash under pain of death.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Volume III Book 9: The Third Marshal'

questComplete.loreInfo: You journeyed to the land of Wildermore, beset by unnatural winter and endangered by pawns of the Wizard Saruman, and did what you could for its people.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Volume III Book 10: Snows of Wildermore'

questComplete.loreInfo: You returned to Edoras and witnessed the restoration of Théoden by Gandalf. You also helped Éowyn prepare for the evacuation of the city, while the King and his riders departed for Isengard, and war.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Volume III Book 11: The Golden Hall'

questComplete.loreInfo: You journeyed throughout West Rohan, aiding its people as they prepare to face the perils of war.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Volume III Book 12: War in the Westemnet'

questComplete.loreInfo: You stood with the Rohirrim at the fortress of the Hornburg, in Helm's Deep, and survived the long night of battle with Saruman's armies. When dawn came, impossibly, Théoden and his people looked out over the Deep in victory.
The Grey Company has completed its mission to find Aragorn, and the threat of Saruman has been ended.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Volume III Book 14: The Waters of Isengard'

title.name: Friend to the Heir of Isildur

deed.name: Festival Fortunes: Oddly Familiar
deed.description: The festival cookies all contained strange pieces of paper with meaningingful phrases written upon them.

objective.text: You should collect the odd phrases from the first ten fortunes.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: 'Bah, that would only have been a scratch...come again!'
'Truly, your heart holds no fear, brother.'
'Dance three is the step here.'
'There has been a rash of rancid pies all across the Shire.'
'Did you hear that, Wanetta? Asphodel said yes!'
'Tra la, tra la, tra lilly, tra la. Red with blood...where life has fled. Pretty flowers...so bright red.... La la, la lilly, la la....'
'I hope the Last Prince comes soon. I'm scared!'
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go north.'
'I bring terror to the sties of Budgeford. These sties are mine! Ba ha ha ha...fear my wrath, Bolgers of Budgeford!'
'Are you trying to kill yourself? Get out of the water before you drown!'

deed.name: Festival Fortunes: A Storyteller's Snippets
deed.description: The festival cookies all contained strange pieces of paper with meaningingful phrases written on them.

objective.text: You should collect the oddly familiar phrases from the first ten fortunes.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: 'Thag you very buch!'
'I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve.'
'It is a dangerous business, going out of your door.'
'You step onto the Road, and if you don't keep your feet, there is no knowing where you might be swept off to.'
'What have I got in my pocket?'
NO ADMITTANCE EXCEPT ON PARTY BUSINESS
'I have called you all together for a Purpose.'
'I'll do as I choose and go as I please.'
'Mr. Bilbo Baggins has gone away; as far as I know, for good.'
'And he lived happily ever after, to the end of his days.'

deed.name: Festival Fortunes: Fateful Foretellings
deed.description: The festival cookies all contained strange pieces of paper with meaningingful phrases written on them.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: An old love will come back to you!
Wonderful luck will come your way today.
Terrible luck will come your way today.
You cannot pass!
The dark fire will not avail you.
Time for some thrilling heroics.
All signs point to maybe.
Quit pestering me!
Maybe you should ask again later.
Reply hazy...best to try again.

deed.name: Festival Fortunes: Excellent Advice
deed.description: The festival cookies all contained strange pieces of paper with meaningful phrases written on them.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: Hungry? Have another cookie.
Beware of very deep holes.
Watch out for cliffs and high places, because you could sustain great injuries if you fall.
Watch out for Black Riders.
Thirsty? Have another Perry's Porter.
You should carry food with you in case you get hungry.
What about a bit of rope? You'll want it, if you haven't got it.
Shadows are darker than most places, so you will not be able to see as much when standing in them.
Always look up! A tree branch could fall on you at any time. But watch where you walk in the meantime; you don't want to trip.
Boars are vicious! Avoid them at all costs. Especially the boars of Evendim.

deed.name: Festival Fortunes: An Adventurer's Song
deed.description: The festival cookies all contained strange pieces of paper with meaningful phrases written on them.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: The road goes ever on and on...
...Down from the door where it began...
...Now far ahead the Road has gone...
..And I must follow...
...if I can.
Pursuing it with eager feet...
...Until it joins some larger way...
...Where many paths and errands meet...
...And whither then...?
...I cannot say.

deed.name: Hawk-Eyed Harrier Slayer
deed.description:
Defeat many hawk-eyed harriers in Skirmishes.
This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The hawk-eyed harriers of the Enemy are a threat to be reckoned with if allowed to cast their arrows from afar....

deed.name: Hawk-Eyed Harrier Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description:
Defeat many hawk-eyed harriers in Skirmishes.
This deed will only be advanced by Lieutenants that do not appear grey to your character, they must be around the same level as you are.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have learned to close the distance between yourself and the hawk-eyed harriers as quickly as possible.

deed.name: Happy Summer
deed.description: The Summer Festival is upon us! It is time to enjoy the longest days of the year, the warmth of the sun, and the peak of the mid-year harvest.

objective.text: The Summer Festival has come to Middle-earth to spread its gaiety and warmth to each and every patron.

condition.loreInfo: A merry, sunny summer has visited the good festival patrons, giving them perfect weather in which to enjoy the many festival games.
condition.progressOverride: Enjoy the summer festivities while they last

deed.name: Helegrod -- The Gate to Thorog
deed.description: Access to the courtyard and Thorog is controlled by three guardians. They must all be vanquished before the master of Helegrod may be approached.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Storvâgûn, the giant-lord of Helegrod, has fallen.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Storvâgûn and claim the Giant Wing

monsterDied.loreInfo: Zaudru, the spider-queen of Helegrod, has been defeated.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Zaudru and claim the Spider Wing

enterDetection.loreInfo: Grisgart, a Man of Angmar controlling the drakes of Helegrod, has fallen.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat Grisgart and claim the Drake Wing

deed.name: A Lucky Day at the Races
deed.description: Win at each of the races taking place during the Summer Festival.

objective.text: Win at each of the races taking place during the Summer Festival.

deed.name: Ale Association Delivery
deed.description: Complete all the underhanded deliveries for the Ale Association.

objective.text: Complete all the underhanded deliveries for the Ale Association.

questComplete.loreInfo: Nathalan asked for Swill; you brought him mead instead.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'A Drink of the Best Character'

questComplete.loreInfo: Wesley Hopwood asked for Limael's Vintage; you brought him Isenwine instead.
Alrek has asked for Forsaken Ale; you brought him Barliman's Best instead.
Lendasil has asked for Dorwinion White; you brought her Dorwinion Red instead.
Harigar Mudbottom requested Blagrove's Brown. Why, then, did you bring him Whitebranch?
Lófi requested Moor-boar Beer; you brought him Toad's Tongue Ale.
Wald Mugwort has requested Thistlebelly's Brew; you brought him a plain small beer.
Óli requested Beakbreaker Ale; you brought him 1404 Vintage Reserve wine instead.
Múli asked for Bombur's Beard Lager; instead you delivered Dragon's Breath Ale.
Foxglove Grubb asked for Stars of Old Cider; instead, she received Forsaken Cider. Poor Foxglove.
Saerthuithel asked for Brandy Wine; you brought her Old Winyards instead.

deed.description: Complete all the deliveries ordered by Inn League Members in need.

You have generously delivered Forsaken Ale to Alrek.

You have generously delivered Blagrove's Brown to Harigar Mudbottom.

You have generously brought Bombur's Beard Lager to Múli.

deed.name: Ale Association Initiation
deed.description: Complete the challenges of the Ale Association Initiation.

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Ale Association Initiation Challenge

deed.name: Exploration from Top to Bottom
deed.description: The ruins of Minas Elendúr in Eregion and their under-cellars of Delotham have gone unexplored for long years since they were abandoned.

questComplete.loreInfo: You found the Elf-ruins of Minas Elendúr and should explore the sprawling ruins.

enterDetection.loreInfo: This central courtyard in Minas Elendúr was taken early by the forces of evil when war came to Eregion. The statue was untouched by the Orcs, but its sad countenance witnessed a great deal of pain and death on the grass below.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the statue in the courtyard of Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: The south-west corner in Minas Elendur contains two platforms of raised steps and a great deal of debris. None of the columns reach the ceiling any longer, and this section of the ruins feels particularly unstable.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the south-west corner of Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: This enclosed porch looks out over one of Minas Elendur's several large courtyards. Valuables were left here, overlooked by the forces of evil that hunted the inhabitants here when war came to Eregion.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the enclosed porch in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: This courtyard, once a place of reflection for the Elves that lived in Minas Elendur, is now home only to bears driven mad with hunger. From above, the windows of an enclosed porch look out over the crumbling stones.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the circular courtyard in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: The pillars of this room in the south-east corner of Minas Elendúr are covered with ivy and crawling vines. The corners are shrouded in darkness, as so much of these ruins are.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the south-east corner in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: This aisle, open to the skies of Eregion, was once the home of much greenery. Now only a few trees and bushes stand atop a raised platform here. This place is a junction of sorts, and passages lead away in three directions.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the south-east aisle in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: This isolated chamber, reachable only by stairs from Delotham, was one of the last places held by the Elves of Minas Elendúr when war came to Eregion. Their sad end left a mark on this grim chamber that time has not erased.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the isolated chamber in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: Pillars still reach to the ceiling in this dimly-lit room, despite the debris and fallen stones piled in the corners.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the dimly-lit, pillared room in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: From this windowed chamber, the Elves that lived in this place watched as the forces of evil marauded through Minas Elendúr, slaying its meagre defenders. This elevated chamber bears the mark of their grief and despair, waiting as they did for the end to come.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the windowed chamber in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: After the first assault of Orcs attacked Minas Elendúr, many of the Elves that remained within were scattered and had to fend for themselves. They made their way through the maze-like interior, avoiding patrolling Orcs wherever they could. Rooms such as this one enabled many of the Elves to escape from their pursuers, but not all were successful.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the room of doors in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: This room has been marked by terrible evil, and the very stones cry out against the stain. What can have happened in this place to leave such torment in its wake?
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the room of dread in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: Three passages lead away from the northernmost room in Minas Elendúr, passages down which the heavy tramp of Orc-feet carried even on the still air when war came to Eregion.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the northern room in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: This upper balcony overlooks a courtyard in the southern area of Minas Elendúr and is home to treasure forgotten -- or ignored -- by the Orcs.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the large balcony in Minas Elendúr

enterDetection.loreInfo: Part of the wall has crumbled away in this south-west corner of Delotham, the basement of Minas Elendúr. It is patrolled now by Ninkoth uruks, their heavy footfalls bringing to mind that of the Orcs that stalked these passages when war came to Eregion.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the south-west corner of Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: Stone-lizards scamper along the floor of this chamber in Delotham, perhaps drawn by the illumination that breaks through the ceiling from above.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the illuminated room in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: Treasure can be found among the fallen rocks and debris of this junction in Delotham, where long ago Elves fought to defend their home from attack by the forces of evil.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the rubble-filled room in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: This chamber, accessible only by stairs from Minas Elendúr, served as a final hiding-place for the Elves here when the Orcs came for them. The Enemy has more than just Orcs in his service, and this chamber still bears the mark of the evil that happened between these buried walls.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the buried room in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: A diverse range of creatures make their home now in Delotham: stone-lizards and insects that have come to this place from hidden cracks within Khazad-dûm. The four passages that meet here ensure that it once saw much foot traffic in time of peace and much hurried panic in time of war.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the four-corridor junction in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: This bend is illuminated by shafts of light from above, one of the few places within Delotham where shadow does not lie heavily upon the stones.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the illuminated bend in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: This chamber within Delotham is centrally-located, but must see very little in the way of explorers. Bats nest here in the dark corners, and treasure too can be found if the shadowy curtain is drawn aside.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the central chamber in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: This corner in the western area of Delotham is partially collapsed, as the ravages of time buckled the south wall. As the Orcs spread throughout Minas Elendúr and Delotham in search of survivors of the initial assault, Elves came to hide wherever they could stay ahead of the marching footfall of the Orcs. This corner may once have sheltered such an Elf, though what became of any who tried to stay here is unknown and unknowable.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the collapsed corner in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: This sunken chamber, hidden for some days following the initial assault of the Orcs, is where the last three Elves of Minas Elendúr made their stand against the Enemy, when war came to Eregion. No tales tell how long they may have held out against the overwhelming force of the Orcs, but it is the tradition of Elrond of Rivendell to say that they held out until the end -- and beyond it -- and only when those who had escaped were safely out of Eregion did these last three fall.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the sunken chamber in Delotham

enterDetection.loreInfo: The northernmost room of Delotham was built a distance from the other rooms, but none can say for what purpose it may have been. It seems to have not been for defensive reasons, for time alone is responsible for the decay in this chamber, and the war that came to Eregion and destroyed the Elves of Minas Elendúr seems to have left this chamber alone.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the northern chamber in Delotham

deed.name: The Library at Tham Mírdain
deed.description: The Library at Tham Mírdain was once one of the greatest repositories of the Elves' knowledge in Middle-earth. After Sauron's forces razed Eregion, much of that knowledge was lost.

objective.text: Forces for Good and Evil race to recover scraps of lost knowledge from the Library at Tham Mírdain

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Purging the Overmasters
Completed Matters of Knowledge
Completed Pillagers of Knowledge
Completed Chieftain Gûrsh
Completed Challenge: Chieftain Gûrsh
Completed Lore of the Forgotten Library
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Lore of the Forgotten Library

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Invaders of Tham Mirdain (Library)

deed.name: The School at Tham Mírdain
deed.description: The School at Tham Mírdain once trained the mightiest Elf-smiths in Middle-earth. Much to their dismay, their learning was used against them when the Great Rings were created.

objective.text: Forces for both Good and Evil race to uncover lingering secrets from the ruins of the School at Tham Mírdain.

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Musings and Teachings
Completed Blade of the Dunlending
Completed Biting the White Hand

deed.name: Annuminas -- Glinghant
deed.description: The gardens of Glinghant were once one of the wonders of Annúminas, but have fallen into decay and corruption.

objective.text: Much needs to be done to free Glinghant from the corruption that has overwhelmed it.

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Impure Waters
Completed Keep it from the Enemy
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Keep it from the Enemy

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Darkest of Waters

deed.name: Annuminas -- Ost Elendil
deed.description: Ost Elendil was once the palace of Elendil, first King of Westernesse in Middle-earth. Now it is home to great evil.

objective.text: Much needs to be done to free Ost Elendil from the corruption that has overwhelmed it.

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed The Door-warden of the Inner Chamber
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete The Door-warden of the Inner Chamber

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Evil in Ost Elendil

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Balhest, Lord of Ost Elendil

deed.name: Annuminas -- Haudh Valandil
deed.description: Haudh Valandil is the final resting place of Isildur's youngest son. Evil things now gnaw at its roots.

objective.text: Much needs to be done to free Haudh Valandil from the corruption that has overwhelmed it.

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed New Home for the Relics of Old
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete New Home for the Relics of Old

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed The Kergrim Stalk Haudh Valandil
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete The Kergrim Stalk Haudh Valandil

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Lights in Darkness
Completed End Dolvaethor's Menace
Completed Challenge: Valandil and Dolvaethor

deed.name: Helegrod -- Drake Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. This wing is now home to a brood of drakes descended from the great dragon Thorog.

objective.text: Grisgart, a Man of Angmar serving at Helegrod, acts as the master of the drakes, bending them to the will of the Iron Crown.

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Challenge: Grisgart
Completed Drake-wrangler
Completed Keep Them from Hatching
Completed Fangs for Nothing

deed.name: Helegrod -- Giant Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. Giants under the influence of Skorgrím Dourhand and the Angmarim now call this wing of the dwarf-hold home.

objective.text: The mighty Storvâgûn leads his people in the fastness of Helegrod, holding the fortress against the Free Peoples.

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Giants in the Service of Angmar
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Giants in the Service of Angmar

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Giant-slayer

deed.name: Helegrod -- Spider Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. Great spiders now infest many portions of the ancient dwarf-hold.

objective.text: The evil spider-queen Zaudru is one of the strongest of the spawn of Shelob, spawn of Ungoliant.
