deed.name: Helegrod -- Dragon Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. This wing now serves as the tomb of the dragon Thorog.

objective.text: Who knows what treasures remain in the hoard of the great beast Thorog.

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Thorog Defeated

deed.name: Mysteries of Enedwaith
deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

objective.text: Complete quests within Enedwaith.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have only begun to uncover the mysteries of Enedwaith....

deed.name: Dunlending-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Dunlendings in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Dunlendings from the Draig-lûth and deserters from Saruman's forces in Eregion threaten the Algraig of Enedwaith. You have done much to defend the Uch-lûth against them.

deed.name: Mysteries of Enedwaith (Intermediate)
deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

objective.text: Complete quests within Enedwaith.

questComplete.loreInfo: As the Grey Company journeys deeper into Enedwaith, the mysteries they discover become stranger and stranger....

deed.name: Mysteries of Enedwaith (Advanced)
deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

objective.text: Complete quests within Enedwaith.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Algraig of Enedwaith are learning to appreciate the aid of yourself and the Grey Company in banishing the fell creatures which have invaded their home.

deed.name: Mysteries of Enedwaith (Final)
deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

objective.text: Complete quests within Enedwaith.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have earned the respect of both the Grey Company and the Algraig of Enedwaith for your efforts against the forces of evil.

deed.name: Path of the Grey Company
deed.description: Rangers of the North, kinsmen of Aragorn son of Arathorn, have ridden forth to their chieftain's aid. As they pass south to Rohan, scout the way ahead for the best roads.

objective.text: Discover the camps of the Grey Company.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Echad Dagoras is the encampment of Dagoras of Esteldín and his companions. It is here that the Grey Company entered Enedwaith and went their separate ways, hoping to pass through the region unnoticed by Saruman's spies.
Echad Saeradan is the encampment of Saeradan of Bree-land and his companions.
Echad Idhrenfair is the encampment of Idhrenfair and his companions, who had aided the Malledhrim in Southern Mirkwood.
Echad Daervunn is the encampment of Daervunn of Esteldín and his companions.
Harndirion is the ruin of an ancient fortress built by the Men of Gondor long ago.

deed.name: The Cartrevs of Enedwaith
deed.description: The clansmen of the Uch-lûth have many outlying farmsteads, though they have come under attack by invaders from the South.

objective.text: Discover the Cartrevs of Enedwaith.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This hut is the home of the shepherd Duved. Along with his daughter Avanen, he tends his flocks in Fordirith.
This stead belongs to a herdsman named Emlun. Recent troubles in the lands of the Uch-lûth have caused him to abandon his home for a time.
This stead belonged to a herdsman named Rurith until raiders from the South butchered him and his family and burnt it to the ground.
This stead belonged to a herdsman named Matho. Raiders from the South burnt it to the ground while Matho was away.
This Uch-lûth farmstead is one of the few that survived the attacks of the half-orcs.

deed.name: Protector of Enedwaith
deed.description: You have put forth your best efforts to protect the peoples of Enedwaith against the evils which arose in their land.

deed.name: Wolf and Shadow-wolf Slayer
deed.description: Defeat wolves and Shadow-wolves in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Not only do wolves hunt the expanses of Enedwaith, you have learned that in some of the darkest crags Shadow-wolves prowl.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat wolves and Shadow-wolves in Enedwaith

deed.name: Wolf and Shadow-wolf Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wolves and Shadow-wolves in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The wolves of Enedwaith and their masters among the shadows quail at your approach.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat wolves and Shadow-wolves in Enedwaith

deed.name: Dunlending-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Dunlendings in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Draig-lûth have learned to fear your name...perhaps tales of your might will flow south into Dunland.

deed.name: Cuthraul and Elhudan-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Cuthraul and Elhudan in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: There is little more mysterious in the region of Enedwaith than the dark Cuthraul and the wisps called the Elhudan... but you do not fear them.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Cuthraul and Elhudan in Enedwaith

deed.name: Cuthraul and Elhudan-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Cuthraul and Elhudan in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Cuthraul shriek at your approach and the Elhudan vanish into the twilight.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Cuthraul and Elhudan in Enedwaith

deed.name: Half-orc Slayer
deed.description: Defeat half-orcs in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many are the servants of Saruman, but few are as twisted as the half-orcs. By your hand, their number is beginning to dwindle in Enedwaith.

deed.name: Half-orc Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many half-orcs in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The half-orcs of Saruman contemplate withdrawal from Enedwaith as you whittle away at their number.

deed.name: Wood-troll Slayer
deed.description: Defeat Wood-trolls in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Wood-trolls pervade the forests of the Mournshaws... you have your work set before you.

deed.name: Wood-troll Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Wood-trolls in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Wood-trolls of Enedwaith skulk in the dark woods, afraid of your prowess.

deed.name: Great Barrow -- The Gate to Sambrog
deed.description: Access to the depths of the Great Barrow and the gaunt-man Sambrog is gated by a key. One half lies within the maze, the other with Thadúr.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Thadúr the Ravager has fallen and you have claimed his half of the Great Barrows key.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Thadúr the Ravager and claim half of the key

monsterDied.loreInfo: Gaerdring and Gaerthel have been defeated and half of the Great Barrows key has been claimed.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Gaerdring and Gaerthel and claim half of the key.

deed.name: Great Barrow -- Maze Wing
deed.description: The haunted tombs of the Barrow-downs are no place for a living mortal.

objective.text: Great Barrow -- Maze Wing

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Grim Tomb-wights
Completed Crawling Arms
Completed Ancient Barrow-wights
Completed Ancient Flames
Completed Gaerdring and Gaerthel
Completed Challenge: Gaerdring and Gaerthel

deed.name: Great Barrow -- Water Wing
deed.description: Rumour has it that a Gaunt-lord rules over this wing of Othrongroth.

objective.text: Great Barrow -- Water Wing

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Gaunt Battle-caller
Completed Chilled Barrow-wights
Completed Barrow-wight Bowlords
Completed Disturbed Remains
Completed Thadúr the Ravager
Completed Challenge: Thadúr the Ravager

deed.name: Great Barrow -- Sambrog Wing
deed.description: The wight-lord Sambrog rules over the Barrow-downs in the name of the Witch-king of Angmar.

objective.text: Great Barrow - Sambrog Wing

questComplete.loreInfo: Completed Accursed Fell-spirit
Completed Consuming Barrow-crawler
Completed Barrow-wights
Completed Ancient Flames
Completed Sambrog
Completed Challenge: Sambrog

deed.name: Known to the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas know your name and wonder what more you will do for them.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your deeds on behalf of the Wardens of Annúminas have earned you a measure of respect.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Wardens of Annúminas

deed.name: Friend to the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas consider you a friend and are willing to trust you with more important endeavours.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your deeds on behalf of the Wardens of Annúminas give the Rangers a reason to consider you a friend to their cause.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Wardens of Annúminas

deed.name: Ally to the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas consider you a stalwart ally and trusted confidant in all things that they do.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your deeds on behalf of the Wardens of Annúminas have earned you a place alongside many of the other trusted allies they call upon in dire times.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Wardens of Annúminas

deed.name: Kindred with the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas look upon you as an honorary member of their people. You are welcome among their number and their homes.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your deeds on behalf of the Wardens of Annúminas earn you a place as one of them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Wardens of Annúminas

deed.name: Known to the Men of Bree
deed.description: Your name is now known throughout the entirety of Bree-land and the people know that you act in their interest.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now known throughout the lands of Bree-land.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Men of Bree

deed.name: Friend to the Men of Bree
deed.description: All you have done within the bounds of Bree-land has made the folk who live within its bounds friendly to you.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have become a welcome friend among the Men of Bree.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Men of Bree

deed.name: Ally to the Men of Bree
deed.description: When Bree is in need of aid the Men of Bree expect that you will find your way to the forefront of battle to assist them in their time of need.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now a trusted ally among the Men of Bree.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Men of Bree

deed.name: Kindred to the Men of Bree
deed.description: You may not have been born among the Men of Bree and you may not make the small towns throughout Bree-land your home, but you are welcome wherever you go.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within the bounds of Bree-land where you are not known. The people feel a deep kinship with you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Men of Bree

deed.name: Known to Council of North
deed.description: The last warriors fighting the oppression in Angmar now know your name.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now known to all fighting for freedom in the besieged land of Angmar.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Council of the North

deed.name: Friend of the Council of the North
deed.description: The Free Peoples fighting against the tyranny of Angmar number you among their friends.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts in the lands of Angmar have earned you a place among the Council of the North.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Council of the North

trait.name: Council of the North - Travel Discount

deed.name: Ally of the Council of the North
deed.description: In Angmar, the last hope of Free Peoples looks to you to stand beside them among the members of the Council of the North.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Among the Council of the North, you are looked to in every battle that is fought as a stalwart ally to their cause.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Council of the North

trait.name: Council of the North - Vendor Discount

deed.name: Kindred of the Council of the North
deed.description: You have become an important part of the Council of the North, and the Free Peoples of Angmar feel a kindred bond with you.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Having shed blood by their side, you have attained a kindred connexion with the Council of the North.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Council of the North

deed.name: Known to the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín know your name and have begun to trust you, somewhat.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done for the Rangers of Esteldín has made you known to them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Rangers of Esteldín

deed.name: Friend to the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín respect you and consider you a friendly voice and assistant to their causes.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done for the Rangers of Esteldín endears you to them in a manner befitting of true friendship.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Rangers of Esteldín

deed.name: Ally to the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín look to you for aid against the dangers that they face in the North Downs.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done for the Rangers of Esteldín earns you a place of alliance with them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Rangers of Esteldín

deed.name: Kindred with the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín consider you to be an honorary member of their number. You are a kindred soul standing beside them on the field of battle.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done for the Rangers of Esteldín has earned their respect in such a way that you have become as one of their own.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Rangers of Esteldín

deed.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Guards of Moria now know your name.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done for the Iron Garrison Guards has earned you a modicum of respect among them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Iron Garrison Guards.

title.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Guards

deed.name: Friend to the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Guards now consider you to be a friendly face and welcome addition to their efforts in Moria.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Iron Garrison Guards appreciate all that you have done for them and now consider you to be a friend to their cause.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Iron Garrison Guards.

title.name: Friend to the Iron Garrison Guards

deed.name: Ally to the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: You are now considered to be an ally to the dwarves who make up the Iron Garrison Guards.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts in the depths of Moria have drawn your relationship with the Iron Garrison Guards to a point where you are considered an Ally to their cause.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Iron Garrison Guards.

title.name: Ally of the Iron Garrison Guards

deed.name: Kindred with the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: The dwarves of the Iron Garrison Guards now consider you to be one of their own.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Iron Garrison Guards appreciate all that you have done for them in Moria and believe that you are a dwarf deep within your being.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Iron Garrison Guards.

deed.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Miners of Moria now know your name.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done for the Iron Garrison Miners has earned you a modicum of respect amongst them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Iron Garrison Miners.

title.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Miners

deed.name: Friend to the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Miners attempting to reclaim Moria consider you to be a friend to their efforts.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Iron Garrison Miners of Moria appreciate your efforts and now consider you a friend.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Iron Garrison Miners.

title.name: Friend of the Iron Garrison Miners

deed.name: Ally to the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: Amongst the Iron Garrison Miners of Moria you are now considered an ally to their cause.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have done much to earn their respect and the Iron Garrison Miners of Moria now consider you a trusted ally.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Iron Garrison Miners.

title.name: Ally of the Iron Garrison Miners

deed.name: Kindred with the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Miners have come to think of you as one of their own in the deep dark of Moria.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All of your efforts in aiding the Iron Garrison Miners has endeared you to them as one of their own.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Iron Garrison Miners

deed.name: Known to the Lossoth
deed.description: The Lossoth are an distrustful brood, but you are now known to them, and this could be a good thing.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Lossoth have come to know your name and offer you a show of respect not typically given to outsiders.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Lossoth

deed.name: Friend to the Lossoth
deed.description: You have earned the trust of the Lossoth -- even their friendship -- and they now treat you far differently than any other outsider.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Lossoth consider you to be one of their friends, and they treat you with a good deal of respect and honour.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Lossoth

deed.name: Ally to the Lossoth
deed.description: The Lossoth no longer consider you an outsider, instead they welcome you as an ally against the many enemies that they face.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Among the Lossoth, your deeds are moving towards the stuff of legend, and they consider you a staunch ally.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Lossoth

deed.name: Kindred with the Lossoth
deed.description: You are now considered to be one of the Lossoth.

factionLevel.loreInfo: If you chose to, you could live among the Lossoth and suffer no ill will. It is as if you are one of their tribe's number.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Lossoth

deed.name: Known to the Galadhrim
deed.description: In the peaceful lands of the Galadhrim, the Elves who protect the sacred bowers know your name.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts have made you known to the Elves of Lothlórien
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Galadhrim

deed.name: Friend to the Galadhrim
deed.description: The Elves of Lothlórien now consider you friendly enough to be trusted unwatched throughout the forest.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done has caused the Elves of Lothlórien to gaze upon you with a friendly eye.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Galadhrim

deed.name: Ally to the Galadhrim
deed.description: The Elves of Lothlórien have come to trust you as an ally.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have done much to earn the respect of the Elves of Lothlórien, and they now consider you an ally.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Galadhrim

deed.name: Kindred with the Galadhrim
deed.description: Even the White Lady knows of your efforts and as such you have earned the highest honour among the Galadhrim.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Elves of Lothlórien have no higher honourifics to bestow upon you. You are welcome in their wood and trusted to do what is right when present.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Galadhrim

deed.name: Known to the Mathom Society
deed.description: You are known to those hobbits who find the outside world something of wonder, the Mathom Society.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your name is known to the Hobbits of the Mathom Society.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Mathom Society

deed.name: Friend to the Mathom Society
deed.description: The Mathom Society appreciates your contributions and considers you a friend to their collection efforts.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Among the Mathom Society your contributions are most welcome and they treat you as a trusted and welcome friend.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Mathom Society

deed.name: Ally of the Mathom Society
deed.description: The Mathom Society regards you as more than just a friendly contributor -- in fact, you have become something of a reliable ally.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your donations and efforts on behalf of the Mathom Society have endeared you, so that they have come to expect your allegiance in many matters.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Mathom Society

deed.name: Kindred with the Mathom Society
deed.description: The hobbits, normally a people distrustful of strangers, have come to find you a welcome guest within the Mathom House.

factionLevel.loreInfo: In the Mathom House, there is discussion that a wing will be added with your name and contributions. They regard you so highly that such a thing is entirely possible.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Mathom Society

deed.name: Known to the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: You are now known to the Elves of Rivendell.

factionLevel.loreInfo: In Rivendell, your name is now mentioned among all of the Elves.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Elves of Rivendell

deed.name: Friend to the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: The Elves of Rivendell now consider you to be a friend to them.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have done much for the Elves of Rivendell, and they consider you to be a friend to them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Elves of Rivendell

deed.name: Ally to the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: You have done much to earn their respect, and now the Elves of Rivendell consider you to be one of their allies.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts throughout their lands and those surrounding Rivendell have earned you the status of ally among them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Elves of Rivendell

deed.name: Kindred with the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: All you have done for the Elves of Rivendell has earned a sincere bond of friendship that gives you great respect among them.

factionLevel.loreInfo: In Rivendell, the Elves consider you to be one of their dearest allies, friends, and confidants. Few others have ever earned the trust that you now possess.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Elves of Rivendell

deed.name: Known to Thorin's Hall
deed.description: You have become known to the dwarves who make Thorin's Hall their home.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your name is known to the Dwarves of Thorin's Hall.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with Thorin's Hall.

deed.name: Friend to Thorin's Hall
deed.description: All know that you are a friend to all who dwell within Thorin's Hall.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The dwarves of Thorin's Hall consider you a friend.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with Thorin's Hall.

deed.name: Ally of Thorin's Hall
deed.description: You are considered a reliable and staunch ally to the dwarves of Thorin's Hall.

factionLevel.loreInfo: When the dwarves of Thorin's Hall are in need of allies, they look to you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with Thorin's Hall.

deed.name: Kindred to Thorin's Hall
deed.description: Among the dwarves of Thorin's Hall there is no greater honour to earn. You are considered to be as one with the stone.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nary a dwarf within all of Thorin's Hall that does not look upon you with a great deal of respect.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with Thorin's Hall.

deed.name: Kindred with the Malledhrim
deed.description: The Malledhrim now consider you one of their own, they will look to you to lead charges against the forces of the Enemy wherever they go.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts in fighting back the Enemy within the bounds of Mirkwood have earned you great respect among the Malledhrim.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Malledhrim

deed.name: Friend to the Malledhrim
deed.description: The Malledhrim now consider you a friend to their cause and respect you more.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts have earned you a standing of friendship with the Malledhrim.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Malledhrim

deed.name: Ally to the Malledhrim
deed.description: You are now trusted among the Malledhrim, and with that trust comes an expectation of continued assistance.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Malledhrim honour all that you do and now consider you to be a reliable ally.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Malledhrim

deed.name: Known to the Malledhrim
deed.description: As the vanguard pushing evil from Mirkwood, the Malledhrim look for any that will stand with them. You have become known to their leaders.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your continued efforts have made your name known to the Malledhrim.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Malledhrim

deed.name: Known to the Algraig
deed.description: The Men who make the wilds their home in Enedwaith have come to know of you.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Algraig have learned of your exploits and know who you are.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Algraig

deed.name: Ally to the Algraig
deed.description: Your continued efforts to aid the Algraig remove their wariness and endear you to them as an ally.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Algraig have come to expect that you will aid them in anything that they ask -- for a price -- as any good ally would.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Algraig

deed.name: Friend to the Algraig
deed.description: You have done enough that the Algraig, normally mistrustful, consider that you are a friend to them.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have earned a measure of respect with the Algraig, enough that they consider you to be friendly to them.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Algraig

deed.name: Known to the Grey Company
deed.description: The Grey Company has learned that you are willing to aid them, and this heartens them some.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your deeds for the Grey Company have earned you a measure of respect.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Grey Company

deed.name: Kindred with the Algraig
deed.description: You have grown close to the Algraig, and they consider you to be a welcome member of their people.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are considered an honorary member of the Algraig clans, expected to assist them, and they expect to be called to assist you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Algraig

deed.name: Ally to the Grey Company
deed.description: The Grey Company has come to rely upon you in matters that aid their cause. They consider you a reliable and able ally.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Grey Company looks upon you as an ally for all that you have done to aid their cause.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Grey Company

deed.name: Friend to the Grey Company
deed.description: Your continued efforts to aid the Grey Company endears you to them as a friend.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your deeds for the Grey Company earn you a place among them as a friend.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Grey Company

deed.name: Kindred with the Grey Company
deed.description: You are considered to be a member of the Grey Company should you choose or would that they were allowed to take you. Still, the respect you have earned cannot be matched.

factionLevel.loreInfo: If they could, the Grey Company would take you to their destination and place you among their number in battle. Alas, their deed requires that only they make the journey.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Grey Company

deed.name: The Odiferous
deed.description: The Stoors of Maur Tulhau pride themselves as farmers, using only the finest boar-droppings as fertilizer and marigolds around their gardens to ward off pesky animals.

objective.text: Complete Miraculous Growth -- Repeatable

questComplete.loreInfo: You have collected so many piles of boar-droppings and collected so many marigold plants that you fairly reek of them.

deed.name: Master of Stairs
deed.description: The road leading to Nar's Peak is a long and arduous one.

objective.text: Climb the stairs to Nár's Peak.

enterDetection.loreInfo: Looking up the stairs, you wonder how you ever survived to make it to the top.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Ascend the stair to Nár's Peak

enterDetection.loreInfo: Looking down the stair, you wonder how you ever mustered the courage to make the ascent
enterDetection.progressOverride: Reach the top of the stairs to Nár's Peak

deed.name: Exiles from the Lonely Mountain
deed.description: When Smaug threw down the dwarves of Erebor, Thrór and his family and many of their subjects escaped south, eventually crossing through Dunland and north to the Blue Mountains.

objective.text: Discover the campsites of the exiles from the Lonely Mountain.

itemUsed.loreInfo: This pillar marks a site where the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain, under the leadership of Thrór and Thráin, encamped during their exile.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Discover the dwarf-marker at Fordh Maru

itemUsed.loreInfo: This pillar marks a site where the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain, under the leadership of Thrór and Thráin, temporarily settled during their exile.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Discover the dwarf-marker at Nár's Peak

itemUsed.loreInfo: This pillar marks a site where the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain, under the leadership of Thráin, encamped during their exile.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Discover the dwarf-marker near the Pool of the King

itemUsed.loreInfo: This pillar marks a site where the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain, under the leadership of Thráin, encamped during their exile.
This pillar marks a site where the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain, under the leadership of Thráin, encamped during their exile.
This pillar marks a site where the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain, under the leadership of first Thráin then Thorin Oakenshield, finally settled during their exile.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Discover the dwarf-marker in Thorin's Hall

deed.name: The Long Road of the Hobbits
deed.description: It is said that the hobbits of the Shire originated east of the Misty Mountains and that after crossing the Misties, a family of Stoors settled in Enedwaith.

objective.text: Discover the campsites of the hobbit pioneers.

itemUsed.loreInfo: This lamp-post marks a place where the first hobbit pilgrims wandered through Enedwaith on their long journey to the Shire.
This lamp-post marks a place where the first hobbit pilgrims wandered through Enedwaith on their long journey to the Shire.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Discover the hobbit lamp-post near Echad Daervunn

itemUsed.loreInfo: This lamp-post marks a place where the first hobbit pilgrims wandered through Enedwaith on their long journey to the Shire.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Discover the hobbit lamp-post near Maur Tulhau

itemUsed.loreInfo: This statue was raised to commemorate Bullroarer Took's victory over Golfimbul and the invention of the game of golf.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Discover the hobbit lamp-post near the statue of the Bullroarer in the Shire

deed.name: Little Wonders
deed.description: While patrolling the Gloomglens, you were amazed to find items clearly belonging to hobbit-folk, however rustic.

objective.text: Find evidence of the Stoors who settled in Enedwaith.

enterDetection.loreInfo: This rough-hewn arrow either belonged to a small child or hobbit -- the make indicates a hobbit.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find a hobbit-arrow in the Gloomglens

enterDetection.loreInfo: These boots, while crude and rustic in design, are clearly of Stoor-make.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find hobbit-boots in the Gloomglens

enterDetection.loreInfo: This little bucket might have been the toy of a child, but if so the maker took great pains to make it labour-worthy.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find a hobbit-bucket in the Gloomglens

enterDetection.loreInfo: This skeleton is clear evidence that hobbits live or once-lived in the Gloomglens.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find a hobbit-skeleton in the Gloomglens

enterDetection.loreInfo: This mining pick is certainly an implement of hobbit-make.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find a hobbit-pick in the Gloomglens

enterDetection.loreInfo: Hobbits were once known as great archers, but now they are better known for gardening...this bow suggests that there are still hunters among them.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find a hobbit-bow in the Gloomglens

deed.name: Fisher-king
deed.description: While most of the Stoors of Maur Tulhau are master farmers and expert hunters, a few choose to make their living fishing.

objective.text: Discover the Fishing Hole.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Only a few even among the Stoors of Maur Tulhau know the location of this marvelous fishing hole.

deed.name: The Haunted Burrow
deed.description: The Haunted Burrow offers a wide array of activities.

questComplete.loreInfo: Normally, you should be proud of your conquest of a terrifying bear, but this time...maybe not so much.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Roaring Maw in the Haunted Burrow

questComplete.loreInfo: You have navigated the many wings and cellars of the Haunted Burrow with great speed and skill.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete A Race Through the Haunted Burrow

questComplete.loreInfo: In any situation but this, you should feel very brave for besting a ghost. It is a shame that it was only a silly hobbit.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Wailing in the Haunted Burrow

questComplete.loreInfo: You would be a hero to many lost and frightened hobbits...if only they were not so stubborn.
You are certainly very clever!
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete A Riddle in a Bottle

questComplete.loreInfo: How brave you were to face the menacing walking skeleton in the Haunted Burrow! Alas, it was only a little hobbit.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Rattling Bones in the Haunted Burrow

questComplete.loreInfo: You are an expert at finding missing valuables.

deed.name: Gwiber-slayer
deed.description: Defeat gwiber in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Gwiber infest the rocky crags of Thrórs Coomb. You have your work set before you.

deed.name: Gwiber-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many gwiber in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The gwiber which call Thrórs Coomb home cower in fear from your prowess.

deed.name: Giant-slayer
deed.description: Defeat giants in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Giants have made their home in the dwarf-ruins in Thrór's Coomb. You have your work set before you.

deed.name: Giant-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many giants in Enedwaith.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The giants which call Thrórs Coomb home cower in fear when your name is mentioned.

deed.name: Oppressors of Stoneheight
deed.description: The Gaunt-lord Ivar, aided by a band of sellswords, swept through the village of Stoneheight in his search for his helm. When his goals were reached, he abandoned the village to the mercy of the sellswords.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated Gundúl.

condition.loreInfo: You have defeated Búbhosh-grat.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have defeated Dale Truitt.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat Dale Truitt

deed.name: Saviour of Stoneheight
deed.description: The Gaunt-lord Ivar, aided by a band of sellswords, swept through the village of Stoneheight in his search for his helm. When his goals were reached, he abandoned the village to the mercy of the sellswords.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Oppressors of Stoneheight Deed.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Oppressors of Stoneheight Deed

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Challenger of Stoneheight Deed.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Challenger of Stoneheight Deed

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Stoneheight Deed.

deed.name: Challenger of Stoneheight
deed.description: The Gaunt-lord Ivar, aided by a band of sellswords, swept through the village of Stoneheight in his search for his helm. When his goals were reached, he abandoned the village to the mercy of the sellswords.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have defeated Búbhosh-grat, and Dale Truitt within the same moment.
questComplete.progressOverride: Defeat Búbhosh-grat, and Dale Truitt within 10 seconds of each other.

deed.name: Ivar's Champions
deed.description: There are many different ways to defeat Ivar and his Champions. Can you succesfully win the battle every way possible?

objective.text: Enter Ost Dunhoth.
Ivar and his Champions can be defeated in many combinations. Only the truest of heroes will succesfully complete them all.

deed.name: Mysterious Relics
deed.description: Mysterious relics of unknown origin have appeared throughout Middle-earth, but for what purpose?

objective.text: Mysterious relics have appeared throughout Middle-earth.

questComplete.loreInfo: A relic was placed in the middle of Bungo Grubb's pipe-weed field. The plants all died, ending his chance for a first-place finish in the annual festival.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth

questComplete.loreInfo: A relic was placed outside the cottage in which Ted and Burt Farmer were dwelling, and the cottage was set aflame. They escaped with their lives, but could not understand who would do this to them, or whence the relic came.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth

questComplete.loreInfo: A relic was left before the sealed door in the depths of the Laenan caves.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth

questComplete.loreInfo: The relic was left among the walls of the Ironspan that connects Forochel with the land of Angmar. The Lossoth believe it signals the return of the Witch-king.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth

questComplete.loreInfo: The relic was left among the slopes of Thrór's Coomb, and the creatures nearby, including the mighty gwiber, seemed hesitant to stray too near.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth

objective.text: Barliman Butterbur, proprietor of the Prancing Pony in Bree, knows all the latest gossip, and may have heard something about these mysterious relics.

npcTalk.loreInfo: Barliman has not heard news of the relics, but he has promised to keep his ears open and will let you know if he does.
npcTalk.progressOverride: Talk to Barliman Butterbur at The Prancing Pony Inn

deed.name: Discoverer of Ost Dunhoth
deed.description: Ost Dunhoth is an ancient Gondorian fortress in Enedwaith. The Gaunt-lord Gortheron has claimed it as the base of his power.

objective.text: Locate the entrance to Ost Dunhoth.

enterDetection.loreInfo: Ost Dunhoth is an ancient Gondorian fortress, corrupted by the Gaunt-lord Gortheron for his foul and dark uses.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Locate the entrance to Ost Dunhoth

deed.name: Lost Temple: Ferndúr's Defeat
deed.description:
Beneath the lost Rhudaran temple in the Trollshaws, the Gaunt-lord Ferndúr creates a deadly plague to decimate the people of the north.
You must defeat him before it can be unleashed.

objective.text: Discover the entrance to the Lost Temple
To earn this deed, you must defeat Ferndúr the Virulent.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated Ferndúr the Virulent

deed.name: Lost Temple: One Ill Turn....
deed.description:
The grounds of the Lost Temple are being desecrated by mercenaries working for Ferndúr the Virulent.
The illness the mercenaries have contracted will soon be the end of them, but it would be best if you defeat them and ensure a quick and painless end to their suffering before they spread this dangerous illness beyond the temple's bounds.

objective.text: Discover the entrance to the Lost Temple
To earn this deed you must defeat many of the sellswords who are attempting to loot the Lost Temple.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The sellswords and brigands looting the ruins of the Lost Temple fear your wrath.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat brigands in the Lost Temple

deed.name: Lost Temple: Clean Sweep
deed.description:
Beneath the lost Rhudaur temple in the Trollshaws, the Gaunt-lord Ferndúr creates a deadly plague to decimate the people of the north.
You must destroy all the infected corpses in his chamber before destroying the Gaunt-lord himself to ensure that his plague is completely eliminated.

objective.text: Discover the entrance to the Lost Temple
To earn this deed, you must destroy all the corpses in Ferndúr's chamber before defeating the Gaunt-lord himself.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have destroyed all the corpses in Ferndúr's chamber and ended Ferndúr's schemes.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Destroy all the corpses in Ferndúr's chamber, then defeat Ferndúr

deed.name: Lost Temple: The Sick and the Dead
deed.description:
The sellswords foolish enough to follow Ferndúr into the depths of the Lost Temple have succumbed to disease or have been slaughtered by the Gaunt-lord himself. Now spirits of plague have possessed their corpses and stalk the crypts, preparing to unleash pestilence and death upon the North.
You must destroy as many of them as you can before they escape to spread Ferndúr's deadly plague.

objective.text: Discover the entrance to the Lost Temple
To earn this deed, you must defeat many of the wights who stalk the crypts beneath the Lost Temple.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated many wights within the crypts of the Lost Temple.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat wights within the crypts of the Lost Temple

deed.name: Lost Temple: Synchronized Slaughter
deed.description:
The entrance to the crypts beneath the Lost Temple is guarded by a pair of powerful Angmarim. Brother and sister, Angaidh and Sidhág complement each other in battle, wielding both spell and blade with dark power.
To earn this deed, both siblings must fall within ten seconds of each other.

objective.text: Discover the entrance to the Lost Temple
To earn this deed, you must defeat Angaidh and Sidhág within 10 seconds of each other.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have defeated Angaidh and Sidhág within ten seconds of each other.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Defeat Angaidh and Sidhág within ten seconds of each other

deed.name: Thadúr's Plans Foiled
deed.description: Within the abandoned Northcotton Farm, Thadúr has created a powerful poison known as Darkthorn. Thadúr plans to unleash his poison on the unsuspecting hobbit-folk. You must foil his plans and defeat him before the poison can be unleashed.

objective.text: To earn this deed, you must defeat Legbarthil the Spider, Úmheryn the vile cauldron, and Thadúr the Ravager.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have defeated Thadúr, his lieutenants, and foiled his plans.

objective.text: To earn this deed, you must defeat Legbarthil the Spider, Úmheryn the vile cauldron, and Thadúr the Ravager.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated the spider Legbarthril at the Northcotton Farm in the Shire.
You have destroyed the vile cauldron Úmheryn at the Northcotton Farm in the Shire.
You have defeated the Gaunt-lord Thadúr the Ravager at the Northcotton Farm in the Shire.

deed.name: The Cleansing of Darkthorn
deed.description:
Darkthorn is a horrible poison brewed by Thadúr the Ravager within the Northcotton Farm. By allowing Úmheryn, the vile cauldron, to boil over while destroying it, you will destroy any trace of this horrific poison.
<rgb=#FF0000>This deed can only be completed on Tier 2 difficulty.</rgb>

questComplete.loreInfo: You have destroyed Úmheryn while the flames beneath it go unquenched.
questComplete.progressOverride: Avoid quenching the fire beneath Úmheryn while destroying the cauldron

deed.name: Champion of the Northcotton Farm
deed.description: Within the quiet confines of the Northcotton Farm, Thadúr the Ravager has begun his quest to defile the Shire. In a time of peril, the Shire was in need of a hero, and you sought out Thadúr and defeated him at every turn.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Thadúr's Plans Foiled Deed.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Thadúr's Plans Foiled Deed

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Cleansing of Darkthorn Deed.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Cleansing of Darkthorn Deed

deed.name: Frost Fight
deed.description:
Sâri-surma is a place filled with many wights and many other strange things. Complete the challenge, defeat all of the lieutenants, guardians, and bosses. Then and only then will your reward be great.
This deed is only completeable in the Tier 2 Legendary difficulty of this instance.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Challenge Mode for Sâri-surma
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the Challenge Mode for Sâri-surma (Tier 2 only)

deed.name: King of the Mountain
deed.description: Sâri-surma is a place filled with many wights and many strange things. Quickly defeat all of the bosses.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have defeated all of the bosses in Sâri-surma
questComplete.progressOverride: Defeat all of the bosses in Sâri-surma

deed.name: Atop the Glacial Throne
deed.description: You have done everything there is to do on top of Sâri-surma. You are now king of the icy world.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the King of the Mountain Deed
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the King of the Mountain Deed

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Frost Fight Deed

deed.name: Facing Your Fears
deed.description: You have become ensnared in the Halls of Night and must defeat Nightmare and his lieutenants before it is too late.

objective.text: To earn this deed you must defeat Terror, Panic, and Nightmare.

enterDetection.loreInfo: Defeat Nightmare, his lieutenants, and escape the Halls of Night.

objective.text: To earn this deed you must defeat Terror, Panic, and Nightmare.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated the fell spirit Terror in the Halls of Night.
You have defeated the fell spirit Panic in the Halls of Night.
You have destroyed the sorcerer Nightmare in the Halls of Night.

deed.name: Raising Spirits
deed.description: Nightmare has corrupted countless adventurers, sapping their strength to weaken their resolve. When Nightmare attempts to weaken your spirit, steel your will and fight through. Defeat him without harming any of the tortured spirits.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have defeated Nightmare without harming any of the tortured spirits trapped in the Halls of Night.

deed.name: Champion of the Halls of Night
deed.description: You have become ensnared in the Halls of Night and must defeat Nightmare and his lieutenants before it is too late.

objective.text: Discover the Halls of Night.
Complete the following deeds within the Halls of Night: Facing Your Fears and Raising Spirits.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have completed the Facing Your Fears Deed.
You have completed the Raising Spirits Deed.

deed.name: Discovery: Lost Temple
deed.description: You have discovered the entrance the the lost Rhudauran Temple of Kings.

objective.text: To earn this deed, you must discover the entrance to the Lost Temple.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the entrance to the Lost Temple
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the entrance to the Lost Temple

deed.name: The Battle of the Twenty-first Hall
deed.description: The Twenty-first Hall of Moria is vital to the success of the Iron Garrison's expedition to reclaim Khazad-dûm.

objective.text: Complete everything in the Battle of the Twenty-first Hall Skirmish

monsterDied.loreInfo: Swangeir Goldstealer is a Dourhand thief who infiltrated the Iron Garrison's expedition, but was discovered and escaped into the vast halls of Moria.
Morûrz-kala is a cave-troll in service to Mazog. He has been tasked with destroying the Iron Garrison's armouries throughout Moria.
Kalus is among the finest archers of Mazog's horde. Many dwarves have fallen to his bow.
Little escapes the notice of Throqûm, one of Mazog's most trusted scouts. Wherever he goes, death follows.
Fodhroval and his chittering pets wander the halls of Moria, outcast from the morroval-tribes which haunt Jazargund.
Many dark creatures dwell in the deep places of the world, not the least of which is the creature known as the Shadow from the Heart of the World.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat the Shadow from the Heart of the World

monsterDied.loreInfo: Helchnaeth, a fearsome Frost-worm, has wandered into Moria from the slopes of Zirakzigil in search of fodder for her brood.

condition.loreInfo: Goblin thieves will find any means they can of breaking into the vaults of the Iron Garrison and claiming their treasure for Mazog.

deed.name: The Battle of the Deep-way
deed.description: The Deep-way lies upon a hidden passage between the Water-works and the Great Delving. The Iron Garrison uses this passage as a major store-house.

objective.text: Complete everything in the Battle of the Deep-way Skirmish

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many creatures wander into the Deep-way from the Water-works, including the glass-spider Lhenathronil, who has built a nest in a dark corner of the passage.
Gâmûrz-ash is only one of many of the mysterious, fungus-infested Orcs known as the Globsnaga who have begun appearing in the deep and dank places of Moria.
The deep-claw Earthbreaker tunnelled long from the Great Delving to find the passage known as the Deep-way.
Forktongue and her brood are among the denizens of the Water-works which have wandered into the Deep-way.
The glow-worm Foulscum has crept into the Deep-way to spin her nest. An infestation of glow-worms could wreak havoc upon the store-house of the dwarves.
Gredbyg have infested and overrun many parts of the Great Delving and have now begun to spill into the Deep-way.
Salamanders are a vicious, though fairly insipid draconic breed. Burntail is quite average for his kind.
The Mad Croaker is one of the toads which infest the Water-works...what madness caused the creature to wander into the Deep-way is unknown.

deed.name: The Battle of the Way of Smiths
deed.description: The Way of Smiths bridges the caverns between the Redhorn Lode and the Silverdeep. Within lies the famed forge of the dwarves known as the Heart of Fire.

objective.text: Complete everything in the Battle of the Way of Smiths Skirmish

monsterDied.loreInfo: Durin's Bane commanded many fell things in the depths of Moria, and since his defeat, spirits such as Fire-heart have begun to establish their own authority.
Durin's Bane commanded many fell things in the depths of Moria, and since his defeat, spirits such as Ice-heart have begun to establish their own authority.
Durin's Bane commanded many fell things in the depths of Moria, and since his defeat, spirits such as Shadow-heart have begun to establish their own authority.
The mighty drake Celebarch has made her lair beneath the Heart of Fire, building a nest in which to nurture her young brood.
Fikûhom serves the Wizard Saruman with utter devotion and seeks to prove his worthiness to his master by claiming Moria for the White Hand...alone.
The spider Durbrennil hunts for prey to nourish her brood within the caverns of the Way of Smiths.
The nearly mindless Cave-troll Sadâuk wanders the halls of the Way of Smiths, maddened by the fungal plague that has stricken the creatures now known as Globsnaga.

title.name: Defender of the Heart of Fire

deed.name: Discover the Halls of Night
deed.description: You have discovered the Halls of Night.

objective.text: You have discovered the Halls of Night.

enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Halls of Night

deed.name: Cartographile -- Moria
deed.description: A fine collection of maps is a feather in the cap of any true adventurer. The maps of Moria, once collected, will allow you to be known to all as such an adventurer.

objective.text: Obtain the maps of Moria

inventoryItem.loreInfo: Also called Hollin Gate, this map shows the area surrounding the entrance to Moria.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Walls of Moria
inventoryItem.itemName: Map of The Walls of Moria

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This is a map of the area of Moria that the dwarves call the Silvertine Lodes.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Silvertine Lodes

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This map shows the main thoroughfare of Moria, also called Durin's Way.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of Durin's Way

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This map of the Water-works of Moria shows the ancient and now flooded sections of the great area of the deep realm.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Water-works

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This map highlights the area of Moria known as Zelem-melek
This map highlights the important locations of the area know as Nud-melek in Moria.
This map details the location know as the Foundations of Stone within Moria.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain a map of the Foundations of Stone
inventoryItem.itemName: Map of the Foundations of Stone

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This map highlights the important locations of the area known as the Redhorn Lodes in Moria.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain a map of the Redhorn Lodes

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This map shows a location on the side of the mountains outside of Moria.
This map highlights the important locations of the areas known as the Flaming Deeps in Moria.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain a map of the Flaming Deeps

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This map details a location that was once a major crossing of passages in Moria; now, it is home to the many factions of goblin-kinds in the depths.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain a map of the Grand Stair

deed.name: Cartographile -- Eriador
deed.description: A well-travelled adventurer has nearly all the maps of the lands where they travel. You must obtain all the maps that outline the areas of Eriador.

objective.text: Obtain the maps of Eriador

inventoryItem.loreInfo: The Old Forest is a place best avoided as the dangers there can be found around every corner. You have obtained a copy of a map of the Old Forest.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Old Forest

inventoryItem.loreInfo: A small village in Bree, Archet recently was burned by the Blackwold brigands. You have acquired a map of the town and surrounding areas.
Bree-town is the main city of Bree-land. Such famous places as Inn of the Prancing Pony and the Boar Fountain are found within the city. You have found a wonderful map of Bree-town.
Once the home of the Kings of Men, Annúminas is now a flooded city on the southern bank of Lake Evendim in the region of Evendim. This is the map of the city.
The Ettenmoors is a forgotten area of the world where evil has crept into nearly every part of the land. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Ettenmoors

inventoryItem.loreInfo: The Men of Bree try to steer clear of the old burial mounds of the Men of Cardolan, for it is rumoured that terrifying creatures come out of the ground to stalk those among the mounds. This is a map of the northern part of the Barrow-downs.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Northern Barrow-downs

inventoryItem.loreInfo: Rivendell is the hidden valley where the Elves dwell on the border of the Misty Mountains and the Trollshaws. This is a map of that valley.
Eregion was a home to the Elves in ages past; now, ruins cover a harsh landscape. This is a map of that land.
A section of land leading south between Eregion and Dunland, Enedwaith is a harsh land of stone and wild. This is a map of the region.
This small community of dwarves rests in the shadow of Thorin's Hall. This is a map of that area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of Thorin's Gate

inventoryItem.loreInfo: A cold and forbidding land claimed by the Lossoth, Forochel lies far to the north. This is a map of those frozen lands.
A town of rich and poor needing assistance in the wintry months. This is a map of the town.
The southern section of the Barrow-downs houses more ruins and mounds of ancient Men. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Southern Barrow-downs

inventoryItem.loreInfo: A fertile land where many Men make their homes. This is a map of the area.
A place which most hobbits call home. The Shire is a collection of many smaller territories that make up the large land belonging to the hobbit-folk. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Shire

inventoryItem.loreInfo: Ered Luin is home to both Elves and dwarves, and each is none too fond of mixing with the other. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of Ered Luin

inventoryItem.loreInfo: The Lone-lands is a lonely stretch heading east through the ruins of Men. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Lone-lands

inventoryItem.loreInfo: War has come to the Men of the North Downs, and they are in need of aid. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the map of the North Downs

inventoryItem.loreInfo: The land here is forbidding and grim with trolls wandering through the wild lands day and night. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Trollshaws

inventoryItem.loreInfo: Cold wind and the bite of goblin-wrought blades await travellers in the Misty Mountains. This is a map of the area.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: Obtain the Map of the Misty Mountains

inventoryItem.loreInfo: The harsh land where the Witch-king once ruled. Now, the land is ruined and evil spreads freely and nearly unchecked. This is a map of the area.

deed.name: The Journal of Captain Rabghul
deed.description:
Beneath The Forsaken Inn stretches an expanse of natural caverns. It seems that people lived here at one time. One such person, the apparent leader of the group, left behind a journal. Who were these people, and what were they doing here? Collect all the pages and discover for yourself.
Note: Not all journal pages can be found in Tier 1 difficulty.

objective.text: Captain Rabghul has not made it easy to locate the pages of his journal. He has left some of them in hidden areas where only a well-balanced party may venture.

deed.name: Lhaid Ogo Exploration
deed.description: You have entered Lhaid Ogo, a series of tunnels beneath the Lich Bluffs. The passages are clogged with mud and feel quite unstable.

objective.text: Lhaid Ogo is a mysterious place. Who knows what you might find down here?

enterDetection.loreInfo: Lhaid Ogo is a series of tunnels beneath the Lich Bluffs, in Enedwaith. Its passages are clogged with mud and not entirely stable.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Delve into Lhaid Ogo and unravel its mysteries

objective.text: The winding passages of Lhaid Ogo are clogged with mud, and its layout seems to shift as if on a whim.

enterDetection.loreInfo: Trapped behind a wooden wall in the depths of Lhaid Ogo, you found the body of an ancient unfortunate. Did he die there in the wall or was he moved to that spot to languish for all the ages?
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the ancient, unlucky explorer

enterDetection.loreInfo: The wooden bridge was of ancient construction, but the damp rotted some of the railings away. The gap could then be used to drop down to the lower passage, but it would be a one-way journey.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the gap in the bridge

itemTalk.loreInfo: The discarded pouch within Lhaid Ogo was filled with small, bird-like bones, stripped of their meat. Tooth-marks on the bones revealed that someone or something had been gnawing on the collection.

enterDetection.loreInfo: Someone was eating a rat in the depths of Lhaid Ogo, but who? And what caused him not to finish it?
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the unfinished dinner

enterDetection.loreInfo: Mud-eater has stalked the passages of Lhaid Ogo for many years and makes his lair in the deepest chamber. He drags prey back to his lair before feasting on it.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find Mud-eater's lair

enterDetection.loreInfo: Deep within Lhaid Ogo, you found signs of something heavy being dragged up a muddy slope, and it filled your heart with worry.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Find the disturbed earthen slope

deed.name: The Perfect Fellowship
deed.description:
The caverns below The Forsaken Inn are filled with all manner of objects and dangers requiring the expertise of a wide range of classes.

deed.description: The necklace by itself is just a necklace, but the spirit surrounding it makes it special. This spirit will stop at nothing to escape its prison and find a new host. You must put it to rest once and for all.

deed.name: The Icy Crevasse
deed.description: Angmar is attempting to send a blizzard from the frozen lands of Forochel down into the waters of Evendim.

objective.text: Complete all encounters at the Icy Crevasse.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The force of a blizzard compacted into a small mobile form, frost grims often terrified the Lossoth.
This powerful mammoth has trampled hundreds beneath his feet.
The sharpest teeth and claws belong to the alpha male of the sabre-tooth pack.
The worms of Forochel may live on the glaciers, but they breathe hot fire.
A powerful Guaradan shaman, Crantok was in line to lead the tribe.
A rare drake in the frozen north, Túgarch terrorizes from the skies.
Terrors live in the snowy hills of Forochel. Ones that take children at night and feast on their bones.
Bears in the frozen north will fight to the death for a meal.

deed.name: Attack at Dawn
deed.description: Late in the night, a party of goblin-scouts discovered the location of the Ranger-refuge known as Esteldín. The goblins have fled to Dol Dínen, where you must dispatch them before they can bring reinforcements.

objective.text: Complete all encounters during the Attack at Dawn.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Despite its size, the vicious creature known as Tharb has defeated many would-be heroes near Dol Dínen.
Pugh has long been a scourge to the Free Peoples near Dol Dínen.
This elusive boggart has been a thorn in the side of the Rangers in the North Downs.
This foul half-orc has defeated many would-be heroes.
This fearsome Orc had fled from Moria and now serves Graug near Dol Dínen.
The fearsome Gorthorog Kaushar has slaughtered many adventurers in the North Downs.

deed.name: Riddles Beneath the Inn
deed.description: The runed doors beneath the Forsaken Inn display a random assortment of riddles. Are you clever enough to solve them all?

objective.text: You or a member of your party must solve each riddle inscription at least once.

condition.loreInfo: My home is dark caves where colour lacks, Distant sounds and slight odours are where I come back. I am found in the hearts of all cowardly Men. I will make you fall down and damage your chin.
Listening to me will bring visions to mind, Of dragons and castles and kingdoms declined. Am I fact or just fancy? It is up for debate. But one thing is for certain: I am unlikely sedate.
I am the word that all men dread most, For when said by a woman, to their friends they shant boast.
A meaningless montage of muttering mum, Close your mouth to speak, and out I shall come.

On a face, I say much, without even speaking, I am useful for searching and watching and seeking. Use me well, and there is naught you will not find, Do not use me at all, and alas, you are just blind.
I am the black child of a white father, A wingless bird flying to heaven. I birth tears of sorrow in pupils that meet me, And at once on my birth, I vanish like a spark.

Some do me to be social, still others for fun. I am not just the action, but the object as well. I make your feet sore, but still do you stomp me. Only that which can stop me is the sound of the bell.
In people, I am scorned. In structures, I am feared. In sounds, I am harsh. But in strength, I am king.
I make you weak at the worst of all times. I keep you safe, I keep you fine. I make your hands sweat and your heart grow cold. I visit the weak, but seldom the bold.
Use me on your belly, then follow by toasting, Use me on your back, and clearly you are boasting.
A biting insult can be defended, By a simple gesture of indifference.
My colour is white, my hope all but vanished. Let those that see spare me, or perhaps just banished.
I am a mirror of the truth. I am used for ridicule and derisiveness. I am a fake, a charlatan. But I can also be constructive.
Only the penitent man shall pass.
I come bearing news of impending disaster. No one is immune to my heart cloaking plaster. I destroy lives both great and small. When I overcome you, I fear you may bawl.
I am the ocean during a terrible storm. I gain strength from fights and heated words. My greatest enemy is calm.
I say much, but have no mouth, Bringing words of hatred or love to those that I meet. Children are scolded for letting me take hold, But all shall succumb whether young or old.
I am heard in battles of all shapes and sizes. I emerge from all things who dislike surprises. Children all over use me as a tool, To get what they want, make their parents the fool.
Through tears and through pain, they utter my name, Whether through anger or sadness or unbearable shame.
No matter how much you feel me, do not show me, Because when someone else sees me, Their slowness will not accept me.
Once you say my name, You will not see me Until we meet again.
Four brothers live peacefully together as one, Two of them swinging, while two of them run. If their roles were to switch, what chaos ensues, For those on the ground now have no shoes!
I am spoken of often, but never directly, Simply speaking my name shows your gratitude correctly.
I am the sound of happy birds. If you wish to hear me, Simply put your lips together… And blow.
Two milky-white fields on either side of a mountain Suddenly turn red as if fueled by a fountain.
I am a casual word with the purpose of play. Men use me, abuse me, then throw me away. A woman may blush at the feel of my touch, But I am just words. Do not think of me much.
Hotter than dragon's fire am I, Yet colder than the winds of the north. The poor man has much of me, The rich man wants for me, And those who dine on me must die.
I am the place that all refer to, but none may head, For when you have passed inside me, you are already dead.
I am the tool of poor and the hungry alike, But those that are asked are sure to dislike.
A terrible mass of pain you must swallow. When diplomacy fails, 'tis I who will follow.
An affectionate feeling I always do bring, For when you feel me, to me you will cling.
When I take hold, men may dream or stamp their feet, Women may laugh or sometimes weep.
I overcome you like a terrible drought, A shroud that covers you inside and out. You show me to friends as they come to be fed, But the one I am meant for is already dead.
Always a helping hand am I, Use me and aid your greatest ally.
I corrupt your thoughts, your manners and actions. When I take hold of people, they are assured a reaction. You may think me anxious or odd or insane, And in fact I am all and cannot explain.
Forgetful Francis Foresby was tired as can be, But alas he had forgotten what to do next. He marched off to bed and began counting sheep, But what must he do before he can sleep?

I am an expression of mirth and of merriment and pleasure, I can be shared with others, or alone at your leisure. Should you use me with others, I have only one plea: Please use me with them, not at them you see.
I am in the middle Of every great riddle When the one being riddled Would rather be fiddled.
I hatch eggs, look after of children. Never moving, always still.
I weaken all men for hours each day. I show you strange visions while you are away. I take you by night, by day take you back, None suffer to have me, but do from my lack.
Thirty white horses on a red hill, First they champ, Then they stamp, Then they stand still.
I measure in time, but also in tension; I am the last bit of track before your ascension.
I am a tool of deadly precision, As well as a ribbon of looping division. I am part of a ship, but that is not all. Bend over to spy me, but please do not fall.
I am an opinion that spreads across boundaries, An undulating current, An army marching towards its aim. I am hot or sometimes cold, A signal delivered by hand.
I travel inside of a bitter wind, Make my way down your spine and demand that you bend.
I betray the thoughts of women and men, Their yearning and sorrow sounding time and again.
Two workers live separately, But sometimes do meet. When they meet quickly, A great sound they excrete.
I am required for every good painting, But I may only be a wolf in sheep's clothing.
Do it to my belly and watch me chuckle, Do it to my eye and taste my knuckle.
An unwelcome guest, from your mouth I will be seeping. I may sneak out at night while you are happily sleeping.
When one makes preparations, I am always what they seek, If one does not have me, they will surely be weak.
When found in the ocean, I am a sailor's best friend. When found in a man, he be one to befriend. You may think me grand no matter my wallow, But be I in sky, a storm might then follow.
Total submission is what I require, Say my name, and you shall have your peace.
I am a respectful act in certain situations, Formally executed before important operations. A soldier's greatest honour am I, With no greater use than the day that he dies.
I bring great joy to all whom I meet, And the happier they are, The more I will repeat.
Use me on yourself, and you are acting rudely. Use me on others, and you are being choosy.
I am a duty entrusted, Or a currency demanded, An accusation of guilt, Or a rushing blow landed.
The only thing that can match my piercing sound, Is the feeling of my terrible blow.
A terrible force of nature am I, Flowing and soaking all I pass by. If I get cool, I may start to waver, But even in death I leave you my flavour.
I kill Men every day in their homes, But all Men require me to live. I am small enough to fit in a glass, Yet large enough to drown you.
Two brothers live in two houses On opposite sides of the hill. One brother shuts then opens his blinds, While the other brother stays still.
I am the sound that many are releasing, Ever loud, never ceasing. Made by Man and nature alike, My sound warns all of an impending strike.
To the ears, I sound like a constant grating. To the eyes, I appear as a simple scrawl. Your skin desires me, All things start from me.
A sparkling gem falls forth from the watchtower. When it reaches the ground, for an instant it is a flower.
An unappreciative gesture am I. With my yelling and pointing, you are liable to cry.
Sleep is the thing to which I must succumb. Open your mouth, and out I come.
I am shared by many. Sometimes I am up. Sometimes I am down. Sometimes I am over. Sometimes I am out. Sometimes I am at you, Or behind your back. And often I am cheap.
Once I am uttered, I demand you an answer. Be it ‘yes’, may you lose, and your soul be devoured, Be it ‘no’, best you run! You are surely a coward.
If you do me to others, you are being a pain. If done to yourself, you should not complain.
Up and down, I carry my host. My number of times shall be what he boasts.
A girl is taught to use me from youth, When meeting a man, to refuse is uncouth.
Where I go, often illness will follow me, Simply open your mouth and try not to swallow me.
I show the way when directions prove confusing, keep track of the winner and who is losing. I am the business end of a sharpened knife. Men seek my existence in their daily life.
I am an action of luck if used on a coin. I am sudden and jerky and seldom adjoin. A man may perform me if he be athletic, But if he were to fall, I shall not be sympathetic.
I am the moment that never comes, Idle time wasted. When my time has elapsed, I cease to exist.
I am that gesture which Can silently summon you To my master's side.
A simple word to say am I, Without me, kiss yourself good-bye.
A rumbling growl if ever I was, I don't want to be here, and that is my cause. If you were to hear me, though my sound be not quaint, You have nothing to fear, ‘tis my master's complaint.
I am just two and two. I am hot. I am cold. I am the parent of numbers that cannot be told. I am a gift beyond measure, a matter of course, And I am yielded with pleasure—then taken by force.
You are using me always day in and day out. Sometimes for better. Sometimes for fitness. Sometimes twice. Or even for nothing.
A cheerful salute or an icy shower be I, If you shout my name out, thy friends shall not say bye.
I am a child and a simpleton at once. All Men are born with me, But few possess me at their death.
Five pointers make I, Of all different sizes, When they all come together, A weapon it comprises.

deed.name: One Thing Drives Out Another
deed.description: Barliman Butterbur had a letter to send you, but he misplaced it. One thing drives out another, after all! Now that he has remembered, he hopes his oversight will not cause trouble.

objective.text: Barliman Butterbur hopes his oversight will not cause trouble.

level.loreInfo: Barliman Butterbur has a habit of misplacing important messages, and only recently remembered he had one such message for you.

deed.name: Cave-claw Wrangler
deed.description:
Cave-claws have long assisted miners in discovering the greatest of treasures.
This deed can only be advanced with Domesticated Cave-claws.

objective.text:
A true miner shows his appreciation to those who help him, even if they are small and tend to bite.
This deed can only be advanced with Domesticated Cave-claws.
