deed.name: Dunlending-slayer
deed.description: The evil Men of Dunland exist to give a bad reputation to the folk of these lands, good and bad alike.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many Dunlendings have chosen to heed Saruman's promises of revenge against Rohan.

deed.name: Beast-slayer
deed.description: The wild creatures of Dunland pose a great threat to the people who try to survive in these harsh lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have proven a great hunter of beasts in the eyes of the Dunlendings.

deed.name: Uruk-hai Slayer
deed.description: The mighty Uruk-hai are loyal only to Saruman. They are more clever and cruel than even the vile Orcs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Uruk-hai that roam the lands of Dunland and the Gap of Rohan are servants of Isengard alone, carrying out the will of Saruman with deadly precision.

deed.name: Half-orc Slayer
deed.description: The half-orcs in Dunland all hail from Isengard, where they strive to carry out Saruman's plan to oppress his neighbours.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The origins of the half-orcs are many, but one truth remains constant: they are evil.

deed.name: Orc-slayer
deed.description: Orcs are always evil, no matter whom they serve. The Orcs of Isengard are no better than those who come from Mordor.

objective.text: Defeat many Orcs in Dunland

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orcs of the White Hand march through Dunland unhindered, which begs the question: Why do the Dunlendings suffer them?

deed.name: Warg-slayer
deed.description: Wargs hunt and howl in greater numbers as the shadows of evil stretch their dark fingers across all of Middle-earth.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Though Morgoth and Sauron were responsible for bringing the Wargs into being, Saruman has not hesitated to put the fell-beasts to his own uses.

deed.name: Craban-slayer
deed.description: Spying crebain serve Saruman as loyally as Orcs and Men, bearing messages to and fro, giving Isengard an advantage in the coming war.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have slain enough crebain to make a coat of their feathers.

deed.name: Slayer of the Dead
deed.description: It is an evil sign when the Dead wake from their long slumber to walk the earth again.

monsterDied.loreInfo: What dark power has caused the Dead to walk again? Whatever creature summoned them forth, it is certain that the Dark Lord had no small part in it.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer
deed.description: Wherever war and violence lash out, goblins are there to cackle while they reap the plunder from the chaos.

monsterDied.loreInfo: From bugan to the Nâkhmau, goblins have started to pour out of the Misty Mountains into Dunland.

deed.name: Dunlending-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The evil Men of Dunland exist to give a bad reputation to the folk of these lands, good and bad alike.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The servants of Saruman quake at the mention of your name.

deed.name: Beast-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The wild creatures of Dunland pose a great threat to the people who try to survive in these harsh lands.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You must be careful not to purge the wilds of Dunland of the game that helps sustain the Dunlendings.

deed.name: Uruk-hai Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The mighty Uruk-hai are loyal only to Saruman. They are more clever and cruel than even the vile Orcs.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Uruk-hai that roam the lands of Dunland and the Gap of Rohan are servants of Isengard alone, carrying out the will of Saruman with deathly precision.

deed.name: Half-orc Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The half-orcs in Dunland all hail from Isengard, where they strive to carry out Saruman's plan to oppress his neighbours.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Saruman's half-orcs are loyal... as long as their foes are weaker than they are!

deed.name: Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Orcs are always evil, no matter whom they serve. The Orcs of Isengard are no better than those who come from Mordor.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Orcs of the White Hand cannot hope to oppose your might.

deed.name: Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Wargs hunt and howl in greater numbers as the shadows of evil stretch their dark fingers across all of Middle-earth.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The hounds of Saruman have been made to suffer at your hand.

deed.name: Craban-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Spying crebain serve Saruman as loyally as Orcs and Men, bearing messages to and fro, giving Isengard an advantage in the coming war.

questComplete.loreInfo: Saruman's spy network has been drastically reduced at your hand.

deed.name: Slayer of the Dead (Advanced)
deed.description: It is an evil sign when the Dead wake from their long slumber to walk the earth again.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Many of the walking Dead have been put to rest once more by your hand.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Wherever war and violence lash out, goblins are there to cackle while they reap the plunder from the chaos.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Whether in service to the White Hand or simply terrorizing the Dunlending people, the goblins in Dunland have suffered terrible losses at your hand.

deed.name: Exploring Trum Dreng
deed.description: Trum Dreng, home of the Stag-clan, has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Dire Hollow is a den of evil wolves which plague the people of Lhan Tarren.
These wide fields are used by the Caru-lûth, Stag-clan, as grazing lands for their herds of oxen.
Lhan Tarren is home to the Caru-lûth, Stag-clan, a dwindling people in Dunland.
The North Pass leads from Trum Dreng into the Mournshaws of Enedwaith.
This old tower once served as a watch-post for the folk of Trum Dreng.
This encampment houses many half-orcs in service to the White Hand of Isengard.

deed.name: Exploring Pren Gwydh
deed.description: Pren Gwydh, home of the city of Galtrev, has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Fanged Lair is the den of a pack of evil wolves which prowl Pren Gwydh.
This is the den of Old Bloodtusk, a boar who is said to have migrated all the way from Archet in Bree-land.
This lumber-camp is worked by the people of Galtrev, the closest thing to a bustling social centre in Dunland.
The Draig-lûth, Dragon-clan, established this encampment to harry the peoples of Galtrev.
A pack of Wargs has established this den from whence to harry the enemies of the White Hand.
Rook, a former craban-keeper for Saruman, is a Bree-land native who aspires to become a great wizard...an unattainable goal he yet fails to grasp.

deed.name: Exploring Carreglyn
deed.description: Carreglyn has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Lower Barnavon is the district of the village of Barnavon where the remnant of the Turch-lûth, the Boar-clan, now dwell.
Upper Barnavon is the district of the village of Barnavon inhabited by the ruling Uch-lûth, Ox-clan.
Naur-maudhûl is an encampment of goblins and Wargs established to allow Saruman's Nákhmau scouts access to Carreglyn.
This mine, currently being worked in the name of Saruman the White, has been overrun by vicious bugan.
This watch-tower was built atop the ruins of an ancient Gondorian tower.
This pond is rumoured to be the home of the Great Avanc, a creature of Dunlending legend.
This shrine was erected by the Uch-lûth long ago as a place to commune with Munfaeril, a spirit of ancient days worshipped as the Uch-gwirod, the Ox-spirit, by the people of Barnavon.

deed.name: Exploring the Gravenwood
deed.description: The Gravenwood has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This great, rune-marked tree is the place where a Dunlending hero of old sacrificed himself to hold off the advance of his people's enemies.
This rune-marked tree is a place where the Dunlendings once mustered their forces to battle against Gondor and Rohan.
This camp was established by Théodred, Prince of Rohan, and his party of scouts to watch the movements of the Dunlending forces.
This slade of three rune-marked trees houses the Dutegelh, a relic of great power wrested from Dol Guldur when the White Council drove forth the Necromancer.
The Draig-lûth, Dragon-clan, established this temporary encampment on their journey south out of Enedwaith to Wulf's Cleft.
The Uch-lûth, Ox-clan, established this temporary encampment on their journey from Barnavon to Wulf's Cleft.
Orcs of the White Hand established this camp to clear-cut the Gravenwood to supply wood for their master's war-efforts.

deed.name: Exploring Starkmoor
deed.description: Starkmoor has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Avardin is a trading post and village of the Uch-lûth, Ox-clan, in the Starkmoor.
Flam-cadlus is an encampment of the Draig-lûth, Dragon-clan, in the Starkmoor.
This is the home of the merchant Andras, to whom you have lent aid in a time of need.
The Hound's Rest is so named because the Wargs of the Enemy like to sun upon the rock.
The Culling Pit is an arena where Dunlending warriors are trained -- or trimmed -- and merchants wager on the battles.
The Overlook gives a vantage of the great valley of Wulf's Cleft, where warriors from across Dunland muster to invade Rohan.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Find the Overlook of Wulf's Cleft

deed.name: Exploring the Heathfells
deed.description: The Heathfells have many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This is the encampment of Grimbold of the Grimslade, one of the Horse-lords of Rohan.
This great hill is of strategic interest to both the Rohirrim and the White Hand.
This contested encampment is where Théodred's forces have fortified to block approach both by the southern road, and up the River Isen.
The Pit of Iron is a great mine beneath Isengard where the Orcs and their prisoners extract ore for use in making weapons for the White Hand.
These cells are where the prisoners of Isengard are housed.
This is where the iron-ore drawn from the Pit of Iron is smelted for use.
This is one of the mines that makes up the Pit of Iron.

deed.name: Exploring Nan Curunír
deed.description: Nan Curunír has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: These gates bar the passage through the Ring of Isengard to Orthanc beyond.
This gruesome pillar points the way to Orthanc, the stronghold of Saruman the White.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Find the Pillar of the White Hand
landmarkDetection.landmarkName: The Pillar of the White Hand

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This goblin-encampment is also home to many Warg-riders.
This stronghold houses many Uruk-hai in service to the White Hand.
This grove is the home of the Ent Bregalad, also called Quickbeam.
The Ranger Dagoras established this camp to keep an eye on Nan Curunír and the Vale of Isengard.

deed.name: Exploring the Bonevales
deed.description: The Bonevales has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Bone Quarry is an old stone-quarry in the Bonevales where the Dievlig have erected many cairns.
This massive cairn is the central tomb of all the Dievlig's leaders.
This is where the Ranger Naeglanc and his Dunlending allies have set up camp.
This Dievlig village suffers under the oppressive rule of their Brenin, Trehéarn.
Lhan Gogledh is the central village of the Dievlig in the Bonevales.

deed.name: Exploring the Isendale
deed.description: Isendale has long been on the edge of border skirmishes between the Rohirrim and Dunlendings, and has many places to explore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Rohirrim have established Forthbrond as a forward encampment in the Gap of Rohan against the Dunlendings who are threatening to invade.
This village is one of many where the Dunlendings are ramping up for the invasion of Rohan.
Many of Saruman's Wargs have inhabited this large warren, awaiting their master's commands.

Brôntrig overlooks the Gap of Rohan and provides the Dunlendings a choke point against any incursion from the Rohirrim. It is one of several villages where the Dunlendings are ramping up for the invasion of Rohan.

deed.name: Exploring the Dunbog
deed.description: Dunbog has many places to explore. As you tread through the swamps, be careful to stop and smell the sulfur.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have found Lhan Colvarn, home of the Abominations.
You have found Lhan Rhos, home of the Avanc-lûth
You have found the Withered Stones, home of Bloodmaw and her brood.
You have found Durgors, temporary home of the Boar Clan
You have found The Pristine Glade, secret place of the Avanc-lûth

deed.name: Explorer of Dunland
deed.description: Dunland is a large and wild land, inhabited by good and wicked folk alike. You should explore the many landmarks of Dunland.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Bonevales are an extension of the Lich Bluffs of Enedwaith, but a section where evil had never stirred until now.
Carreglyn is controlled by the Uch-lûth, the Ox-clan, who operate a significant mine in the service of Saruman.
The Dunbog is home to a number of backwater clans and refugees from the Boar-clan.
The Gravenwood is a sacred place of the Dunlendings, both honoured and feared.
The Heathfells are a wide stretch of land in the Gap of Rohan which lie between Nan Curunir, the Isendale, and Rohan.
The Isendale lies at the entrance to the Gap of Rohan, leading into the Heathfells.
The wide vale of Nan Curunír is home to Isengard and the tower of Orthanc, stronghold of Saruman the White.
Pren Gwydh is the cultural centre of Dunland. Here, representatives from many clans come to trade.
The Starkmoor is a territory controlled by the Uch-lûth, the Ox-clan, and is home to Avardin, a major trading outpost.
Trum Dreng is a pastoral land that is home to the Caru-lûth, the Stag-clan, a people that is slowly dwindling from Dunland.

deed.name: Quests of Dunland
deed.description: There is much to be done to help the people of Dunland while war arises around them.

deed.description: Saruman has placed two of his most powerful servants to watch the gates of Isengard and destroy any who approach unannounced.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Ufdrágh, the Hammer of Fear stands guard upon the gates of Isengard.
Barashal the Crusher stands ready to destroy any who approach the gates of Isengard.

deed.description:
Saeradan, Amlan, and Andreg are searching the Gravenwood for clues to the whereabouts of the Old Woman of the Mountain.
Help Andreg deal with the threats of the <rgb=#FFFF00>South Gravenwood</rgb>.

You have helped Andreg collect samples of a strange corruption infecting the Gravenwood.
You have helped Andreg hunt down the vile dusk-hounds of the Gravenwood.
You have helped Andreg hunt the spying crebain of the Gravenwood.
You have helped Andreg defeat many Orcs in the Gravenwood.

deed.name: Storm on Methedras
deed.description: The dwelling place of Gwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain, lies atop Methedras, overlooking Isengard. The witch has allied herself with Saruman the White and seeks to bring a great army of ancient evil down upon the Rohirrim.

objective.text: Defeat all of Gwyllion's lieutenants in the Storm on Methedras Skirmish.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Rhodri is one of Gwyllion's chief lieutenants. A captain of the Draig-lûth, the Dragon-clan of Dunland, Rhodri is a savage and dangerous warrior.
Budant is one of the Brenin-lhud, the great ape-like creatures which inhabit the hills and mountains of Dunland. Gwyllion has called Budant and many of his kind to her cause.
Among the great evils that Gwyllion has summoned to aid Saruman is the wight Maru Brenin, lord of the Dead of Dunland.
Saruman has sent Garzog, one of his trusted lieutenants, to keep an eye on Gwyllion...just in case she decides to turn on him.
The giant Caur wandered into Dunland from the mountains above Thrór's Coomb in Enedwaith and pledged his service to Gwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain.
The fell spirit Helechúl is among the many fell spirits and ancient evils summoned by Gwyllion to lead her army of terror into Rohan on behalf of Saruman of Many Colours.
The Rogmul Núrvor and his twin Dombor were once servants of Durin's Bane, but following the demon's death answered the summons of Gwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain.
The Rogmul Dombor and his twin Núrvor were once servants of Durin's Bane, but following the demon's death answered the summons of Gwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain.

The Caerog Daeharn emerged from the depths of the Misty Mountains in answer to the mystical summons of Gwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain, and now serves the witch as one of her terrible lieutenants.

deed.name: Maggot's Mushrooms Victories (Tier 1)
deed.description: A group of mischevious young hobbits organizes a yearly secret raid of Farmer Maggot's fields, seeking to snatch wild mushrooms that grow among the grain -- and each year Farmer Maggot sets his dogs loose in the field to chase them off -- can you prove your worth as a mushroom-hunter?

questComplete.loreInfo: Maggot's mushrooms, some of the finest mushrooms in the Shire, grow in his fields among the other crops, and young hobbits throughout the land gather to challenge each other to acts of daring and bravery whilst avoiding the nip of Farmer Maggot's dogs, Grip, Fang, and Wolf.

deed.name: Maggot's Mushrooms Victories (Tier 2)
deed.description: A group of mischevious young hobbits organizes a yearly secret raid of Farmer Maggot's fields, seeking to snatch wild mushrooms that grow among the grain...and each year Farmer Maggot sets his dogs loose in the field to chase them off. Can you prove your worth as a veteran mushroom-hunter?

questComplete.loreInfo: You have proven yourself a fine mushroom-hunter. The hobbit-youths look up to you in reverence and awe, as you nimbly avoid the pursuit of Maggot's dogs.

deed.name: Tower of Orthanc: Ring of Lightning -- Tier 1
deed.description: The Free Peoples often believe trolls to be drooling, unthinking monsters -- and often they are correct -- but it is not the rule. Some of the Enemy's greatest and most intelligent leaders are trolls, and Saruman has acquired one of these for himself. To this beast, he has given a ring which imbues upon him the power of the storm....

deed.name: The Vanished Rider
deed.description: The Nazgûl that rode upon the fell-beast, which lies now dead in the Brown Lands, is missing somewhere along the Great River. Perhaps the residents of those lands have seen some sign of its passage.

objective.text: Some of the Rohirrim beheld a mysterious shadow falling from the sky not long ago. Is this event of some significance for your strange dream in Dunland?
Search the lands alongside the Great River for sign of the Nazgûl's passage.

deed.name: Explorer of the Great River
deed.description: You have explored the length and breadth of the Great River lands on your trek into the south, towards the open plains of Rohan.

deed.name: Parth Celebrant Explorer
deed.description: Parth Celebrant is an old crossroads and battlefield that holds a long significance to the Rohirrim as the birthplace of their kingdom.

objective.text: Discover the campsites of the hobbit pioneers.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This is the camp of the Rohirrim warden Idmar.
This great field is where the Battle of the Field of Celebrant took place, when the Men of Gondor and Men of the North drove forth the Easterling Horde, and Rohan became a nation.
Hordfierd is a fortress erected by the brigands who stole into Parth Celebrant to thieve the relics there...only to be swayed by the servants of Mordor.
Ost Celebrant was once a great fortress of Gondor before it fell to the treachery of Oathbreakers. Now it houses the shades of the betrayers and their evil allies.
This place has become the den of a pack of ravenous wolves, which have turned to cannibalism for the lack of food.

deed.name: Titan-slayer
deed.description: Defeat huge enemies in Limlight Gorge.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Despite your comparatively small stature, you have defeated many huge enemies in Limlight Gorge.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat huge enemies in Limlight Gorge

deed.description: Defeat spiders in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Spiders of the Great River did not stand a chance against you.

deed.description: Defeat many Brigands in the Great River.

monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Brigands in the Great River

deed.name: Limlight Gorge Explorer
deed.description: The Limlight Gorge has always been a wild and sparsely inhabited area, but since a band of trolls came down from the Misty Mountains, what few inhabitants there were have fled its rocky slopes. Massive creatures now inhabit the Gorge, making travel through the area perilous, and it is said that even the trees themselves sometimes move about, perhaps thanks to some strange magic from the neighbouring forest of Fangorn....

objective.text: Explore the Limlight Gorge in Great River.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: When the last inhabitants of the Limlight Gorge were driven out by the arrival of trolls from the Misty Mountains, the Rohirrim erected this guard-post to keep an eye on the entrance to the Gorge and ensure that nothing came out of it unseen. Luckily, the trolls dare not stray too far from the caves and ledges they take cover beneath during cloudless days, and so they have made no attempt to come up out of the Gorge.

The Limlight Falls mark the bottom extent of the foothills leading down from the Misty Moutains as the rushing river empties out towards the plains to the south.
The cold rushing stream ensures a steady supply of fresh water for the community of Stangard.

The northernmost extent of the forest of Fangorn ends here, at the banks of the Limlight River.
The Ents have long had a small gathering place here, where they would long ago meet with the Elves of Lothlórien and learn news of the outside world

This ancient Gondorian tower once watched over the Limlight Gorge.
To what purpose, or against what threat, no-one today remembers, for it fell into ruin long, long ago.

This old river pothole remains from time long past when the Limlight's course ran further up the Gorge. It left this oddly smoothed pit behind as it shifted course.
Now, alas, it seems that trolls have taken up residence within its deep shadows.

This may once have been a homestead or hunting-cabin down in the Gorge, but more recently it has been the waypost for a band of prospectors and treasure-seekers exploring the Gorge for valuable minerals.

This old sawmill was built some years ago by the Men of Stangard, before the trolls arrived and drove them away.
More recently it appears that a band of hard-working but obstinately foolish dwarves have been trying to restore the mill to working order.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Brigands in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have made the Great River safer against the villainous brigands who roam there.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Brigands in the Great River

deed.name: Thinglad Explorer
deed.description: The Elves of Lórien have an outpost in the little-known woods of Thinglad, a grey place in winter that runs along the edge of the Great River.

objective.text: Discover the landmarks of interest in Thinglad.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Foul-maw is an old and ugly bear, huge and horrible of temper.
Haldirith, a ruined garden of the Elves, is where the sentinels of Thinglad have made their home.
The den, long abandoned by its former inhabitants, has been lately reclaimed by vicious Wargs.
Orcs have begun to settle in Thinglad for the first time in many a year. This is surely a sign of evil days to come.
Orcs seem to be everywhere these days, even in the once-peaceful woods of Thinglad, so near to Lórien's edge.

deed.name: The Spirits of the Limlight
deed.description: Ordhrien has suggested that you attempt to speak with the spirits of the Limlight Gorge. The Elves of Lothlórien once communed with these spirits and claim that they can only be seen by the light of the stars.

objective.text: Complete Ancient Ruins of the Limlight

Ordhrien has suggested that you attempt to speak with the spirits of the Limlight Gorge.
The Elves of Lothlórien once communed with these spirits, and claim that they can only be seen by the light of the stars.

npcTalk.loreInfo: A spirit of the Limlight Gorge spoke of her mistress' long ago protection of the Gorge and of how the trees once learned to speak.
npcTalk.progressOverride: Speak with the Spirit of Reverence

npcTalk.loreInfo: One of the spirits of the Limlight Gorge claimed that they act as the custodians of memories of long ago, but it seems impossible to guess at what she meant by that.
npcTalk.progressOverride: Speak with the Spirit of Rememberance

npcTalk.loreInfo: This spirit spoke of a time when the forests of Lórien and Fangorn met, and the Elves spoke often with the Ents, though she did not reveal the name of her mistress. Could she mean the Lady Galadriel?
npcTalk.progressOverride: Speak with the Spirit of Amity

npcTalk.loreInfo: An ancient spirit spoke of the songs of the Elves which could once be heard echoing through the gorge in times long past, and wondered if they might one day return.
npcTalk.progressOverride: Speak with the Spirit of Melody

npcTalk.loreInfo: This spirit spoke of a time when they helped teach the Elves how to speak with the trees of the forest. But she mourned that most of these things had long been forgotten by the trees of the Gorge.
npcTalk.progressOverride: Speak with the Spirit of Enlightenment

npcTalk.loreInfo: A strange spirit wondered what would become of them, when at last the final traces of the Elves faded from the Limlight Gorge.
npcTalk.progressOverride: Speak with the Spirit of Destiny

deed.name: Ancient Ruins of the Limlight
deed.description: Look for traces of the ancient legacy of the Limlight Gorge, when it was still a part of the Golden Wood ages ago.

objective.text: Look for traces of the ancient legacy of the Limlight Gorge, when it was still a part of the Golden Wood ages ago.

itemUsed.loreInfo: A few Ancient stones remain here among the rocks. It is hard to say, but they may be of Elf-make.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find Ancient Elf-ruins in the Limlight Gorge

itemUsed.loreInfo: The few remaining chunks of masonry and stonework you found suggest that the Elves once lived here...but it must have been an age of the world at least since that time.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find Mysterious Elf-ruins in the Limlight Gorge

itemUsed.loreInfo: Covered with ancient lichens, you find the final crumbling remnants of an Elf-ruin. What purpose could the Elves have had so long ago that brought them here?
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find Tumbled Elf-ruins in the Limlight Gorge

itemUsed.loreInfo: These ruins look even older than the rest, if that is possible. You cannot even begin to guess at what their purpose might have been.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find Hallowed Elf-ruins in the Limlight Gorge

itemUsed.loreInfo: These old Elf-ruins appear to have some strange markings carved upon them. You have some considerable difficulty deciphering the odd runes, until finally you realize that they are rather recent additions, likely made by Men or dwarves surveying the Gorge long after the structure fell to ruin.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find Engraved Elf-ruins in the Limlight Gorge

itemUsed.loreInfo: These ruins are so ancient that there is no sign of what brought them to this state, whether it was war, calamity, or the passing of some vast span of time that crumbled them to all but nothing.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find Crumbling Elf-ruins in the Limlight Gorge

deed.name: Rushgore Explorer
deed.description: The marshes of the Rushgore have long been uninhabited...or so the border-guard of Rohan believed. Besides wild beasts, villains of a two-legged variety have recently come....

objective.text: Discover the camps and sites of the Rushgore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The small campsite is held by Aculf and his companions...a small patrol to watch over what was supposed to be uninhabited territory....
This encampment was established as a waypoint for the brigands of the Brown Lands who seek to plunder Parth Celebrant for ancient relics.
This place is the breeding ground for the avanc of the Rushgore...a dangerous place for the unwary.
The Creeping Mud is, in fact, a nest of vile gredbyg which dwell in the Rushgore.
Tik Botokh is a encampment of scouts for an Easterling tribe called the Khundolar, descendants of the Horde who battled Gondor and the ancestors of the Rohirrim at the Field of Celebrant
Turtles of great size inhabit the Rushgore, and this is their nesting place.

deed.name: Shade-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Shades in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You had defeated many haunted shades of the Great River.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Shades in the Great River

deed.name: Wailing Hills Explorer
deed.description: The Wailing Hills, north-west of Stangard, are so named due to a great battle and the slaughtering of Orcs that occured there many years ago, around the time of Rohan's founding.

objective.text: Explore the Wailing Hills in the Great River.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Stone of Friendship, where Cirion, the Steward of Gondor, and Eorl, the first King of Rohan, met on the battlefield as victorious allies. The monument commemorates their oath of friendship and service.
A small group of Rohirrim, led by Frithstan, guard the south of the Wailing Hills. Their primary task is to keep safe the Cuthstan monument.
This is a recently constructed Orc-encampment. The Nink-hai have boldly abandoned their mountain homes to live in huts and tents along the northern edge of the Limlight River.

The Mor-hai Orcs have grown in number and tenacity. They have begun constructing war-camps beyond the safety of their dark mountain dwellings, in order to more directly provoke the Men of Stangard along the road.
Landroval and Meneldor, two of the Great Eagles in service to Gwaihir the Windlord, selected this secluded clearing as a safe location to regroup, after splitting up to search the area.
This large cave in the mountainside is the central breeding grounds for the Venom-bite spiders, a breed renowned for their venomous fangs.
Named for the bright star-shaped flowers that blanket each ridge, this hilltop has become a favourite grazing spot for the wild goats native to the region.

deed.name: Easterling-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Easterlings in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Easterlings have learned to fear your name...perhaps tales of your might will flow to other enemies throughout the Great River.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Easterlings in the Great River

deed.name: Beast Slayer
deed.description: Defeat wild beasts in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have slain many beasts along the Anduin.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat wild beasts in the Great River

deed.name: Titan-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many huge enemies in Limlight Gorge.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The titans which call Limlight Gorge home cower in fear when your name is mentioned.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat huge enemies in Limlight Gorge

deed.name: Shade-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Shades in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have ended the long, haunted miseries of many evil shades.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Shades in the Great River

deed.name: Beast Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wild beasts in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The beasts of the Great River have met their match in you.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat wild beasts in the Great River

deed.name: Easterling-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Easterlings in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Easterlings you have encountered along the Anduin have met their match.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Easterlings in the Great River

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many spiders in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The evil spiders of the Great River diminish greatly in number, thanks to you.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat many spiders in the Great River

deed.name: Eorlsmead Explorer
deed.description: Eorlsmead is on the distant northern border of Rohan, a watch-post against the evils of the north.

objective.text: Discover the landmarks of Eorlsmead.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This farm was once lovingly tended by farmers of Stangard, but it has been long left abandoned.
These caves are den to a pack of wild dogs, which haunt the Men of Stangard.
You have discovered the great Rohirrim settlement of Stangard, the north watch of Rohan. You find it is a bit shabbier than you expected from so great a town.
A great tower of questionable purpose, standing tall in its watch over Eorlsmead.
You have happened upon an unfortunate set of tunnels carved out by vile worms in Eorlsmead.

deed.name: Orc Slayer
deed.description: Defeat Orcs in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated a great number of Orcs in the Great River.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Great River

deed.name: Orc Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Orcs in the Great River.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated a great many Orcs during your travels in the Great River.
monsterDied.progressOverride: Defeat Orcs in the Great River

deed.name: Brown Lands Explorer
deed.description: The Brown Lands were once a green land, lush with vegetation, until war and corruption turned them into a desolate wasteland.

objective.text: Discover the camps and sites of the Brown Lands.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Etheburg is a waypost of the Rohirrim border-guard. It is the last bastion of defence for the Rohirrim before entering the Riddermark itself.
Long have brigands and ruffians used the Brown Lands as a hideaway. Helstor is their last refuge in that desolate place.
The Khundolar, Easterlings descended from the Horde that fought the Lords of Gondor and the ancestors of the Rohirrim at the Field of Celebrant, have returned, prepared for war....
These ancient and ruined gardens once blossomed at the caring hands of the Entwives before war ravaged them.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Desolation of the Gardens

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This network of caves houses a tribe of wild trolls, who have chosen to inhabit the Brown Lands

deed.description: Complete quests within Thinglad.

objective.text: Complete quests within Thinglad.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have aided both the Elves of Lórien and the Men of Stangard in Thinglad.

deed.description: There is much to be done to help the people of the Great River while war arises around them.

deed.name: Roots of Fangorn: Slaves of the Spider Queen
deed.description: An ancient evil has burrowed its way beneath the roots of the forest of Fangorn, using labour provided by a band of enslaved Orcs. The leader of these Orcs is Frûshkul, and he must be defeated if you are to reach the spider queen and prevent the roots of the forest above from being poisoned and corrupted.

objective.text: DNT - you wont see this.
To earn this deed, you must defeat Frûshkul.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated Frûshkul

deed.name: Saviour of the Roots of Fangorn
deed.description: Those who would call themselves the Saviour of the Roots of Fangorn must overcome all of the challenges they face within.

objective.text: DNT - you wont see this
Complete all the Deeds within the Lost Temple.

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Challenge: Roots of Fangorn -- Green Thumb'

deed.name: Roots of Fangorn: Defeat Gurthúl
deed.description: Entering the eeries natural caverns that extend beneath the fringe of the Forest of Fangorn, you discovered and defeated the terrible Gurthúl and her brood, thus foiling their attempt to poison the ancient roots of the forest above.

objective.text: DNT - You won't see this
To earn this deed, you must defeat Gurthúl.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have defeated Gurthúl.

deed.description: You have discovered the entrance to the Roots of Fangorn.

objective.text: DNT - you won't see this.

deed.name: Reflections
deed.description: Many ancient mirrors can be found throughout the dark halls of Moria.

objective.text: Many ancient mirrors can be found throughout the dark halls of Moria.

deed.name: Friend to the Riders of Stangard
deed.description: The Riders of Stangard now consider you a friend to their cause and respect you more.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts have earned you a standing of friendship with the Riders of Stangard.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Riders of Stangard

deed.name: Known to the Riders of Stangard
deed.description: As the vanguard pushing evil from Mirkwood, the Riders of Stangard look for any that will stand with them. You have become known to their leaders.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your continued efforts have made your name known to the Riders of Stangard.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Riders of Stangard

deed.name: Kindred with the Riders of Stangard
deed.description: The Riders of Stangard now consider you one of their own, they will look to you to lead charges against the forces of the Enemy wherever they go.

factionLevel.loreInfo: Your efforts in aiding the people of the Great River have earned you great respect among the Riders of Stangard.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Riders of Stangard

deed.name: Ally to the Riders of Stangard
deed.description: You are now trusted among the Riders of Stangard, and with that trust comes an expectation of continued assistance.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Riders of Stangard honour all that you do and now consider you to be a reliable ally.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Riders of Stangard

deed.name: Tracking an Old Goat
deed.description:
Saeradan, Amlan, and Andreg are searching the Gravenwood for clues to the whereabouts of the Old Woman of the Mountain.
Help Andreg deal with the threats of the <rgb=#FFFF00>South Gravenwood</rgb>.

questComplete.loreInfo: You helped Andreg disable many traps set by the Orcs in the Gravenwood.
You have helped Andreg collect samples of a strange corruption infecting the Gravenwood.
You have helped Andreg hunt down the vile dusk-hounds of the Gravenwood.
You have helped Andreg hunt the spying crebain of the Gravenwood.
You have helped Andreg defeat many Orcs in the Gravenwood.

deed.name: Stangard Explorer
deed.description: Discover all of Stangard's interiors.

objective.text: Discover the buildings of Stangard.

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Mead Hall of Stangard is where Stanric and the other Rohirrim conduct the majority of their business.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Mead Hall

enterDetection.loreInfo: The lockhouse is guarded closely by Cynred, and none may enter without strict permission from the leadership of Stangard. Here are all things that must be locked up, from food-stores to prisoners.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Lockhouse

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Skirmish Hall is where all skirmish-related business is done.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Skirmish Hall

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Auction Hall is rarely used by the Men of Stangard, but the Auctions of Middle-earth can be viewed here.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Auction Hall

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Stangard Vault offers only the most secure place to store your cherished items.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Stangard Vault

enterDetection.loreInfo: When the burdens of the day become overwhelming, the Stangard Tavern serves as a place to relax and quench thirsts.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Stangard Tavern

enterDetection.loreInfo: This house near the Mead Hall is home to Stanric, the lord of Stangard.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Stanric's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Athulf alone cares for the gentle dogs that inhabit the kennel of Stangard.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Stangard Kennel

enterDetection.loreInfo: Undesired weather can force the horses of Stangard indoors. This stable helps provide warmth during the winter months.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Stangard Stable

enterDetection.loreInfo: This is the home of the workman Wada, an overworked and underfed resident of Stangard.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Wada's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Legendary Item Store employs the only two soldiers in Stangard that have mastered the Forging and Imbuing of Legendary Items.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Legendary Item Store

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Supplier lives here, but the supplies in this house belong to him, not to you.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Supplier's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: The Provisioner lives here, but the provisions in this house belong to him, not to you.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Provisioner's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Byrnstan is a loyal guard of the Mead Hall, and does his work with little compensation.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Byrnstan's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Dunstan's home is now unoccupied, for this brave hunter was slain by Orcs in Thinglad. He will never sleep in his bed again, for his grave is under the eaves of the great trees of Thinglad.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Dunstan's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Uthrad is a guard loyal to Sithric. It is best not to cross him.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Uthrad's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Tatwine is a gentle farmer who tends the horses of Stangard, day in and day out. He wants nothing more than some land to tend, but he is not permitted to do any farming.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Tatwine's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Long Abandoned, this home strikes fear into the hearts of any man living in Stangard. All those that enter are never heard or seen from again.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Abandoned House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Adalbert is a guard loyal to Stanric. It is best not to cross him.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Adalbert's House

enterDetection.loreInfo: Sabert is your friend. He guards the front gate of Stangard, and greets you whenever you come and go.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Sabert's House

deed.description:
Without knowing where we have come from, we cannot possibly know where we are going.
Éogar, master of Hengstacer Farm, will look for help around the farm and for someone to help train the new arrival once per day.

objective.text: Horses have memories longer than most Men....

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Herding to the North Downs

deed.description: An unusual horse you met in Combe seems to have bonded to you. Perhaps you were meant to help him in some way?

questComplete.loreInfo: You have formed a strong bond with a descendant of the Mearas. When you make your way into Rohan, this will surely be of benefit.

deed.name: An Unusual Arrival
deed.description: An unusual horse has arrived in the town of Combe and those tending the stables are having trouble giving it adequate attention.

objective.text: The workers at the stables in Combe are desperate for someone to help with their new arrival!

deed.name: East Wall Explorer
deed.description: The cliffs and tree-clad slopes of this hilly region serve as the eastern boundary of the kingdom of Rohan, and the northernmost reach of the kingdom of Gondor today.

objective.text: There are many places of interest to visit for the curious explorer along the tree-clad slopes of the East Wall.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This camp of Rohirrim hail primarily from the Wold, but there are representatives from throughout the kingdom of Rohan. They came to the East Wall under the command of Mansig. Their purpose was to investigate the fresh gathering of Orcs and Uruks that crossed the river, but they were ambushed upon arrival and still work to recover from that attack.
More than a dozen Orcs lie dead in a glade not far from Amon Hen. What happened here?
The grassy lawn of Parth Galen would serve as a good location for the campsite of any travellers forced to disembark the river, but it is in full view of the far shore and could be dangerous.
The Tindrock is a great spur of rock that divides the waters of the Anduin as they rush towards the Falls of Rauros. Called Tol Brandir by the Elves, it is said to be unclimbable.
The great Falls of Rauros descend from the cliffs with a booming roar. To follow the river over the edge means death.
Amon Hen is one of the two hills that rise on either side of the Anduin at the Falls of Rauros. The kings of old once sat upon the Seat of Seeing at its summit and saw many things of use to them.
The Orcs in the East Wall have erected a barricade to keep travellers from coming into the East Wall from the Sutcrofts.
The North-guard is a chamber dominated by the Orcs of Moria in the tunnels beneath the East Wall.
This chamber is full of gredbyg. It is possible other tunnels beneath the East Wall are infested with the creatures as well.
This is the southernmost chamber of the tunnels beneath the East Wall, and it is full of Orcs from Moria.

deed.description: The people of the Sutcrofts stand united against the enemy but they cannot succeed alone.

objective.text: The people of the Sutcrofts stand united against the enemy but they cannot succeed alone.

deed.name: Orc-slayer of the Eastemnet
deed.description: You should slay Orcs in the Eastemnet.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Orcs have begun to harry the lands of Rohan, wreaking havoc upon the good people there. War has begun, and all must do their part in reducing the number of foes in the lands of the Free Peoples.

deed.name: Cities of Eastern Rohan
deed.description: Rohan is home to many great cities and settlements.

objective.text: Rohan is home to many great cities and settlements.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Langhold, the northernmost city of the Wold. It stands guard against invading brigands and Easterlings.
Harwick is a large city of the Wold, home to Harding, the stern Aldor.
You have found Floodwend, a fair city near the rapids of Sarn Gebir, governed by a very young Thane, Radwig.
Cliving is a great city in the Norcrofts, home to the Reeve, Athelward.
The Norcrofts city of Elthengels is presided over by Thane Mildreth, a fearless and proud woman.
You have discovered the town of Faldham.
You have discovered the town of Eaworth, ruled over by the loyal Reeve Ingbert.
You have found Thornhope empty of all inhabitants, filled with ash, smoke, and death wrought by the enemies of Rohan.
Snowbourn is the largest city in the Sutcrofts, where Fastred is Thane. Orcs surround and threaten this great city and all who live there.
Garsfeld is a principal city in the Sutcrofts, governed by Thane Gísil.

deed.name: Beast-slayer of the Eastemnet
deed.description: Huntsmen in the Eastemnet of Rohan find no lack of beasts for prey, for the grasslands are rife with all sorts of creatures.

deed.description: Brigands are among the worst enemies in Middle-earth, for they are ordinary Men, but cruel and greedy in their lawless, destructive ways.

deed.description: Wargs in the Eastemnet of Rohan seem to be stronger and more brutal than those in other lands, with the open plains fueling their speed and power.

deed.name: Eaves of Fangorn Exploration
deed.description: Explore Fangorn.

objective.text: Explore Fangorn

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Silkenhold is overrun with evil spiders who snuff out the light with their webs, much to the displeasure of the trees who live there.
Deep in the deepest reaches of Fangorn's eaves is a dark stretch of forest covered by shadows old and strong.
A mossy set of tall stones runs along the edge of the Entwash River in Fangorn, the rocks green and lovely from the clean water they drink.
The meadow of Sweetmead is appropriately named, for in the midst of the thick trees is a meadow, smelling of gentle honey and sweet sunlight.

A large, deep pond stands still in the midst of Fangorn, treacherously hiding under its thick veil of fog. You cannot help but wonder how many unsuspecting creatures have drowned in the hidden depths.

deed.name: Quests of the East Wall
deed.description: Finish the quests of the East Wall.

objective.text: Finish the quests of the East Wall.
Finish the quests of the East Wall.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have done many good deeds at the East Wall and helped those people as much as you were able.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete all of the East Wall's quests

deed.name: The Wilds of the Eastemnet
deed.description: Explore the wilds of Rohan.

objective.text: Explore the wilds of Rohan.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Stinging Bog lies just beyond the walls of Harwick in the Wold.
Cracabor is the highest hill in the Wold, looking out over the grassy plains.
The Croft-watch is rumoured to be the fairest and most scenic place in the Sutcrofts.
The Wódfen is a wetland in the Entwash Vale, plagued by salamanders and madness-inducing draugar.
Wild horses run free in the lands of Rohan, and one particular herd of these impressive beasts can be found in the Entwash Vale.

deed.name: The Defences of Eastern Rohan
deed.description: Explore the defences of Rohan.

objective.text: Explore the defences of Rohan.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Undeep Watch is where the Rohirrim of Langhold keep watch upon the ford against the crossing of Easterlings.
Feldburg is a defence outpost of Harwick, presided over by Captain Agelmund.
Wakenflood, a Rohirrim outpost of the Wold, has nearly fallen to Easterlings. Soldiers lie wounded as they struggle to uphold the defences.
Twickenburg is the Rohirrim watch upon the crossroads in the Wold, ensuring that the roads are held by the Free Peoples.
North-torr is the Rohirrim's last defence against Easterlings in the enemy's march upon Floodwend.
The huntsman Caddabrand has set up camp within a rock formation to hunt on behalf of Reeve Athelward.

The men of the western watchtower are the vanguard of defences for the city of Cliving. From their outpost, they are able to identify enemy forces approaching from the plains and are able to halt their intrusion.
Reeve Athelward's men have converted a secluded farmstead in the north-east into a training ground for aspiring soldiers. The relatively hidden location offers some protection from Orc-assault.

The merchants and traders at this outpost sell much-needed supplies to travellers along the road and to those fleeing from the invading Orc-armies. Their location is a dangerous one, but hired guards help to protect the traders from wandering enemies.

deed.name: Enemies of the Rohirrim
deed.description: Explore the encampments of Rohan's enemies.

objective.text: Explore the encampments of Rohan's enemies.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Olghakhósh is a small Easterling-camp in the Wold.
Jóshkhin Orda is the large Easterling-encampment of the Wold, where Súth-torr was captured by the Nazgûl to pave the way for the enemies of the Rohirrim.
The Orcs of Nîn-stazg rally for an attack on Floodwend.
The brigand-leader Eastmund has been exiled many times, but his lair always seems to reappear somewhere in the northern Wold.
The shallows of the Anduin present a vulnerable spot for the Wold, for Easterlings attempt to creep across the river at such places.
A company of Uruk-hai warriors, who had marched west with a larger force, has recently returned and made camp south of Elthengels. What could have caused them to flee eastwards?
A group of White Hand Orcs, the Nink-hai, have established a war-camp in the mountain-passes between the Norcrofts and the East Wall, planning to assault the farming-village of Faldham.
The Orcs that have escaped Walstow's spears at the East Wall have set up camp at Ash Durub in the Sutcrofts, blocking Walstow from receiving any aid from Snowbourn.
Along with Ash Durub, the Orcs of Ufum-mau prevent Walstow from receiving aid from Snowbourn.
Half-orcs of the White Hand have been actively trying to sack Garsfeld, having met minimal resistance from Gísil's men.
The Orcs and Uruks of Maustazg pose a dire threat to the people of the Entwash Vale.
You have come across Thrug-unur, an encampment of Moria goblins in the Entwash Vale. Having goblins as neighbours is a situation that is less than ideal for the Rohirrim here.

deed.name: Where Evil Creatures Dwell
deed.description: Explore the dwellings of evil creatures in Rohan.

objective.text: Explore the dwellings of evil creatures in Rohan.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The Howling Wood is a Warg-den in the Wold that was once a strategic worksite for Floodwend, but is now overrun with the filthy, deadly beasts.
Fang Point is a Warg-camp that threatens the Men of Feldburg, who stand watch on the road.

Âmbal, the renowned and feared wolf-matron, makes her home in a circle of cliffs and rocks near the stream that runs across the Norcrofts. She and her offspring have caused no shortage of suffering to the nearby farmers.
A once-peaceful valley, spanning from west of Faldham into the East Wall, has become overrun with dangerous Láthbear.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Valley of the Láthbear

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Wyrmdelf, a cave teeming with evil drakes in the Entwash Vale. Such places are deadly even for the hardiest and bravest of warriors.
The Wyrm-father of Wyrmdelf lives upon the high rock of Fang Tor in the Entwash Vale.

deed.name: Farms and Crofts of the Eastemnet
deed.description: Discover the farms of the Eastemnet.

objective.text: Discover the farms of the Eastemnet.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This small farm belongs to the farmer Randgar, who has refused to evacuate despite the growing danger of the Orc-threat.
This estate was once home to a prosperous farming family, but it has fallen into the greedy hands of the invading Orcs.
The crofts of Walstow, ravaged almost completely beyond saving, are held by Orcs, so what few crops remain are far too dangerous for any crofter to harvest.
Bradcroft is the largest croft in the Sutcrofts and lies south of Garsfeld. It is currently overrun and has been destroyed by a number of half-orcs and Orcs.
Wyrthing is a largely untouched spread of croftlands surrounding Snowbourn. The Orcs have made attempts to besiege them, but so far their efforts have been repelled by the forces of Snowbourn.

deed.name: Ruins, Tombs, and Monuments of the Eastemnet
deed.description: Discover the ruined places of the Eastemnet.

objective.text: Discover the ruined places of the Eastemnet.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The dead stir in the barrows of the Dwolung Hole in the Wold, never a good sign to the Men of Rohan, who are naturally superstitious.
Wódscrafen is home to the Dead who walk, though they should be asleep in their tombs. What wakes the sleeping draugar from their rest?
The Seething Mire lies near Langhold, once a fair Gondorian structure, now naught but ruins overrun by salamanders and their nests.
A freestanding stone tower, Minas Rant is a relic of the ancient armies of Gondor that once protected the lands now called the Norcrofts.

The Red Fields were once ideal lands for growing crops and raising livestock, but became the primary battlegrounds of the first of the recent Orc-invasions. The area received its nickname due to the bloodshed incurred by mounted Orc-archers.

You have found the grave of the father of Fastred, the previous Reeve of the Sutcrofts. Fastred often visits to pay his respects and to mercilessly hunt any Orc that dares to stray too close to his father's resting place.

Alas for Thornhope, newly arrived upon the list of dead and abandoned places in the Eastemnet. Thornhope was a thriving city once, but now it is naught but death and ruin, a hollow reminder of the good people that lived there.

Tombs of the Men of Gondor can sometimes be found in secluded corners of Rohan. Such crypts often attract adventurers who seek treasures of the Second Age, but they are frequently filled only with danger and death.

enterDetection.loreInfo: Byrgenstow was once an ancient burial tomb belonging to the ancestors of the Dunlendings. Now it teems with evil in the form of the draugar.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Byrgenstow

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: This memorial to Eorl the Young stands in the Wold as a reminder to the greatest deeds in Rohan's history. Eorl's monument stands here, but his tomb is near Edoras.

deed.name: To the Aid of Rohan
deed.description: You have been summoned to the aid of Rohan.

objective.text: You have been summoned to the aid of Rohan.

condition.loreInfo: Rohan awaits!

deed.name: Boar-hunter of the Eastemnet
deed.description: The wide plains of Rohan are known for their extraordinary boars.

objective.text: Kill boars on the plains of the Eastemnet.

deed.description: Most of the Reeve's family are laid to rest in the graveyard outside of Forlaw. Most of his family has been killed recently as the conflict in Wildermore escalates.

objective.text: There are many of Reeve Gárwig's family buried in the graveyard outside of Forlaw. Many of these graves are relatively fresh.

deed.name: Farms of the Fallows
deed.description: Gárwig gave each of his sons a section of the Fallows as they came of age. Each of them built or inherited a farm on their land, and some were more successful than others at producing goods for Forlaw and Wildermore.

objective.text: Discover the farms of the Fallows.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Edsig's Farm is one of the larger farms in the Fallows, but was recently abandoned with the attack on Forlaw. Nobody from Edsig's farm returned to Forlaw or made it to Thrymm's Farm, and are assumed dead.
Gárnoth's Farm is one of the largest in the Fallows, but has been on the decline since Gárnoth died to Brúlk. It is well-known in Wildermore for the quality of cattle raised at the farm.
Thrymm's Farm is the largest farm in the Fallows, and at its peak, was a major supplier to Forlaw and the northern cities of Wildermore.
Cuthbald's Farm is one of the three smaller farms in the Fallows. When Cuthbald died at an early age this farm went to Gárferth's control, though it suffered due to his focus being elsewhere.
Gársig's Farm is one of the smaller farms of the Fallows, and is furthest from the city of Forlaw. The farm's distance from Forlaw is symbolic of the relationship between him and his father.
Gárferth's Farm is one of the smaller farms of the Fallows. Gárferth has always made training as a warrior and protecting Forlaw his top priority, and his two farms suffered for it.

deed.name: The Path of Núrzum
deed.description: Discover the sites of Núrzum's destruction in Wildermore

objective.text: Discover the sites of Núrzum's destruction in Wildermore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Núrzum paused here to get a good look at Forlaw, and his footprints lead the other way.
It is clear that Núrzum paused in this spot to hunt a messenger from Forlaw and mangle his horse.
Orcs have set up a small encampment encircling these ice-spires, letting their guard down in the shadow of Núrzum's presence.
Núrzum stood outside of Dunfast and tossed about trees and boulders as if they were a child's toys.
Núrzum carved a path of terror through Balewood, freezing the forest and paving the way for the White Hand invasion of Wildermore.

deed.name: The Wilds of Wildermore
deed.description: Explore the wilds of Wildermore.

objective.text: Explore the wilds of Wildermore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have wandered into a sprawling wood in the Whitshaws, once lush and green, but now full of wintry skeletons of trees.
You have come upon a cave high upon a tall tor in the High Knolls. It offers shelter against the cold winds that blow across the craggy peaks.
You have discovered a frozen pond that was once a favoured meeting place for the young Ents of Balewood.
You have discovered a rocky outcropping overlooking the Limlight Gorge where several Ents have made their home in the wake of Núrzum's destruction.
Home to one of the eldest Ents in Fangorn, Leaflock, this mead is buried in deep snow from Núrzum's passing.

deed.name: Settlements of Wildermore
deed.description: Discover the settlements of the people of Wildermore.

objective.text: Discover the settlements of the people of Wildermore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered a great settlement of the Writhendowns, home to Thane Cynegar. The people of Scylfig stand poised to repel an impending assault by the White Hand.
The town of Dunfast, a small village full of ordinary peasants, lies silent and empty in this troubled time.
Byre Tor, a wild stronghold in the tors of the High Knolls, is now inhabited by the enemy, its banners defiled by the White Hand.
A makeshift camp led by a champion of Wildermore, this settlement was built recently to prepare the Rohirrim of Writhendowns for an impending White Hand attack.
A small camp hidden amongst the outskirts of the Balewood, Cerdic and his men keep watch on the nearby road for sign of more White Hand invaders.
Iothete, a villager from Dunfast, abandoned his home long ago and left his people, coming to this remote spot in the Elderwood.
This small town in the High Knolls once offered a tall view upon all of Wildermore, but the people who lived here were slain to the very last by the Uruks from Isengard.

deed.name: These Hostile Lands
deed.description: Discover where the foes of the Rohirrim dwell in Wildermore.

objective.text: Discover where the foes of the Rohirrim dwell in Wildermore.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: Now inhabited by all manner of unnatural evil, this abandoned fishing village was once the main source of food for the people of Scylfig.
This substantial White Hand settlement occupies a strategic location in the Writhendowns, and aims to keep a watchful eye on the city of Forlaw.
A White Hand outpost erected recently to scout Scylfig for the coming attack.
Snow-cats of the High Knolls prowl in great numbers on this snowy hill, starving as their prey die from the cold.
Built atop the remains of an elder Huorn of Fangorn, this camp is now home to the White Hand forces in Balewood.

deed.name: Protecting the Lands of Wildermore
deed.description: Though Núrzum has perished, the enemy still lingers in Wildermore.

objective.text: Wildermore's lands are not yet safe.

deed.name: Known to the Eorlingas
deed.description: Your name is now known amongst the Eorlingas, and they know that you act in their interest.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now known to the Eorlingas.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Eorlingas

deed.name: Friend to the Eorlingas
deed.description: You are now considered a friend to the Eorlingas of the Westemnet.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have become a welcome friend among the Eorlingas.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Eorlingas

deed.name: Ally to the Eorlingas
deed.description: When the Eorlingas are in need of aid, they expect that you will find your way to the forefront of battle to assist them.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now a trusted ally among the Eorlingas
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with the Eorlingas

deed.name: Kindred to the Eorlingas
deed.description: You may not have been born an Eorling, but you are welcome wherever you go in the eastern Westemnet.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within Eastfold, Kingstead, and Broadacres where you are not known. The people feel a deep kinship with you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Eorlingas

deed.name: Known to the Helmingas
deed.description: Your name is now known amongst the Helmingas, and they know that you act in their interest.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now known to the Helmingas.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Helmingas

deed.name: Friend to the Helmingas
deed.description: You are now considered a friend to the Helmingas of the Westemnet.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have become a welcome friend among the Helmingas.

deed.name: Ally to the Helmingas
deed.description: When the Helmingas are in need of aid, they expect that you will find your way to the forefront of battle to assist them.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now a trusted ally among the Helmingas

deed.name: Kindred to the Helmingas
deed.description: You may not have been born a Helming, but you are welcome wherever you go in the western Westemnet.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within Stonedeans and Westfold where you are not known. The people feel a deep kinship with you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with the Helmingas
