questComplete.progressOverride: Complete On the Brink of Victory

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 2
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point.

deed.name: Quick as the Wind
deed.description: Hunters who can release arrows the fastest tend to be the first to eat.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The faster you can put multiple arrows in your enemy, the faster they hit the ground.

deed.name: Blindsided
deed.description: Attacking one's blind side may not be the most valiant tactic, but it is nevertheless effective.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: No one is likely to mistake you for a master of the sword, but they will learn to respect your blade nonetheless or suffer the consequences.

deed.name: Retaliatory Strike
deed.description: A Guardian is always a fierce opponent, but never more so than when they are angered.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Strike your foes not just with force, but with contempt. Few enemies can stand to turn from an opponent who treats them with disdain, and so you can arrange their downfall.

deed.name: First Line of Defence
deed.description: A Guardian would rather be nowhere else than the front line, ready for battle.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your second wind endures through long battle and renews your strength.

deed.name: Swept Away
deed.description: You have vanquished many foes with your Sweeping Cut and many more will fall.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Protecting another sometimes means removing threats from the field in the most expedient manner possible.

deed.name: Efficient Shield-work
deed.description: Bring up your shield and never let it falter.

deed.name: Dazed and Confused
deed.description: A dazed and confused enemy is a much easier target than one who is alert and aware.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Drawing, aiming, and firing at speed is an act of skill and of will. With enough training, the petty distractions of battle will not disrupt your perfect form.

deed.name: Master of Beasts
deed.description: Of the magicks that can be wielded by Man or Elf, the hearts of beasts are among the most closely tied to the visible world, and so there are many who strive to master them.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There are signs and sigils that can be used by the Wise to speak to the heart of a wild creature without words, but those who truly understand this art know that it is not the sign that speaks most loudly to the beast, but your own heart.

deed.name: Dúnadan-learning
deed.description: While the Elves were long known as masters of lore, the Dúnedain of old were very near their equals in many arts.

objective.text: Use Signs of Power or Battle to improve your skill.

skillUsed.loreInfo: At the height of their power, the ancient Dúnedain held great stores of lore, and unlike the Elves whose memories span Ages and thus commit little to writing, the Dúnedain wrote many volumes describing this lore. Most were lost in great calamities past, but some survive today and from these the Lore-masters learn a great deal.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Signs of Power or Battle

deed.name: Improved Storm-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the sudden fury of storms in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which makes the sudden echoes of the storm even more dangerous to your enemies than before.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Storm-lore or Lightning Strike

deed.name: A Shocking Strike
deed.description: Call upon the power of lightning to strike your foes.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Lightning is among the most powerful forces of nature. Mastering it is no small feat, but the benefits of doing so are not to be underestimated.

deed.name: The Study of Fire-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of fire in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may raise the temperature of the air about your enemies still higher.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Fire-lore or Sign of Battle: Wizard's Fire

deed.name: The Study of Frost-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of frost in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may lower the temperature of the air about your enemies still lower.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Frost-lore or Gust of Wind

deed.name: Combat Traps
deed.description: Very few keep their eyes down to look for a tripwire, and if they do, they'll never see you coming.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It takes practiced skill to lay a trap in the midst of a fray, but the benefits are worth the hours spent in practice.

deed.name: Sturdy Traps
deed.description: Traps are not by their nature terribly dependable weapons. They are nevertheless effective.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is all in the knots. Some are strong, but can be pulled apart by great strength or desperate struggles. Others seem to hold but loosely until they are pulled against, at which point they tighten like a deadly noose.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use your Set Trap or Triple Trap skills

deed.name: Strong Draw
deed.description: The strength required to pull a bowstring back with sufficient power to penetrate armour is sorely underestimated by warriors who do not understand the art of the Hunter.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is more than brute strength involved. No one can hold the string back so far for so long. Such a pull must be followed by a swift and sure release before fatigue spoils the shot.

deed.name: Heightened Senses
deed.description: Hunters are often renowned for their ability to see what is hidden and follow signs that few others are even aware of.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your eyes and ears are your ultimate allies. No detail must escape you, whether it be at five-hundred paces or mere inches before you, as you study the earth and the stories that it can tell.

deed.name: Master of the Staff
deed.description: Even a lore-master will occasionally find himself face-to-face with the enemy. At times like these, a sturdy oaken staff may take on a simpler and most vital role.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have found that there are few magicks that can duplicate the effects of a good rap upon the skull with a stout piece of oak.

deed.name: The Best Defence is a Better Offence
deed.description: While you are known for your defensive technique, you are not to be underestimated when on the offensive.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is a special rage that is reserved for those who would threaten the lives of a Guardian's companions. You have felt its heat often enough to know its power.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use War-chant, Thrust, or Smashing Stab

deed.name: Stoic
deed.description: Many would call Guardians fatalistic. Perhaps they should try holding a bridge alone against countless Orcs?

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The world throws a great many things your way -- most of them are heavy, sharp, or on fire, and all of them are addressed to you with ill will and poor tidings. It is best just to take these things in stride.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Guardian's Pledge, Protection, or Protection by the Sword

deed.name: Phantom Pain
deed.description: In the heat of battle, pain is to be ignored. You can lick your wounds when your foe has fallen.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned that your enemies' greatest weakness can be their pride. You have mastered the art of turning their rage and ignorance against them.

deed.name: Grim Challenge
deed.description: A Guardian's task is to protect his allies from the assaults of their foes.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your taunts and jibes draw the wrath of your foes upon you, distracting them from your allies.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Challenge, Fray the Edge, or Engage

deed.name: Final Straw
deed.description: Practice harrying your foes, encouraging them to expose their vulnerabilities.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The guardian knows patience and possesses great reserves of endurance. You know how to whittle away at the composure and control of your foes until they undo themselves.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Hammer Down, Juggernaut, or Cataclysmic Shout

deed.name: Heat of Battle
deed.description: A Guardian's most important role is to ensure the lives of their companions. A Guardian who forgets this creed is no Guardian at all, but a preening fool.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is no thrill to battle without a large audience to appreciate your handiwork. If that audience is composed mainly of blood-foes, then so much the better.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Thrill of Danger, Overwhelm, or Litany of Defiance in battle

deed.name: Blocking Force
deed.description: Above all, a Guardian must be where they are needed and quickly, for your companions are not so sturdy as you.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

condition.loreInfo: Few things sharpen the wit or quicken the feet so effectively as a rain of arrows and blades.

deed.name: Quick Wrist
deed.description: A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

condition.loreInfo: Few things sharpen the wit or quicken the feet so effectively as a rain of arrows and blades.

deed.name: Focused and Ready
deed.description: Being able to gain focus in the midst of chaos is a true art that few can master.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Calming your mind and regaining strength in a moments notice will make you a formidable foe.

deed.name: Swift and Sharp
deed.description: It is said that the Elves developed the art of the bow long ago, but the old tales do not say who among them first mastered it.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The art of the bow is both simple and elegant once it is truly mastered.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike enemies with Swift Bow, Barbed Arrow, or Lingering Wound

deed.name: Awareness of Body
deed.description: Clearly, if one is to learn to properly manipulate the forces of nature and other lore, one must first understand the true nature of power.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Incarnate beings -- even the Elves -- were never truly meant to channel the primal energies from which the world is formed, and so it tears at them even as they strive to master it. As you have learned more about the nature of power you have learned to let these powers flow through you with less difficulty, though great care is still called for.

deed.name: Healer
deed.description: Among the most respected forms of learning is that of healing. Every Lore-master should strive to understand this fundamental art.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Tending to the injured and sick is often an exhausting process, but for those like yourself who have taken the lessons of kindness and sacrifice to heart it is also very rewarding.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Heal your fellows with Knowledge of Cures

deed.name: The Study of Wind-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of wind in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which brings stronger gusts to hamper your foe's movements even more.

deed.name: Deep Lore
deed.description: The elements of nature can be truly understood by few and to those few alone will they lend their power.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: All of nature speaks, but to most its voices speak in unyielding riddles. Long ago, the Valar taught the Eldar the truth of some of these riddles. That lore has been passed down through many generations of the wise, for those who are willing to listen.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use your Lore Skills against enemies

deed.name: Knowledge of the Past
deed.description: Much of what simpler folk call magic is tied to the life of the world and is intertwined with it since the time before days.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Those who call upon the knowledge of the ancient world understand that much of this lore is tied to the ever-shifting forces of life and nature and so can call upon those powers to rejuvenate themselves even as they wield them.

deed.name: Proof against all Ills
deed.description: Disease and illness has always been a favoured weapon of the Enemy, and Lore-masters have long striven to contest this power to greater or lesser success.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Sickness is an invisible malaise touching man and beast alike, but it is itself alive. The Lore-master who fully understands its nature can turn the sickness against itself, greatly magnifying their curative powers.

deed.name: Tactically Adept
deed.description: Lore-masters are dreaded for their ability to ignite any object in their hands.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Only through practice can we come to understand the subtlety of our knowledge.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Burning Embers or Sticky Gourd, or either of the Improved versions of these skills

deed.name: Light of Hope
deed.description: Hope is so much more than a naive emotion or dream...it is a wellspring of great power.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: For the novice, the kindling of hope in the heart of another seems a monumental and draining task. For the master who understands the true nature of sacrifice, it becomes a simple and fulfilling exertion.

deed.name: Power and Wisdom
deed.description: There is much to be learned from your enemies, but every Lore-master must decide for themselves how deeply to delve into the darkness. Every being has their limits, and it is never clear when you have taken a step too far until it is too late to return.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Those who understand darkness and power and the dreadful temptation that it poses to the Wise have learned only that they must always stand vigilant against such forces and that there is no final lesson...save for failure.

deed.name: Subtlety of Wisdom
deed.description: Many Lore-masters choose to forsake the garish magics of thunderous fire and glamour, for they may bring the wrath of the Enemy quickly upon them.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have discovered that in the violent confusion of battle, simple distractions can be used to conceal the power of the ancient lore as it is bent to the purpose of war.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Blinding Flash against your enemies

deed.name: Improved Sign of Battle
deed.description: Continue your study of ancient signs and the power they represent.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'I believe that the path to knowledge is a road with no end. I suppose, therefore, that I will probably never get there. That is why I take frequent stops to read, have a bite to eat, lend a hand here or there, that sort of thing. Just because I take my time about it does not mean I have not gotten anywhere. There are secret things that I could show you, but...well, you would probably not enjoy the lesson.' -- Gregori, Wanderer from the Forest
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Sign of Battle: Wizard's Fire

deed.name: Improved Inner Flame
deed.description: Channeling your Inner Flame takes great effort and concentration, but the reward can be quite enlightening.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You've mastered your Inner Flame, able to spread the benefits to nearby allies.

deed.name: The Secret of Tar
deed.description: Refine the quality of your sticky mixtures to make them easier to prepare.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Handling this substance can be, well, a sticky problem. Fortunately, I have perfected a mixture that surmounts the problem. The solution? Now, that would be telling....' -- Vistan, Master of Robes

deed.name: Harmony with Nature
deed.description: Lore-masters are often said to be in harmony with the forces of nature. It is sometimes difficult to understand what is so harmonious about the earth-rents they just ripped open under an enemy's feet however.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Many men believe that being in harmony with nature means being at peace. Nothing could be further from the truth, for it is nature's way to express change, often in the most chaotic and violent manners imaginable. Interestingly, most sailors seem to grasp this lesson quite readily.

deed.name: Improved Sign of Power: Command
deed.description: You have heard that there may be a more complete form of the sign you uncovered previously.

skillUsed.loreInfo: One must take care when employing the sign of command. The imposition of one's will upon another can leave a lasting mark upon both.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Sign of Power: Command

deed.name: True Shot
deed.description: Few of your foes are foolish enough to take to the field of battle without armour, but every armour has its flaws.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The novice Hunter focuses on the art of striking their target true. This is of no concern to you. You are more interested in the art of striking that slot below the shoulder, no wider than an acorn, that opens as they raise their swords.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Critically hit enemies with Penetrating Shot

deed.name: Poison? What Poison?
deed.description: There are many different kinds of poison in Middle-earth. Knowing how to cure them is a life long task.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Many across Middle-earth would be wise to befriend a Hunter with a mastery of poisons.

deed.name: The Quality of Mercy
deed.description: The quality of your shot must not strain your bow. The strain on your target is another matter altogether.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Have...some...mercy!'-- Alobri, the Zealous
skillUsed.progressOverride: Achieve critical hits with Merciful Shot

deed.name: Cut Them Down
deed.description: The Hunter depends on disabling their enemies at key moments in combat to emerge victorious.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A disabled foe, is a dead foe.

deed.name: Tools of the Trade
deed.description: Show your enemies all the different ways you can be dangerous.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Time spent in the wild acquaints the hunter to many forms of animal-emotions. Survival in the wild oft teaches the hunter to shape or inspire that emotion that suits their needs.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Bard's Arrow, Rain of Arrows, or Blood Arrow

deed.name: Deadly Precision
deed.description: Hunters cannot rely on brute force to achieve victory in battle, so it is important to find your enemy's weaknesses.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: To the eye of the trained Hunter, it is clear when an arrow has found its true mark, and another must swiftly follow the first.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land critical hits with your Bow Skills

deed.name: Rapid Fire
deed.description: Your attacks are quick, numerous, and without mercy.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Precision aim comes from training and knowledge of your foe. Know your enemy, know where to send your arrow to cause the greatest result, and be able to let fly with confidence and precision.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Upshot, The One Trap, or Rapid Fire

deed.name: Total Attention
deed.description: Sometimes taking that extra second to concentrate and focus on your target makes all the difference.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: On more than one occasion, you have found it necessary to throw artistry and caution to the winds and simply turn your foes into walking pincushions.

deed.name: Stealthy Shot
deed.description: Many fear Hunters not for the death they bring, but for the silence with which it approaches.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Many warriors seek to turn the tide of battle with bellows and bravery. You find that that fear of an unseen enemy can unnerve foes even more effectively than the sight of a charging madman.

deed.name: Sneaky Sneaky
deed.description: Blending into your surroundings provides both defensive and strategic bonuses.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The deadliest Hunters are the ones you never see...

deed.name: Skill Shot
deed.description: Almost anyone can learn to fire an arrow, but few can shoot like you.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The ability of traps to cause damage is not limited to the jaws of death.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use your Pinning Shot, Explosive Arrow, or Split Shot skills

deed.name: Shot through the Heart
deed.description: Earn a name for yourself and improve the reliability of your most deadly attack.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'You didn't seriously think they all keep their heart in the same place did you? Those that have one at all can be cagey about those sorts of things down here....' -- Jóngir, Cavern-hunter

deed.name: Scorching Rain
deed.description: Whether they burn hot or fall in a rain of arrows, they will fall.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The name of Bard will live long in the memories and hearts of the Free Peoples. The same name can strike fear into the hearts of those who walk in shadows, and in their terror, they leave themselves vulnerable to the strongest attacks of the Hunter's art.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Burn Hot, Rain of Thorns, or Barrage

deed.name: Strong Voice
deed.description: Let loose the cry of war and see your enemy's resolve erode.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Never death, never defeat, never despair. These are not permitted by the Warden...your cause is greater than these.' -- Kais, the Ironhand-warden

deed.name: Expert Hurler
deed.description: In the way of the spear, one always desires to have the option of using the best attack at the right time.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Let the spear drop among your foes, a herald of your arrival.

deed.name: Perseverance
deed.description: Take your foe off their feet to allow yourself to recover.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The well-springs of your morale flow stronger.

deed.name: Terrible Visage
deed.description: Let your enemy look upon your face and see the fear spread across theirs.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Sear your foe with the light of justice, let it expose their weaknesses.

deed.name: Master of the Spear
deed.description: Master the Way of the Spear.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you have become an expert of the spear.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Mighty Blow, Wall of Steel, or Boar's Rush

deed.name: On the Brink of Victory
deed.description: In the face of your confidence, let your opponent's own surety drain away.

skillUsed.loreInfo: As you show your confidence, let doubt grow within your enemy.

deed.name: Mighty Throw
deed.description: The point may always be made sharper.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Fall from the sky and find the heart of your enemy.

deed.name: Master of the Fist
deed.description: Master the Way of the Fist.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you truly have a fist of legend.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Exultation of Battle or Desolation

deed.name: Force of Personality
deed.description: Lead with the fist, and the rest will follow.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Master the passage of the fist, and it shall become inescapable.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Surety of Death, Resolution, or Spear of Virtue

deed.name: Master of the Shield
deed.description: Master the Way of the Shield.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden,...you have achieved excellence with the shield.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Shield Mastery, Celebration of Skill, or Dance of War

deed.name: Know Your Enemy
deed.description: Taunt your foe into error.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A battle is not as satisfying until the enemy will endanger himself to fight you.

deed.name: Dark Before Dawn
deed.description: Your spear-thrust will weaken your foe's armour.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The reach of the spear extends to the courage of your enemy. They know that that they are not beyond the touch of its point.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with The Dark Before Dawn

deed.name: Wary Blocks
deed.description: Strike with your defence foremost in your mind.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Watchfulness in battle serves you well and those in your charge.

deed.name: Shield-trickery
deed.description: Present your foe with your shield...to his face.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Sometimes, your shield is like other weapons, too. Good for hitting things...and usually a little surprising.' -- Jeb Wheaton, Warden of the Trollshaws
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Shield-bash or Behind the Shield

deed.name: Skill and Power
deed.description: Even a routine attack may become more powerful.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Skill in gambits mean that every form may be an advantage to you.

deed.name: Efficient Thrust
deed.description: A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your mastery of the quick thrust will be a boon to you in battles to come.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Quick Thrust or Quick Toss

deed.name: Skillful Blocking
deed.description: Blocking is an art cultivated with practice.

condition.loreInfo: Your shield is a weapon, too, but it is used against weapons.

deed.name: Deadly Insult
deed.description: Do not allow your foe to think of any target but yourself.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Choice words and gestures can focus the foe wonderfully upon yourself.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Warden's Taunt or Warden's Aim

deed.name: A Keen Response
deed.description: A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your mastery of the precise blow will be a boon to you in battles to come.

deed.name: Find Weakness
deed.description: A well-placed hit may be reveal your foe's weaknesses.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Nothing made in this age is without some flaw...do you think something fashioned by these base creatures would be an exception?' -- Krom, Vault-warden
skillUsed.progressOverride: Achieve critical hits with Critical Strike

deed.name: Never Say Die
deed.description: Take respite, however brief, and you can fight on.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Soldier on just a little longer and see it carry you through the battle.

deed.name: Strength of Voice
deed.description: The most powerful music is also the most tiring, and it cannot be sustained for long.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It turns out that nothing strengthens the voice quite like yelling at the top of your lungs during the heat of battle.

deed.name: Light in the Dark
deed.description: Many creatures of evil and darkness do not fare well before the beauty and light of music.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: As you have come to better understand the true nature of the darkness you fight, so have your songs come to dismay them all the more.

deed.name: Dauntless
deed.description: Easing the fears of your allies is an important role in any fellowship.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Let us join the tale that never ends. It goes on and on, my friends. And so shall we.' -- Burt Ninetails, Minstrel Tale-weaver

deed.name: Improved Herald's Strike
deed.description: Be a herald of your opponent's defeat.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is piece of victory in every skillful swing of a sword. Draw heart from the strike, let it herald your ultimate triumph.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike enemies with Herald's Strike, Hero's Strike, or Dissonant Strike

deed.name: Lyrics of Bravery
deed.description: Become a master of your own will, and you will not so easily fall under the sway of others.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Those who are composed with the resolve to face their greatest fears shall conquer them.

deed.name: Improved Raise the Spirit
deed.description: Master the words that may raise the spirits of those who stand upon the edge of despair.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Do not give in to despair, friend. Trust in me as I trust in you, and we shall overcome even this.' -- Éadoin, Dawn-singer
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use any version of Raise the Spirit

deed.name: Spectacular Finish
deed.description: A strong finish makes your words and melodies all the more potent.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your audience may recall bits of a verse, but a bombastic finish is far more memorable.

deed.name: Dynamic Performance
deed.description: Improvisation is a vital skill for any performer.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Sometimes you have to work around a fickle crowd.

deed.name: Silver Tongue
deed.description: Lately you have been hearing a faint strain of music, seemingly more beautiful even than that of the Elves. But where could it be coming from?

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is said that there is an etherial chorus that underpins all that is real. By catching the faint strains of this ancient song, you can call upon your songs more quickly in the heat of battle.

deed.name: Harmonious Melody
deed.description: The magic of the voice is a delicate thing, easily disturbed by failures of harmony or rhythm.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have mastered the art of intertwining your individual ballads into a greater work to inspire the hearts of your fellows.

deed.name: Herald's Hammer
deed.description: In this time of strife, even a minstrel cannot travel the roads unarmed.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have realized that, like music, there is a rhythm and tempo to battle that you have begun to master.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike enemies with Herald's Strike, Hero's Strike, or Dissonant Strike

deed.name: Graceful Demeanour
deed.description: For those who have lost all hope during battle, perhaps new hope can be kindled in between the notes of a song...

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: While this song is commonly heard in the midst of desperate battle, it is strangely among the most soothing of and restful of all melodies, and therein lies its power to restore the spirit of those on the edge of the void.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Enlivening Grace or Improved Enlivening Grace

deed.name: Smooth Voice
deed.description: The Piercing Cry is rough on the throat, making it difficult to utter too often without losing one's voice.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have mastered the art of the Piercing Cry such that you can use it more frequently without the need to soothe your poor throat at the local pub.

deed.name: Subtle Movements
deed.description: Unfortunately, the old tales are filled with incidents of foolhardy minstrels finding themselves riddled with arrows as they bravely sing their last upon the field of battle.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Motivational singing has been shown to be far more effective than motivational speaking.

deed.name: Powerful Voice
deed.description: Minstrels often find it difficult to make themselves heard over the din of battle.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: When all else fails, sing very loudly.

deed.name: Heralded Saviour
deed.description: It is believed that by lightening the heart with song, one can more easily weather the physical ills of the world.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: So much of fear and pain is a matter of perception, and with the strains of your voice you can make such perceptions easier to bear for those who weary of battle and war.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Song of Aid or Inspire Fellows

deed.name: Enduring Morale
deed.description: Increase your vigour and find greater well-springs of spirit within yourself.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The stalwart are those who stand strong long after lesser men have abandoned hope.

deed.name: Power of Song
deed.description: Cultivate the endurance to last through any conflict.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Breath is the life we draw in and draw upon. So long as you draw breath, you have the power to act...and to save.' -- James Grant, Healer of Ills

deed.name: Improved Echoes of Battle
deed.description: Let the calls of battle echo from the hills and mountains in a great clamour.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The clash of clamour and battle shall be intensified by your songs, sending your foes down to swift defeat.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Melody of Battle, Echoes of Battle or Timeless Echoes of Battle

deed.name: Unrelenting
deed.description: It is said that minstrels who can maintain the most difficult keys can cause disorienting pain to their foes.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have trained your voice such that you can disorient your enemies with strange and painful tones.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land Critical hits with Piercing Cry

deed.name: Life-singer
deed.description: The songs of life are quite draining, and only the most experienced minstrels can use them for long.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: In time, you have learned to draw strength from your own songs of healing, and they no longer tire you as they once did.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use your Healing and Motivation Skills

deed.name: Battle-hymn
deed.description: The Cry of the Valar is considered one of the most stirring pieces of music ever sung upon the battlefield.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is said that this cry was used by Elves who had once laid eyes upon the isle of Valinor, far across the sea to the West.

deed.name: All in All
deed.description: Your Blade Wall has the power to fell many a foe in a single swing.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your blades now move with such speed as to dismay your foes, and with this speed comes greater power.

deed.name: Wild Thing
deed.description: Food, drink, companionship -- for the Champion, all of these are second to the joys of battle...drink is a very close second though.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Some find the Champion's lust for battle to be distasteful. Too bad they do not know what they are missing.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land Critical Hits using Wild Attack

deed.name: Mighty Blast
deed.description: You must master your horn-blowing technique to use the horns of the South Kingdom.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Many of the nations of Middle-earth employ distinctive styles of horns. While some are imbued with a greater power than another, the power and will of the wielder can make up for much.

deed.name: Deep Strikes
deed.description: Deep wounds are deadly wounds. Many a warrior survives the battle, but not the night that follows.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your wild and vicious blows cause terrible wounds to your enemies.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Critically Hit enemies with Rend, Brutal Strikes or Bracing Attack

deed.name: Deadly Strikes
deed.description: Champions are known for their reckless and powerful strikes in battle, cleaving any foolish enough to stand in their way.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is no holding back once the battle has been joined, no time to be clouded by restraint or hesitation. The time for caution is before, and the time for regret is after.

deed.name: Battle Acumen
deed.description: Master your understanding of battle and the space in which it takes place so that you can end battles more swiftly in the future.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The Champion is acutely aware of his surroundings throughout battle. This sensitivity and understanding can allow more ready access to skills when a Champion's understanding and control has reached a greater level.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Champion's Duel, Fury of Blades, or Unbreakable

deed.name: Call of the Wild
deed.description: Champions prefer to fight their enemies face-to-face, so that they may look their foes in the eye as they fall.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned a display of swordsmanship that enemies find intimidating, such that they fear to turn their back to you.

deed.name: At the Ready
deed.description: Champions are students of battle and become adept at controlling the ebb and flow of each conflict.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A true champion knows how and when to draw focus to himself or to divert that focus to others.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Ebbing Ire, Battle Frenzy, or Second Wind

deed.name: Winds of the Storm
deed.description: Blade-storm is one of the Champion's most impressive attacks, causing considerable havoc upon the field of battle.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Through grueling practice, you have refined your skill to inflict even greater damage and havoc upon your foes.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Blade-Storm, Remorseless Strike or Sudden Defence

deed.name: Clobbered
deed.description: There is no time like the present to do some clobbering.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: With every attack there is an opening. If you are under attack from all sides, then you can keep yourself occupied taking advantage of all of them.

deed.name: A Challenge Accepted
deed.description: The Champion is afraid of none and welcomes any foe who accepts their challenge.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: For champions who have mastered this style of battle, numbers no longer seem important, as their strength grows with each enemy they face.

deed.name: Swift to Anger
deed.description: Swift Strike and Swift Blade are dangerous attacks, but require dedication to master them.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your blade now not only moves faster than the eye can follow, but you have found the trick to following such rapid blows with devastating power.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike enemies with Swift Strike or Swift Blade

deed.name: No Surrender
deed.description: Sometimes you do not have time to work yourself up to a task; you must simply hurl yourself into the breach.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: For those champions to whom battle is an old friend, the blood can be made to sing to the memory of old conflicts before your blade is even unsheathed.

deed.name: Athletic
deed.description: Build your sprinting stamina with focused training.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Many a champion improves his running strength barrelling into battles or to the aid of an ally. On occassion, a champion finds all the training useful at the other end of a fight -- but more often its to find the next foe before the last has come to rest on the ground.

deed.name: Flashing Blade
deed.description: The Blade-wall is a staple of battle for champions, allowing them to engage multiple opponents in battle and evening the odds when outnumbered.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Those who have become accomplished masters of the Blade-wall can use it to manoeuvre opponents into dangerous positions.

deed.name: Always in Control
deed.description: Master self-control, and many techniques will be possible that were not before.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Why is it that the last thing anyone expects from me is a little self-control? Do you think anyone lasts particularly long swinging a pair of blades about your body without a little control?' -- Grímr, Champion of the Blue Mountains
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Devastating Strike, Exchange of Blows, or Adamant

deed.name: Heroic Resolve
deed.description: You are more than just a champion for the people of Middle Earth, you are a true hero.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is true that sometimes success in battle may take a toll on the conscience of the victor. Not all enemies begin as such and even the champion, confident in his cause, may grieve for the fallen.

deed.name: Bountiful Mercy
deed.description: Learn to identify the turning point in a foe's strength and strike.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The veteran eye can sometimes see when a foe's strength starts to flag even before the enemy himself knows it.

deed.name: Time of Need
deed.description: Some champions have been known to hurl themselves into battle with such vigour that they injure themselves more grievously than the enemy does.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You did not choose the path of the champion out of a finely honed sense of caution, or in hope of a long and healthy life. You seek to hear the vibrant song of battle.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Dire Need, Great Cleave, or Controlled Burn

deed.name: Tight Grip
deed.description: Practice your weapon-recovering strike; it could save your life...or a friend's.

skillUsed.loreInfo: In a sword-fight, it is usually a safe bet that the man without a blade is in a bad way. You, however, have learned how to hedge that bet better than most.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Riposte, Ferocious Strikes, or Raging Blade

deed.name: Rip to Shreds
deed.description: Your attacks tear through your opponents, leaving none standing.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'If you have gone to the trouble of getting past enough hide, metal, or mail to make them bleed, you might find it worth your while to cut a strap or two on your way out. I usually do.' -- Brethilthor, Stone-troll Slayer
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Rend, Brutal Strikes, or Bracing Attack

deed.name: Raging Storm
deed.description: The Champion has a number of skills at their disposal, but perhaps none more deadly than their remorseless nature.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have discovered a particular flow and momentum to battle that allows you to execute the Blade-storm with considerably less effort.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land critical blows with Blade-storm, Remorseless Strike or Raging Blade

deed.name: Adherent of Elendil
deed.description: Invoke the name of Elendil, the Elf-friend and king of old, and let his example guide your blade.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The blood of Westernesse carries strength to this day, no matter how distant the days of the kings of old may seem.

deed.name: Inspire Valour
deed.description: A Captain is someone to look up to and admire. Their sound technique and valour inspires others to keep fighting.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is said that a true sign of the Kings of old was the power to heal the sick and injured. Perhaps a trace of their blood runs through your veins?
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land a Critical or Devastate with Valiant Strike or Inspire

deed.name: Quick Wrist
deed.description: A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.

objective.text: A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.

condition.loreInfo: A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.

deed.name: Renewed Voice
deed.description: A trumpet-call and cry of triumph oft begin the rage of war.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your anger is rightly feared upon the battlefield, for many foes have fallen before it.

deed.name: Never in Doubt
deed.description: Before entering battle you must visualize your triumph to ensure the desired outcome.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is greater strength for the courageous than even that which they give to others. It can lead to greater independence, but may also make imparting direct commands impractical.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Crit or Devastate with Sure Strike

deed.name: In Darkest Days
deed.description: Even when the situation seems most grim, the Captain is a light that pierces through the darkness and inspires hope in the hopeless.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The tide of battle is at your command, and it may ebb only if you give it leave to. The commander must yield the advantage, but strike with it and you will strike with ever greater strength and vigour.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land a Critical Hit or Devastate with Blade of Elendil

deed.name: A Sense of Urgency
deed.description: Some things are better when you take your time, decimating your enemies is not one of them.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your voice has become powerful, able to rattle multiple opponents.

deed.name: Precise Ally
deed.description: You must field your archer to practice his art in order to cultivate greater skill and precision.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You understand well the role of the archer on the battlefield and the need for precision. Under your training and guidance, your ally has achieved new levels of excellence.

deed.name: Deeds before Words
deed.description: Be an example to your shield-brother, and you will find your inspiration greater still.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Action is the best spark to kindle fire in your shield-brother's heart.

deed.name: Valour
deed.description: Sometimes courage and motivation just aren't enough, you need to dig deep for that little bit extra.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is not possible for each kind word or bold proclamation to have the same effect. The hearts of your companions will receive them each time anew. You have learned how to make the markedly inspiring even more so.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Crit or Devastate with Words of Courage or Rallying Cry

deed.name: With Absolute Certainty
deed.description: Sometimes you can't afford mistakes.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your skill with the blade allows you to greatly protect yourself.

deed.name: Grave Digger
deed.description: You aim to inflict a grave wound that your enemy will never fully recover from.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Even when the need is great or desperate, if the commander upon the field is composed, a personal sacrifice may yet yield a greater gift of inspiration and hope.

deed.name: Improved Routing Cry
deed.description: Fortunately, being the centre of attention in a battle can help lead your allies through safely.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned the art of aiding your troops by making yourself the centre of the enemy's attention, and your allies will probably live longer for it.

deed.name: Fear No Darkness
deed.description: Warriors must have courage to do battle, and in battle it is your sworn duty to ensure they have it.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There are words you have learned, mundane words filled with a truth that works magic in the hearts of free wills.

deed.name: Devastation
deed.description: A captain is known for their leadership, but underestimate them in battle and be laid to waste.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your foes have come to fear your battle-cry as the harbinger of death and defeat.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land Critical Hits and Devastates with Devastating Blow

deed.name: Now for Wrath
deed.description: All the stalwart bravery in the world will not save a warrior who no longer has the strength to lift their sword.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: There is an old, old art to summoning the last vestiges of strength from a soldier's worn and injured limbs -- an art that you have now mastered.

deed.name: A Call to Arms
deed.description: When a Captain calls for aid, they will never be alone.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your banner is renowned for its presence at the forefront of battle, leading warriors forth to crush the enemy wherever they might flee or hide.

deed.name: Captain's Victory
deed.description: Victory is rarely achieved without help. The Captain inspires those around them to heed their call and be more than they ever thought they could be.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your banner is held aloft by those who would stave off the tides of darkness, holding firm where others might break and flee.

deed.name: Brother in Arms
deed.description: A good Captain takes pride, not in individual glory, but rather the shared success of a unit.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your banner has become renowned among the brave, and those who rally to it believe in the strength of your leadership.

deed.name: Strong Voice
deed.description: All the florid phrases and knowledge of the hearts of warriors will avail you not if you lack the strength to even draw a breath.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: True words of courage come from the heart, and they draw upon your strength more greatly than any sword -- but you have mastered them, and they now come easily to you.

deed.name: Tactical Prowess
deed.description: Master the call to arms and the empowerment of your shield-brother.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The army on the field is one arm as much as it is a thousand. The arm that matters most in the moment is the one holding the blade best positioned to strike. Inspire your brother to deliver the blow, and you all will have swung the tide to victory.

deed.name: Expert Attacks
deed.description: A great captain must lead by example. Prove your skill in battle!

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your martial skills have been well-proven upon the fields of battle, and your foes have come to respect the power of your blade.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land Critical Hits and Devastates with Devastating Blow

deed.name: Quick Wrist
deed.description: The best remedy for an explosive offence is a sound defence.

condition.loreInfo: Pain is a good teacher, and there is no armour as effective as not being beneath an enemy's blade when it falls.

deed.name: Mass Confusion
deed.description: An opponent who cannot think clearly is vulnerable.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Some creatures are too dangerous to be allowed to fight unimpeded. By interfering with their weapons, or forcing them off-balance, you can slow them down.

deed.name: Burglarize
deed.description: Take what you want and never apologize.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A steady hand can Burgle great riches from unwitting targets.

deed.name: Footpad
deed.description: If you cannot be seen, you cannot be killed. So do not be seen.

objective.text: Distract your enemies and improve your ability to remain unseen as you move about.

skillUsed.loreInfo: One of the most important tricks to moving stealthily is learning to move when your enemy's eyes are elsewhere.

deed.name: Bleeding is Better
deed.description: There is much to be learned from seeing a foe's reaction to an open wound, and you consider yourself a scholar.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You are capable of landing precise blows quickly, bringing to an end in short order what might have been a long battle.

deed.name: No Time For Games
deed.description: You must exercise patience and self control in battle, and always make efforts to ensure your opponent does not do the same.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It has long been known that the forces of Evil suffer from impatience and ill-tempers, and you have learned the knack of using that to your own advantage.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Provoke or Trick Removal skills

deed.name: Better and Better
deed.description: With each blow you improve and become more dangerous to your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Precision and patience yield perfection and, for your foe, new depths of pain.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Critical Hit Chain opening skills

deed.name: Opportunist
deed.description: Every creature has its weak spots -- eyes, throat, spleen, something -- you just need to figure out what they are.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have grown skilled at discovering and exploiting the weaknesses of your enemies.

deed.name: Leaf-walker
deed.description: Moving silently is easy -- moving silently and quickly? That is a challenge....

skillUsed.loreInfo: Escaping from the middle of a fray requires more than just subtlety -- it requires subtlety and a quick pair of feet.

deed.name: Finish What You Started
deed.description: An explosive start can be ruined if you do not follow through. Make sure you finish what you started.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Burglars work best when taking advantage of confused and overwhelmed opponents. Once allies have an enemy trapped, then your skills come fully into play.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Critical Hit chain finishing skills

deed.name: Perplexing Riddle
deed.description: A clever burglar can confuse opponents with odd challenges and riddles.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Riddles have been an honoured challenge in Middle-earth since time before memory. Even hardened warriors may find themselves caught up in the game.

deed.name: Hidden Dagger
deed.description: It is always surprising how many enemies forget to look over their shoulder during a fight.

objective.text: Strike your enemies from the shadows.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is neither fair nor particularly honourable, but striking from the shadows is safer than hurling yourself into the mouth of some fire-breathing monster.

deed.name: Resistance is Futile
deed.description: No matter how hard your opponents fight back, your resolve will always win out in the end.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The best riddle is one whose answer is obvious the moment after it is revealed. The strongest puzzles are the ones tempered through trial and proven with practice.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use your Riddle or Trick Removal skills

deed.name: Swift and Subtle
deed.description: With extensive practice, your Subtle Stab will improve in deadliness.

objective.text: Strike enemies using the Subtle Stab skill.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You are skilled at taking advantage of weaknesses in your enemy's defences, allowing you to make telling blows with but a simple stab.

deed.name: Side-step
deed.description: When Orcs are raining arrows down upon you, you had best have a spring in your step.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

condition.loreInfo: Pain is a good teacher, and there is no armour as effective as not being beneath an enemy's blade when it falls.

deed.name: Strike from Shadows
deed.description: You have only one shot when ambushing an opponent -- make it count!

objective.text: Strike from Shadows

skillUsed.loreInfo: When attacking from surprise, it is easier to find gaps in an enemy's armour and make your blow count.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Land Critical blows with skills that benefit from stealth

deed.name: Cunning Wound
deed.description: Burglars cannot rely on strength and power to defeat their enemies -- but a severely bleeding wound will often do the trick.

objective.text: Cunning Wound

skillUsed.loreInfo: Sometimes even the most innocuous wound will bleed profusely. You have learned how best to bleed your foe.

deed.name: Trickster
deed.description: So what if it is an old trick? The old tricks are the best tricks.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is all about the dust. Some burglars will just use whatever is lying around, but you know better...the finer the grains, the bigger the cloud.

deed.name: Cruel Odds
deed.description: To better twist chance in your favour, you must first master the art of piling victory on top of success.

skillUsed.loreInfo: When facing off against the gambling Burglar, the odds are that their enemies find cruel chance at the point of a blade.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Achieve a critical hit with any skill unlocked by a critical hit

deed.name: An Unpleasant Surprise
deed.description: Those who strike first often see more success, and you like your odds.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Now your foes will know -- however briefly -- that location truly is everything, and that this particular location is somewhere behind their back.

deed.name: On the Move
deed.description: Make the most of successful coordination with your allies, be it to strike fast or ready an escape.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned that the momentum of success may sometimes lead forwards and sometimes backwards. When you have the edge, taking a gamble is not such a gamble as it might have been before.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use the Touch and Go skill

deed.name: Insult to Injury
deed.description: As a burglar, you know that you must take advantage of any opportunity that presents itself and revel in the moments when luck is on your side.

skillUsed.loreInfo: If they thought your riddle perplexing, just wait until they hear this....
skillUsed.progressOverride: Crit with a Critical Hit chain skill

deed.name: Shield Expertise
deed.description: To truly measure the worth of a shield, one must master it as a living thing with a motion and cunning equal to that of any sword or bow.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your enemies believe that your shield is simply an obstacle to be circumvented, and so go to their defeat believing, never understanding whence came the blow that felled them.

deed.name: Controlled Breathing
deed.description: There is no point in going into a fight if you always run out of breath just as things are getting good.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is important to time your breathing with the rise and fall of your blows as you hew through your enemies.

deed.name: Reactive Block
deed.description: A shield is not simply some hobbit's door that has been strapped to your arm. It is as effective a weapon as any, and better than most for one who has mastered it.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The unexpected shock of a blow against a sturdy shield can injure the attacker more than the defender. All you need to do is add a little power to your blocks, and your foes will feel it more than you do.

deed.name: Stinging Blow
deed.description: Sometimes the most basic styles avail the greatest results.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your simple, stinging blow yields greater damage against your foes.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike enemies with the Sting skill

deed.name: Guardian's Ward
deed.description: Constant vigilance is needed to protect oneself in battle. A moment's forgetfulness can be the end of you.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Some fools would believe that a solid defence means sitting around like some kind of rock. If only it were that easy or restful, but you know better.

deed.name: Brave Heart
deed.description: Every warrior tests his limits and faces his own mortality in battle.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You can no longer be found wanting, for your bravery is matched by only a few, and they too are great warriors.

deed.name: Quickness
deed.description: Time is of the essence in battle. It can either be your ally or your enemy. It is best to have it on your side, because you are not going to beat it in the end.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: As you have continued to practice your Sting skill, your attacks have become noticeably faster.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike enemies with the Sting skill

deed.name: Hit Where It Hurts
deed.description: A well-placed strike can throw your opponent off-balance.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Without balance, movement is hampered; without movement, speed is hindered; without speed, the fight is against you. Remember this and apply it to your foe.' -- Tirnedhruith, Guardian Trainer

deed.name: Never Bashful
deed.description: Guardians don't always stand out, but if underestimated, they've been known to get violent.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'Nowadays, when someone asks for credit, I just give them \qThe Look'\q...you know? Sure, I learned it on the field, but it still comes in handy at the shop.' -- Patrick Pot-patcher, Guardian, retired

deed.name: To the Rescue
deed.description: Above all, a Guardian must be where they are needed and quickly, for your companions are not so sturdy as you.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

condition.loreInfo: Few things sharpen the wit or quicken the feet so effectively as a rain of arrows and blades.

deed.name: Quick of Foot
deed.description: Practice your stamp to interrupt your foes, for using the skill repeatedly will help you to perform it with greater ease in the future.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A quick boot, swiftly applied, can disrupt many an enemy's plans -- and it is best that the plans of the enemy do not come to fruition.

deed.name: Rune Master
deed.description: You rely on your Runestone in battle, and together, you cannot fail.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Runes may bind the stone upon which they are written, preserving meaning and integrity.

deed.name: Winter-storm
deed.description: Your narratives combine the chill of a winter night and the turbulence of the fiercest storm.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Greatness can be seen in the details; great details can be seen in the world.

deed.name: Versatility
deed.description: Your enemies would be wise to not judge a book by its cover and to not underestimate a Rune-keeper.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Kindly do words come to those who need them and linger with care.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Mending Verse, Sustaining Bolt, or Smouldering Wrath

deed.name: Tale of Rage
deed.description: Learn to let your temper loose in your writing, and it shall burn through to your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Wrath, like fire, may burn bright but cold...or hot and nigh invisible. With your rage channelled, you control the venting of your anger and stoke the fires as you wish.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Strike with Wrath of Flame skills

deed.name: Thunderous Words
deed.description: The spark may light the way to greater things.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Few are prepared the first time they experience even the simplest of your runes.

deed.name: Master of Allusion
deed.description: Your ability to write between the lines confounds your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Meaning within meaning and allusions away from the truth can work to a rune-keeper's advantage.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use any Words of Grace skills

deed.name: Self Starter
deed.description: You draw strength from within and find motivation that will carry you further than before.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'I find that necessity is an excellent motivator.' -- Gronir, dwarf stone-keeper

deed.name: Stare at the Flame
deed.description: There are few things as simple and beautiful as fire, and the Rune-keeper knows how to use its majesty to their advantage.

skillUsed.loreInfo: When you know your purpose, you can craft your words with intent to be effective and yet cunningly subtle.

deed.name: Conflagration of Runes
deed.description: With practice, you can kindle flame from fragments faster and with less effort.

skillUsed.loreInfo: 'If you cannot endure the heat, stay of the library' -- Ciryalen, Rune-keeper in the north

deed.name: Confounding Principles
deed.description: Improve the effect your touch can have upon your foe.

skillUsed.loreInfo: If only your foes would learn to fear your reach, they might realize there is no place where they are safe when assailing you.

deed.name: The Prophetic Word
deed.description: Practice the art of casting your vision forwards, and you shall be able to do it with greater frequency.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Grave portents may give the uncertain pause, but with practiced eye, foresight may come more swiftly to sight.

deed.name: A Critical Writ
deed.description: Writs are always effective, sometimes more than others.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The cold bites and the fire burns, but why would not tongues of flame also bear teeth? Fire and frost are not so different in their harsher aspects--though inimical to one another, they may be doubly so to those afflicted by them.

deed.name: Harsh Words
deed.description: Learn how to unsettle your foe with your unrelenting assertions.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Unending discourse is your art, but it can sometimes take your foes by surprise. Of course, such is your aim.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Ceaseless Argument, Epic for the Ages, Essence of Flame

deed.name: Written in Stone
deed.description: Through fire, ice, and sustainability, you can fell any foe.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Insults, as burns, may fade slowly from memory and leave scars longer still.

deed.name: Epic Essay
deed.description: Like all the great tales, your battles end in an epic conclusion.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned to leave your foes with a memory of biting cold that can linger long in their mind...and their feet.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Ceaseless Argument, Epic for the Ages, Essay of Fire

deed.name: New Beginnings
deed.description: When one door closes, another opens.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Welcome words can be given to those in need with less notice taken by those who would not see them sent.

deed.name: Alternate Ending
deed.description: The ending of this tale is yours to determine.

skillUsed.loreInfo: An epic is sometimes best presented in a shorter form.

deed.name: Sign of the Times
deed.description: All signs point to a grisly end for your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Fire weakens as it burns, reducing your foe's protections against fire.

deed.name: Master of Tragedy
deed.description: Your studies in the construction of tragedy can have tremendous impact upon your foes.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Tragedy in literature can tug at the heartstrings...tragedy in the world can tug down fortified walls.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Critical Hits with Fury of the Storm skills

deed.name: Closing Remarks
deed.description: Having the final word does not guarantee a positive outcome, but it certainly helps.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The crash of thunder carries finality, and the silence that follows is broken only by receding echoes unto the horizon.

deed.name: Wordsmith
deed.description: Few dare to engage you in a war of words, and those who do, lose.

skillUsed.loreInfo: If your foe does not understand you, it may be that the connotation of your words was too confusing.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Combustion, Concession and Rebuttal, or Bombastic Inspiration

deed.name: Armour of Exaltation
deed.description: Protecting oneself in battle is paramount when dealing with the monsters of Middle-earth.

skillUsed.loreInfo: As the runes may protect against ignorance, so may they also defend against the blade.

deed.name: Bounder's Bounty (Tier 3)
deed.description: Hand in Bounder's Tokens to unlock unique rewards.

objective.text: Hand in Bounder's Tokens to Meg Proudfoot in Michel Delving to unlock unique rewards!

questComplete.loreInfo: You have helped the Bounders an incredible amount of times! Amazing! Terrific!
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Aiding in the Bounty' to unlock unique rewards

deed.name: Bounder's Bounty (Tier 1)
deed.description: Hand in Bounder's Tokens to unlock unique rewards.

objective.text: Hand in Bounder's Tokens to Meg Proudfoot in Michel Delving to unlock unique rewards!

questComplete.loreInfo: You have helped the Bounders a small amount. Good job.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Aiding in the Bounty' to unlock unique rewards

deed.name: Bounder's Bounty (Tier 2)
deed.description: Hand in Bounder's Tokens to unlock unique rewards.

objective.text: Hand in Bounder's Tokens to Meg Proudfoot in Michel Delving to unlock unique rewards!

questComplete.loreInfo: You have helped the Bounders many times. Great work!
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Aiding in the Bounty' to unlock unique rewards

deed.name: Baggins' Birthday
deed.description: Listen to all twelve of the hobbits' stories about Bilbo Baggins' adventures.

objective.text: Listen to all twelve of the hobbit's stories about Bilbo Baggins' adventures.

questComplete.loreInfo: Shipped off in a Barrel? Reminds of me another story I heard once....
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Ted Sandyman's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Gandalf kidnapped Bilbo and carried him off in a sack.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Shirrif Robin Smallburrow's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: A story about dwarves and hidden tunnels.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Dudo Chubb's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Mushrooms in pies? Bleegh....
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Lobelia Sackville-Baggins' Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Bilbo flew off riding a firework, shooting across the sky.
In which Bilbo goes off to the Elves... to learn about growing the best taters.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Hal Hornblower's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Bilbo is all dressed in black as a masked vigilante, protecting the Shire from evil.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Bogo Chubb's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Bilbo's purchased a fine fake beard and is hiding amongst the dwarves.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Lotho Sackville-Baggins' Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Bilbo's bringing the Lonely Mountain a new, nice dragon to help it be less lonely.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - a Child's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: The Riders of Rohan and the company of Théoden have a new member riding with them on a war-pony of his very own.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Hereward Loamsdown's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Radagast has taken Bilbo under his wing as the first ever hobbit Lore-master!
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Holly Hornblower's Story

questComplete.loreInfo: Bilbo is living with the elves, writing his memoirs in the form of a one act play.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Baggins' Birthday - Postman Grubb's Story

deed.name: Volume III, Book 11: Foreword
deed.description: West Rohan is at war, and a new story begins!

objective.text: West Rohan is at war, and a new story begins!

condition.loreInfo: West Rohan is at war, and a new story begins!

deed.name: Thespian
deed.description: You have earned the Thespian title by participating in the Yule Festival Play.

objective.text: To earn the title of Thespian, you must be chosen to perform all three roles in the Yule Festival play.

enterDetection.progressOverride: Perform the Extra's role in the Yule Festival play
Perform the Protagonist's role in the Yule Festival play
Perform the Villian's role in the Yule Festival play

deed.name: Explorer of Bree-land
deed.description: Explore the Barrow-downs, the forbidding Old Forest, and the ruins of old Arnor scattered all across Bree-land.

questComplete.loreInfo: For many generations the Dúnedain of Cardolan buried their dead within the Downs, until the Great Plague destroyed the last vestiges of Cardolan, and spirits from Angmar claimed the barrows.
For years beyond memory it has been a forbidding place, which Men and hobbits alike have shunned. Hobbit-tales tell that the trees are aware and can move of their own accord.
The ruins of old Arnor are scattered all across Bree-land. They remain a constant reminder of the ancient glories of the North Kingdom...and of the evil that destroyed it.
Find pages of the Journal of Cardolan lost within the Barrow Downs.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find the Lore of the Cardolan Prince

questComplete.loreInfo: Explore the history of the Dúnedain Rangers of the North.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find the History of the Dúnedain

questComplete.loreInfo: Old tales tell of eight entwives who passed from the south into the Old Forest, never to be seen again. Could they be true?
questComplete.progressOverride: Find the Flowers of the Old Forest

deed.name: Explorer of Angmar
deed.description: Explore the blasted wastes with bastions of resistance well-hidden among the hills of this dark land, and the great road that leads to the ancient fortresses of the Witch-king of Angmar.

questComplete.loreInfo: Even in the blasted wastes of Angmar, there remain a few small bastions of resistance and valour to strive against the darkness.

The ancient fortress of the Witch-king of Angmar is rumoured to be surrounded by eight dread towers within which his lieutenants resided during the long war with Arnor, weaving their dread magic there against the forces of the West.

There is a great road that leads through the wastes of Angmar to the very gates of Carn Dûm. It is along this road that the dark armies march forth to bring the Free Peoples of Eriador under the yoke of the Enemy.
Seven swords have been stolen from Krúslë Lannan and must be returned to their proper resting place.

deed.name: Explorer of Evendim
deed.description: Explore the wilds of Evendim, the tombs of the kings that ruled over Arnor, and the ruins of the ancient city of Annúminas.

questComplete.loreInfo: Explore the ruins of the ancient city of Annúminas.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the City of the Kings

questComplete.loreInfo: Explore the ruins of ancient Arnor.

The kings of Annúminas were intered within tombs along the road to the gate of the city.
Nine were the kings that ruled over Arnor from this ancient seat of power, but not all of them were buried in the Way of Kings...

Once the capital of the North, Evendim has nonetheless always had its wild places and mysteries -- and those have grown stranger and more dangerous still in the long years since Annúminas was abandoned.
Far across the waters of lake Evendim lie lands long unexplored by Men.
Find the marker plaques scattered throughout Annúminas.
questComplete.progressOverride: Find the Markers of the Sunken City
