deed.name: Explorer of Ered Luin
deed.description: Explore the settlements held by the Dwarves, the old places left behind by the Elves, and the strongholds of the Dourhand brigands.

questComplete.loreInfo: The Blue Mountains are dotted with ruins dating back to the elder days when the ancestors of the Dourhands ruled a vast kingdom, ruined when Beleriand fell.
Explore the places and settlements held by the Dwarves of the Blue Mountains.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the places of the Dwarves

questComplete.loreInfo: Explore the old places left behind by the Elves as they abandoned Edhelion and moved further south to Duillond.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Elf-ruins of Ered Luin

questComplete.loreInfo: Explore the dark valley of Rath Teraig.

deed.name: Explorer of Forochel
deed.description: Explorer the brutal wilderness of Forochel.

questComplete.loreInfo: Discover each of the key battlegrounds for control of the Ice Bay of Forochel.
While the Lossoth of Forochel are not great builders, the dwarves long ago had many mines and encampments in the North.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Ancient Stones of Forochel

deed.name: Explorer of the Lone-lands
deed.description: Explore the ruins of forts and towers that once guarded the roads, the ancient ruin of Amon Sûl or more commonly known as Weathertop, and the stronghold of corruption and evil that is Garth Agarwen.

questComplete.loreInfo: Garth Agarwen lies in the north-east hills of the Lone-lands. Once a great fortress of the ancient kingdoms, rumours say that it has become a stronghold of corruption and evil.
The Grimfens are in the south-east extent of the Lone-lands. Travellers have avoided this place for as long as any can remember -- and for good reason.
The Lone-lands were once host to a string of forts and towers that guarded the roads against the incursions of Angmar and Rhudaur. Long ago, they fell into ruin with the defeat of the North Kingdom.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the defences of the Lone-lands

questComplete.loreInfo: Weathertop is in the western half of the Lone-lands. Its proper name of old is Amon Sûl, and within it once lay one of the palantíri of the ancient kingdoms.

deed.name: Explorer of the Misty Mountains
deed.description: Explore the mountain passes of the Misty Mountains with ruins built long ago by the dwarves. However the way is treacherous, often choked with snow, knife-like winds, and other more aggressive hazards.

questComplete.loreInfo: While most folks sensibly stay home and tend to fields and shops, some hardy adventurers are drawn to the most inhospitable and difficult places in Middle-earth. Few such places pose so great a challenge as the stretch of the Misty Mountains surrounding the region of the High Pass, which is fraught with hazards -- both natural and otherwise -- to test the most rugged individuals.

Few know the full extent of the depths of Goblin-town, and those who have experienced them most likely died therin as slaves to cruel goblin-overseers. The goblins themselves may not know all the ways, for the deepest passages extend far into the heart of the Misty Mountains where dark and unseen terrors lie, and the goblins will not brave these passages unless driven or enraged.

In order to cross the Misty Mountains, travellers have long had to traverse high and trecherous passes, often choked with snow, knife-like winds, and other more aggressive hazards. Seek out these passes and learn the secret ways of the mountains.

There are not many ruins to be found in the Misty Mountains, for few indeed are those willing to build anything of note in such an inhospitable environment. Those that are to be found here were built long ago by the dwarves.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Ruins of the Misty Mountains

questComplete.loreInfo: Travellers have long told tales of the mighty and capricious giants that inhabit the cold peaks of the Misty Mountains, you must seek out their places for yourself however, for there are few who have seen them left to tell you the way.

How strange...scattered throughout the warrens of Goblin-town seem to be a set of old, well-worn brass buttons, as if lost from a Hobbit's waistcoat. How in the world did such things come to be in these dark and twisted tunnels?

deed.name: Explorer of the North Downs
deed.description: Explore the Fields of Fornost, the villages of the Earth-kin, and the many ruins that lie forgotten in lands of the North Downs.

questComplete.loreInfo: An odd people calling themselves the Earth-kin have been discovered in the eastern North Downs. Seek out their villages and learn more of them, and whether they be friend or foe.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Villages of the Earth-kin

questComplete.loreInfo: Many ruins lie forgotten in lands east of the Baranduin. Explore them and determine if they have fallen into the hands of the Enemy.
Spy out the Orc and goblin-strongholds in the North Downs.
Explore the ruins scattered in and around the Fields of Fornost

deed.name: Explorer of the Shire
deed.description: Explore the historical and cultural places as well as the farmsteads that can be found throughout the Shire.

questComplete.loreInfo: Farming represents the heart of the Shire, and farmsteads can be found throughout -- the largest of which surround the town of Michel Delving.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Farms of the Shire

questComplete.loreInfo: The pastoral peace of the Shire presents travellers with an excellent opportunity to explore its historical and cultural places.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Sights of the Shire

deed.name: Explorer of the Trollshaws
deed.description: Explore the lone winding road through the Trollshaws, but be wary as it is not well-guarded from the dangers of the wild.

questComplete.loreInfo: The lone winding road through the Trollshaws leads to the last bastion of civilization for a great many leagues. Travellers must take great care while exploring this road however, for it is not well-guarded from the dangers of the wild.

These lands once were the eastern extent of the old kingdom of Rhudaur. They have lain in ruins for many long years now and most are inhabited only by wild beasts -- or horrid creatures that have crawled more recently out of the depths of Angmar.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Ruins of the Trollshaws

questComplete.loreInfo: The southern Trollshaws are dominated by the Wilds of Tâl Bruinen. Few even amongst the Elves live here now, and the forested hills have become heavily overgrown and inhabited mostly by wild beasts that pose a constant danger to travellers and the few who try to eke out an existence in these undisciplined lands.
questComplete.progressOverride: Explore the Wilds of Tâl Bruinen

deed.description: Explore the fell and hopeless stronghold of evil that has become of the once great forest of Mirkwood.

questComplete.loreInfo: There are many wild and forsaken places to be stumbled upon as the wary wanderer passes through Mirkwood.
Mirkwood is home to many places that were once great, but have fallen into ruin after long years of corruption and disrepair.
Many foes have settled throughout Mirkwood, striving ever to make it the fell and hopeless stronghold of evil that it has since become.

questComplete.loreInfo: Discover where the foes of the Rohirrim dwell in Wildermore.

questComplete.loreInfo: Explore the wilds of Wildermore.
Most of the Reeve's family are laid to rest in the graveyard outside of Forlaw. Most of his family has been killed recently as the conflict in Wildermore escalates.
Even flowers and plants can be hardy enough to brave the fearsome snows. When you come upon these fierce little blooms, you feel hope for the shivering people of Wildermore.

This is an excellent dish, simple to prepare but delicious.

deed.name: The Strength of Sauron
deed.description: Unravel the Epic Story for Volume IV: The Strength of Sauron.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have crossed the White Mountains and come into Gondor, where new adventures await. The servants of Sauron assail this last bastion of the Free Peoples, and the Dark Lord turns his greatest strength upon the south-kingdom.
You crossed through the expanse of Central Gondor and came to the port city of Pelargir, where you faced Balakhôr the Scourge and ended the threat of Umbar.

Following the defeat of the Corsairs at Pelargir, Aragorn entrusted you with the mission of keeping secret his capture of their ships and his plan to sail up the Anduin to the aid of Minas Tirith. You went by another road to Osgiliath, now held by the enemy, and sabotaged the great war machine Grond. It was there that you encountered a foe you thought had been dispatched: Mordirith, once the Steward of Angmar, eternal slave of the Witch-king. He had been wrested from the Void and sent back in a new guise, and as the wraith Gothmog he commands many of the forces of Mordor.

You arrived at the great city of Minas Tirith with little time to spare, as the forces of the Enemy encircle the White City and prepare to mount their siege. From a secret chamber in the Tower of Ecthelion, Steward Denethor wrestled against the despair of Sauron in the depths of the Anor-stone. If no allies come, and soon, the doom of which he speaks must surely fall upon Minas Tirith.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Book 4: Siege of the White City'

questComplete.loreInfo: With the aid of the Woses you found the Riders of Rohan and joined their charge to the fields of Pelennor. The battle is joined, and the fate of Gondor hangs in the balance.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Book 5: The Ride of the Rohirrim'

questComplete.loreInfo: The armies of Gondor and Mordor clashed on the fields of the Pelennor, and you stood with your friends against the ravening Morgul hordes. The cost of victory was high. Many heroes will not return to their homes to see the peace their lives have bought.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete 'Book 6: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields'

questComplete.loreInfo: Aragorn has undertaken a dangerous mission: he marches to the Black Gate of Mordor with an army too small to wage serious war against the forces of Sauron. And yet, the Host of the West occupies every thought of the Dark Lord, for he is consumed with fear that Aragorn has obtained the Ring of Power and seeks to install himself as sovereign.

Aragorn's dangerous scheme to draw the eye of the Dark Lord has borne fruit, but it brings an upsetting revelation: Sauron has captured a hobbit within Mordor, and his dark messenger displays tokens of proof: Bilbo's mail-shirt, Sam's short sword, and an Elf-cloak of Lórien. The Quest of the Ring has failed. The Host of the West fights on, but the circle in which it stands draws ever smaller as the end approaches...

And so it was that the Quest of the Ring came to a successful conclusion, and Sauron was destroyed. In the end, it was not through feat of strength or prowess in combat that the Dark Lord was undone, but by the courage and fortitude of two hobbits, and the mercy they showed to another: Sméagol of the river-folk. He it was who destroyed the Ring and ended the dominion of Sauron.

object.name: Grant the Strength of Sauron Emote

deed.name: Gondorian Treasure Cache
deed.description: Find West Gondor's treasure that has been lost over the years.

itemUsed.loreInfo: This treasure had been lost, forgotten, or perhaps even stolen.

deed.name: Beacons of West Gondor
deed.description: Discover structures atop the hills of West Gondor.

objective.text: Discover structures atop the hills of West Gondor.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Stone of Erech, brought from Númenor to Blackroot Vale by Isildur. This beacon later became a constant reminder of betrayal for the people of Gondor.
You have discovered the Fallen Beacon, at the northernmost tip of the Emyn Ernil. It is the sixth South-beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered the beacon of Maegond, atop a sharp blade of rock jutting up from the hills. It is the seventh South-beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered the beacon of Nendath, along the edges of the Emyn Ernil. It is the eighth South-beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered the beacon of Amon Lontir, along the edges of the Emyn Ernil. It is the ninth South-beacon of Gondor.

deed.name: Paths of the Dead
deed.description: Discover the Paths of the Dead.

objective.text: Discover the Paths of the Dead.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Lenn Dûskud, where the dead gather over its black waters.
You have discovered Kêr Izel, the sunken steps of a once great mountain city.
You have discovered Kêr Bras. An ancient place once full of life, now only filled with death.
You have discovered the Shadow-watch. Once a place of stunning vistas, it has sunken into the depths of the mountain over the centuries.

deed.name: West Gondor: Camps of the Enemies
deed.description: Scout enemy camps scattered throughout West Gondor.

objective.text: Scout enemy camps scattered throughout West Gondor.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Tingobel, a once prosperous Gondorian mining village, now overrun with Orcs.
You have discovered Tathrendalf, a swamp on the river Ciril concealing a Corsair encampment.
You have discovered the Bandit Encampment, hidden in the Tarlang's rocky foothills.
You have discovered Abedec's Watch, a Corsair camp built in the burning ruins of a once prosperous Gondorian settlement near the Bridge of Aeriant.
You have discovered Hashadîr, a large Corsair camp built on the shores of the Cape of Belgast.
You have discovered Makham Mijann, a small Corsair camp built into the hills north of the river Ringló.

deed.name: Prosperity of West Gondor
deed.description: Discover Gondorian settlements in West Gondor.

objective.text: Discover Gondorian settlements in West Gondor.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the village of Morlad. The people of Morlad have grown wary of the dead lurking around the Hill of Erech.
You have discovered Lothgobel, a small farming village in Lamedon that is eerily quiet.
You have discovered Dínadab, a small Gondorian hamlet in the north of Lamedon.
You have discovered the Gondorian town of Calembel. This is home to Angbor and his son, Drambor.
You have discovered the Gondorian town of Tadrent, located near Nendath.
You have discovered the Gondorian town of Ost Lontir, located near Amon Lontir.
Dol Amroth is the chief city and port of the fiefdom of Belfalas, standing on a rocky promontory overlooking the inlet into which the Morthond River flows.

deed.name: A Hobbit's Holiday
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.
A Hobbit's Holiday was written by Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit from the Shire who went on an unexpected and surprising adventure. You leaf through the pages with interest to read his account of meeting your ancestor Beorn, but you are unable to find it.
Many of the pages in the middle of the book have gone missing. An entire chapter seems to be missing. Is it the chapter where he met Beorn?

objective.text: Bilbo Baggins is in Rivendell, and will be most interested that you found a copy of his book.

npcTalk.progressOverride: Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell.

objective.text: You should search for missing pages from A Hobbit's Holiday throughout Angmar and the Misty Mountains.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, Bilbo describes a harrowing ride on the back of an Eagle. It does not sound like the experience agreed with either the hobbit or the Eagle.
On this page, Bilbo describes Gandalf's declaration to the dwarves that he will soon be leaving them on their own in order to see to his own affairs.

On this page, Bilbo describes Gandalf's plan for introducing the dwarves to Beorn: two by two, very carefully, very slowly, and very politely. This account of Beorn makes him sound very quick to anger.

On this page, Bilbo describes the arrival at Beorn's house, and particularly the tremendously large bees that live there even today. Beorn took great pride in his bee-pastures, and so too does his son Grimbeorn.

On this page, Bilbo describes his first meeting with Beorn. Your relative's tremendous size and bluster made an impression on the hobbit, as did his reluctance to entertain any guests. Fortunately the party consisted only of Bilbo and Gandalf... as far as Beorn knew.

On this page, Bilbo describes how Gandalf introduced the remaining dwarves at such a slow pace as to keep Beorn's curiosity piqued but not so quick as to anger him. You have heard variations of this story from Grimbeorn quite often during your childhood.
On this page, Bilbo describes the delicious meal that Beorn served after all the dwarves had arrived, and the stories that your relative told of Mirkwood and the mountains.

On this page, Bilbo describes an uneasy sleep punctuated with growling outside his door and the sound of many animals. The fear he felt would not have been eased had he known the true extent of Beorn's nature, but you know that he was never in any danger from your fierce relative.

deed.name: Genealogy of the Beornings
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.
This book contains a number of genealogical charts professing to document the various lines and branches of your family, but some of the pages are missing.
You do not know who prepared this book, but perhaps Bilbo Baggins, currently staying in Rivendell, knows something about it. He has an interest in such things and knew your relative Beorn.

objective.text: You have found a book that purports to trace the genealogy of your family. Perhaps Bilbo Baggins, currently staying in Rivendell, will know something about it.

npcTalk.progressOverride: Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell.

objective.text: Collect the missing pages of 'Genealogy of the Beornings' and add them to the book.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: This page contains the final section of the genealogical charts, which has brought the line of Beorn down to your generation: you, Sterkist, and Langhár.

This page contains some paragraphs of information about Beorn, your relative and the apparent forebear of your line. Even you have little information about Beorn's parentage, and if Grimbeorn knew of it he never spoke of it to you.

This page contains a number of paragraphs concerning Grimbeorn, the son of Beorn and your relative. He is the leader and patriarch of your folk, and maintains the lodge where Beorn once lived. He is now very old, and has little patience for the fancies of the young.
This page contains a paragraph of information about Ofolmóth, your one-time relative. The information is now... outdated.

This page contains several paragraphs of information about your cousin Varthmath and his siblings. Most of them range further afield and do not stay near the lodge, so you do not know them as well as Varthmath.
This page briefly describes the heritage of your sister Langhár, but most of the page is blank. You suppose that it is waiting to be filled with her deeds.

This page briefly describes the heritage of your brother Sterkist, but most of the page is blank. You suppose that it is waiting to be filled with his deeds. Curiously, his name is misspelled. You decide to spare his feelings and not tell him about the error.
This page is about you! It is mostly blank. You suppose it is waiting to be filled with record of your deeds. One day you should write your own page in this book.

deed.name: A Study of the Skin-changer
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.
This curious manual seems to describe the nature of your family's ability to take the shape of animals. It is a description of skin-changing over the years, written long ago by someone with very little actual understanding of the ability. You wonder if there is any truth hidden within its exaggerated and mostly-untrue account.
Several pages are missing, but a small, much more recent, bit of parchment tucked into the front cover contains the inscription 'Ask Bilbo.'

objective.text:
This curious manual seems to describe the nature of your family's ability to take the shape of animals. It is a description of skin-changing over the years, written long ago by someone with very little actual understanding of the ability. You wonder if there is any truth hidden within its exaggerated and mostly-untrue account.
Several pages are missing, but a small, much more recent, bit of parchment tucked into the front cover contains the inscription 'Ask Bilbo.' Is this a reference to Bilbo Baggins, currently residing in Rivendell?

npcTalk.progressOverride: Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell.

objective.text: The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author claims that most skin-changers can assume the forms of many animals, and acquire their most fundamental characteristics. You have never known this to be true.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 4
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 4

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author describes his belief that the power of the skin-changer is passed through the male line. The power does seem to be hereditary, but there are many women in your family who also share that power, including your own sister Langhár.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 8
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 8

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author notes that when a skin-changer assumes the form of an animal, he may grow to several times his normal size. You have known this to be true, and wonder if the author has based this portion of his account on actual encounters with your family or pure supposition.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 15
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 15

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author says that every skin-changer is uniformly more ferocious than other folk, which you know to be an outright fabrication. Many members of your family are introspective and thoughtful. You wonder what the author would make of your brother Sterkist, who is given to day-dreaming of adventure but would never hurt anybody.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 16
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 16

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author describes the skin-changer's love of honey-cakes. This, at least, is accurate. Your cousin Varthmath is particularly skilled at the baking of honey-cakes, and now you want one. You silently curse the mysterious author for reminding you of such deliciousness without any near at hand.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 23
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 23

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author describes the expansive bee-pastures which your family have tended for years. The bees grow to incredible size and produce some of the most delicious honey you have ever tasted.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 42
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 42

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author poses a question he finds undeniably frightening: are there skin-changers among us? You know that your people are not as numerous as he believes, nor are they as skilled at blending in as he thinks they are.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 11
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 11

inventoryItem.loreInfo: On this page, the author supplies a surprising confession: he claims that he himself is a skin-changer! Judging from the rest of his book, you find this a difficult thing to believe.
inventoryItem.progressOverride: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 21
inventoryItem.itemName: A Study of the Skin-changer, Page 21

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Tungobel, a small village in Dor-en-Ernil, being pillaged by the corsair forces.
You have discovered Gaerlond, a small fishing village in Dor-en-Ernil that has been destroyed by corsair forces.
You have discovered Lornost, a small town overrun by Haradrim forces.
You have discovered the Ruins of Ethillorn, a small ruined town on the Ethir Anduin.

deed.description: Defeat many Half-trolls in Central Gondor.

deed.name: Path of the Grey Host
deed.description: Walk the path of Aragorn and his men from Ringló Vale to Pelargir.

objective.text: Walk the path of Aragorn and his men from Ringló Vale to Pelargir.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the village of Ethring, which stands on either side of the main fords of the Ringló. It is a rustic village of lumberers and fisher-folk with a mighty hall upon a nearby knoll. Timbers hewn in its woods are sent downstream to Amroth and south, overland, to the Ethir and Pelargir.
You have discovered the Camp of the Grey Host, a stop for Aragorn and his men before they march on Pelargir.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Camp of the Grey Host

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the city of Linhir which straddles the river on either side, guarding a ford and bridge. Part of the town belongs to Lebennin, and part to Belfalas. It is normally a quiet harbor of fisherfolk, but has been assailed and partially destroyed by the Haradrim and Corsairs of Umbar, who besieged it and fought long against its defenders, led by Lord Angbor of Lamedon and Comeldir, a Swan-knight entrusted by Prince Imrahil with guardianship over the far reaches of his province.
You have discovered Calembel, This is home to Angbor, who commands great forces for Aragorn.
You have discovered the Stone of Erech, where Aragorn called upon the Dead Men of Dunharrow to honour their oath.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the city of Pelargir, one of Gondor's oldest and greatest cities. It has long stood in direct opposition to the city of the Corsairs in Umbar. It stands at the mouth of the River Sirith as it flows into the Anduin just above the delta of the Ethir; it is a city of wharves, bridges, and canals, with a palace built on pilings out in the Anduin itself.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Pelargir

deed.name: Beast-slayer of Central Gondor
deed.description: Defeat many Beasts in Central Gondor.

objective.text: Defeat many Beasts in Central Gondor.

questComplete.loreInfo: Walk the path of Aragorn and his men from Ringló Vale to Pelargir.
Explore the city of Pelagir.
Scout Gondorian settlements in Central Gondor that are in ruins or under siege.
Find Central Gondor's treasure that has been lost or stolen.

deed.name: Central Gondor: Camps of the Enemies
deed.description: Scout enemy camps scattered throughout Central Gondor.

objective.text: Scout enemy camps scattered throughout Central Gondor.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Gríshru, a White Mountain Orc camp.
You have discovered Dâr Matum, a camp upon the slopes of the White Mountains, occupied by both Orcs and the Ruthless Dead.
You have discovered Lang Boha, a beach encampment run by Haradrim forces.
You have discovered Barad Rill, the once great lighthouse, now a base of operation for the corsair forces.
You have discovered Hata Khezrat, a small Corsair campsite to the north of Linhir where some of the Corsairs fled following the passing of the Dead.
You have discovered Hata Kebir, a large corsair encampment along the edge of the river Anduin.
You have discovered Thama Aklam, An inland Haradrim compound where forces are mustering.

deed.name: Vanguard of Central Gondor
deed.description: Complete the epilogue of Central Gondor.

objective.text: Complete the epilogue of Central Gondor.

questComplete.loreInfo:
The Ruthless Dead found themselves hopelessly bound to their oath, and banished far from their Master.
Drugât grew weary, and asked your aid in reclaiming gifts once given Isildur and his men. In exchange, his cursed folk would return to the Paths of the Dead and never again trouble the lands of the Living.
You held your word and for once, Drugât upheld his. He and the Ruthless Host have left Gondor in peace, hoping that one day, they shall finally be at rest.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the epilogue of Ringló Vale

questComplete.loreInfo:
In the end, the Sister of the Gilrain played a tremendous role in shaping the fate of Gondor.
Her command over the river Gilrain not only banished the Ruthless Dead from Dor-en-Ernil, but also had the curious power of saving Garvir during the attack on Linhir.
Reunited with their brother once more, Erchar and Herion have a renewed sense of hope for the future, and have prepared themselves for any troubles that lie ahead.
questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the epilogue of Dor-en Ernil

questComplete.loreInfo:
In the aftermath of the attack on Hata Kebir, the folk of Lebennin have grown curious about what became of the strange Corsair that aided the Men of Linhir.
You found Jajax and Daxamat on the shores of the Anduin where they planned to set off... on a stolen ship. Indeed, Jajax and his brother were true Corsairs to the very end. You shared strong drinks with the mischievous pair, but by the time you awoke from your antics, they had sailed off.
You wonder what will become of Jajax, and you hope your paths cross once again.

object.name: Blemished Symbol of the Elder King

deed.name: The Legacy of Pelargir
deed.description: Explore the city of Pelargir.

objective.text: Explore the city of Pelargir.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Eastern Seagate of Pelargir.
You have discovered King Minardil's Memorial, who was killed by Castamir's great grandsons in the year 1634.
You have discovered the Destroyed Monument of Castamir, toppled by those who wish to forget the reign of the Usurper.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Destroyed Monument of Castamir

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Monument of the Sea-kings; Tarannon, Eärnil, Ciryandil, and Hyarmendacil, who ruled Pelargir from years 830 to 1149.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Monument of the Sea-kings

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Monument of King Telumehtar, who raised the Gondorian fleet anew and attacked Umbar by land and sea.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Monument of King Telumehtar

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Statue of Thorongil, erected for a mysterious man who sailed to Umbar and sacked the city of the Corsairs, then resigned his service to the Steward and disappeared.
You have discovered Tol Ciryarani, the well settled island and home to the palace of the Sea-Kings.
You have discovered the Western Seagate of Pelargir.

deed.name: The Line of Beorn, Part Four
deed.description: Descendants of Beorn have not traditionally left the skin-changer's home-land, but your journey has brought you to Eriador in defence of the Free Peoples. You should now go to meet your cousin Varthmath in Moria, at the Orc-watch in the Redhorn Lodes.

objective.text: Your journey continues in Moria and Rhovanian.

deed.name: The Line of Beorn, Part Three
deed.description: Descendants of Beorn have not traditionally left the skin-changer's home-land, but your journey has brought you to Eriador in defence of the Free Peoples. You should now go to meet your brother Sterkist, at the Spire of Meeting in Rivendell.

objective.text: Your journey continues in Eriador.

deed.name: The Line of Beorn, Part Two
deed.description: Descendants of Beorn have not traditionally left the skin-changer's home-land, but your journey has brought you to Eriador in defence of the Free Peoples. You should now go to meet your sister Langhár at Ost Guruth, in the Lone-lands.

objective.text: Your journey continues in Eriador.

deed.name: The Line of Beorn, Part One
deed.description: Descendants of Beorn have not traditionally left the skin-changer's home-land, but your journey has brought you to Eriador in defence of the Free Peoples. Your quest continues at Adso's Camp, in the Bree-land.

objective.text: Your journey continues in Eriador.

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs
deed.description: Orcs are clever, skilled, and brutal in combat. They do not however, anticipate their enemy changing into a massive bear and mauling them.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Bred solely for war, Orcs form the bulk of the enemy's forces. Every one that is defeated makes Middle-earth the slightest bit safer.

deed.name: Enmity of the Spiders
deed.description: Living near Mirkwood, you and your kin are no stranger to monstrous spiders twisted by darkness.

monsterDied.loreInfo: You have started to cull these foul creatures from Middle-earth.

deed.name: Enmity of the Spiders II
deed.description: These creatures have taken root in the once pure woods of Middle-earth. You have made some progress in clearing them out.

monsterDied.loreInfo: After your efforts, sightings of these monsters have lessened.

deed.name: Enmity of the Spiders III
deed.description: In your travels, you have found that spiders plague more than just your humble home. They are a threat that needs to be answered across Middle-earth.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
You have defeated spiders hither and thither, bringing a greater sense of security to the populations they once plagued.
Though these creatures persist, their numbers are far more manageable and less threatening.

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs II
deed.description: Some Orcs are aware of Beornings' unique ability. They have yet to figure out how to stop the mauling, though.

monsterDied.loreInfo: Your experience with fighting Orcs has taught you that, though more formidable in single combat, Orcs are much like goblins in that they are both susceptible to a claw to the head.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins III
deed.description: Fear spreads throughout the ranks of goblins. Far and wide, they whisper in hushed tones of the wrath of the line of Beorn.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
Grimbeorn said that in time, the goblins would come to fear his children as they fear himself and feared Beorn before him.
That time has come.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins II
deed.description: Your might can easily match several goblins at once.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
It is clear the goblins have some greater force backing them, otherwise they would lack the courage to attack Grimbeorn's lodge.
You have defeated many of these loathsome creatures, but as they pour out of their hiding places it becomes evident they number more than anyone fathomed.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins
deed.description: Goblins have always been the enemy of Beornings ever since Beorn was driven from the Misty Mountains.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
Goblins have always been the enemy of Beornings ever since they drove Beorn from the Misty Mountains.
You have begun to repay them for their villainy.

deed.name: Hearten!
deed.description: Though reclusive, Beornings are natural leaders when called to action.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your own strength gives your friends the courage to fight on in desperate times.

deed.name: Not the Bees!
deed.description: You have nearly perfected your technique of wielding bees as a weapon. You only get stung once or twice!

skillUsed.loreInfo: It is a unique joy to watch servants of the Enemy desperately tear off their armour as they try to get out the bees that found their way underneath.

deed.name: Overbearing Presence
deed.description: Your great presence is an inspiration to your fellows.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Free Peoples from far and wide are in awe of your might.

deed.name: Full Force
deed.description: Beornings are known for throwing their considerable weight around in battle.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The enemy is prepared for swords, spears, maces, hammers, and even great halberds, but none are ready to counter the full might of a Beorning.

deed.name: Overwhelming Strength
deed.description: Use a flurry of fierce strikes to break even the most hardened foe.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Innumerable agents of the Enemy have fallen to your unrelenting assault.

deed.name: Quick Slash
deed.description: One of your most dangerous attacks is a simple slash.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: After much practice, your slash makes contact with your target before it even realizes you took a swing.

deed.name: Weight on Their Shoulders
deed.description: Sometimes, the sheer weight of your attack matters more than its method of delivery.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have crushed many enemies under the weight of your attacks.

deed.name: Beorn's Might
deed.description: Wield the strongest of your abilities in the fight for Middle-earth.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have mastered your most potent powers.
skillUsed.progressOverride: Use Thickened Hide, Call to Wild, or Nature's Bond

deed.name: Unexpectedly Agile
deed.description: Foes might expect a Beorning to be slow and lumbering, but you are as quick as you are strong.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

condition.loreInfo: Your speed and skill have saved your hide both literally and figuratively countless times.

deed.name: A Building Rage
deed.description: What might seem like an uncontrolled, chaotic, thrashing attack to an outsider is actually a very deliberate, chaotic, thrashing attack.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: The wildness of your attack makes it difficult for your foes to defend themselves against it.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 4
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point

deed.name: Master the Basics
deed.description: You are a fierce fighter who knows there is always room for improvement.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Even your simplest of attacks can be devastating to a foe.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 8
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete Bear in Mind and Heart
Complete the quest The Path Homeward

deed.name: A Thousand Stingers
deed.description: To fight the Enemy you have enlisted unconventional aid.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have deepened your understanding of the temperament of these small creatures, and wield them more effectively in battle.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 5
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest Hatred of Bear and Man

deed.name: Natural Beorn Leadership
deed.description: As you travel throughout Middle-earth, you learn the customs and ways of the other races. Using that knowledge effectively makes you a better leader.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You are a source of confidence to your peers.

deed.name: Rattling Roar
deed.description: A fierce bellow braces you for coming conflict and fills your heart with wrath.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Word spreads throughout Middle-earth of your deeds, your abilities, but most notably, your roar.

deed.name: Get Your Bearings
deed.description: Your dual nature is no stranger to you, but transforming in the heat of battle is a bit more complicated.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have learned to transform swiftly even during the most intense battle.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 2
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point.

deed.name: Impervious
deed.description: Deflect and evade the enemy's attacks.

condition.loreInfo: Enemy attacks barely scratch your thick hide, when they manage to hit it that is.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 6
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point

deed.name: Beorn's Gift
deed.description: You begin to realize the unique advantages of both of your forms and are learning to use them properly.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Your understanding of Beorn's Gift has led to greater prowess in combat.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 3
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point

questComplete.progressOverride: Complete the quest The Speech of Animals

deed.name: Stand Firm
deed.description: Renew yourself in the midst of battle.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Some creatures leave the battlefield to re-gather their strength. Beornings prefer shouting quite loudly before charging back into the fray.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 7
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point

deed.name: Bear in Mind and Heart
deed.description: Find harmony between your two forms and wield a power as great as Beorn's own.

skillUsed.loreInfo: You have embraced the gift of your lineage.

deed.name: To Battle!
deed.description: Few things are quite as terrifying as the sight of a Beorning bounding into battle.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: Nothing stirs the pot like the sudden appearance of a very angry bear.

deed.name: Class Deeds - Tier 1
deed.description: Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point.

deed.name: Hearth and Home
deed.description: It is rumoured that Beorning honey-cakes are so delicious, even Elves try to replicate the recipe.

objective.text: This is your objective description.

skillUsed.loreInfo: A warm honey-cake, served with tea or coffee, is a welcome treat to any.

deed.name: Kindred to the Rangers of Ithilien
deed.description: You have proven yourself invaluable to the Rangers of Ithilien and have done much to aid Gondor and its people. For this, the Rangers now count you among their own.

factionLevel.loreInfo: The Rangers of Ithilien count you among their own, and your deeds will be remembered for ages to come.

deed.name: The Five Sisters
deed.description: Search for tribute baskets to the five River-maidens of Lebennin.

objective.text: Search for tribute baskets to the five River-maidens of Lebennin.
Search for tribute baskets to the five River-maidens of Lebennin.

itemTalk.loreInfo: You have discovered a tribute basket to Roamingstar of the River Gilrain. Roamingstar is considered gentle, dreamy, and prone to deep affections.
itemTalk.progressOverride: Find a tribute basket to Roamingstar of the River Gilrain

itemTalk.loreInfo: You have discovered a tribute basket to Grey-eye of the River Serni. Grey-eye is considered hard and unsentimental, both Roamingstar's opposite and complement.
itemTalk.progressOverride: Find a tribute basket to Grey-eye of the River Serni

itemTalk.loreInfo: You have discovered a tribute basket to Silverfroth of the River Celos. Silverfroth is considered flighty and filled with jokes, tricks, and laughter.
itemTalk.progressOverride: Find a tribute basket to Silverfroth of the River Celos

itemTalk.loreInfo: You have discovered a tribute basket to Truetongue of the River Sirith. Truetongue is considered honest, forthright, and serious.
itemTalk.progressOverride: Find a tribute basket to Truetongue of the River Sirith

itemTalk.loreInfo: You have discovered a tribute basket to The Lone Lady of the River Erui. The Lone Lady is considered distant, brooding, and silent. She is prone to dark thoughts since the bloodying of her waters during the Kin-strife.
itemTalk.progressOverride: Find a tribute basket to The Lone Lady of the River Erui

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Glaniath, a small village in Upper Lebennin whose residents are unwilling to flee their homes in times of war.
You have discovered Tumladen, a walled refuge to the women and children of Minas Tirith in times of war.
You have discovered Arnach, the central town of Lossarnach.
You have discovered Imloth Melui, a walled refuge known for its blooming flower gardens in times of peace.
You have discovered Bâr Húrin, the secret, southern base of the Rangers of Ithilien.
You have discovered Faramir's Lookout, a small Ranger camp overlooking Osgiliath, established by Faramir.

You have discovered Lân Mefam, a large Haradrim encampment in South Ithilien on the road to Harad.
You have discovered Barad Nemorn, a hidden Orc encampment on the banks of the Morgulduin in Southern Ithilien.

deed.name: The Southern Beacons
deed.description: Discover the Beacons of Central & Eastern Gondor.

objective.text: Discover the Beacons of Central & Eastern Gondor.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Eilendoth, perched overlooking the Ringló Vale. It is the fifth South-beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Dol Brannor, the beacon of Dor-en Ernil. It is the fourth South-beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Anglebed, the beacon of Lower Lebennin. It is the third South-beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Sirthanc, the beacon overlooking the city of Pelargir. It is the second South-beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Minlos, the beacon bordering Lebennin and Lossarnach. It is the first South-beacon of Gondor.

deed.name: The Legacy of Osgiliath
deed.description: Explore the city of Osgiliath.

objective.text: Explore the city of Osgiliath.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered The Dome of Stars. It was once the hall of the kings and Osgiliath's greatest structure.
You have discovered the Osgiliath Culverts. These ancient tunnels and waterways form a network of unmapped passages under the entire city.
You have discovered Meneldil's Square, named after the first king of Gondor to rule from Osgiliath.
You have discovered Rómendacil's Square, named after a king of Gondor.

You have discovered The Great Bridge. Destroyed by Faramir and his elder brother Boromir to hold the western shore, The Great Bridge has been rebuilt in recent days by the Orkish forces occupying Osgiliath.
You have discovered the Theatre of Cemendur, named after Meneldil's son and successor.
You have discovered the Palace of Eldacar, named after the king who ended the kin-strife and returned the throne to Osgiliath.
You have discovered the Houses of Healing, once a training ground for healers within the city.
You have discovered The High Archives, once a centre of knowledge for the people of Osgiliath.
You have discovered the Hall of the Osgiliath-stone, the high tower of The Dome of Stars which once housed a palantír.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Hall of the Osgiliath-stone

deed.name: Ruins of South Ithilien
deed.description: Scout the ruins of Southern Ithilien.

objective.text: Scout the ruins of Southern Ithilien.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Duindir, Gondorian ruins overlooking the Anduin River.
You have discovered Ost Sarram, Gondorian ruins upon the cliffs of the Emyn Arnen.
You have discovered Brangobel, Gondorian ruins buried in the woods of Southern Ithilien.
You have discovered Tuntham, Gondorian ruins upon the highest peak of Emyn Arnen.
You have discovered Rolanthir, Gondorian ruins looking down upon the Morgulduin River.

deed.name: Kindred to Minas Tirith
deed.description: You may not have been born among the people of Old Anórien, and you may not make the great city of Minas Tirith your home, but you are welcome wherever you go.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within the bounds of Old Anórien where you are not known. The people feel a deep kinship with you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with Minas Tirith

deed.name: Friend to Minas Tirith
deed.description: All you have done within the bounds of Old Anórien has made the folk who live here friendly to you.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have become a welcome friend among the people of Minas Tirith.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with Minas Tirith

deed.name: Ally to Minas Tirith
deed.description: When Old Anórien is in need of aid, its inhabitants expect that you will find your way to the forefront of battle to assist them.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now a trusted ally among the people of Minas Tirith.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Ally standing with Minas Tirith

deed.name: Known to Minas Tirith
deed.description: Your name is now known throughout the entirety of Old Anórien, and the people know that you act in their interest.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now known throughout Old Anórien.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with Minas Tirith

deed.name: Guests of the White City
deed.description: Read the plaques of landmarks frequented by those visiting the city of Minas Tirith.

objective.text: Read the plaques of landmarks frequented by those visiting the city of Minas Tirith.

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Rochmar Oston, these stables carved into the stone pier are where visitors, soldiers, and errand-riders quarter their steeds while inside the city.
Also known as Tham Pethgyl, it is the location through which all messages to and from Minas Tirith pass, and headquarters of the city's errand-riders.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Hall of Errands plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Sennas Iaur. It is a stately inn where errand-boys loiter and await orders.
Also known as Sennas Charn, a more recently constructed inn than the Old Guesthouse.
Also known as Sennas Forn, an inn that quarters traders from far-off lands.

Also known as Sennas Hedyr, the dwelling for soldiers visiting from outside Minas Tirith. The soldiers of the fiefs are quartered here, as well as being billeted in guesthouses and evacuated homes throughout the city's lowest three circles.
Also known as Bâr Haust, a guesthouse for visiting merchants.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the House of Rest plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Sennas Vrand, a small inn catering to the wealthy.
Stables carved into the wall of the Seventh Circle for those few who ride to the top of the city. Also known as Rochbar Raud.
This building contains a group of guest-rooms for visitors to the Citadel. The lords of the fiefs reside within, including Lord Forlong.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Southern Great Guesthouse plaque

deed.name: Workings of the White City
deed.description: Read the plaques of places that govern the laws, rules, and commerce of Minas Tirith.

objective.text: Read the plaques of places that govern the laws, rules, and commerce of Minas Tirith.

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Tham Baudh, the main courthouse of the city. It is where magistrates pass judgement against all but the highest lords in the city.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Hall of Laws plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Gadorost. Dug into the side of the Mindolluin, it houses many cells where common folk are held after judgement is passed.
Also known as Bâr Caun, the city's public auction hall.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the House of Clamour plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Sammath Oston, it contains offices of city clerks, heralds, records-keepers, and so forth. It is the heart that keeps Minas Tirith alive.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Chambers of the City plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Rond Anor, the great meeting-hall of Minas Tirith. It is where the city councilors hold court, and high magistrates hold trials for prominent citizens or the highest of crimes.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Dome of the Sun plaque

deed.name: Vaults of the White City
deed.description: Read the plaques of landmarks used by those living in Minas Tirith to store provisions and valuables.

objective.text: Read the plaques of landmarks used by those living in Minas Tirith to store provisions and valuables.

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Tham Fendir, the headquarters of the city's doorwards. It is governed by Húrin, Warden of the Keys.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Keep of the Keys plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Bachrond Dofn. Tunneled into the Hill of Guard, it contains the butteries and warehouses for the coming siege.
The city's public vaults, located within the Hill of Guard.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Vaults of Rynd Mírath plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Bachrond Enedh. Located within the Hill of Guard, it contains the butteries and warehouses for the coming siege.
Also known as Bachrond Raud. Located within the Hill of Guard, it contains the butteries and warehouses for the coming siege.

Also known as Bâr Mírath. This well-guarded dome contains the treasury of Gondor, holding all the wealth belonging to the Steward. Many locked chambers beneath the building house gold, silver, jewels, and heirlooms from ancient days.

deed.name: Taverns of the White City
deed.description: Read the plaques of taverns and wine-shops within Minas Tirith.

objective.text: Read the plaques of taverns and wine-shops within Minas Tirith.

itemUsed.loreInfo: A simple ale-house also known as Hwinir a Calph.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find The Wheel and Cask plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Perian Lavrol. The wine-shop features a caricature of a hobbit on its sign, though it is based on secondhand descriptions and highly offensive to actual folk.
Also known as Thand Thannan, an ale-hall that caters to soldiers.
Also known as Mûmak a Barad, an ale-hall that caters to soldiers.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find The Mûmak and Keep plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Dol Rachrohir, a wine-shop for soldiers.
Also known as Dring a Mebir, an ale-house that caters to the city's smiths.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find The Hammer and Tongs plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Lond Veriannen, a cozy ale-house.
Also known as Alph ’Elir, a tavern favoured by the hostellers of Minas Tirith. It boasts of having the finest wine cellar in the city.
Also known as Drafn a Gwedgeph, an ale-house catering to the builders of the city.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find The Brick and Mortar plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Falf Falthol, a wine-shop where minstrels and their wealthy patrons gather.
Also known as Narthan Ereb, a wine-shop of refinement and beauty whose establishment is marked by the large brazier atop its portico and a central garden.

Also known as Cenir Faug, it is a warm, friendly, and collegial tavern nestled into a nook in the side of the Mindolluin. It has been beloved for centuries by the students and masters alike in the Houses of Lore.
Also known as Thoron a Cerch, a tiny wine-shop next to a larger lawn and garden where poets often come to recite their odes. Its name comes from two of the greater constellations.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find The Eagle and Sickle plaque

deed.name: Teachings of the White City
deed.description: Read the plaques of buildings used for the advancement of knowledge within the city of Minas Tirith.

objective.text: Read the plaques of buildings used for the advancement of knowledge within the city of Minas Tirith.

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Bâr Menel, a tower for gazing at the stars. Soothsayers and natural philosophers congregate here, and artisans craft navigational tools for the mariners of the Falas.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the House of the Heavens plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Gobeth Iaur, the original library of Minas Anor which delves into the pier-rock in the middle of the Sages’ Neath. It is dark, dusty, and little-used; its books and scrolls have no semblance of order.

Also known as Gobeth Vorondil, named for the last Steward not to serve as Ruling Steward. This library was built when Minas Anor was renamed as Minas Tirith. It is a brighter, more orderly place filled with works penned within the past thousand years, as well as transcripts of major texts from ages past. Sometimes called Gobeth Wain, or the New Archives, though this name has fallen out of favour for obvious reasons with the passage of centuries.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find The Archives of Vorondil plaque

itemUsed.loreInfo: Also known as Bâr Vorn, named for the dark stone of which it is built, as well for the ink used within. This is the chief scriptorium of Minas Tirith, where scribes write, copy, and translate texts both old and new. It is part of the Houses of Lore, and its tower houses the school's Warden.

Also known as Bair Istoth, a collection of halls and towers where the wise gather to teach, learn, argue, and think. Younger sons and daughters of the nobility are often sent here to become sages; teachers from the Houses also work throughout the city, teaching rich and poor children alike to read and write, as well as numbers, history, and other lore.
itemUsed.progressOverride: Find the Houses of Lore plaque

deed.name: Kindred to The Riders of Rohan
deed.description: You may not have been born among the people of Far Anórien, but you are welcome wherever you go.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within the bounds of Far Anórien where you are not known. The people feel a deep kinship with you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Kindred standing with The Riders of Rohan

deed.name: Known to The Riders of Rohan
deed.description: Your name is now known throughout the entirety of Far Anórien, and the people know that you act in their interest.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now known throughout Far Anórien.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Acquaintance standing with The Riders of Rohan

title.name: Known to the Riders of Rohan

deed.name: Celebrated in Minas Tirith
deed.description: The people of Old Anórien and Minas Tirith celebrate you whenever you travel through their lands.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within the bounds of Old Anórien where you are not known. The people celebrate you, far and wide.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Celebrated standing with Minas Tirith

deed.name: Friend to The Riders of Rohan
deed.description: All you have done within the bounds of Far Anórien has made the folk who live here friendly to you.

factionLevel.loreInfo: You have become a welcome friend among the people of Far Anórien.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with The Riders of Rohan

title.name: Friend to the Riders of Rohan

deed.name: Honoured in Minas Tirith
deed.description: The people of Old Anórien and Minas Tirith honour you whenever you travel through their lands.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within the bounds of Old Anórien where you are not known. The people honour you, even when you are away.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Honoured standing with Minas Tirith

deed.name: Respected in Minas Tirith
deed.description: The people of Old Anórien and Minas Tirith respect you whenever you travel through their lands.

factionLevel.loreInfo: There is nowhere you can travel within the bounds of Old Anórien where you are not known. The people deeply respect you.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Respected standing with Minas Tirith

deed.name: Ally to The Riders of Rohan

factionLevel.loreInfo: You are now a trusted ally among the people of Far Anórien.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Calenhad, atop of one of the beacon hills. It is the sixth Warning Beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Erelas, atop of one of the beacon hills. It is the fourth Warning Beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Halifirien, surrounded by the Firien Wood. It is the seventh Warning Beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Min-Rimmon, the beacon overlooking the mining town of Ost Rimmon. It is the fifth Warning Beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Amon Dîn, the beacon on the northeastern edge of the Drúadan Forest. It is the first Warning Beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Eilenach, surrounded by the Drúadan Forest. It is the second Warning Beacon of Gondor.
You have discovered Nardol, overlooking the border between Taur Drúadan and the Beacon Hills. It is the third Warning Beacon of Gondor.

deed.name: Throne of the Dread Terror: Short Fuse

Like his brother, Thrúgrath, Rakothas's rage cannot be contained. If he is defeated without many attempts to temper his wrath, he shall be shamed in defeat.
<rgb=#FF0000>This deed can only be completed on Tier 2 of the Throne of the Dread Terror raid.</rgb>

deed.name: Throne of the Dread Terror: The Returned King

deed.name: Gathering of Evil
deed.description: Discover Enemy encampments in The Wastes.

objective.text: Discover Enemy encampments in The Wastes.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered Carchost, the Fang-fort. It is one of the Towers of the Teeth.
You have discovered Dol Acharn, the Hill of Vengeance. It was here that Calimehtar and Marwhini met upon the field when they defeated the Wainriders and slew their chief.
You have discovered Dûm Boha, an encampment of Haradrim hidden in the foothills of the Mountains of Shadow.
You have discovered Fushaum Gund, an Orc encampment protecting the base of Carchost.
You have discovered Lang Rhuven, known as Darvoz Gârb to the Khundolar. It is the gateway which leads to the distant Rhûn.
You have discovered Narchost, the Render. It is one of the Towers of the Teeth.
You have discovered Ondoher's Folly, the place where Ondoher and his son stood when the Wainriders beset them.
You have discovered Skoironk, the largest web of connecting maggot-holes, teeming with broods of evil things.

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs II
deed.description: Unlike the goblins, the Orcs have been raised with a martial outlook and form the backbone of the Enemy's armies. They are neither cowards nor weaklings -- though they cannot hope to match the martial prowess of the Elves -- but their numbers and war industry are vast when motivated by their shadowy lords.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
The minds of Orcs are weak and easily befuddled, and the greatest of the Elf-refuges have long been protected by magical wards that turn away such evil, allowing the Elves havens of relative safety from which to strike against their foes with surprise and precision.
Thus it has been that in these later ages their dark armies are oft turned first against the fortresses of Men or dwarves, rather than the Elves whom are hated most of all by the Enemy of old. So it has often turned to you and your people to strike at their flanks, cutting them off and sowing confusion and fear in their well-ordered ranks so that the larger armies of Men may smash their vanguards.

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs III
deed.description: While Orcs dislike the sun nearly as much as their lesser brethren, the goblins, they have more tolerance for it and can be forced to endure it for a time when necessity -- or the lash of their masters -- demands. Despite this, it has long been an artifice of the Enemy to conjure forth vast clouds of smoke or darkness both to protect their troops from the rays of the sun and to conceal their movements from spies and scouts.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
It has been said of late that endless clouds have descended again upon the hills of Angmar. This can only bode ill, for it heralds the gathering intentions of the Enemy. They strive to claim the North, even as rumours of war spread from Mordor in the South.
You and your brethren must continue to fight as you have ever before to contain their growing might, until the greater forces of the Free Peoples of Middle-earth can be rallied to battle.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dourhands II
deed.description: Some can fall to the Shadow, but these dwarves have allied themselves with the Enemy by choice.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Elves stand against the Enemy and their allies.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dourhands
deed.description: Some can fall to the Shadow, but these dwarves have allied themselves with the Enemy by choice.

monsterDied.loreInfo: The Elves stand against the Enemy and their allies.

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs
deed.description: Bred by the Enemy for war over land, the Orcs are larger and tougher than their goblin cousins, but their origins remain the same. Militant and brutish, they retain some native talent for the clever working of wood and metal, though they only apply this to the construction of weapons and other machines of war.

monsterDied.loreInfo:
The Elves and Orcs have clashed for ages, but with many of the Elven people leaving across the Sea to the West, fewer remain to carry on the battle.
It seems that in the end it will fall to Men to eradicate the Orc-menace once and for all -- but it remains to be seen if they are strong enough for the task. In the meantime, you remain to carry on the battle in the name of your people.

deed.name: Friend to the Galadhrim
deed.description: The Elves of Lothlórien now consider you a dear friend.

factionLevel.loreInfo: All you have done has caused the Elves of Lothlórien to gaze upon you with a friendly eye.
factionLevel.progressOverride: You must earn Friend standing with the Galadhrim

deed.name: The Black Book of Mordor - Where the Shadows Lie
deed.description: Unravel the story of 'The Black Book of Mordor - Where the Shadows Lie'

questComplete.loreInfo: You delved beyond the Black Gate into the vale of Udûn, where Sauron's armies were equipped for war. The Dark Lord may be gone, but his lieutenants remain and vie for power in the absence of his unifying evil. Chief among these is Ugrukhôr, the Captain of the Pit, who seeks to maintain his command over Udûn from the fortress of Durthang.

With the unlikely help of the Khundolar war-leader Ayorzén the Wily, you obtained an heirloom corrupted by its long stay in Gorgoroth. You were able to cleanse it of the evil that encircled it, and Elrond imbued it with the Light of Eärendil, a powerful force for Good that will light your way in the Black Land. You met with Dulgabêth, the former Mouth of Sauron, and listened to his offer of peace. Aragorn deemed it unacceptable, but believes you learned information of use from he who hopes to rule Mordor as Sauron's heir.

The search for information led you further into Gorgoroth, and you learned more about the Gúrzyul and the uneasy alliances they have formed in order to solidify their own domains. More troubling for Gandalf and for Middle-earth is your discovery that Lhaereth the Stained, the Lady of Blight, has returned to Mordor and seeks to perfect her pestilential master-work. She was responsible for the Great Plague that swept Gondor and the lands to the east earlier in the Third Age; does she now hope to finish what she started?

Your infiltration of Amon Thaur has revealed a troubling development for Middle-earth: the Masters of Mordor have set aside their differences and come together beneath the rule of Lhaereth the Stained, Lady of Blight. A unified Mordor endangers all the Free People: Men, dwarves, Elves, and hobbits alike.

In the wake of Sauron's defeat, the Gúrzyul Ugrukhôr seeks information about a mysterious artifact known only as the Bugdatish, and he sends his minions in search of Karazgar the Weeping Warrior, another of the Gúrzyul who may possess the secret of it. Meanwhile, the Lord and Lady of the Golden Wood come to Dol Guldur, the former stronghold of the Necromancer, and raze it to the ground.

The search for Karazgar continued into Eryn Lasgalen and the Dale-lands, bringing you into the confidence of the surviving dwarves of Thorin's Company, who sought answers for the apparent decline of their people's craft-skill. Gandalf came to believe that the Gúrzyul might be experiencing a similar decline, and they seek a means to reverse or counter it.

At the behest of King Thorin you brought Khîl Tale-spinner, a trouble-making Zhélruka, back to his father's home in the Ironfold. You also brought word to Thorin's own son Durin that the time had come for him to learn what it takes to lead. But even as Durin prepared to return to the Lonely Mountain, Khîl discovered a hidden chamber within his father's house, and in that secret room was revealed a black-bound book covered in evil sigils and bearing the Eye of Sauron: the Black Book of Mordor.

On your return to the Lonely Mountain you encountered a band of Zhélruka on the border of the Dale-lands. Aggrieved that the messenger they dispatched to King Thorin had not yet returned, they threatened to cross by the base of Erebor, in war if need be, and Durin stayed behind to ease the tension. After bringing the Black Book of Mordor to Gandalf and delivering word of his son to King Thorin, you learned that the Zhélruka passed into the Grey Mountains; unwilling to shed dwarf-blood, Durin followed them instead, vowing to protect the Men of Dale from the possibility of Zhélruka aggression. When you finally caught up to Durin, his heart had been moved by the chill air of the mountains, and he desired to prove himself a worthy son and heir to King Thorin, though it mean risking the ire of Karazgar, the Weeping Warrior.

An excursion to the Anvil of Winterstith and a quest for vengeance embroiled the Dwarves of Skarháld in further conflict with Karazgar, the Weeping Warrior, and only the timely intervention of Gandalf staved off disaster. His study of the Black Book of Mordor has borne some fruit, but Karazgar's interest in that forbidding tome has convinced the Wizard that it must not remain in the Grey Mountains.

At Gandalf's suggestion you journeyed to the house of Grimbeorn in the Beorning-lands. While you helped his folk make safe their homes and those of their neighbours in the vales of the Anduin, the Wizard continued his study of the Black Book of Mordor. Before long, Elrond and much of his household arrived in the vales on their way to Gondor for the wedding of his daughter Arwen to Aragorn Elessar. They also sought out Grimbeorn, who found his hospitality, and his patience, tested by the arrival of the Elves. Meanwhile, the presence of the Weeping Warrior can still be felt in the vales, and his desire to obtain the Black Book has not lessened.
The story continues in future chapters!
questComplete.progressOverride: The story continues in future chapters!

deed.name: The Way Into Mordor
deed.description: Scout the major routes and vantage points of Mordor's antechamber, Udûn.

objective.text: Scout the major routes and vantage points of Mordor's antechamber, Udûn.

enterDetection.loreInfo: This road drives like a rod of iron from the Black Gates on into Gorgoroth, where it splits to encircle Orodruin.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Iron Road

enterDetection.loreInfo: Many fell weapons and great war-works have winded their way down this road, out of the great forges of Anglach.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the west road to Anglach

enterDetection.loreInfo: Thousands of rough pairs of feet have marched, stood, and camped upon Udûn's broad central basin.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the parade grounds

enterDetection.loreInfo: Atop this steep ascent, countless rough, cruel weapons were wrought to arm the Dark Lord's immeasurable armies.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the road to Mornaur

enterDetection.loreInfo: Servants bore goods and messages up this way to the fastness of Durthang.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the west road to Durthang

enterDetection.loreInfo: The lord of Durthang could survey his domain from this height -- and more.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Durthang tower-top

enterDetection.loreInfo: Comings and goings along the Iron Road can be viewed with ease from this spot.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Durthang lookout

enterDetection.loreInfo: Being nearer to Barad-dûr, this path to Durthang was used for purposes of state and ceremony.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover Durthang's eastern stairs

enterDetection.loreInfo: The heights above have been used for many purposes over the centuries; most recently to host a contingent of Easterling forces.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the path to Rhûd Vorn

enterDetection.loreInfo: From here, a wary eye was kept on Anglach and the high bridge leading to it.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Rhûd Vorn watch point

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: For what strange purpose was this platform used?

enterDetection.loreInfo: It is no coincidence that directly before Anglach affords the best view of all eastern Udûn.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Anglach vantage point

enterDetection.loreInfo: An overseer may watch over the works below from here and, also, the road.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the overseer's perch

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: The doors were somehow wrenched asunder in the chaos and struggle that directly followed the fall of Sauron.
landmarkDetection.progressOverride: Discover the gates of the Isenmouthe

enterDetection.loreInfo: Great steam and water works were controlled from this point, which looked down onto the waste reservoirs below.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the foundry deck

deed.name: Spider-haunts and Web-rifts
deed.description: Explore the dark caverns and web-shrouded passes of Lhingris.

objective.text: Explore the dark caverns and web-shrouded passes of Lhingris.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have explored the Morgai, the black fence of Mordor which divides the lands of Lhingris from the plains of Gorgoroth.
You have explored Rath Cail, a narrow pass between the peaks of the Mountains of Shadow and the Morgai.
You have explored Ceber Dúath, a jagged ridge that rises along the Mountains of Shadow in Lhingris.
You have explored Dath Nethryn, a foul swampland fed by the recently unearthed, rotten springs of the Mountains of Shadow.
You have explored Kâm Lagúrz, also known as the Brokencleft, a ruined cavern where one of the Queensbrood was felled and where vile creatures now dwell.
You have explored Amon Rûth, a crag shattered by the eruption of Mount Doom, which now spews foul water into Dath Nethryn below.
You have explored a cavern leading into Torech Ungol, the dark caverns home to the ancient daughter of Ungoliant, Shelob.

deed.name: Quests of Lhingris
deed.description: Complete quests in Lhingris.

objective.text: Complete quests in Lhingris.

questComplete.loreInfo: You have stood firm against the evil forces at work in Lhingris.

deed.name: Strongholds of the Ephel Dúath
deed.description: Explore the strongholds of Lhingris upon the jagged slopes of the Mountains of Shadow.

objective.text: Explore the settlements of Lhingris upon the jagged slopes of the Mountains of Shadow.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have explored Kála-murg, the main encampment of the Orc-trackers in Lhingris.
You have explored Lugvarg, a watchtower of Lhingris built to guard a narrow pass in the Morgai.
You have explored Nelegroth, a tower built to keep watch on one of the eastern passages into Torech Ungol.
You have explored Iant Angos, an imposing bridge spanning from Lhingris to the western reaches of Talath Úrui.
You have explored Cirith Ungol, a long-abandoned tower built by the Men of Gondor to keep watch on Mordor after Sauron's defeat at the end of the War of the Last Alliance.
You have explored Fennas Gost, a battlement created by the Men of Gondor to guard the pass to Minas Ithil before it fell to the servants of Sauron in the Third Age and became known as Minas Morgul.

deed.name: The Tower of Cirith Ungol
deed.description: Explore the heights and depths of Cirith Ungol in Lhingris.

objective.text: Explore the heights and depths of Cirith Ungol in Lhingris.

landmarkDetection.loreInfo: You have stood before the imposing heights of Cirith Ungol in Lhingris.

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Silent Watchers of Cirith Ungol. Within their conjoined bodies and vulture-faces, some dreadful evil still resides.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Silent Watchers

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the courtyard of Cirith Ungol. Even now, you can see grisly evidence of the great skirmish that broke out when Shagrat and Gorbag battled over Frodo's mithril-coat.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Courtyard of Cirith Ungol

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Tower of Cirith Ungol. Long ago, the Tower of Cirith Ungol was held by the Men of Gondor, but now it has become a grim fortress under the control of Mordor.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Tower of Cirith Ungol

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the top chamber of the Tower of Cirith Ungol. It was here that Frodo Baggins was kept prisoner and stripped of his belongings after he was found by Shagrat and Gorbag near Torech Ungol.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the top chamber of the Tower of Cirith Ungol

enterDetection.loreInfo: You have discovered the Under-gate of Cirith Ungol. It was here that Samwise Gamgee became separated from Frodo Baggins as the Uruks of Cirith Ungol sealed the Under-gate behind them to ward against Shelob's children.
enterDetection.progressOverride: Discover the Under-gate of Cirith Ungol

deed.description: Urudanî, the mysterious flame-wraith under the command of Borangos the Horror, has been seen many times, entering and exiting the prison fortress of Naerband. deed.name: The Abyss of Mordath: The Order of Death
deed.description:
The Order of the Eye descended into the Abyss of Mordath to defeat the Firehorns and seek the lost artifacts of the Dark Lord, but instead they have found secrets more terrible than they dared imagine.
<rgb=#FF0000>This deed can only be completed on Tier 2 of the Abyss of Mordath raid.</rgb>

deed.name: The Abyss of Mordath -- Tier 1
deed.description: Determined to wield the lost Ring of Power Manthríf once more, King Váskmun Greytooth has led his Firehorn Dwarves into the Abyss of Mordath, where the sunken foundations of Barad-dûr now rest. Meanwhile, the Order of the Eye has made haste to pursue the Firehorns, eager to avenge their fallen and contest the dwarves' claim to the greatest artifacts of the Dark Lord. Unbeknownst to any of them, greater still are the terrors Sauron hid away in the shadows of the Mordath.

deed.name: The Abyss of Mordath: A Light in the Darkness
deed.description:
In the darkness of the Abyss of Mordath, it is the Bitter Warden who protects the most well-concealed secrets of the Dark Lord, but his identity has ever been a mystery to both the slaves and guards of the Mordath.
<rgb=#FF0000>This deed can only be completed on Tier 2 of the Abyss of Mordath raid.</rgb>
